Description: 15.931  CONSERVATION ACTIVITIES BY YOUTH SERVICE ORGANIZATIONSTHIS PROGRAM UTILIZES QUALIFIED NON-PROFIT YOUTH- AND VETERAN-SERVING ORGANIZATIONS TO CARRY OUT APPROPRIATE NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE CONSERVATION, EDUCATION, VOLUNTEER SERVICE AND EDUCATION PROJECTS ON DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR LANDS THROUGH AUTHORIZED NATIONAL PARK SERVICE PROGRAMS. A CANDIDATE WILL BE SELECTED THROUGH THE AMERICORPS VISTA PROGRAM. THE VISTA STEWARD WILL IDENTIFY SERVICE-LEARNING PROJECTS AROUND THE PARK THAT CAN BE USED TO FOSTER RELATIONSHIPS WITH YOUTH ORGANIZATIONS THAT SPARK STEWARDSHIP AND A SENSE OF OWNERSHIP OF THEIR NATIONAL PARK. THE VISTA STEWARD WILL CONTINUE TO OVERSEE THE PARKS VOLUNTEER PROGRAM TO MAINTAIN AND GROW THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN THE PARK AND THE COMMUNITY THROUGH VOLUNTEER-FOCUSED PROJECTS IN AREAS OF NATURAL, CULTURAL, AND HISTORICAL RESOURCE PROTECTION. THE BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE PRIVATE NON-PROFIT INSTITUTIONS AND ORGANIZATIONS  PUBLIC AND PRIVATE NON-PROFIT ACADEMIC INSTITUTIONS  STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENT AGENCIES  QUASI-PUBLIC NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS THAT SUPPORT YOUTH AND YOUNG ADULT CAREER TRAINING AND DEVELOPMENT, AND EDUCATION IN THE AREAS OF NATURAL AND OR CULTURAL RESOURCE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT. INDIVIDUALS FAMILIES, STUDENTS, AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC WILL RECEIVE A BENEFIT FROM THE DEVELOPMENT AND EXECUTION OF THESE PROGRAMS AND PROJECTS.

15.931: YOUTH AND VETERAN ORGANIZATIONS CONSERVATION ACTIVITIESTHIS PROGRAM UTILIZES QUALIFIED NON-PROFIT YOUTH- AND VETERAN-SERVING ORGANIZATIONS TO CARRYOUT APPROPRIATE NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE CONSERVATION, EDUCATION, VOLUNTEER SERVICE AND EDUCATIONPROJECTS ON DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR LANDS THROUGH AUTHORIZED NATIONAL PARK SERVICE PROGRAMS.GBI AND GOLDEN GATE NRA WILL ENTER A PARTNERSHIP WHEREBY GBI WILL PROVIDE ONE OR MORE RESEARCH ASSOCIATES (RAS) TO SUPPORT A WIDE ARRAY OF NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE RELATED PROJECTS. THE INITIAL WORK UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL BE FOCUSED ON ENVIRONMENTAL AND COMPLIANCE MANAGEMENT RELATED TO NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES PROTECTION DURING UTILITIES MAINTENANCE WORK. GREAT BASIN INSTITUTE WILL PROVIDE 1 RA FOR A MINIMUM OF 1040 HOURS. THE DUTIES OF THE RA WILL INCLUDE COORDINATION BETWEEN NPS NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES STAFF ON UTILITIES PROJECTS, REVIEW OF PROJECTS IN THE FIELD, SUPPORT WITH NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES SURVEYS, AND MONITORING OF PROJECT WORK DURING IMPLEMENTATION TO ENSURE RESOURCE PROTECTION. GBI REQUESTS  70,869 TO FULL SUPPORT THIS INITIAL PHASE OF PROJECT SUPPORT AND WILL LEVERAGE  24,251.20 IN IN-KIND CONTRIBUTIONS. REMAINING FUNDS WILL BE USED FOR SUPPLEMENTAL RA PROJECT SUPPORT. BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE PRIVATE NON-PROFIT INSTITUTIONS AND ORGANIZATIONS  PUBLIC AND PRIVATE NON-PROFIT ACADEMIC INSTITUTIONS  STATE AND LOCALGOVERNMENT AGENCIES  QUASI-PUBLIC NON-PROFIT INSTITUTIONS AND ORGANIZATIONS THAT SUPPORT YOUTH AND YOUNGADULT CAREER TRAINING AND DEVELOPMENT, AND EDUCATION IN THE AREAS OF NATURAL AND OR CULTURAL RESOURCECONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT. INDIVIDUALS FAMILIES  STUDENTS  AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC WILL RECEIVE A BENEFITFROM THE DEVELOPMENT AND EXECUTION OF THESE PROGRAMS AND PROJECTS.

DEBRIS REMOVAL AT WRIGHT BROTHERS NATIONAL MEMORIAL  THIS PROJECT WILL RESTORE HISTORIC LANDSCAPES AND VIEWSHEDS BY USING A CONSERVATION CREW TO ASSIST WITH THE REMOVAL OF TREES AND VEGETATION THAT HAVE GROWN INSIDE THE VIEWSHEDS AND HISTORIC LANDSCAPE. IMPROVED VIEWSHEDS WILL INCREASE VISITOR UNDERSTANDING AND ENJOYMENT OF THE SITE BY ALLOWING THEM TO EXPERIENCE THE HILL IN ITS HISTORIC STATE AND ALLOW MORE VIEWING OF THE ACTIVE AIRSTRIP.  THE CONSERVATION CREW WILL GAIN VALUABLE EXPERIENCE IN TREE WORK AND RESTORATION OF HISTORIC LANDSCAPES THAT CAN BE APPLIED TO A MULTITUDE OF CAREERS.

A.PERFORMANCE GOALS  THE REGION 11 INTERPRETATION COHORT IS A PROGRAM THAT WILL HOST THREE INTERNS AT VARIOUS PARK SITES FOR A RIGOROUS 28 WEEK INTERPRETATION FELLOWSHIP. THESE POSITIONS WILL WORK IN A PARK BEGINNING WITH SEASONAL INTERPRETIVE TRAINING THROUGH A FULL SUMMER INTERPRETIVE PROGRAM SEASON. IN THE FALL THE COHORT WILL TRANSITION INTO THE TRAINING AND DEVELOPMENT OF NONPERSONAL SERVICES (SUCH AS PUBLICATIONS, WEB, SOCIAL MEDIA, ETC) THROUGH PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENTAL OPPORTUNITIES BASED AT THE ALASKA REGIONAL OFFICE AND LOWER 48. THE COHORT WILL THEN RETURN TO THEIR HOST PARKS TO COMPLETE THEIR INDIVIDUAL INTERPRETIVE PROJECTS.

ASSIST CUMBERLAND ISLAND NATIONAL SEASHORE WITH TRAIL MAINTENANCE  INTERN WILL ASSIST CUMBERLAND ISLAND NATIONAL SEASHORE (CUIS) RESOURCE MANAGEMENT STAFF WITH THE MAINTENANCE OF PEDESTRIAN TRAILS WITHIN THE PARK. THE INTERN WILL CARRY OUT NECESSARY TRAIL WORK IN CONJUNCTION WITH OTHER NPS VOLUNTEERS AND AID THE CUIS VOLUNTEER PROGRAM COORDINATOR IN ESTABLISHING WORK PLANS FOR THESE GROUPS.  TRAIL WORK WILL INCLUDE BRUSH TREE REMOVAL AND CLEARING DEBRIS FROM NEARLY 50 MILES OF PEDESTRIAN TRAILS TO INCLUDE PARALLEL, WILLOW POND, BRICKHILL AND TERRAPIN TRAILS. UPKEEP OF THESE RAILS ENHANCES THE VISITORS NATIONAL PARK EXPERIENCE AND PROVIDES APPROPRIATE AND ADEQUATE ACCESS TO THE ISLAND RESOURCES.

PROVIDE ON THE GROUND ASSISTANCE TO GLEN CANYON AND GRAND CANYON TO IMPROVE NATIVE ECOSYSTEMS THROUGH INVASIVE FISH REMOVAL AND RESTORING DEGRADED AREAS TO NATURAL HABITATS. INSTALLATION OF A BACKCOUNTRY TOILET WILL DEMONSTRATE STRATEGIES FOR SATISFYING THE REQUIREMENTS OF BOTH THE WILDERNESS ACT AND THE ORGANIC ACT TO MOTIVATE YOUTH PARTICIPANTS TO BECOME INVOLVED IN IN THE STEWARDSHIP OF DEATH VALLEY WILDERNESS AND BACKCOUNTRY RESOURCES. THIS PROJECT PROVIDES A YOUTH INTERN WITH TRAINING, PLACE-BASED LEARNING, EDUCATION, AND MENTORING THROUGH RESEARCH FOCUSED ON CULTURAL RESOURCES AT TUMACCORI NATIONAL HISTORICAL PARK. RESEARCH WILL FOCUS ON THE IMPACTS OF RACE AND GENDER ON LIFE IN THE MISSION ERA. THE RECIPIENT WILL CONDUCT HISTORICAL RESEARCH USING PRIMARY AND SECONDARY SOURCES AND ASK QUESTIONS THAT HAVE NEVER BEEN ASKED BY RESEARCHERS OF THE PIMERA ALTA REGARDING THE ROLES OF RACE AND SEX IN THE LIVES OF MISSION-ERA RESIDENTS (BOTH IN AND OUTSIDE OF THE MISSION COMMUNITY). IT IS EXPECTED THAT WORK COMPLETED VIA THIS PROJECT WILL RESULT IN NEW INFORMATION THAT COULD BE USED FOR PUBLIC EDUCATION AND INTERPRETATION. THIS PROJECT PROVIDES THE OPPORTUNITY FOR YOUTH TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE UNDERSTANDING OF HISTORICAL IMPACTS OF RACE AND GENDER AROUND THE MISSION COMMUNITY OF TUMACCORI NATIONAL HISTORICAL PARK. THE RESEARCH IS INTENDED TO PROVIDE A VARIETY OF NEW INTERPRETIVE MEDIA AND PROGRAMMING FOR PARK VISITORS. INFORMATION MAY BE SHARED ON WEBSITES, SOCIAL MEDIA, AND ON DISPLAY TO ENCOURAGE DIALOGUE. THE INTERN SHOULD HAVE A BACKGROUND IN HISTORICAL RESEARCH AND BE BILINGUAL TO BE ABLE TO READ AND TRANSLATE HISTORICAL DOCUMENTS.  THE INTERN WILL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO INTERACT WITH PARK STAFF AND BUILD POSITIVE RELATIONSHIPS TO SUPPORT THE NPS MISSION. THEY WILL BE PROVIDED WITH JOB TRAINING AND MENTORING WITHIN THE FIELDS OF HISTORY AND INTERPRETATION. PRODUCTS OF THIS PROJECT WILL HELP TO IMPROVE VISITOR EXPERIENCES IN THE PARK.THIS TASK AGREEMENT SERVES A PUBLIC PURPOSE BY PROMOTING AND STIMULATING EDUCATION, JOB TRAINING, DEVELOPMENT OF RESPONSIBLE CITIZENSHIP, PRODUCTIVE COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT, AND FURTHERING THE UNDERSTANDING, APPRECIATION, AND CONSERVATION OF CULTURAL RESOURCES. THE PUBLIC WILL GAIN NEW KNOWLEDGE PROVIDED THROUGH RESEARCH. INFORMATION WILL BE DISSEMINATED THROUGH A VARIETY OF STRATEGIES TO INCREASE AWARENESS, KNOWLEDGE, UNDERSTANDING, AND SUPPORT FOR HISTORIC PRESERVATION. THIS EXPERIENCE IS EXPECTED TO FOSTER AN ENVIRONMENT OF LEARNING AND INSTILL A SENSE OF RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP IN THE INTERN THAT WILL CARRY FORTH INTO THE FUTURE.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO COOPERATIVELY RECRUIT AND MENTOR YOUTH FROM TUCSON AND SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES FOR PAID INTERNSHIPS, PLACED IN NATIONAL PARKS. PARTICIPANTS WILL BE MENTORED BY PARK STAFF IN ALL AREAS OF PARK MANAGEMENT IN ORDER TO GAIN SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE WHICH WILL BENEFIT THEM IN THEIR LONG-TERM CAREER OR EDUCATION GOALS. PARTICIPANTS WILL RECEIVE TRAINING IN ESSENTIAL LIFE SKILLS INCLUDING RESUME BUILDING, PUBLIC SPEAKING, COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT, AND CONSERVATION PROJECTS WITHIN PUBLIC LANDS IN SOUTHERN ARIZONA. THE RECIPIENT WILL RECRUIT AND HIRE LOCAL YOUTH INTERNS TO BE PLACED WITH THE DIVISION OF INTERPRETATION, EDUCATION AND COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT AT SAGUARO NATIONAL PARK AS NEXT GENERATION RANGER CORPS MEMBERS REFERRED TO AS A NEXTGEN RANGERS. THIS PROJECT ADDRESSES THE PUBLIC PURPOSE OF PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES TO ALLEVIATE POVERTY THROUGH PROVIDING EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUTH INTERESTED IN PUBLIC LANDS AND CONSERVATION. YOUTH FROM UNDER-REPRESENTED AREAS OF TUCSON WILL BE PROVIDED WITH OPPORTUNITIES TO GAIN PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT IN CAREER TRACKS THAT THEY MAY NOT HAVE TRADITIONALLY CONSIDERED AVAILABLE TO THEM. BY WAY OF PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUTH TO LEARN ABOUT THE ENVIRONMENT AND SPENDING TIME WORKING ON AND COMPLETING CONSERVATION PROJECTS IN NATIONAL PARKS, THEY WILL BE MOTIVATED TO BECOME INVOLVED IN NATURAL RESOURCE PROTECTION OF THEIR COMMUNITIES AND BEYOND. THIS PROJECT ENGAGES PARTICIPANTS IN MEANINGFUL HANDS-ON EXPERIENCES.

GBI, IN PARTNERSHIP WITH JOSHUA TREE NATIONAL PARK, WILL HIRE A RESEARCH ASSOCIATE TO CONDUCT AN ASSESSMENT OF DESERT TORTOISE MOVEMENT PATTERNS AND ROAD EFFECTS, INCLUDING MORTALITY ASSOCIATED WITH INCREASED PARK VISITATION. BY ANALYZING A LARGE DATASET OF DESERT TORTOISE LOCATIONS, SPANNING OVER 15 YEARS, THE PARK WILL BETTER UNDERSTAND THE RISK THAT VEHICLES AND INCREASED VISITATION (MORE VEHICLES) WILL HAVE. THIS INFORMATION WILL ALLOW THE PARK TO RESPOND AND TAKE MEASURES TO REDUCE COLLISIONS WITH THE DESERT TORTOISE (AN ENDANGERED SPECIES), WHOSE POPULATIONS IN THE PARK ARE AT A VERY LOW NUMBER. EFFORTS TO REDUCE MORTALITY FROM VEHICLE COLLISIONS WILL CERTAINLY HELP WITH RECOVERY OF THE SPECIES.  40,000 WILL BE OBLIGATED TO SUPPORT THIS INITIAL DATA ANALYSIS EFFORT. REHABILITATE AND MAINTAIN RED TRAIL IN CHICKAMAUGA BATTLEFIELD - INTERNS WILL WORK IN THE CHICKAMAUGA BATTLEFIELD TO PROVIDE MUCH NEEDED TRAIL MAINTENANCE TO SEVERAL SECTIONS OF THE RED TRAIL, WHICH IS UTILIZED BY THOUSANDS OF VISITORS A YEAR AS A MULTI-USE TRAIL FOR HIKING AND HORSEBACK RIDING, AS WELL AS TO ACCESS MANY OF THE HISTORIC MONUMENTS, MARKERS, PLAQUES, AND CANNON POSITIONS LOCATED IN THE HEART OF THE BATTLEFIELD. THIS PROJECT ENGAGES YOUTH IN PROTECTING PUBLIC LANDS THROUGH BEING MENTORED BY ORGAN PIPE CACTUS NATIONAL MONUMENTS (OPRI) FACILITY MANAGEMENT DIVISION (FMD) IN PERFORMING VEGETATION REMOVAL ALONG ROAD CORRIDORS, PARKING AREAS, AND CAMPGROUNDS.  THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE AN OPPORTUNITY FOR ACE CREWMEMBERS TO BE MENTORED BY EXPERIENCED NATIONAL PARK SERVICE (NPS) STAFF TO GET EXPOSURE TO LAND MANAGEMENT PRACTICES WITHIN AN NPS SITE, DEVELOP PLANT IDENTIFICATION SKILLS TO AVOID CUTTING THREATENED AND ENDANGERED (T E) PLANTS, RECEIVE TRAINING AND DEMONSTRATION OF HOW TO USE TOOLS (SUCH AS HAND TOOLS AND A WOODCHIPPER), AND INSTRUCTION ON HOW TO CUT-AND DISPOSE OF THE PLANT MATERIAL SAFELY.THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE EXPERIENCE AND TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT OF YOUNG ADULTS THROUGH HANDS-ON WORK. PARTICIPANTS WILL REMOVE ENCROACHING VEGETATION ALONG ROAD CORRIDORS, PARKING LOTS, AND CAMPGROUND AREAS WITH ORPI.  AT THE END OF THE PROJECT ACE CREWMEMBERS WILL BE ABLE TO IDENTIFY T E PLANTS WITHIN ORPI, LEARN HOW TO MANAGE FOOT AND VEHICULAR TRAFFIC ALONG DIRT ROADS AND CAMPGROUND, AND HOW TO SAFELY CUT AND REMOVE VEGETATION USING LOPPERS AND SAWS. ANOTHER OBJECTIVE OF THE PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE PARTICIPANTS WITH A RANGE OF EXPERIENCES AND TRAINING THAT PROMOTES PUBLIC RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP AND MOTIVATES THEM TO BECOME INVOLVED IN NATURAL RESOURCE PROTECTION AND MANAGEMENT.THIS TASK AGREEMENT SERVES A PUBLIC PURPOSE BY PROMOTING AND STIMULATING EDUCATION, JOB TRAINING, DEVELOPMENT OF RESPONSIBLE CITIZENSHIP, PRODUCTIVE COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT, AND FURTHERING THE UNDERSTANDING, APPRECIATION, AND CONSERVATION OF RESOURCES. THIS PROJECT WILL MOTIVATE YOUTH AND YOUNG ADULTS TO BE INVOLVED WITH THE NATURAL, CULTURAL, AND HISTORICAL RESOURCE PROTECTION OF THEIR COMMUNITIES AND BEYOND. BY WAY OF SUPPORTING EDUCATION, MENTORING, AND TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUNG ADULTS, THE PARTICIPANTS WILL ATTAIN HANDS-ON EXPERIENCE IN THE FIELD. THIS EXPERIENCE IS EXPECTED TO FOSTER AN ENVIRONMENT OF LEARNING AND INSTILL A SENSE OF RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP THAT WILL CARRY FORTH INTO THE FUTURE.

A.THIS PROGRAM SEEKS TO UTILIZE QUALIFIED NON-PROFIT YOUTH AND VETERAN SERVING ORGANIZATIONS TO CARRY OUT APPROPRIATE NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE CONSERVATION, EDUCATION, VOLUNTEER SERVICE AND EDUCATION PROJECTS ON DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR LANDS THROUGH AUTHORIZED NPS PROGRAMS. B.THIS PROJECT TARGETS THE GOALS AND VALUES OUTLINED UNDER THE LEGACY RESTORATION FUND- MAINTENANCE ACTION TEAM, A SERVICE-WIDE FACILITY MAINTENANCE PROGRAM WHICH WILL SUPPORT, ENGAGE, AND STIMULATE MAINTENANCE AND PRESERVATION TRADES WORK WHILE PROVIDING TRANSFERRABLE SKILLS TRAINING AND AN ETHIC OF RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP TO PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS. THIS PROJECT DIRECTLY ADDRESSES THE DEFERRED MAINTENANCE BACKLOG AT SMALL AND MEDIUM SIZED NATIONAL PARKS.  THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO REHABILITATE SECTIONS OF THE MANNING CAMP TRAIL IN SAGUARO NATIONAL PARKS RINCON MOUNTAIN WILDERNESS.  THE TRAIL CONDITION HAS FALLEN INTO A STATE OF DEFERRED MAINTENANCE AND DISREPAIR.  THE TRAIL HAS ALSO BEEN EXPOSED TO HEAVY MONSOON RAINS OVER THE LAST COUPLE OF SUMMERS WHICH HAS LEFT SECTIONS OF THE TRAIL IN A SERIES OF DEEP RUTS DUE TO EROSION, WHICH CAUSE SAFETY CONCERNS TO NPS EMPLOYEES, THE NPS MULE STRING AS WELL AS HIKING AND EQUESTRIAN VISITORS TRAVELING THROUGH.  SECTIONS OF THE MANNING CAMP TRAIL ALIGN WITH THE ARIZONA TRAIL. PARTICIPANTS WILL BE TRAINED, EDUCATED, AND MENTORED ON THE REMOVAL OF NON-NATIVE INVASIVE PLANT SPECIES AND HELP TO RESTORE NATIVE PLANT SPECIES TO THE DEADMAN WASH HABITAT.PARTICIPANTS WILL RECEIVE TRAINING AND EDUCATION FOCUSED ON THE CONTROL OF NON-NATIVE PLANTS AND BE ENGAGED IN THE RESTORATION OF NATIVE PLANT SPECIES WITHIN THE PARK. PARTICIPANTS WILL BE MENTORED BY NPS STAFF IN THESE ACTIVITIES, RECEIVE A RANGE OF EXPERIENCES AND TRAINING THAT PROMOTES PUBLIC RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP, AND BE MOTIVATED TO BECOME INVOLVED IN NATURAL RESOURCE PROTECTION AND MANAGEMENT. THIS WORK WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE PROTECTION OF SENSITIVE RESOURCES AND PROMOTE CONSERVATION EDUCATION. PARTICIPANTS WILL UTILIZE CHAINSAWS AND HERBICIDE TO KILL NON-NATIVE, INVASIVE TAMARISK, AND CAMELTHORN PLANTS. RESTORATION EFFORTS WILL INVOLVE THE COLLECTION AND RE-PLANTING OF NATIVE SEED FROM WITHIN WUPATKI NATIONAL MONUMENT. NATIVE GRASSES AND SHRUBS WILL BE TRANSPLANTED FROM HEALTHY AREAS OF THE DEADMAN WASH HABITAT TO RECOLONIZE AREAS WHERE NON-NATIVE INVASIVE PLANTS WERE REMOVED.  THIS PROJECT FULFILLS AN IMPORTANT PUBLIC PURPOSE BY ENGAGING AND MOTIVATING PARTICIPANTS IN SHARED RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP, PROVIDING THEM WITH DIRECT HANDS-ON WORK EXPERIENCE IN AND ON NATURAL RESOURCES, AND FACILITATES A GREATER UNDERSTANDING OF NATURAL AND RECREATIONAL ASPECTS OF CONSERVATION AREAS. BY WAY OF BEING MENTORED, PARTICIPANTS WILL BE PROVIDED WITH JOB TRAINING, CAREER DEVELOPMENT, AND EDUCATION IN THE MANAGEMENT OF PUBLIC LANDS. THIS EXPERIENCE IS EXPECTED TO FOSTER AN ENVIRONMENT OF LEARNING AND INSTILL A SENSE OF RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP THAT WILL CARRY FORTH INTO THE FUTURE.

THIS PROJECT PROMOTES AND STIMULATES EDUCATION, JOB TRAINING, DEVELOPMENT OF RESPONSIBLE CITIZENSHIP, PRODUCTIVE COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT, AND FURTHERS THE UNDERSTANDING AND APPRECIATION OF NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES THROUGH THE INVOLVEMENT OF YOUTH IN THE CARE AND ENHANCEMENT OF PUBLIC RESOURCES. THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE YOUTH WITH OUTDOOR EXPERIENCES AND JOB TRAINING SKILLS THROUGH BEING MENTORED BY NPS STAFF IN VEGETATION AND MAINTENANCE PROJECTS. PARTICIPANTS WILL ENGAGE IN ACTIVITIES THAT ENHANCE VISITOR EXPERIENCES, PROTECT NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES, AND MAINTAIN INFRASTRUCTURE AT PETROGLYPH NATIONAL MONUMENT.THE RECIPIENT WILL SELECT AND OVERSEE QUALIFIED AND MOTIVATED PARTICIPANTS TO BE MENTORED BY NPS STAFF IN PERFORMING VEGETATION MANAGEMENT AND FENCE MAINTENANCE REPAIRS AT PETROGLYPH NATIONAL MONUMENT (PETR OR MONUMENT). PARTICIPANTS WILL BE PROVIDED WITH TRAINING AND EDUCATION THROUGHOUT THE PROJECT. THIS WORK WILL HELP TO PROTECT THE MONUMENTS NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES AND PROVIDE FOR VISITOR USE AND ENJOYMENT. PARTICIPANTS SELECTED FOR THIS PROJECT WILL WORK CLOSELY WITH THE RECIPIENTS TEAM LEADERS AND NPS STAFF ON A DAY-TO-DAY BASIS, RECEIVING MENTORING AND SUPPORT. THE PRINCIPAL PURPOSE OF THIS TASK AGREEMENT IS TO SUPPORT THE GOVERNMENTS OBJECTIVE TO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES TO YOUTH TO LEARN ABOUT THE ENVIRONMENT BY SPENDING TIME WORKING ON PROJECTS IN NATIONAL PARKS. THE NPS RECEIVES THE INDIRECT BENEFIT OF COMPLETING CONSERVATION PROJECTS. THIS PROGRAM MOTIVATES ITS YOUTH PARTICIPANTS TO BECOME INVOLVED IN THE NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE PROTECTION OF THEIR COMMUNITIES AND BEYOND. YOUTH PARTICIPANTS WILL GAIN REAL WORLD OR HANDS-ON EXPERIENCE OUTSIDE OF THE CLASSROOM IN NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE PROJECTS. THIS TASK AGREEMENT CONTINUES LONGSTANDING EFFORTS FOR THE NPS TO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUTH PUBLIC SERVICE AND DEVELOPMENT AND JOB TRAINING. THIS PROGRAM SERVES THE PUBLIC BY MAINTAINING THE INTEGRITY OF THE MONUMENTS INTERIOR AND BOUNDARY FENCE LINES THAT PROTECT THE UNPARALLELED ARCHAEOLOGICAL RESOURCES WITHIN THE MONUMENT. PROJECT WORK WILL ALSO INCLUDE VEGETATION MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES ALONG THE MONUMENTS FENCE LINES AND ELSEWHERE. ENSURING THE INTEGRITY OF THE MONUMENTS FENCING, CARING FOR THE GROUNDS, AND CONDUCTING PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES ON FENCE LINES PROVIDES THE PUBLIC WITH AN AESTHETICALLY PLEASING AND SAFE ENVIRONMENT IN WHICH THEY CAN BETTER ENJOY THE MONUMENT.

THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FOR EMPLOYMENT FOR PARTICIPANTS WITH ACCESSIBILITY CHALLENGES IN NATIONAL PARKS AND INCREASES ACCESSIBILITY TO NATIONAL PARKS. ENVIRONMENT FOR THE AMERICAS WILL PARTNER WITH BIRDABILITY TO ACCOMPLISH THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROGRAM. BIRDABILITY RAISES AWARENESS OF THE NEEDS OF INDIVIDUALS WHO VISIT OR WOULD LIKE TO VISIT OUR NATIONAL PARKS, BUT WHO ALSO EXPERIENCE MOBILITY CHALLENGES, BLINDNESS OR LOW VISION, CHRONIC ILLNESS, INTELLECTUAL OR DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES, NEURODIVERGENT, AND DEAF OR HARD OF HEARING. ENVIRONMENT FOR THE AMERICAS AND BIRDABILITY, IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE, WILL FOSTER AN INCLUSIVE ENVIRONMENT AND PROMOTE WILDLIFE EDUCATION, PARTICULARLY BIRDWATCHING, BY DEVELOPING TOOLS AND METHODS THAT NATIONAL PARKS CAN INTEGRATE INTO THEIR PROGRAMS AND TRAILS TO MEET THE NEEDS OF VISITORS WITH MOBILITY AND OTHER ACCESSIBILITY CHALLENGES. BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS, PUBLIC NONPROFIT INSTITUTIONS ORGANIZATIONS, PRIVATE NONPROFIT INSTITUTIONS, NON-FEDERAL GOVERNMENT ENTITIES, AND THE PUBLIC.

THIS PROGRAM UTILIZES QUALIFIED NON-PROFIT YOUTH- AND VETERAN-SERVING ORGANIZATIONS TO CARRY OUT APPROPRIATE NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE CONSERVATION, EDUCATION, VOLUNTEER SERVICE AND EDUCATION PROJECTS ON DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR LANDS THROUGH AUTHORIZED NATIONAL PARK SERVICE PROGRAMS.GREAT SAND DUNES WILL UTILIZE THREE CONSERVATION CREWS TO IMPROVE PARK TRAILS AND PRIMITIVE ROAD. TASKS INCLUDE REPAIR OF THE SAND CREEK TRAIL, BRING THE ONLY THREE ACCESSIBLE TRAILS IN GREAT SAND DUNES NP P BACK INTO COMPLIANCE WITH THE ARCHITECTURAL BARRIERS ACT ACCESSIBILITY STANDARDS (ABAAS), AND CLEAR BRUSH ALONG THE MEDANO PASS PRIMITIVE ROAD TO INCREASE VISITOR SAFETY. THIS CREW WORK WILL BENEFIT THE LOCAL COMMUNITY AND APPROXIMATELY 400,000 VISITORS. PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDE CORRECTING DRAINAGE ISSUES BY REPAIRING OVER 6,000 FEET OF OUTSLOPE, 600 FEET OF INBOARD DITCH, REPAIRING 120 WATERBARS AND 24 CHECK STEPS ON THE SAND RAMP TRAIL, REPAIR OF 4,140 LINEAR FEET (22,800 SQUARE FEET) OF ACCESSIBLE TRAIL TO MEET ABAAS GUIDELINES, AND CLEARING BRUSH FROM 6 ACRES OF ROAD SHOULDER.BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE PRIVATE NON-PROFIT INSTITUTIONS AND ORGANIZATIONS  PUBLIC AND PRIVATE NON-PROFIT ACADEMIC INSTITUTIONS  STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENT AGENCIES  QUASI-PUBLIC NON-PROFIT INSTITUTIONS AND ORGANIZATIONS THAT SUPPORT YOUTH AND YOUNG ADULT CAREER TRAINING AND DEVELOPMENT, AND EDUCATION IN THE AREAS OF NATURAL AND OR CULTURAL RESOURCE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT. THIS PROJECT ENGAGES YOUTH IN PROTECTING AND RESTORING PUBLIC LANDS THROUGH PARTICIPATION IN A VARIETY OF RESOURCE MANAGEMENT AND TRAILS PROJECTS. THE PARTICIPANTS WILL BE MENTORED AND PROVIDED WITH JOB TRAINING AND EDUCATION IN THE AREAS OF CONSERVATION, MAINTENANCE, AND CARE OF NATURAL RESOURCES. PARTICIPANTS WILL ACCOMPLISH MEANINGFUL WORK AND GAIN IMPORTANT PERSONAL AND PROFESSIONAL SKILLS WHILE BUILDING A LIFELONG CONNECTION TO THE OUTDOORS. THEY WILL RECEIVE TRAINING AND EDUCATION WHILE PARTICIPATING IN PROJECTS THAT HELP TO PROTECT RESOURCES AND IMPROVE VISITOR EXPERIENCES. THIS PROJECT UTILIZES THE GOALS AND VALUES OUTLINED UNDER THE LEGACY RESTORATION FUND- MAINTENANCE ACTION TEAM. THIS TEAM IS A SERVICE-WIDE FACILITY MAINTENANCE PROGRAM, WHICH WILL SUPPORT, ENGAGE, AND STIMULATE MAINTENANCE AND PRESERVATION TRADES WORK WHILE PROVIDING TRANSFERRABLE SKILLS TRAINING AND INSTILLING RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP ETHICS TO PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS. PARTICIPANTS WILL RECEIVE TRAINING, MENTORING, AND EDUCATION WHILE ENGAGED IN ACTIVITIES, DEVELOP A FOUNDATION IN CULTURAL AND NATURAL RESOURCES PROTECTION, AND FOSTER LIFELONG CONNECTIONS TO THE OUTDOORS. ANOTHER OBJECTIVE OF THE PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE A RANGE OF EXPERIENCES AND TRAINING THAT PROMOTES PUBLIC RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP AND MOTIVATES PARTICIPANTS TO BECOME INVOLVED IN RESOURCE PROTECTION AND MANAGEMENT. THIS WORK WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE PROTECTION OF SENSITIVE RESOURCES AND PROMOTE CONSERVATION EDUCATION.THIS TASK AGREEMENT SERVES A PUBLIC PURPOSE BY PROMOTING AND STIMULATING EDUCATION, JOB TRAINING, DEVELOPMENT OF RESPONSIBLE CITIZENSHIP, PRODUCTIVE COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT, AND FURTHERING THE UNDERSTANDING, APPRECIATION, AND CONSERVATION OF NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES. THIS PROJECT WILL MOTIVATE PARTICIPANTS TO BE INVOLVED WITH CULTURAL, NATURAL, AND HISTORICAL RESOURCE PROTECTION (LOCALLY AND NATIONALLY) THROUGH HANDS-ON SKILLS-BASED TRAINING. PARTICIPANTS WILL BE MENTORED AND EDUCATED BY NPS STAFF TO DEVELOP TRADE SKILLS AND BE PROVIDED WITH JOB TRAINING. THE NPS RECEIVES THE INDIRECT BENEFIT OF COMPLETING CULTURAL, NATURAL, AND HISTORICAL RESOURCE PROTECTION PROJECTS. THIS EXPERIENCE IS EXPECTED TO FOSTER AN ENVIRONMENT OF LEARNING AND INSTILL A SENSE OF RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP IN PARTICIPANTS THAT WILL CARRY FORTH INTO THE FUTURE.BY WAY OF THE ACE EPIC INTERN POSITION, THERE IN AN OPPORTUNITY TO ALLEVIATE POVERTY FOR YOUTH INTERESTED IN PUBLIC LANDS AND CONSERVATION. DIVERSE AND INCLUSIVE YOUTH PROGRAMS ARE A TOP PRIORITY FOR THE NPS AND PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS. INCLUSION IS ALSO ESSENTIAL TO HELPING THE NPS REACH DIVERSE AUDIENCES AND ENGAGE THESE AUDIENCES IN PARK PROGRAMMING. LASTLY, THIS PROJECT ALSO PROVIDES SAFE, EASILY NAVIGABLE, AND ENJOYABLE TRAILS FOR HIKERS AND EQUESTRIAN USERS VISITING SAGUARO NATIONAL PARK.

THIS PROJECT ENGAGES YOUTH IN PROTECTING AND RESTORING PUBLIC LANDS THROUGH THE RESTORATION AND REPLACEMENT OF A WILDLIFE FRIENDLY FENCE LINE ALONG VARIOUS PARK LOCATIONS.  PARTICIPANTS WILL ACCOMPLISH MEANINGFUL WORK AND GAIN IMPORTANT PERSONAL AND PROFESSIONAL SKILLS WHILE BUILDING A LIFELINE CONNECTION TO THE OUTDOORS. PARTICIPANTS WILL GAIN TRAINING AND EDUCATION IN RESOURCE MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES THAT HELP TO PROTECT RESOURCES AND IMPROVE VISITOR EXPERIENCES.PARTICIPANTS WILL RECEIVE TRAINING AND EDUCATION FOCUSED ON NATURAL RESOURCE AND WILDLIFE MANAGEMENT PRACTICES AND TECHNIQUES THROUGH CLEARING AND BRUSHING ALONG FENCE LINES, PUTTING UP FENCE, STRINGING BARBED WIRE, SETTING POSTS, REPAIRING REPLACING SEVERELY DAMAGED FENCE SECTIONS, AND CONSTRUCTING WILDLIFE CROSSINGS. WORK WILL TAKE PLACE AS WEATHER PERMITS. FENCE REPAIRS AND REPLACEMENT WILL BE BUILT IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE MONUMENT S 2015 FENCE MANUAL SOP. THIS CLEARING WILL BE DONE WITH HAND TOOLS AND POWER TOOLS (CHAINSAWS AND RECIPROCATING SAWS) TO CLEAR LARGE TREES AND BRANCHES. FENCE SUPPLIES (BARBED WIRE, FENCING STAYS, CEDAR POSTS, T POSTS AND ALL FENCING TOOLS) WILL BE HAULED BY TRAILER TRUCK TO DESIGNATED PROJECT WORK AREA. ANOTHER OBJECTIVE OF THE PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE A RANGE OF EXPERIENCES AND TRAINING THAT PROMOTES PUBLIC RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP AND MOTIVATES PARTICIPANTS TO BECOME INVOLVED IN NATURAL RESOURCE PROTECTION AND MANAGEMENT. THIS WORK WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE PROTECTION OF SENSITIVE RESOURCES AND PROMOTE CONSERVATION EDUCATION.THIS AGREEMENT WILL ENGAGE YOUNG ADULTS IN PUBLIC LAND MANAGEMENT AND THE CONSERVATION OF NATURAL AREAS IMPORTANT TO OUR NATIONS HERITAGE.  THE ACTIVITIES CONDUCTED AS PART OF THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE YOUTH CORPS MEMBERS WITH VALUABLE KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCES IN THE CONCEPTS AND PRACTICES OF PUBLIC LAND MANAGEMENT.  THEIR WORK WILL PROVIDE FOR THE PUBLIC ENJOYMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES IN A NATIONAL MONUMENT.  THE PROJECT MOTIVATES ITS YOUTH PARTICIPANTS TO BECOME INVOLVED IN THE NATURAL, CULTURAL AND  OR HISTORICAL RESOURCE PROTECTION OF THEIR COMMUNITIES AND BEYOND.  PARTICIPANTS GAIN HANDS-ON EXPERIENCE OUTSIDE OF THE CLASSROOM IN NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE PROJECTS.

THIS PROJECT FUNDS NPS AND ACE CREWS WHO WILL WORK AS A TEAM TO COMPLETE HISTORIC PRESERVATION AND STABILIZATION WORK ON THE PARKS PRIMARY VISITOR USE AREA, TRAIL REPAIR PARK-WIDE, AND FENCE REPAIR ALONG THE PARKS BOUNDARY.THIS WORK WILL INCLUDE MIXING ADOBE-BASED MORTARS TO MATCH HISTORIC COLORS AND TEXTURES, APPLYING MORTARS TO HISTORIC WALLS TO PREVENT ENVIRONMENTAL DAMAGE. REPAIRING HISTORIC WALLS WITH ADOBE BLOCK IN A MANNER TO MATCH HISTORIC BUILDING METHODS. TRAIL REPAIR WILL INCLUDE BASIC HAND TOOL USE TO REDISTRIBUTE SOIL, REMOVE VEGETATION AND CREATE WALKING SURFACES. FENCE REPAIR WILL INCLUDE BASIC HAND TOOL USE TO REMOVE AND INSTALL WOODEN SPLIT-RAIL TYPE FENCING.TRAINING FOR BOTH TOOL USE AND PROPER MAINTENANCE TECHNIQUES WILL BE PROVIDED BY NPS STAFF. ON-SITE SAFETY BRIEFINGS WILL BE HELD DAILY. CREWS WILL SOMETIMES BE EXPECTED TO WORK AND LIVE IN BACK-COUNTRY STYLE CAMPS FOR UP TO NINE-DAY PERIODS WHILE PERFORMING MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES. REHABILITATION OF LITTLE CATALOOCHIE TRAILPROJECT STATEMENT  LITTLE CATALOOCHIE TRAIL IS IN THE CATALOOCHIE DISTRICT IN GREAT SMOKY MOUNTAINS NATIONAL PARK (GRSM) AND IS 4 MILES IN LENGTH. THIS TRAIL IS ACCESSIBLE TO HIKERS AND EQUESTRIANS AND IS IN A STATE OF DISREPAIR.  DEFICIENCIES INCLUDE EROSION PROBLEMS (TRENCHING, EXPOSED ROCKS AND ROOTS) AND DRAINAGE PROBLEMS (WET AND MUDDY AREAS ON TRAIL AND FAILING WATER DIVERSION STRUCTURES).   THE DEFICIENCIES ARE CREATING SAFETY HAZARDS AND ARE CAUSING DAMAGE TO GRSM RESOURCES AS HIKERS AND EQUESTRIANS ARE WALKING AROUND HAZARDS CREATING BRAIDS AND SOCIAL TRAILS. PERFORMANCE GOALS  THE GOAL OF THE PROJECT IS TO HAVE A MORE SUSTAINABLE, SAFER, AND BETTER-DEFINED TRAIL. THIS WILL LEAD TO HIKERS AND EQUESTRIANS STAYING ON THE DESIRED PATH.PERFORMANCE OBJECTIVES:BUILD NEW TRAIL STRUCTURES AS NEEDEDREMOVE ROCKS AND ROOTS FROM THE TRAIL SURFACE AS NEEDED          ADD NEW WATER DIVERSION STRUCTURESBLOCK OFF TRAIL BRAIDS AND SOCIAL TRAILS

AMERICAN CONSERVATION EXPERIENCE AND NPS NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGERS WILL COOPERATE TO REHABILITATE SUNSET CRATER VOLCANO NATIONAL MONUMENT FOLLOWING THE 2022 TUNNEL FIRE.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:CREW FIELD WORKERS WILL UTILIZE HERBICIDES, GARDENING TOOLS, AND HAND-PULLING TECHNIQUES TO REMOVE NON-NATIVE, INVASIVE PLANTS FROM AREAS WITHIN SUNSET CRATER VOLCANO NATIONAL MONUMENT THAT WERE IMPACTED BY THE 2022 TUNNEL FIRE.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:IT IS EXPECTED THAT APPROXIMATELY 3.7 ACRES OF FIRE-IMPACTED LANDS WILL BE CLEARED OF NON-NATIVE, INVASIVE PLANTS. BENEFICIARIES:THIS PROJECT FULFILLS A PUBLIC PURPOSE BY EMPLOYING A DIVERSE YOUTH CONSERVATION CORPS CREW, PROVIDING HANDS-ON JOB TRAINING AND PROMOTING EDUCATION AND CONSERVATION OF NATURAL RESOURCES. RESTORATION OF CULTURALLY SIGNIFICANT NATIVE PLANTS AND VOLCANIC HABITATS WILL BENEFIT PARK VISITORS AND WILDLIFE.

PROJECT TITLE  INTERPRETATION SUPPORTPROJECT STATEMENT  THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO CREATE MULTIPLE INTERNSHIPS THROUGHOUT THE JEAN LAFITTE NATIONAL HISTORICAL PARK AND PRESERVE (JELA) NEW ORLEANS JAZZ NATIONAL HISTORICAL PARK (JAZZ). JELA JAZZ SITES. THE INTERNSHIPS HAVE BEEN ESTABLISHED TO PROVIDE ENGAGEMENT AND OUTREACH, IN ALIGNMENT WITH THE URBAN AGENDA AND PROGRAM GOALS THROUGH VISITOR SERVICES AND RESOURCE EDUCATION PROGRAMS. THESE INTERNSHIPS WILL ALSO BE USED TO INFORM AND EDUCATE ALL VISITORS WHO ENTER THIS PARK. PERFORMANCE GOALS  THE PRIMARY GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE MEMORABLE AND MEANINGFUL LEARNING AND RECREATIONAL EXPERIENCES FOR THE INTERNS, AS WELL AS THE VISITORS THEY INTERACT WITH. PERFORMANCE OBJECTIVES:THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THE POSITION IS TO PROVIDE HIGH QUALITY INTERPRETIVE SERVICES THROUGH CONTACTS AT THE VISITOR.  A SECONDARY OBJECTIVE OF THE INTERNSHIP IS TO PROVIDE A DIVERSE AND EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCE.

THIS PROGRAM SUPPORTS PROJECTS THAT FURTHER THE MISSION OF THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE AND EFFORTS IN NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE CONSERVATION, PROTECTION, AND ENVIRONMENTAL SUSTAINABILITY THAT ARE NOT COVERED UNDER OTHER SPECIFIC FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS. THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE (NPS) IS PARTNERING WITH LIVING CLASSROOMS FOUNDATION TO HIRE SEVEN YOUNG PEOPLE FOR A SUMMER SEASON TO CONDUCT FREE LIVING HISTORY INTERPRETATION PUBLIC PROGRAMS FOR FORT MCHENRY, HAMPTON, AND THE STAR-SPANGLED TRAIL.  BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS, PUBLIC NONPROFIT INSTITUTIONS ORGANIZATIONS, PRIVATE NONPROFIT INSTITUTIONS ORGANIZATIONS, NON-FEDERAL GOVERNMENT ENTITIES, INDUSTRY AND PUBLIC DECISION MAKERS, RESEARCH SCIENTISTS, ENGINEERS, AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC.

THE YMCA-NPS SUMMER CAMP PROGRAM SETS AN ANNUAL MINIMUM GOAL FOR 2023 TO REACH OVER 4,500 YOUTH AGES 5-15 TO PARTICIPATE IN A SUMMER DAY CAMP PROGRAM EXPERIENCE LEARNING ABOUT THE OUTDOORS, NATURAL OR CULTURAL HISTORY AT THE Y AND AT THEIR NEARBY NATIONAL PARK SITES. BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE PRIVATE NON-PROFIT INSTITUTIONS AND ORGANIZATIONS  PUBLIC AND PRIVATE NON-PROFIT ACADEMIC INSTITUTIONS  STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENT AGENCIES  QUASI-PUBLIC NON-PROFIT INSTITUTIONS AND ORGANIZATIONS THAT SUPPORT YOUTH AND YOUNG ADULT CAREER TRAINING AND DEVELOPMENT, AND EDUCATION IN THE AREAS OF NATURAL AND OR CULTURAL RESOURCE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT. INDIVIDUALS FAMILIES  STUDENTS  AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC WILL RECEIVE A BENEFIT FROM THE DEVELOPMENT AND EXECUTION OF THESE PROGRAMS AND PROJECTS.

THIS PROJECT MENTORS YOUTH IN PROTECTING AND RESTORING PUBLIC LANDS THROUGH ENGAGEMENT IN HABITAT RESTORATION ACTIVITIES. PARTICIPANTS WILL GAIN TRAINING AND EDUCATION IN HABITAT RESTORATION WORK THAT HELPS TO PROTECT RESOURCES AND IMPROVE VISITOR EXPERIENCES. PARTICIPANTS WILL ACCOMPLISH MEANINGFUL WORK AND GAIN IMPORTANT PERSONAL AND PROFESSIONAL SKILLS WHILE BUILDING A LIFELONG CONNECTION TO THE OUTDOORS.PARTICIPANTS WILL RECEIVE TRAINING AND EDUCATION FOCUSED ON THE CONTROL OF UNSIGHTLY INVASIVE WEEDS, NATIVE SEED COLLECTION FOR FUTURE PLANTING, AND NON-NATIVE PLANT CONTROL. PARTICIPANTS WILL BE MENTORED BY NPS STAFF IN THESE ACTIVITIES. WORK WILL OCCUR ALONG THE MAIN PARK ROAD (UP TO 4.6 MILES) AND WITHIN APPROXIMATELY 10 ACRES OF ROCK CANYON. THE WORK WILL IMPROVE THE CULTURAL AND NATURAL LANDSCAPE OF THESE AREAS, AND PROVIDE PARTICIPANTS WITH A RANGE OF EXPERIENCES AND TRAINING THAT PROMOTES PUBLIC RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP AND MOTIVATES THEM TO BECOME INVOLVED IN NATURAL RESOURCE PROTECTION AND MANAGEMENT. THIS WORK WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE PROTECTION OF SENSITIVE RESOURCES AND PROMOTE CONSERVATION EDUCATION. NPS STAFF WILL MENTOR PARTICIPANTS IN NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE CONSERVATION AND EDUCATION BASED ACTIVITIES. THE PARTICIPANTS CREWS WILL ASSIST IN RESTORING VEGETATION AREAS DEGRADED BY IMPACTS FROM TRESPASSING LIVESTOCK AND INVASIVE WEEDS.  THIS PROJECT FULFILLS AN IMPORTANT PUBLIC PURPOSE BY ENGAGING AND MOTIVATING PARTICIPANTS IN SHARED RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP, PROVIDING THEM WITH DIRECT HANDS-ON WORK EXPERIENCE IN AND ON NATURAL RESOURCES, AND FACILITATES A GREATER UNDERSTANDING OF NATURAL AND RECREATIONAL ASPECTS OF CONSERVATION AREAS. BY WAY OF BEING MENTORED, PARTICIPANTS WILL BE PROVIDED WITH JOB TRAINING, CAREER DEVELOPMENT, AND EDUCATION IN THE MANAGEMENT OF PUBLIC LANDS. THIS EXPERIENCE IS EXPECTED TO FOSTER AN ENVIRONMENT OF LEARNING AND INSTILL A SENSE OF RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP THAT WILL CARRY FORTH INTO THE FUTURE.

THIS PROGRAM UTILIZES QUALIFIED NON-PROFIT YOUTH- AND VETERAN-SERVING ORGANIZATIONS TO CARRY OUT APPROPRIATE NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE CONSERVATION, EDUCATION, VOLUNTEER SERVICE AND EDUCATION PROJECTS ON DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR LANDS THROUGH AUTHORIZED NATIONAL PARK SERVICE PROGRAMS. THE UNFINISHED RAILROAD IS A SIGNIFICANT CULTURAL LANDSCAPE FEATURE THAT WAS A FOCAL POINT OF MUCH OF THE SECOND BATTLE OF MANASSAS, AND ITS PRESERVATION AND INTERPRETATION IS CRITICAL TO THE PARKS MISSION. HOWEVER, WHAT WAS ONCE SERIES OF CLEARED, EARTHEN EMBANKMENTS ARE NOW HEAVILY COVERED IN VEGETATION. THIS VEGETATION BOTH DAMAGES THE CULTURAL RESOURCES, AS WELL AS SIGNIFICANTLY IMPEDES THE ABILITY FOR VISITORS TO VIEW AND UNDERSTAND THE FEATURE. THIS PROJECT WOULD UTILIZE YOUTH WORK CREWS TO CONDUCT VEGETATION TRIMMING AND REMOVAL ALONG MUCH OF THE NEARLY 3-MILE LENGTH OF THE STRUCTURE. PROJECT TITLE  SEA TURTLE PROTECTION AND CONSERVATION CAREER FOCUSBUCK ISLAND REEF NATIONAL MONUMENT (BUIS) IS A NESTING BEACH FOR SEVERAL THREATENED AND ENDANGERED SPECIES OF SEA TURTLE PROTECTED UNDER THE ENDANGERED SPECIES ACT (ESA) INCLUDING HAWKSBILL (ERETMOCHELYS IMBRICATA), GREEN (CHELONIA MYDAS), LEATHERBACK (DERMOCHELYS CORIACEA), AND LOGGERHEAD (CARETTA CARETTA) SEA TURTLES. THIS PROJECT HAS PROVIDED LOCAL HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS, COLLEGE STUDENTS, AND PROFESSIONALS WITH EXPOSURE TO FIELD RESEARCH. PERFORMANCE GOALS:THE GOAL OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO COMPLETE IMPORTANT CONSERVATION PROJECTS, PROVIDE YOUNG ADULTS WITH STRUCTURED, SAFE, AND CHALLENGING WORK AND EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES THROUGH EMPLOYMENT PROJECTS THAT PROMOTE PERSONAL GROWTH, THE DEVELOPMENT OF LIFE SKILLS AND AN ETHIC OF NATURAL RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP.PERFORMANCE OBJECTIVES:INTERNS WILL PROVIDE SUPPORT TO PARK STAFF TO PATROL NESTING BEACHES, CONDUCT SATURATION AND TELEMETRY TAGGING OF NESTING SEA TURTLES, RECORD BIOMETRIC DATA, COLLECT SAMPLES, DOCUMENT THE LOCATION OF NESTING ACTIVITIES, EVALUATE THE SUCCESS OF NESTING ACTIVITIES, AND RELOCATE IMPERILED NESTS USING ESTABLISHED, PEER REVIEWED METHODS AND PROTOCOL.

THIS PROJECT ENGAGES YOUTH IN PROTECTING AND RESTORING PUBLIC LANDS THROUGH RESOURCE PROTECTION AND MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES. PARTICIPANTS WILL ACCOMPLISH MEANINGFUL WORK AND GAIN IMPORTANT PERSONAL AND PROFESSIONAL SKILLS WHILE BUILDING A LIFELINE CONNECTION TO THE OUTDOORS. PARTICIPANTS WILL GAIN TRAINING AND EDUCATION IN ACTIVITIES THAT HELP TO PROTECT RESOURCES AND IMPROVE VISITOR EXPERIENCES. PARTICIPANTS WILL BE MENTORED ON IMPROVING THE VISITOR CAMPING EXPERIENCE BY IMPROVING CAMPGROUND AMENITIES, AND REHABILITATING THE NATURAL LANDSCAPE WITHIN THE PARKS TWO DEVELOPED CAMPGROUNDS.PARTICIPANTS WILL RECEIVE TRAINING AND EDUCATION FOCUSED ON RESOURCE PROTECTION AND MANAGEMENT THROUGH ASSEMBLY AND DISTRIBUTION OF NEW PICNIC TABLES TO CAMPSITES AT BOTH DEVELOPED CAMPGROUNDS, REMOVAL OF OLD PICNIC TABLES FROM CAMPSITES AND STAGING THEM FOR DISPOSAL, OBLITERATING AND REHABILITATING UNOFFICIAL TRAILS ASSOCIATED WITH CAMPSITES ONCE TRAIL ACCESS IS CLOSED, REHABILITATION OF UNOFFICIAL CAMPSITES WITHIN BOTH CAMPGROUNDS, AND COMPLETING MINOR REGRADING AND EROSION MITIGATION TO MAINTAIN NATIVE VEGETATION INTEGRITY AROUND CAMPSITES.THIS PROJECT FULFILLS AN IMPORTANT PUBLIC PURPOSE BY ENGAGING AND MOTIVATING YOUTH PARTICIPANTS IN SHARED RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP, PROVIDING THEM WITH DIRECT HANDS-ON WORK EXPERIENCE IN RESOURCE PROJECTS, AND FACILITATING A GREATER UNDERSTANDING OF NATURAL AND RECREATIONAL ASPECTS OF CONSERVATION AND RECREATION AREAS. PARTICIPANTS WILL GAIN IMPORTANT SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE THROUGH IMPROVING AND PROTECTING KEY AREAS OF THE PARK. THE NPS RECEIVES THE INDIRECT BENEFIT OF COMPLETING CONSERVATION PROJECTS.  IN ADDITION, THIS PROJECT ENGAGES RECIPIENTS, PARTNERS, COMMUNITIES, AND OR VISITORS IN SHARED ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP.

THIS PROJECT PROMOTES AND STIMULATES PUBLIC PURPOSES SUCH AS EDUCATION, JOB TRAINING, DEVELOPMENT OF RESPONSIBLE CITIZENSHIP, PRODUCTIVE COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT, AND TO FURTHER THE UNDERSTANDING AND APPRECIATION OF NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES THROUGH THE INVOLVEMENT OF LOCAL YOUTH IN THE CARE AND ENHANCEMENT OF PUBLIC RESOURCES. THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE LOCAL YOUTH WITH  JOB TRAINING SKILLS, THE OPPORTUNITY TO ASSIST AND LEARN FROM NPS STAFF, ENGAGE IN ACTIVITIES THAT ENHANCE THE VISITORS EXPERIENCE AT THE MONUMENT, PROTECT THE MONUMENTS NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES, AND MAINTAIN INFRASTRUCTURE.THE RECIPIENT WILL SELECT AND OVERSEE QUALIFIED AND MOTIVATED YOUTH PARTICIPANTS TO BE MENTORED BY NPS STAFF IN CYCLIC MAINTENANCE OF THE PIEDRAS MARCADAS CANYON TRAIL SYSTEM AND THE NORTH RIM TRAIL, WITHIN PETROGLYPH NATIONAL MONUMENT (PETR OR MONUMENT). CYCLIC MAINTENANCE TO THE MONUMENTS TRAIL SYSTEMS WILL BETTER DELINEATE THE ROUTE, PROTECT MONUMENT RESOURCES, AND REDUCE THE POTENTIAL FOR VISITORS TO BECOME LOST OR DISORIENTED. YOUTH PARTICIPANTS AND YOUNG ADULTS SELECTED FOR THIS PROGRAM WILL WORK CLOSELY WITH THE RECIPIENTS PROGRAM COORDINATOR, AND WITH NPS STAFF ON A DAY-TO-DAY BASIS, RECEIVING MENTORING AND SUPPORT.THE PRINCIPAL PURPOSE OF THE TASK AGREEMENT IS TO PROMOTE AND STIMULATE EDUCATION, PROVIDE JOB TRAINING, INSTILL A SENSE OF RESPONSIBLE CITIZENSHIP AND PRODUCTIVE COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT, AND FURTHER THE UNDERSTANDING, APPRECIATION, AND CONSERVATION OF NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES ALONG PARTICIPANTS. THE PROGRAM WILL MOTIVATE YOUTH AND YOUNG ADULTS TO BE INVOLVED WITH THE NATURAL, CULTURAL, AND HISTORICAL RESOURCE PROTECTION OF THEIR COMMUNITIES AND BEYOND. INCLUSION IN THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE TRAINING AND EDUCATION OPPORTUNITIES AND INSPIRE PARTICIPANTS. THIS TASK AGREEMENT CONTINUES LONGSTANDING EFFORTS FOR THE NPS TO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR PUBLIC SERVICE YOUTH EMPLOYMENT, MINORITY YOUTH DEVELOPMENT AND TRAINING, AND CONSERVATION-RELATED WORK OF PUBLIC BENEFIT. THIS PROJECT SERVES THE PUBLIC BY DELINEATING TRAILS AND MAINTAINING THE INTEGRITY OF THE TRAIL SYSTEM IN PIEDRAS MARCADAS CANYON AND THE NORTH RIM TRAIL, AND IMPLEMENTS COMPONENTS OF THE RECENTLY APPROVED VISITOR USE MANAGEMENT PLANNING EFFORT. ENSURING THE INTEGRITY OF THE MONUMENTS TRAIL TREAD, CARING FOR THE GROUNDS, AND CONDUCTING PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES ON THE TRAIL SYSTEMS PROVIDES THE PUBLIC WITH AN AESTHETICALLY PLEASING AND SAFE ENVIRONMENT IN WHICH THEY CAN BETTER ENJOY THE MONUMENT.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):SAND CREEK MASSACRE NHS PLANS TO FOSTER BENEFICIAL RELATIONSHIPS WITH CONSERVATION ORGANIZATIONS THAT ADVOCATE FOR BALANCED STEWARDSHIP AND USE OF OUR PUBLIC LANDS BY COLLABORATING WITH THE AMERICAN CONSERVATION EXPERIENCE (ACE) TO IMPLEMENT PRAIRIE RESTORATION ACTIVITIES AT THE PARK.  THIS WORK WILL BE PERFORMED BY CONTROLLING EXOTIC VEGETATION GROWTH IN THE PARK WHILE SIMULTANEOUSLY SUPPORTING GROWTH OF NATIVE SPECIES ASSOCIATED WITH THE HIGH PLAINS OF SOUTHEASTERN COLORADO.    IN ADDITION, DEBRIS REMOVAL OF FALLEN TREE LIMBS AND TUMBLEWEEDS WILL MAINTAIN THE LANDSCAPE IN PRISTINE CONDITION, AS CLOSE AS PRACTICABLE TO 1864. TRAINING AND OVERSIGHT FOR ALL ACTIVITIES WILL BE PROVIDED BY NPS STAFF. ON-SITE SAFETY BRIEFINGS WILL BE HELD DAILY OR AS NEEDED.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:EXOTIC VEGETATION CONTROL VIA MANUAL, CHEMICAL, OR MECHANICAL REMOVAL.  MOWER TRACTOR OPERATIONSEEDINGWATERINGDEBRIS REMOVALPERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:PROJECT GOAL IS TO USE AN EFFICIENT INTEGRATED PEST MANAGEMENT APPROACH TO ALLOW THE PARK TO TARGET ANNUAL INVASIVE PLANTS AT THE SOURCE (SEEDS) AND IMPROVE SMALL AMOUNTS OF ACREAGE IN MINIMAL TIME. THE COMBINED EFFECT OF BOTH CHEMICAL TREATMENT AND MANUAL REMOVAL HAS BEEN PROVEN THROUGH UNIVERSITY RESEARCH REDUCE FUEL LOADS, LIMIT IMPACTS FROM INVASIVE SPECIES, RESTORE WILDLIFE HABITAT, AND INCREASE PLANT BIODIVERSITY. THE MANAGEMENT OF EXOTICS, REVEGETATION AND DEBRIS REMOVAL WILL MAKE SUBSTANTIAL PROGRESS WITH THE MANDATE IN THE SAND ESTABLISHMENT ACT, P.L. 106-465, WHICH  STATES THAT THE PROTECTION AND PRESERVATION OF THE CULTURAL LANDSCAPE OF THE SITE SHALL BE MANAGED TO PRESERVE, AS CLOSELY AS PRACTICABLE, AS IT APPEARED IN 1864.BENEFICIARIES:THE VISITING PUBLIC, TRIBAL PARTNERS AND LOCAL COMMUNITIES WILL BENEFIT FROM THIS PROJECT WITH HISTORICALLY ACCURATE MAINTAINED LANDSCAPES THAT ACCURATELY REPRESENT THE HISTORIC ECO-SYSTEM.

THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE WILL WORK IN PARTNERSHIP WITH CONSERVATION LEGACY TO RECRUIT YOUTH TO SERVE AS INTERNS FOR SELECTED NATIONAL HERITAGE AREAS. BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE NATIONAL HERITAGE AREAS IN DOI REGIONS 6, 7,   8, AS WELL AS YOUTH YOUNG ADULTS RECRUITED WITH CONSERVATION LEGACY.

PROJECT TITLE  INTERPRETIVE INTERN ON AFRICAN AMERICAN EXPERIENCESPROJECT STATEMENT  STONES RIVER NATIONAL BATTLEFIELD (STRI) HAS MADE GREAT STRIDES IN ENGAGING THE AFRICAN AMERICAN COMMUNITY, BUT PARK STAFF RECOGNIZE THAT OPPORTUNITY FOR CONTINUED GROWTH REMAINS. STRI ENJOYS A THRIVING PARTNERSHIP WITH THE AFRICAN AMERICAN HERITAGE SOCIETY OF RUTHERFORD COUNTY (AAHSRC). SINCE 2013, WE HAVE WORKED WITH THAT PARTNER TO PRESENT AN ARRAY OF STAKEHOLDER PRODUCED PROGRAMMING FOCUSED ON THE AFRICAN AMERICAN EXPERIENCE ON THE PARKS LANDSCAPES. THIS INTERNSHIP WILL BUILD ON THAT RELATIONSHIP AND WORK TO ENHANCE EXISTING AUDIENCE CENTERED PROGRAMS TO ENGAGE A LARGER AUDIENCE. THE INTERN WILL FOSTER PROGRAMMING DEVELOPED BY MEMBERS OF THE AFRICAN AMERICAN COMMUNITY WITH THE EXPECTATION THAT IT WILL MORE EFFECTIVELY INTEREST MEMBERS OF THE COMMUNITY TO PARTICIPATE. GOAL - EXPAND KNOWLEDGE OF AFRICAN AMERICAN EXPERIENCES ON STONES RIVER NATIONAL BATTLEFIELDS LANDSCAPES FROM THE CIVIL WAR THROUGH THE CIVIL RIGHTS ERA.

NEW AWARD - PROJECT ABSTRACT SUMMARY: PROJECT TITLE: FORT FREDERICA NM, NATURAL AND CULTURAL GROUNDS MAINTENANCEAWARD PURPOSE: THE PROJECT WORK WILL INCLUDE THE MAINTENANCE OF THE NATURAL AND CULTURAL LANDSCAPES AT FORT FREDERICA NATIONAL MONUMENT.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED: THE CREW WILL HELP RESTORE AND MAINTAIN THE CULTURAL LANDSCAPE TO AN APPROXIMATE 1740S VISTA, TO INCLUDE REMOVING VEGETATION ALONG THE FREDERICA RIVER.DELIVERABLES AND OR EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE PROJECT WILL IMPROVE AND MAINTAIN UP TO 5 MILES OF NATURE TRAIL. IT WILL REMOVE APPROXIMATELY  MILE WORTH OF RIVER EDGE VEGETATION. PROJECT WORK WILL INCLUDE REMOVAL OF PINE BEETLE DAMAGED TREES THAT ARE DEEMED HAZARDOUS AND NON-BENEFICIAL TO THE NATURAL LANDSCAPE. IT WILL RESULT IN THE REMOVAL OF TREES FROM THE MOAT EARTHWORKS THAT THREATEN THE INTEGRITY OF THE CULTURAL FEATURES.

THIS PROJECT ENGAGES YOUTH IN PROTECTING AND RESTORING PUBLIC LANDS THROUGH PARTICIPATING AND BEING MENTORED IN TRAILS AND PRESERVATION WORK. PARTICIPANTS WILL RECEIVE EDUCATION AND TRAINING TO DEVELOP SKILLS IN RESOURCE MANAGEMENT, CONSERVATION, AND PROTECTION. ASSIGNED PROJECTS WILL MOTIVATE PARTICIPANTS TO BECOME INVOLVED IN NATURAL, CULTURAL, AND OR HISTORICAL RESOURCE PROTECTION OF THEIR COMMUNITIES AND BEYOND. YOUTH WILL GAIN REAL-WORLD EXPERIENCE THROUGH BEING MENTORED BY NPS PROFESSIONALS IN A PARK SETTING. THIS PROJECT PROVIDES BALANCED STEWARDSHIP AND USE OF OUR PUBLIC LANDS. THE RECIPIENT WILL ENGAGE IN TRAIL AND PRESERVATION WORK AT FRONTCOUNTRY AND BACKCOUNTRY ARCHAEOLOGICAL SITES AND TRAILS LOCATED WITHIN THE MONUMENT. THIS PROJECT WILL CONSIST OF MULTIPLE CREWS FOCUSED ON TRAIL AND PRESERVATION WORK AT FRONTCOUNTRY AND BACKCOUNTRY ARCHAEOLOGICAL SITES AND TRAILS LOCATED WITHIN THE MONUMENT. PARTICIPANTS WILL BE MENTORED DURING THE LIFE OF THE AGREEMENT. THE BANDELIER CONSERVATION CORPS (BCC) CREW WILL BE COMPOSED OF A BACKCOUNTRY SPIKE CREW, MADE UP OF EIGHT CREW MEMBERS AND ONE SUPERVISOR, FOR A TOTAL OF SEVENTEEN WEEKS (8.5 SPIKES). THERE WILL ALSO BE A DAY CREW, WHICH CONSISTS OF FIVE CREW MEMBERS AND ONE SUPERVISOR FOR A TOTAL OF 9 WEEKS. THE BANDELIER PRESERVATION CORPS (BPC) CREW WILL BE ONE CREW, COMPOSED OF FIVE CREW MEMBERS AND ONE SUPERVISOR (AGES 17-25), FROM NEIGHBORING COMMUNITIES. YOUTH PARTICIPANTS RECEIVE A STIPEND WHILE SERVING IN THIS ROLE AND MONEY TOWARDS FURTHERING THEIR EDUCATION. PARTICIPANTS WILL BE MOTIVATED TO BE INVOLVED WITH THE NATURAL, CULTURAL, AND HISTORICAL RESOURCE PROTECTION OF THEIR COMMUNITIES AND BEYOND THROUGH ENGAGEMENT IN WORK ON RECREATION ACCESS PROJECTS SUCH AS TRAILS, TRAILHEADS, AND ACCESS TO ANCESTRAL SITES.  CREWS WILL WORK ON ACTIVITIES (I.E., FUELS REDUCTION AND NON-NATIVE SPECIES REMOVAL) TO ENHANCE THE USER EXPERIENCE AND ENSURE PUBLIC SAFETY.

PROJECT TITLE - INTERPRETATION SUPPORT, VISITOR SERVICESAWARD PURPOSE - THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO CREATE TWO INTERNSHIPS FOR THE DIVISION OF INTERPRETATION AND THE MAINTENANCE DIVISION AT CAMP NELSON NATIONAL MONUMENT PERFORMANCE GOALS  THE PRIMARY GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE MEMORABLE AND MEANINGFUL LEARNING EXPERIENCES, FOSTER DEVELOPMENT OF A PERSONAL STEWARDSHIP ETHIC, AND BROADEN PUBLIC SUPPORT FOR PRESERVING CANE RESOURCES.PERFORMANCE OBJECTIVES:THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THE POSITION IS TO PROVIDE HIGH QUALITY INTERPRETIVE SERVICES THROUGH CONTACTS AT THE VISITOR INFORMATION DESK, FORMAL AND INFORMAL INTERPRETIVE PROGRAMS, AND SPECIAL EVENT MANAGEMENT ASSISTANCE. A SECONDARY OBJECTIVE OF THE INTERNSHIP IS TO PROVIDE A DIVERSE AND EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCE TO THE CANDIDATES TO STRENGTHEN THEIR KNOWLEDGE OF THE AGENCY AND THE WORK WE DO, WHILE ALLOWING THEM TO SEE OTHER CAREER OPPORTUNITIES THAT ARE AVAILABLE.

ADDITIONALLY, THE PARTICIPANT WILL WORK COLLABORATIVELY WITH OTHER INTERPRETERS TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE PARK S SOCIAL MEDIA OUTREACH PROGRAM. THIS PROJECT ENGAGES YOUTH IN PROTECTING AND RESTORING PUBLIC LANDS THROUGH PARTICIPATION IN SELECT RESTORATION PROJECTS WITHIN BRYCE CANYON NATIONAL PARK. PARTICIPANTS WILL ACCOMPLISH MEANINGFUL WORK AND GAIN IMPORTANT PERSONAL AND PROFESSIONAL SKILLS WHILE BUILDING A LIFELINE CONNECTION TO THE OUTDOORS. PARTICIPANTS WILL GAIN TRAINING AND EDUCATION IN RESTORATION ACTIVITIES THAT HELP TO PROTECT RESOURCES AND IMPROVE VISITOR EXPERIENCES. THE RECIPIENT WILL ASSIST IN THE RESTORATION OF PONDEROSA PINE FORESTS TO PROMOTE FOREST HEALTH AND MINIMIZE RISKS (SAFETY, PROPERTY, AND ECOLOGICAL) RELATED TO WILDFIRE.PARTICIPANTS WILL RECEIVE TRAINING AND EDUCATION IN RESTORATION PRACTICES AND TECHNIQUES THAT IMPROVE VISITOR ACCESS WHILE PROTECTING AND CARING FOR PUBLIC LANDS. EACH MEMBER WILL RECEIVE AN EDUCATIONAL COMPONENT IN ADDITION TO PERFORMING PHYSICAL WORK. PARTICIPANTS CAN EXPECT TO OBSERVE AND INTERACT IN A VARIETY OF GROUP DISCUSSIONS RELATED TO THE ASSIGNED PROJECTS. THE RECIPIENT WILL COMPLETE PRESCRIBED MECHANICAL TREATMENTS IN SELECTED PONDEROSA PINE STANDS TO REDUCE STAND DENSITIES, USE CHAINSAWS TO THIN AREAS AROUND PARK INFRASTRUCTURE TO CREATE DEFENSIBLE SPACE, REDUCE DENSITIES OF SELECTED STANDS TO RESTORE NATURAL FOREST CHARACTERISTICS, AND PILE RESULTING SLASH SO IT CAN BE SAFELY BURNED DURING WINTER MONTHS.THIS PROJECT FULFILLS AN IMPORTANT PUBLIC PURPOSE BY ENGAGING AND MOTIVATING YOUTH PARTICIPANTS IN SHARED RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP, PROVIDING THEM WITH DIRECT HANDS-ON WORK EXPERIENCE IN RESTORATION ACTIVITIES, AND FACILITATES A GREATER UNDERSTANDING OF NATURAL AND RECREATIONAL ASPECTS OF CONSERVATION AREAS.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):PERFORMANCE GOALS  THE SELECTED INTERNS (11) WILL COMPLETE A WEEK LONG ORIENTATION AND TRAINING DURING SPRING BREAK AND 8-16 WEEK SUMMER INTERNSHIPS IN A VARIETY OF DISCIPLINES RELATING TO THE OPERATIONS, STEWARDSHIP AND PROTECTION OF NATIONAL PARKS. PROJECT OBJECTIVES ARE TO PROVIDE A LEARNING OPPORTUNITY FOR INTERNS WHILE ACHIEVING THE GOALS FOR EACH DIVISION OR PROGRAM.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:INTERNS WILL ATTEND A WEEK-LONG TRAINING AND PARTICIPATE IN 8-16 WEEK SUMMER INTERNSHIPS. ACTIVITIES DIFFER BY POSITION AND WILL INVOLVE WORKING ALONGSIDE PARK STAFF TO COMPLETE DUTIES AND ACHIEVE PARK GOALS. INTERN ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: PROVIDING INTERPRETATION TO PARK VISITORS, COMPLETING TRAIL WORK, STUDYING FIRE EFFECTS, COLLECTING SCIENTIFIC DATA, AND PROMOTING VISITOR SAFETY.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:INTERNS WILL COMPLETE A WEEK-LONG SPRING ORIENTATION AND BEGIN WORK DURING THE SUMMER SEASON. INTERNS WILL RECEIVE TRAINING UPON ARRIVAL AT THEIR JOBS AND THROUGHOUT THE SEASON. BY THE END OF THE SEASONS INTERNS WILL HAVE LEARNED NEW SKILLS, GAINED NEW EXPERIENCES, AND HELPED ACHIEVE THE GOALS OF THE DIVISION THEY WORK FOR.BENEFICIARIES:BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE INTERNS, PARK STAFF, THE PARK RESOURCE, AND THE AMERICAN PUBLIC.

THIS PROGRAM UTILIZES QUALIFIED NON-PROFIT YOUTH- AND VETERAN-SERVING ORGANIZATIONS TO CARRY OUT APPROPRIATE NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE CONSERVATION, EDUCATION, VOLUNTEER SERVICE AND EDUCATION PROJECTS ON DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR LANDS THROUGH AUTHORIZED NATIONAL PARK SERVICE PROGRAMS. THE COLLECTIONS ASSISTANT WILL GET A BEHIND-THE-SCENES LOOK AT COLLECTIONS BOTH ON EXHIBIT AND IN COLLECTION STORAGE. WORKING WITH THE PARKS MUSEUM CURATOR, THE COLLECTIONS ASSISTANT WILL GAIN EXPERIENCE WORKING WITH THE PARKS COLLECTION OF OVER 2 MILLION ARCHAEOLOGICAL AND HISTORIC ARTIFACTS, AS WELL AS ARCHIVES. BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE PRIVATE NON-PROFIT INSTITUTIONS AND ORGANIZATIONS  PUBLIC AND PRIVATE NON-PROFIT ACADEMIC INSTITUTIONS  STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENT AGENCIES  QUASI-PUBLIC NON-PROFIT INSTITUTIONS AND ORGANIZATIONS THAT SUPPORT YOUTH AND YOUNG ADULT CAREER TRAINING AND DEVELOPMENT, AND EDUCATION IN THE AREAS OF NATURAL AND OR CULTURAL RESOURCE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT. INDIVIDUALS FAMILIES  STUDENTS  AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC WILL RECEIVE A BENEFIT FROM THE DEVELOPMENT AND EXECUTION OF THESE PROGRAMS AND PROJECTS.

THIS PROJECT PROVIDES YOUNG ADULTS WITH THE OPPORTUNITY TO GAIN SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE IN ENVIRONMENTAL AND CONSERVATION ACTIVITIES, AND INVOLVES THEM IN THE NATURAL, CULTURAL AND  OR HISTORICAL RESOURCE PROTECTION OF THEIR COMMUNITIES AND BEYOND.  IN ADDITION, THIS PROJECT  HELPS MEMBERS TO DEVELOP A SENSE OF RESPONSIBLE CITIZENSHIP AND PRODUCTIVE COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT. THE MCC SEEKS TO PROTECT AND ENHANCE THE ENVIRONMENT BY ENGAGING YOUNG ADULTS AGES 15-25 IN HANDS-ON CONSERVATION SERVICE. MCC TEACHES MEMBERS TO BE LEADERS,  STEWARDS OF THE LAND, AND ENGAGED CITIZENS WHO IMPROVE OUR COMMUNITIES. MCC MEMBERS WILL GAIN AN UNDERSTANDING AND APPRECIATION OF RESOURCE CONSERVATION AND PROTECTION ACTIVITIES, AND BUILD IMPORTANT SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE THROUGH HANDS-ON TRAINING, MENTORSHIP, AND EDUCATION. MEMBERS WILL LEARN ABOUT AND DISCUSS SUSTAINABLE MAINTENANCE TECHNIQUES AND PRACTICES, LEARN ABOUT RESOURCE PROTECTION ACTIVITIES WITHIN PARK, AND SUPPORT CULTURAL AND NATURAL RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP.THE RECIPIENT WILL BE MENTORED BY THE PARKS  REVEGETATION CREW IN A VARIETY OF RESOURCE PROJECTS ON THE WEST AND EAST SIDES OF GLACIER NATIONAL PARK. PROJECT ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PLANTING ALONG THE GTSR, POSSIBLE WHITEBARK AND LIMBER PINE PLANTING, ASSISTANCE WITH NURSERY CLOSING, SEED COLLECTION AND NURSERY MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES AT PARK HEADQUARTERS, AND OTHER RESOURCE MANAGEMENT PROJECTS. THE RECIPIENTS CREW WILL BE MENTORED BY PARK STAFF ON ADDITIONAL MAINTENANCE AND REPAIR ACTIVITIES IN THE PARK, SUCH AS THE REPAIR OF FENCING ALONG THE PARKS EASTERN BOUNDARY. REPAIRS TO FENCING MAY INCLUDE REPLACING OF WIRE, POSTS, FENCE TIGHTENING, BUILDING REPLACING H BRACES, AND SIMILAR WORK.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):   SAN ANTONIO MISSIONS NATIONAL HISTORICAL PARK PROTECTS MISSION ERA STRUCTURES AND TWO OF THE IRRIGATION SYSTEMS (ACEQUIAS) THAT FED THEM.  ACEQUIAS, THE LIFEBLOOD OF EVERY SPANISH COLONIAL SETTLEMENT, HAVE BEEN LARGELY NEGLECTED BY PREVIOUS PRIVATE OWNERS AND ANNUAL VEGETATION SUCCESSION IS SIGNIFICANT. YOUTH CREWS WILL PERFORM RECURRING TASKS ASSOCIATED WITH GENERAL SITE WORK, VEGETATION REMOVAL, DE-SILTING AND CLEANING OF THE 6 MILE ESPADA ACEQUIA AND PORTIONS OF THE 7 MILE SAN JUAN ACEQUIA TO RESTORE AND MAINTAIN ADEQUATE WATER FLOW FROM THE RIVER INTO THESE HISTORIC GRAVITY FLOW IRRIGATION SYSTEMS.  THESE SYSTEMS ARE ONE OF THE PARKS PRIMARY HISTORIC RESOURCES AND A KEY ELEMENT IN THE DESIGNATION OF SAN ANTONIO MISSIONS NATIONAL HISTORICAL PARK AS A UNESCO WORLD HERITAGE SITE.  THE PROJECT MEETS THE PURPOSE OF PROVIDING: EDUCATION, JOB TRAINING, DEVELOPMENT OF RESPONSIBLE CITIZENSHIP, PRODUCTIVE COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT, YOUTH EXPERIENCE, AND FURTHERING THE UNDERSTANDING AND APPRECIATION OF NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES THROUGH THE INVOLVEMENT OF YOUTH AND YOUNG ADULTS IN THE CARE AND ENHANCEMENT OF PUBLIC RESOURCES.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:   ACTIVITIES INCLUDE ALL LABOR ASSOCIATED WITH VEGETATION REMOVAL, TREE WORK, EXOTIC PLANT CONTROL, DESILTING IRRIGATION FEATURES, REMOVING DETERIORATED FENCING, LANDSCAPE BED RENEWAL, EARTHWORKS, TRAIL MAINTENANCE, BOLLARD INSTALLATION, UTILITY EASEMENT CLEARING, LARGE TRASH AND DEBRIS REMOVAL AND MANY OTHER ASPECTS TO SUPPORT THE PARKS PRESERVATION OF HISTORIC LANDSCAPES.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:   PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDE AMOUNT OF VEGETATION REMOVED, LENGTH OF ACEQUIA EASEMENTS CLEARED, FENCE LINES REMOVED, ACRES MAINTAINED, AND OTHER METRICS RELATED TO LANDSCAPE PRESERVATION.BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE PRIVATE NON-PROFIT INSTITUTIONS AND ORGANIZATIONS  PUBLIC AND PRIVATE NON-PROFIT ACADEMIC INSTITUTIONS  STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENT AGENCIES: QUASI-PUBLIC NON-PROFIT INSTITUTIONS AND ORGANIZATIONS THAT SUPPORT YOUTH AND YOUNG ADULT CAREER TRAINING AND DEVELOPMENT, AND EDUCATION IN THE AREAS OF NATURAL AND OR CULTURAL RESOURCE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT. INDIVIDUALS FAMILIES  STUDENTS  AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC WILL RECEIVE A BENEFIT FROM THE DEVELOPMENT AND EXECUTION OF THESE PROGRAMS AND PROJECTS.SPECIFIC BENEFICIARIES:PRIMARYINDIVIDUAL YOUTH CREW MEMBERSSECONDARYSAN ANTONIO MISSIONS NATIONAL HISTORICAL PARKSAN JUAN ACEQUIA DITCH COMPANYESPADA DITCH COMPANYLOCAL COMMUNITY MEMBERS1.4 MILLION ANNUAL VISITORS TO SAN ANTONIO MISSIONS NATIONAL HISTORICAL PARK

THE PUBLIC PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE YOUNG ADULTS WITH VALUABLE TRAINING AND EXPERIENCES THAT WILL TRANSLATE INTO LIFE-LONG SKILLS IN CULTURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT AND PROMOTE RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP OF PUBLIC LANDS. THE PROJECT WILL PROMOTE AND STIMULATE PUBLIC PURPOSES SUCH AS EDUCATION, TRAINING, DEVELOPMENT OF RESPONSIBLE CITIZENSHIP, PRODUCTIVE COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT, YOUTH EXPERIENCE, AND FURTHERING THE UNDERSTANDING AND APPRECIATION OF CULTURAL RESOURCES THROUGH THE INVOLVEMENT OF YOUTH AND YOUNG ADULTS IN THE CARE AND ENHANCEMENT OF PUBLIC RESOURCES. IN ADDITION, THIS PROJECT WILL IMPROVE THE APPEARANCE AND STABILITY OF STANDING WALLS AT TWO CULTURALLY IMPORTANT SITES, AS WELL AS ENHANCE THE QUALITY AND SAFETY OF THE VISITOR EXPERIENCE.THE PROJECT WILL EDUCATE YOUTH AND GIVE THEM DIRECT TECHNICAL EXPERIENCE WITH HISTORIC PRESERVATION TECHNIQUES. THE RECIPIENT WILL PROVIDE A 5-PERSON CREW TO BE TRAINED AND MENTORED IN HISTORIC PRESERVATION WORK AT MONTEZUMA CASTLE AND TUZIGOOT NATIONAL MONUMENTS.  THE YOUTH INVOLVED IN THIS PROJECT WILL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO BE MENTORED BY NPS RESOURCE PROFESSIONALS, LEARN ABOUT PARK OPERATIONS, NPS MISSION, POLICIES, PROTOCOLS, METHODOLOGIES, AND SURVEY AND MONITORING TECHNIQUES FOR CULTURAL RESOURCES.

THIS PROJECT FULFILLS AN IMPORTANT PUBLIC PURPOSE BY ENGAGING AND MOTIVATING YOUTH PARTICIPANTS IN SHARED RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP, PROVIDING THEM WITH DIRECT HANDS-ON WORK EXPERIENCE IN RESTORATION PROJECTS, AND FACILITATES A GREATER UNDERSTANDING OF NATURAL AND RECREATIONAL ASPECTS OF CONSERVATION AREAS. THE CREWS WILL GAIN IMPORTANT SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE THROUGH IMPROVING AND PROTECTING KEY AREAS BY MAINTAINING ACCESS AND CONDITION OF KEY TRAILHEADS, ROADS, AND PARKING AREAS AT ARCHES NATIONAL PARK.THIS PROJECT ENGAGES YOUTH IN PROTECTING AND RESTORING PUBLIC LANDS THROUGH VEGETATION AND NATURAL RESOURCE PROTECTION ACTIVITIES. PARTICIPANTS WILL ACCOMPLISH MEANINGFUL WORK AND GAIN IMPORTANT PERSONAL AND PROFESSIONAL SKILLS WHILE BUILDING A LIFELINE CONNECTION TO THE OUTDOORS. PARTICIPANTS WILL GAIN TRAINING AND EDUCATION IN VEGETATION MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES THAT HELP TO PROTECT RESOURCES AND IMPROVE VISITOR EXPERIENCES. ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE REMOVAL OF INVASIVE VEGETATION FROM AREAS WHERE IT IMPEDES CHANNEL DRAINAGE, THREATENS INFRASTRUCTURE THROUGH FUELS BUILDUP, AND DEGRADES ECOSYSTEM HEALTH.  THIS PROJECT FOCUSES SPECIFICALLY ON AREAS THAT WILL MAINTAIN VISITOR ACCESS AND EXPERIENCE OF DELICATE ARCH TRAIL AND HISTORIC WOLFE RANCH AREA OF ARCHES NATIONAL PARK.PARTICIPANTS WILL RECEIVE TRAINING AND EDUCATION FOCUSED ON VEGETATION MANAGEMENT PRACTICES AND TECHNIQUES THROUGH THE CONTROL OF SECONDARY NOXIOUS WEED INFESTATIONS IN AN AREA BELOW THE WOLFE RANCH ROAD, WHICH ARE DISTURBED BY MECHANIZED TAMARISK REMOVAL AND DRAINAGE MAINTENANCE. IF LEFT UNCHECKED, RUSSIAN THISTLE (AKA TUMBLEWEED) SKELETONS BLOCK DRAINAGE OF THIS AREA WHICH CONTRIBUTES TO FLOODING ACROSS WOLFE RANCH RD, INHIBITING VISITOR ACCESS TO DELICATE ARCH.  CREWS WILL ALSO TREAT TAMARISK RESPROUTS IN THIS AREA. LATE IN THE SEASON, CREWS WILL FOCUS ON TAMARISK REMOVAL IN SALT WASH NEAR DELICATE ARCH TRAIL, WHERE FUELS OF THIS INVASIVE SPECIES THREATEN THE HIKER BRIDGE AND HISTORIC STRUCTURES OF ADJACENT WOLFE RANCH. CREWS MAY ALSO ASSIST NPS STAFF IN OTHER RESTORATION ACTIVITIES SUCH AS SEED COLLECTION AND REVEGETATION WITH NATIVE SPECIES IN OTHER HIGH USE AREAS SUCH AS TRAILHEADS, ROADSIDES, AND PARKING AREAS.

THIS TASK AGREEMENT IS FOR 6 WEEKS (3 HITCHES) OF NON-TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE OF YOUTH CONSERVATION CORPS TO HELP WITH NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE PROJECTS CENTERED ON HISTORIC ORCHARDS IN CAPITOL REEF NATIONAL PARK. WE WOULD LIKE TO ENGAGE YOUTH STEWARDSHIP TO FACILITATE SCIENCE-BASED MANAGEMENT OF THE ORCHARDS IN ORDER TO IMPROVE RESOURCE QUALITY AND VISITOR EXPERIENCE OF THE FRUITA RURAL HISTORIC DISTRICT.THIS TASK AGREEMENT AIMS TO IMPROVE YOUTH INVOLVEMENT IN CULTURAL AND NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES, INCLUDING IMPROVED STEWARDSHIP FOR RESOURCES, SCIENCE-BASED APPROACHES TO MANAGEMENT DECISION MAKING, AND IMPROVED VISITOR EXPERIENCE AND ACCESS.  YOUTH INVOLVEMENT IS IMPROVED BY PROVIDING YOUTH WITH AMERICORPS POSITIONS TO GAIN EXPERIENCE WITH FEDERAL LAND MANAGEMENT AGENCIES. THE STEWARDSHIP IS IMPROVED BY UTILIZING SCIENCE-BASED APPROACHES TO UNDERSTANDING NATURAL AND CULTURAL SYSTEMS AND SUPPORTING MANAGEMENT DECISIONS WITH SCIENTIFIC DATA.  IN ADDITION, VISITOR ACCESS AND QUALITY OF ACCESS ARE IMPROVED FOR THE PUBLIC THROUGH IMPROVEMENT OF RESOURCE ACCESS AND AVAILABILITY.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:CANYON COUNTRY YOUTH CORPS CREWS WILL ASSIST CARE STAFF IN DEPLOYING OVER 1,000 MATING DISRUPTORS TO IMPLEMENT CARES INTEGRATED PEST MANAGEMENT (IPM) STRATEGIES. CREWS WILL ALSO ASSIST IN MAINTAINING OVER 10,000 FEET OF HISTORIC OPEN FLOOD-FURROW IRRIGATION DITCHES AND MAINTAINING THE HEALTH OF OVER 1,800 HISTORIC FRUIT TREES IN ONE OF THE PARK SERVICES LARGEST ORCHARDS.CREWS WILL ALSO WORK WITHIN CARE TO CONDUCT PRIORITY NATURAL RESOURCE PROJECTS ACROSS THE PARK, INCLUDING INVASIVE SPECIES REMOVAL, BORDER FENCE REPAIR, AND NATIVE SEED COLLECTION. CREWS WILL ALSO ASSESS, MAP, AND REPAIR CARE BOUNDARY FENCES. EFFECTIVE FENCES PRESERVE THEUNIQUE ECOLOGICAL, GEOLOGICAL, AND CULTURAL RESOURCES IN CARE BY MINIMIZING UNAUTHORIZED LANDUSES AND TRESPASS IN SENSITIVE AREAS. MANY OF THE PARKS BOUNDARY FENCES TRAVERSE REMOTETERRAIN, MAKING IT CHALLENGING FOR LIMITED PERMANENT STAFF TO INVENTORY ROUTINELY.FINALLY, CREWS WILL BE UTILIZED TO COLLECT NATIVE PLANT SEEDS FROM A VARIETY OF PLANT COMMUNITIES IN CARE FOR FUTURE USE IN THE RESTORATION OF NATIVE ECOSYSTEMS. IT IS IMPORTANT TO USE LOCAL SEED SOURCES AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE TO TAKE ADVANTAGE OF LOCALLY ADAPTED PLANTS AND MAINTAIN LOCAL GENETICS.BENEFICIARIES: YOUTH CORPS PARTICIPANTS, CAPITOL REEF NATIONAL PARK

PARTICIPANTS WILL WORK ALONGSIDE PARK SERVICE STAFF AS AN INTEGRAL MEMBER OF A COLLECTIVE CREW. THIS PROJECT ENGAGES YOUTH IN PROTECTING AND RESTORING PUBLIC LANDS THROUGH PRESERVATION (STABILIZATION) MAINTENANCE OF PREHISTORIC ARCHAEOLOGICAL SITES AT HOVENWEEP NATIONAL MONUMENT. THIS PROJECT ENGAGES YOUTH IN PROTECTING AND RESTORING ARCHAEOLOGICAL RESOURCES. PRESERVATION MAINTENANCE IS AN ONGOING EFFORT AT HOVENWEEP AND THROUGHOUT THE SOUTHEAST UTAH GROUP. ONGOING PRESERVATION MAINTENANCE PROJECTS ARE A PRIORITY FOR THE PARK IN 2023 AND BEYOND, PARTICIPANTS WILL ACCOMPLISH MEANINGFUL WORK AND GAIN IMPORTANT PERSONAL AND PROFESSIONAL SKILLS WHILE BUILDING A LIFELINE CONNECTION TO THE OUTDOORS. PARTICIPANTS WILL GAIN TRAINING AND EDUCATION IN STABILIZATION ACTIVITIES THAT HELP TO PROTECT RESOURCES AND IMPROVE THE VISITOR EXPERIENCE. THESE PROJECTS WORK TO PRESERVE ARCHAEOLOGICAL SITES THAT ARE THREATENED BY ONGOING DETERIORATION.PARTICIPANTS WILL RECEIVE TRAINING AND EDUCATION FOCUSED ON STABILIZATION TECHNIQUES THROUGH THE HANDS ON EXPERIENCE OF PRESERVING PREHISTORIC STANDING ARCHITECTURE. THIS PROJECT WILL ENSURE THAT THE INTEGRITY OF THE PARKS CULTURAL RESOURCES REMAIN INTACT BY KEEPING THE SITES IN A STABLE AND SAFE CONDITION. IN ADDITION, THEY WILL ENSURE A SAFE VISITOR EXPERIENCE WHILE MAINTAINING VISITOR EXPECTATIONS OF STANDING ARCHITECTURAL SITES. THESE PREHISTORIC STRUCTURES ARE UNDER CONSTANT PRESSURE FROM NATURAL AND HUMAN CAUSED DISTURBANCES. RECENT ARCHAEOLOGICAL MONITORING VISITS HAVE INDICATED THAT THE SITES SHOW SIGNS OF IMPACTS AND EROSION. AS OPEN ARCHITECTURE, THE STRUCTURES ARE EXHIBITING MORTAR LOSS, LOOSE STONES, DETERIORATING BASAL STONE MASONRY, AND DETRIMENTAL CONCRETE CAPPING ALLOWING MOISTURE PENETRATION THAT RESULTS IN CRACKING. PERFORMING PRESERVATION MAINTENANCE ON THESE STRUCTURES WILL PREVENT THE FURTHER DETERIORATION OF THESE CULTURAL RESOURCES.IN ADDITION TO ACHIEVING VALUABLE CULTURAL RESOURCE PRESERVATION MAINTENANCE GOALS, THIS PROJECT FULFILLS AN IMPORTANT PUBLIC PURPOSE BY ENGAGING AND MOTIVATING NATIVE AMERICAN YOUTH PARTICIPANTS IN SHARED ENVIRONMENTAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP. BY PROVIDING PARTICIPANTS WITH DIRECT HANDS ON WORK IN CULTURAL RESOURCE PRESERVATION, THEY WILL DEVELOP A GREATER UNDERSTANDING OF CULTURAL AND NATURAL ASPECTS OF CONSERVATION AREAS. THE EXPERIENCE PROVIDES THEM WITH DIRECT HANDS ON WORK EXPERIENCE ON MULTIPLE CULTURAL RESOURCE PRESERVATION PROJECTS, WHILE FACILITATING A GREATER UNDERSTANDING OF NATURAL AND CULTURAL ASPECTS OF NATIONAL PARKS.

THIS PROJECT FULFILLS AN IMPORTANT PUBLIC PURPOSE OF ENGAGING AND MOTIVATING YOUTH IN SHARED RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP. BY WAY OF PROVIDING PARTICIPANTS WITH DIRECT HANDS ON WORK IN NATURAL RESOURCE RESTORATION, THEY WILL DEVELOP A GREATER UNDERSTANDING OF NATURAL AND RECREATIONAL ASPECTS OF CONSERVATION AREAS. THE CREWS WILL GAIN IMPORTANT SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE THROUGH IMPROVING AND PROTECTING KEY AREAS SUCH AS CAMPSITES ON THE RIVER, TRAILHEADS, ROADS, AND PARKING AREAS IN CANYONLANDS AND ARCHES NATIONAL PARKS.THIS PROJECT ENGAGES YOUTH IN PROTECTING AND RESTORING PUBLIC LANDS THROUGH VEGETATION AND NATURAL RESOURCE PROTECTION ACTIVITIES. PARTICIPANTS WILL ACCOMPLISH MEANINGFUL WORK AND GAIN IMPORTANT PERSONAL AND PROFESSIONAL SKILLS WHILE BUILDING A LIFELINE CONNECTION TO THE OUTDOORS. PARTICIPANTS WILL GAIN TRAINING AND EDUCATION IN VEGETATION MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES THAT HELP TO PROTECT RESOURCES AND IMPROVE VISITOR EXPERIENCES. WORK WILL OCCUR IN AREAS DEGRADED BY THE INVASION OF AGGRESSIVE NON NATIVE VEGETATION. THIS WORK WILL HELP TO IMPROVE WILDLIFE HABITAT, ENHANCE VISITOR EXPERIENCE AND ACCESS TO CAMP AREAS AND TRAILS, AND SUPPORT FIRE SAFETY FOR CAMPS ALONG THE RIVER.PARTICIPANTS WILL RECEIVE TRAINING AND EDUCATION FOCUSED ON VEGETATION MANAGEMENT PRACTICES AND TECHNIQUES THROUGH THE REMOVAL OF TAMARISK. THIS WILL PROTECT STANDS OF NATIVE VEGETATION IN PRIORITY AREAS, IMPROVE VISITOR RIVER ACCESS AND CAMPING, EXPAND PUBLIC CAMP AREAS, CREATE FUEL BREAKS TO PREVENT FIRE SPREAD, AND PROTECT HIGH VALUE STANDS OF NATIVE TREES (SUCH AS LEGACY COTTONWOODS THAT CANNOT RESPROUT POST FIRE). PARTICIPANTS WILL ALSO REMOVE RIPGUT BROME FROM UPPER CORDOVA WASH AT ARCHES NATIONAL PARK, WHICH WILL PROTECT THE HEALTH OF THE NATIVE RIPARIAN VEGETATION COMMUNITY DOWNSTREAM OF THIS INFESTATION. RIPGUT IS AN ANNUAL GRASS THAT SENESCES EARLY IN THE SEASON, ALSO CREATING FUEL LOADS AND WILDFIRE DANGER IF LEFT UNCHECKED. WORK IN SALT WASH WILL CONTROL SECONDARY NOXIOUS WEED INFESTATIONS IN THE LARGE AREA DISTURBED BY MECHANIZED TAMARISK REMOVAL AND DRAINAGE MAINTENANCE. IF LEFT UNCHECKED, RUSSIAN THISTLE (AKA TUMBLEWEED) SKELETONS BLOCK DRAINAGE OF THIS AREA WHICH CONTRIBUTES TO FLOODING THAT INHIBITS VISITOR ACCESS.  CREWS WILL BE MENTORED BY NPS STAFF IN OTHER RESTORATION ACTIVITIES INCLUDING SEED COLLECTION AND REVEGETATION WITH NATIVE SPECIES IN HIGH USE AREAS OF THE PARKS (SUCH AS TRAILHEADS, ROADSIDES, AND PARKING AREAS).

15.931: YOUTH AND VETERAN ORGANIZATIONS CONSERVATION ACTIVITIESSAM.GOV LINK: CLICK HERE FOR THE SAM.GOV ASSISTANCE LISTINGTEMPLATE: THIS PROGRAM UTILIZES QUALIFIED NON-PROFIT YOUTH- AND VETERAN-SERVING ORGANIZATIONS TO CARRY OUT APPROPRIATE NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE CONSERVATION, EDUCATION, VOLUNTEER SERVICE AND EDUCATION PROJECTS ON DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR LANDS THROUGH AUTHORIZED NATIONAL PARK SERVICE PROGRAMS.THE PUEBLO AND FOUR WINDS FIRE ECOLOGY PROGRAM IS STATIONED AT BANDELIER NATIONAL MONUMENT IN THE JEMEZ MOUNTAINS OF NORTHERN NEW MEXICO. THE FIRE ECOLOGY PROGRAM FOCUSES ON MONITORING AND RESEARCH, COLLECTING BOTH SHORT AND LONG-TERM DATA ON PERMANENT VEGETATION AND FUEL PLOTS. THE DATA IS USED TO PROVIDE INFORMATION ABOUT THE COMPOSITION AND STRUCTURE OF VEGETATION AND SURFACE FUELS PRIOR TO AND AFTER MANAGEMENT TREATMENTS (E.G., PRESCRIBED FIRE AND THINNING) WITH AN EMPHASIS ON THREATENED AND ENDANGERED SPECIES HABITAT. THE DATA IS USED TO EVALUATE IF OBJECTIVES ARE MET, TO MEASURE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF FIRE AND THINNING PRESCRIPTIONS, AND TO DETERMINE IF ADDITIONAL RESEARCH IS NEEDED. INTERNS ARE INVOLVED WITH DATA COLLECTION, PLANT IDENTIFICATION, DATA MANAGEMENT, ENTRY, ANALYSIS, AND GRAPHING. INTERNS CAN ALSO FOCUS ON AN INDIVIDUAL PROJECT. OTHER OPPORTUNITIES INCLUDE LEARNING ABOUT THE NPS FIRE MANAGEMENT AND FIRE ECOLOGY PROGRAMS AND HOW THESE PROGRAMS CONTRIBUTE TO THE RESTORATION OF NATURAL AREAS AND LEARNING ABOUT PRESCRIBED FIRE AND THE FIRE ECOLOGY OF SOUTHWESTERN ECOSYSTEMS.BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE PRIVATE NON-PROFIT INSTITUTIONS AND ORGANIZATIONS  PUBLIC AND PRIVATE NON-PROFIT ACADEMIC INSTITUTIONS  STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENT AGENCIES: QUASI-PUBLIC NON-PROFIT INSTITUTIONS AND ORGANIZATIONS THAT SUPPORT YOUTH AND YOUNG ADULT CAREER TRAINING AND DEVELOPMENT, AND EDUCATION IN THE AREAS OF NATURAL AND OR CULTURAL RESOURCE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT. THIS WORK WILL CONTRIBUTE TOWARDS UNDERSTANDING THE ROLE OF MINORITIES IN AVIATION DEVELOPMENT AND TOWARDS THE CONTENT DEVELOPMENT OF A NEW INTERPRETIVE TRAIL ON THE FREEDMANS COLONY AND CONTENT DEVELOPMENT OF NEW EXHIBITS AND DIGITAL RESOURCES.

NEW AWARD   PROJECT ABSTRACT SUMMARY  PROJECT TITLE  CONSERVE HISTORIC CANNONS AND HISTORIC METAL FEATURES AT THE CASTILLO DE SAN MARCOS NATIONAL MONUMENTAWARD PURPOSE  INTERNS WILL LEARN SKILLS IN HISTORIC PRESERVATION AND RESTORATION OF THE HISTORIC IRON ARTILLERY. INTERNS WILL GAIN KNOWLEDGE OF THE HISTORY OF THE CASTILLO DE SAN MARCOS NATIONAL MONUMENT AND THE HISTORIC IRON ARTILLERY TYPES.ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED  THE GOAL IS FOR ALL (25) HISTORIC IRON ARTILLERY (CANNONS) TO HAVE NEW TOPCOATS OF PAINT, AND FOR ALL (16) HISTORIC BRONZE ARTILLERY (CANNONS) TO BE FREE OF CORROSION AND PREVIOUS OVERPAINT DAMAGE.DELIVERABLES AND OR EXPECTED OUTCOMES  THE OBJECTIVE IS THAT THE (41) HISTORIC ARTILLERY AND IRON FEATURES WILL NOT CORRODE IN THE NEXT 10 YEARS DUE TO THIS NEW CONSERVATION WORK. INTERNS WILL FOLLOW CONSERVATION GUIDANCE TO PROTECT IRON AND BRONZE ARTILLERY, WHICH MAY ALSO INCLUDE WAXING. THE HISTORIC IRON WORK, SUCH AS CARRIAGE TRACKS AND THE HOTSHOT FURNACE WILL BE NEWLY CLEANED, PAINTED, AND POSSIBLY WAXED. INTERNS WILL LEARN SKILLS IN HISTORIC PRESERVATION AND BECOME FAMILIAR WITH THE HISTORY OF THE CASTILLO DE SAN MARCOS NATIONAL MONUMENT AND THE VARIOUS ARTILLERY TYPES.

THE INTERN WILL ALSO POST TO THE PARKS SOCIAL MEDIA SITES, ASSIST VISITORS AT THE VISITOR CENTER, AND PROVIDE INTERPRETIVE PROGRAMMING. THE INTERN WILL HELP TO PRESERVE WRANGELL ST. ELIAS BY PROMOTING STEWARDSHIP AND PRESERVATION PRINCIPLES. SPECIFICALLY, THIS INTERNSHIP WILL FULFILL A DEEP CONNECTION BETWEEN THE YOUNGER GENERATION (THE SCA INTERN) AND THE PARK. THE STUDENT INTERN WILL BE OFFERED A VARIETY OF OPPORTUNITIES TO DEVELOP JOB SKILLS SUCH AS PUBLIC SPEAKING, CUSTOMER SERVICE, AND TRAINING WHILE WORKING IN MULTIPLE DIVISIONS AND FIELDS. THIS PROMOTES INNOVATION, CREATIVITY, AND A DIVERSE WORK ENVIRONMENT FOR THE INTERN WHILE SUPPORTING PARK STAFF. ALL OF THESE SKILLS WILL BE INSTRUMENTAL IN CREATING A PATHWAY TO EMPLOYMENT WITH THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE.

THIS PROJECT SEEKS TO CONNECT YOUTH TO THEIR NATIONAL PARKS AND PUBLIC LANDS THROUGH ENGAGEMENT IN RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP. THROUGH THIS PROJECT YOUNG PEOPLE WILL ACCOMPLISH MEANINGFUL WORK AND GAIN IMPORTANT PERSONAL AND PROFESSIONAL SKILLS WHILE BUILDING A LIFELONG CONNECTION TO THE OUTDOORS. PARTICIPANTS WILL BE PROVIDED WITH VALUABLE TRAINING AND EDUCATION, AND DEVELOP SKILLS IN RESOURCE MANAGEMENT, PROTECTION, AND CONSERVATION THROUGH ACTIVITIES SUCH AS INVASIVE PLANT INVENTORY AND MANAGEMENT, NATIVE SEED COLLECTION, AND NATIVE PLANT RESTORATION. WORK COMPLETED WILL ENCOURAGE PARTICIPANTS TO BECOME STEWARDS OF NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES IN THEIR COMMUNITIES AND BEYOND.THIS PROJECT FULFILLS A PUBLIC PURPOSE BY ENGAGING RECIPIENTS AND PARTNERS IN SHARED RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP. THE PROJECT MOTIVATES PARTICIPANTS TO BECOME INVOLVED IN THE NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE PROTECTION OF THEIR COMMUNITIES AND BEYOND. PARTICIPANTS WILL GAIN HANDS-ON RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP EXPERIENCE BY CONTRIBUTING TO CRITICAL PARK PROJECTS WITHIN AN AMAZING OUTDOOR CLASSROOM.

THE PROGRAM WILL PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUTH TO GAIN WORK EXPERIENCE AND JOB SKILLS AND DEVELOP AN UNDERSTANDING OF THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE GOALS OF PROVIDING PUBLIC USE WHILE SAFEGUARDING CULTURAL AND NATURAL RESOURCES. WORKING THROUGH THE APPALACHIAN CONSERVATION CORPS, PARTICIPANTS WILL BE INTRODUCED TO THE APPOMATTOX COURT HOUSE NATIONAL HISTORICAL PARK STORY AND BE GUIDED BY NATIONAL PARK SERVICE INTERPRETIVE STAFF TO PRESENT INFORMAL PRESENTATIONS TO FURTHER EDUCATE THE PUBLIC. POSITION DUTIES INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING: PROVIDING FRONT LINE INTERPRETIVE SERVICES WITHIN THE PARK VISITOR CENTER, LEADING PRINTING PRESS DEMONSTRATIONS, CONDUCTING INDEPENDENT RESEARCH FOR SOCIAL MEDIA PLATFORMS, CONDUCTING POP-UP INTERPRETIVE TALKS FOR VISITORS, SERVE AS ROVING GUIDES TO ANSWER VISITOR QUESTIONS.

THE PROJECT PROVIDES YOUTH CORPS MEMBERS WITH THE OPPORTUNITY TO GAIN SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE IN ROADS AND TRAILS WORK, AND INCREASES PUBLIC ACCESS AND RECREATION ON THE GREENWAY, RIM TRAIL, BRIDLE PATH, BRIGHT AGNEL POINT TRAIL, SOUTH RIM VISITOR USE AND RESIDENTIAL USE PAVED TRAILS, WEST RIM TRAIL, NORTH KAIBAB, SOUTH KAIBAB, AND BRIGHT ANGEL TRAILS. WORK WILL TAKE PLACE AT THE NORTH OR SOUTH RIM OF GRAND CANYON (GRCA) AS NEEDED TO FACILITATE REHABILITATION WORK ON THE CORRIDOR TRAILS. ADDITIONAL WORK LOCATIONS INCLUDE THE NORTH RIM FOREST TRAILS, THE TANNER TRAIL, GRANDVIEW TRAIL, HERMIT TRAIL, AND TAPEATS CREEK TRAIL.NPS AND AZCC CREWS WILL WORK IN CONJUNCTION TO COMPLETE A VARIETY OF TRAIL MAINTENANCE PROJECTS ON SEVERAL GRAND CANYON TRAILS.ONE HALF MILE OF TRAIL SHALL BE SUBSTANTIALLY IMPROVED FOR EVERY 1 2 MONTHS OF THIS AGREEMENT. PROJECT WORK WILL INCLUDE, BUT IS NOT LIMITED TO THE FOLLOWING  CLEARING DRAINAGE DITCHES AND WATER DIVERSION FEATURES USING HAND TOOLS, BUILDING VARIOUS TRAIL STRUCTURES AND MAINTAINING TRAIL TREAD PER GRCA TRAILS STANDARDS, RESPONDING TO UNFORESEEN TRAIL DAMAGE (I.E. ROCKSLIDES) CAUSED BY WEATHER EVENTS, ASSISTING MULE PACKERS DURING DIRT HAULING OPERATIONS, ASSISTING NPS TRAIL CREW WITH VARIOUS MASONRY PROJECTS, REPAIR OF MORTAR AND DRY MASONRY WALLS, ASPHALT REPAIR, REPAIR REPLACEMENT OF STONE LINER, REPAIR REPLACEMENT OF TRAIL TREAD MATERIALS, QUARRYING, AND TRANSPORT OF MATERIALS (STONE SOIL).THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ENGAGE YOUTH CORPS MEMBERS IN ROADS AND TRAILS RELATED WORK THAT ENCOURAGES THEM TO BE INVOLVED IN THE NATURAL, CULTURAL AND  OR HISTORICAL RESOURCE PROTECTION OF THEIR COMMUNITIES AND BEYOND, AND TO BUILD THEIR SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE IN THIS FIELD. THE PUBLIC WILL BENEFIT FROM THIS PROJECT THROUGH INCREASED ACCESS AND RECREATION ON THE GREENWAY, RIM TRAIL, BRIDLE PATH, BRIGHT AGNEL POINT TRAIL, SOUTH RIM VISITOR USE AND RESIDENTIAL USE PAVED TRAILS, WEST RIM TRAIL, NORTH KAIBAB, SOUTH KAIBAB, AND BRIGHT ANGEL TRAILS.

EXPERIENCE WITH BOTANICAL SYSTEMATICS AND PLANT BIOLOGY, SEED COLLECTION, CURATION, AND ECOLOGICAL RESTORATION PLANNING IN NPS UNITS WITHIN THE CALIFORNIA INVASIVE PLANT MANAGEMENT TEAM  CA IPMT  NETWORK OF PARKS  ACE INTERNS WILL ASSIST PARKS IN THE CA IPMT NETWORK WITH SEED COLLECTION AND BOTANICAL SURVEYS TO PROMOTE NATIVE PLANT CONSERVATION AND HABITAT RESTORATION THROUGHOUT THE PARKS SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES WORK ACTIVITIES INCLUDE BOTANICAL SURVEYS TO LOCATE TARGET POPULATIONS, SEED EVALUATION AND COLLECTION, AND SEED CURATION  THIS PROJECT SUPPORTS THE SEED COLLECTION THAT IS ESSENTIAL TO ALL VEGETATION MANAGEMENT, PROVIDING THE NECESSARY NATIVE PLANT MATERIALS TO PROMOTE THE RESTORATION OF NATIVE PLANT COMMUNITIES PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES THE GOALS OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE A MINIMUM OF 80 INDIVIDUAL SPECIES  SEED COLLECTIONS TO SUPPORT FUTURE RESTORATION OPERATIONS  THESE COLLECTIONS WILL BE MADE IN CLOSE COOPERATION WITH INDIVIDUAL PARK UNITS TO DEVELOP TARGET SPECIES LISTS, IDENTIFY POTENTIAL SEED COLLECTION LOCATIONS, AND ASSIST ACE MEMBERS BY IDENTIFYING THE LOCATIONS FOR CLEANING, STORAGE, AND CURATION OF INDIVIDUAL SPECIES OF PLANTS SELECTED FOR COLLECTION BENEFICIARIES THE YOUTH PARTICIPATING IN THIS PROJECT WILL LEARN ABOUT RESOURCE MANAGEMENT IN THE NATIONAL PARKS AND WILL BE EXPOSED TO CAREER OPPORTUNITIES WITH PUBLIC AGENCIES, WHILE GAINING SKILLS IN NATIVE PLANT CONSERVATION, BOTANY, SEED COLLECTION AND CURATION, HABITAT RESTORATION, AND PLANT MATERIALS PRODUCTION  THEY WILL DIRECTLY CONTRIBUTE TO THE CONSERVATION OF NATIVE PLANTS FOR THE ENJOYMENT OF THE PUBLIC, FURTHER PROMOTING THE PURPOSES OF THE NPS SUPPORTING THE PROTECTION OF NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES FOR THE ENJOYMENT OF FUTURE GENERATIONS  THE PROJECT WILL FOSTER AN UNDERSTANDING OF BOTANY AND FOREST ECOLOGY FOR PARTICIPATING YOUTH  INFORM THEIR UNDERSTANDING OF HABITAT RESTORATION TECHNIQUES  AND INFORM THEIR UNDERSTANDING OF THE IMPACTS OF INVASIVE PLANTS ON NATIONAL PARK RESOURCES  THIS WORK WILL FOSTER AN ETHIC OF STEWARDSHIP AND DEVELOP LEADERSHIP SKILLS THAT PARTICIPANTS WILL BE ABLE TO TAKE WITH THEM INTO THEIR COMMUNITIES AND BEYOND
