PURPOSE OF AWARD PERFORMANCE GOALS   ACE AND NPS WILL PARTNER TO PROVIDE ON THE JOB TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES THROUGH A BROAD RANGE OF LAND STEWARDSHIP PROJECTS AT THE GOLDEN GATE NATIONAL RECREATION AREA  GOGA  AND POINT REYES NATIONAL SEASHORE  PORE  TO DEVELOP AND INSPIRE THE NEXT GENERATION OF PUBLIC LAND STEWARDS  ACE AND NPS WILL WORK TO RECRUIT A DIVERSE RANGE OF YOUTH TO ENGAGE IN THESE TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES  THROUGH THIS TASK AGREEMENT, ACE WILL PROVIDE ADMINISTRATIVE, DEVELOPMENTAL, AND LOGISTICAL SUPPORT, WHILE NPS WILL PROVIDE SERVICE PROJECTS, TECHNICAL TRAINING, AND RESOURCE KNOWLEDGE  PROJECT OBJECTIVES   ACE WILL PROVIDE CREWS THAT WILL WORK ON A BROAD RANGE OF PROJECTS FROM FENCING, TRAIL MAINTENANCE AND REMOVING SOCIAL TRAILS, INSTALLING SIGNAGE, HABITAT RESTORATION, INVASIVE PLANT REMOVAL, AND FUELS REDUCTIONS  NPS WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL TRAINING FOR PROJECT SKILLS NEEDED, INFORMATION ON RESOURCE SENSITIVITIES AND AVOIDANCE MEASURES IN SENSITIVE HABITATS, AND PROJECT BACKGROUND AND ECOLOGICAL INFORMATION FOR EACH SITE OR PROJECT SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES NPS WILL WORK WITH ACE ON A RANGE OF FENCING, SIGNAGE, HABITAT RESTORATION, AND FUELS REDUCTION WORK  HABITAT RESTORATION IN THE PARK CAN TAKE A VARIETY OF FORMS INCLUDING INVASIVE PLANT REMOVAL, REMOVAL OF NATIVE SHRUBS AND TREES, OUTPLANTING NURSEY PLANTS, DIRECT SEEDING, SEED COLLECTION, AND SOIL DECOMPACTION FENCING AND SIGNAGE TO PROTECT MISSION BLUE BUTTERFLY HABITAT  ACE WILL PROVIDE 2 6 PERSON WORK CREWS  WORK 8 STRAIGHT 10 HOUR DAYS IN THE PARK THEN GET 6 DAYS OFF FROM ACE  TO INSTALL FENCING AND SIGNAGE ALONG RECREATIONAL TRAILS TO PROTECT MISSION BLUE BUTTERFLY HABITAT  WORK AREAS WILL BE IDENTIFIED AND PRIORITIZED BY NPS STAFF  WORK WILL OCCUR IN PARK AREAS IN MARIN AND SAN MATEO COUNTIES, CALIFORNIA  WORK CREWS MAY ALSO ASSIST WITH INSTALLATION OF FENCING SIGNAGE BRUSH TO RESTRICT ACCESS TO SOCIAL TRAILS IN THESE AREAS  IF FENCING AND SIGNAGE PROJECTS ARE COMPLETED, THE REMAINDER OF CREW TIME WILL BE ASSISTING WITH HABITAT RESTORATION IN THESE SAME AREAS HABITAT RESTORATION WORK IN MISSION BLUE BUTTERFLY HABITAT  ACE WILL PROVIDE 1 6 PERSON WORK CREW  WORK 8 STRAIGHT 10 HOUR DAYS IN THE PARK THEN GET 6 DAYS OFF FROM ACE  TO ASSIST WITH HABITAT RESTORATION WORK IN PARK AREAS IN MARIN AND SAN MATEO COUNTIES, CALIFORNIA  WORK AREAS WILL BE IDENTIFIED AND PRIORITIZED BY NPS STAFF  HABITAT RESTORATION WORK WILL INCLUDE INVASIVE PLANT MANAGEMENT  TREATMENTS MAY INCLUDE REMOVAL WITH HAND TOOLS AND POWER TOOLS OR USE OF HERBICIDE AS FOLIAR OR CUT STUMP METHOD , SCRUB REMOVAL TO KEEP GRASSLAND PATCHES OPEN, OUTPLANTING BUTTERFLY HOST AND NECTAR PLANTS, DIRECT SEEDING OF HOST AND NECTAR PLANTS, AND POSSIBLE MULCHING AND WATERING FUELS REDUCTION WORK  FUELS REDUCTION WORK WILL INVOLVE REMOVAL OF TREES AND INVASIVE SHRUBS  TREE WORK MAY INVOLVE REMOVAL OF NON NATIVE TREES, LIMBING, AND SOME UNDERSTORY THINNING  BECAUSE MANY OF THE NON NATIVE PLANT SPECIES IN THE PARK CAN VIGOROUSLY RESPROUT AFTER CUTTING, THERE WILL BE A NEED TO APPLY HERBICIDES TO CUT STUMPS FOR EFFECTIVE, LONG LASTING FUEL MITIGATION  WORK MAY ALSO INVOLVE REMOVAL OF SOME OF THE MATERIAL, BUCKING AND STASHING TREES, AND CHIPPING AND DISPERSING MATERIALS  MOST OF OUR FUELS WORK WILL BE DONE IN A WAY THAT ENHANCES NATIVE HABITAT AND REDUCES FIRE RISKS TO PARK INFRASTRUCTURE AND COMMUNITIES ADJACENT TO THE PARK  NPS WILL IDENTIFY AND PRIORITIZE AREAS FOR WORK BENEFICIARIES  THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE TRAINING, WORK EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUTH THROUGH LAND STEWARDSHIP PROJECTS WITH THE GOAL OF TRAINING THE NEXT GENERATION OF PUBLIC LAND STEWARDS

PURPOSE OF AWARD  SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT  THE GOAL OF THIS TASK AGREEMENT IS TO SUPPORT WORK AND TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUNG ADULTS THROUGH COLLABORATIVE PARTICIPATION IN NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT IN ACADIA NATIONAL PARK  COLLECTIVELY THE PROJECTS FOSTER YOUTH INVOLVEMENT IN INVASIVE PLANT MANAGEMENT THAT HELP PRESERVE AND PROTECT THE RESOURCES OF ACADIA NATIONAL PARK  THESE PROJECTS ALSO PROVIDE VALUABLE EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE YOUTH INTERESTED IN LEARNING ABOUT OR HELPING TO PROTECT NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES WORK WILL FOCUS ON THE FIELD MONITORING AND MANAGEMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES AND CULTURAL RESOURCES PRESERVATION  SPECIFIC PROJECTS INCLUDE FOREST VEGETATION MONITORING, RARE PLANT MONITORING, FOREST INSECT PEST SURVEYS, AND NATIVE PLANT RESTORATION PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES IMPLEMENTATION OF FOREST MONITORING PROGRAM USING NPS PROTOCOLS REMOVAL OF INVASIVE PLANT SPECIES FROM PARK LANDSCAPES THROUGH MECHANICAL AND CHEMICAL MEANS RESTORATION OF WETLANDS AND FOREST TO HEALTHY NATIVE PLANT COMMUNITIES BY REVEGETATING DEGRADED HABITATS IDENTIFICATION NATIVE AND NON NATIVE PLANTS BENEFICIARIES THE PUBLIC WILL BENEFIT FROM THE GENERAL INCREASED KNOWLEDGE OF ACADIA NATIONAL PARK S NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES AND FROM TRAINING OF EARLY CAREER PROFESSIONALS  THE PARK WILL BENEFIT FROM ASSISTANCE WITH IMPLEMENTING NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE MONITORING, MANAGEMENT, AND INTERPRETATION

SUSTAINABLE TRAIL  THE RESULT OF THE WORK SHOULD DECREASE THE AMOUNT OF HIKER INJURIES THEREFOR FEWER CARRY OUTS BY NPS RESCUE TEAMS  TRAIL IMPROVEMENTS WILL ALSO ALLOW MORE HIKERS  WHO WON T HIKE IT CURRENTLY WALKING AROUND TRAIL HAZARDS AND OBSTACLES CREATING BRAIDS  ONCE THE TRAIL IS REPAIRED AND BETTER DEFINED HIKERS WILL STAY ON THE DESIRED PATH PERFORMANCE OBJECTIVESPRIMARY OBJECTIVES ADD PROJECT STATEMENT   CARL IS A NATIONAL HISTORIC LANDMARK WITH A REMARKABLY PRESERVED CULTURAL LANDSCAPE  THIS PROJECT WILL HELP MAINTAIN THAT LANDSCAPE FOR FUTURE GENERATIONS  THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE A FIVE MEMBER WORK CREW TO PERFORM CYCLIC MAINTENANCE ON THE HISTORIC CULTURAL LANDSCAPE AT CARL SANDBURG HOME NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE  THE LANDSCAPE REQUIRES REGULAR MAINTENANCE TO ENSURE THE APPEARANCE REMAINS IN CHARACTER WITH THE SANDBERG ERA  THE WORK IS ALSO ESSENTIAL TO PREVENT THE SPREAD OF INVASIVE PLANTS AND PROTECT NATIVE VEGETATION  THE CREW WILL REMOVE INVASIVE SPECIES, REPAIR, AND REPLACE PASTURE FENCING, PLANT VEGETATION, PRUNE VEGETATION, AND COMPLETE OTHER LANDSCAPE AND HISTORIC PRESERVATION WORK  THE CREW WILL ALSO INSTALL WAYSIDE SIGNS TO BETTER ORIENT AND EDUCATE VISITORS  WORK WILL FOCUS ON THE MAIN HOUSE, FRONT DRIVE AND FRONT LAKE LANDSCAPES, BUT MAY OCCUR THROUGHOUT THE PARKPERFORMANCE GOALS   THE GOAL OF THE PROJECT IS TO RETURN THE MAIN HOUSE, FRONT DRIVE AND FRONT LAKE LANDSCAPES TO GOOD CONDITION FOLLOWING THE RECOMMENDATIONS OF THE PARK S CULTURAL LANDSCAPE REPORT  AFTER COMPLETION THE LANDSCAPE WILL BETTER REFLECT THE PERIOD OF SIGNIFICANCE OF THE PARK  ADDITIONALLY, VISITORS WILL BE BETTER SERVED THROUGH IMPROVED WAYSIDE SIGNAGE  PERFORMANCE OBJECTIVES  1000  LINEAR FEET OF FENCING WILL BE INSPECTED AND REPAIRED AS NEEDEDINSTALL 6 WAYSIDE SIGN BASES 25 ACRES OF INVASIVE PLANTS WILL BE REMOVED 2 ACRES OF LANDSCAPE WILL BE RESTORED PER CULTURAL LANDSCAPE REPORT RECOMMENDATIONSCFDA  15 931 CONSERVATION ACTIVITIES BY YOUTH SERVICE ORGANIZATIONS

COMPETITIVE AWARD AGREEMENT REQUIREMENTSFUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: N/AFUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT: N/AREQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSPURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE AT BENT'S OLD FORT, NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE (BEOL) WILL WORK DIRECTLY WITH AN INTERN FROM STUDENT CONSERVATION ASSOCIATION (SCA) TO MANAGE AND IMPROVE THE NATURAL RESOURCES OF THE PARK, TO IMPROVE THE OVERALL HEALTH OF THE SHORT GRASS PRAIRIE, IMPROVE THE VISITOR EXPERIENCE, AND TO IMPROVE THE INTERPRETATION OF THE HISTORIC SETTING THE PARK IS LOCATED WITHIN. THIS WORK DIRECTLY SUPPORTS THE PARK MISSION AND ENABLING LEGISLATION.THIS WORK WILL BE PERFORMED BY CONTROLLING EXOTIC VEGETATION GROWTH IN THE PARK WHILE SIMULTANEOUSLY SUPPORTING GROWTH OF NATIVE SPECIES ASSOCIATED WITH THE HIGH PLAINS OF SOUTHEASTERN COLORADO.TRAINING AND OVERSIGHT FOR ALL ACTIVITIES WILL BE PROVIDED BY NPS STAFF. COMPETITIVE AWARD AGREEMENT REQUIREMENTSFUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: N/AFUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT: N/AREQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSPURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): CONNECT YOUTH TO THEIR NATIONAL PARKS THROUGH NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE PROJECTS. PROVIDE ON THE GROUND ASSISTANCE TO GLEN CANYON TO IMPROVE NATIVE ECOSYSTEMS THROUGH CULTURAL RESOURCE SURVEYS AND RESTORING DEGRADED AREAS TO NATURAL HABITATS. BY PARTICIPATING IN THE PROJECT, YOUTH WILL LEARN AND DEVELOP VALUABLE SKILLS IN CULTURAL RESOURCE SURVEYS, MAPPING, AND MANAGEMENT; NATIVE PLANT RESTORATION; AND RESTORATION EFFECTIVENESS MONITORING.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: GREAT BASIN INSTITUTE WILL PROVIDE 1 RESTORATION INTERN AND 1 ARCHAEOLOGICAL INTERN, FOR 6 MONTHS EACH, 40 HOURS PER WEEK, UP TO 1,040 HOURS. THE DUTIES OF THE RESTORATION INTERN WILL BE TO LEAD OTHER INTERNS AND YOUTH CREWS FOR NATIVE PLANT RESTORATION, SEEDBED PREP, INSTALLING EROSION CONTROL MEASURES, TREATING INVASIVE SPECIES, MANAGING A GREENHOUSE AND REPORT WRITING. THE DUTIES OF THE ARCHAEOLOGICAL INTERN WILL BE TO COMPLETE ARCHAEOLOGICAL FIELD WORK, ASSIST WITH CULTURAL RESOURCE INVENTORIES, COMPLETE CONDITION ASSESSMENTS, DIGITIZE PAPERWORK, DATA ENTRY AND REPORT WRITING.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE RESTORATION INTERN WILL RESTORE 2 MILES OF CLOSED OFF-HIGHWAY VEHICLE TRAILS, PROPAGATE 100 NATIVE PLANTS, LEAD 2 CONSERVATION CORPS CREWS AND TREAT 2 ACRES OF INVASIVE SPECIES. THE ARCHAEOLOGICAL INTERN WILL CONDUCT 10 CONDITION ASSESSMENTS, SURVEY 5 ACRES FOR ARCHAEOLOGICAL RESOURCES AND ASSIST WITH WRITING 5 REPORTS.BENEFICIARIES: THE BENEFICIARIES OF THE PROJECT WILL BE THE INTERNS WHO WILL GAIN INVALUABLE EXPERIENCE WORKING WITHIN A NATIONAL PARK UNIT AND GETTING HANDS-ON, REAL-WORLD EXPERIENCE. THE PUBLIC WILL BENEFIT AS CULTURAL AND NATURAL RESOURCES WILL BE PROTECTED AND PERSEVERED.

COMPETITIVE AWARD AGREEMENT REQUIREMENTSFUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: N/AFUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT: N/AREQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSPURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS FOR YOUTH INTERNS TO GAIN PRACTICAL, HANDS-ON EXPERIENCE IN NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT, AND ESPECIALLY IN FUEL REDUCTION AND MANAGEMENT OF INVASIVE PLANTS. THE CREW WILL PARTICIPATE IN ACTIVE FUEL REDUCTION AND ECOLOGICAL RESTORATION, INCLUDING REMOVING INVASIVE PLANTS THROUGH MECHANICAL MEANS. CREW MEMBERS WILL ALSO RECEIVE SOME EXPERIENCE IN OTHER NATURAL RESOURCE PROJECTS, SUCH AS IMPROVING HABITAT CONNECTIVITY BY REMOVING OLD FENCES AND/OR MAKING THEM MORE WILDLIFE-FRIENDLY.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:A. NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES, ESPECIALLY: 1) REDUCING OF INVASIVE PLANT FUEL IN DESERT ECOSYSTEMS THAT ARE NOT ADAPTED TO FIRE; 2) ECOLOGICAL RESTORATION.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: 1) TREAT MINIMUM OF 20 ACRES OF INVASIVE PLANTS; 2) WORK ON RESTORATION OF AT LEAST 3 SITES.BENEFICIARIES: BENEFITS WILL BE TO YOUTH INTERNS WHO WILL GAIN CAREER SKILLS IN NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): THE AWARD WILL FUND THE ROCKY MOUNTAIN YOUTH CORPS ADULT CREWS TO COMPLETE A FENCING PROJECT.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: THE CREWS WILL TRAIN IN THE USE OF HAND TOOLS AND CONDUCT CYCLIC MAINTENANCE TO SECTIONS OF BOUNDARY FENCING AT PECOS NATIONAL HISTORICAL PARK. SECTIONS OF BOUNDARY FENCING HAVE DETERIORATED, ALLOWING LIVESTOCK TRESPASS, ILLEGAL OFF HIGHWAY VEHICLE USE, AND OTHER ACTIVITIES THAT ENDANGER SENSITIVE NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES WITHIN THE PARK. THE CREWS WILL REPAIR AND REPLACE THESE DAMAGED BOUNDARY FENCE SECTIONS WITH NEW FENCING WHICH WILL PROVIDE ENHANCED PROTECTION FOR PARK RESOURCES.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE CREWS WILL WORK 4 SPIKES STARTING LATER THIS YEAR INTO NEXT YEAR. THEY WILL ALSO PARTICIPATE IN FIELD DAYS TO LEARN ABOUT THE MISSION OF THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE, TO LEARN MORE DETAILS ABOUT THE RESOURCES OF PECOS NATIONAL HISTORICAL PARK, AND TO LEARN ABOUT THE MISSION OBJECTIVES OF DIFFERENT TEAMS AND PROGRAMS WITHIN THE PARK. THE CREWS WILL COMPLETE REPAIRS ON 4,500 LINEAR FEET OF DAMAGED FENCING.BENEFICIARIES: AREA YOUTH WILL BENEFIT FROM THE PROJECT BY LEARNING SKILLS THAT WILL ALLOW THEM TO APPLY FOR FUTURE SEASONAL WORK IN LAND MANAGEMENT AGENCIES. THEY WILL ALSO GAIN KNOWLEDGE AND UNDERSTANDING ABOUT PUBLIC LANDS AND THE LAND MANAGEMENT MISSION. THE PARK WILL BENEFIT FROM THE PROTECTION PROVIDED BY THE UPDATED AND REPAIRED FENCING.

THE ALASKA PUBLIC LANDS INFORMATION CENTER IS SEEKING A DYNAMIC CANDIDATE WHO CAN HELP MAINTAIN AND GROW ITS EDUCATION PARTNERSHIPS  PREFERRED CANDIDATES WILL BE MOTIVATED SELF STARTERS THAT HAVE A DESIRE TO MAKE CONNECTIONS WITH FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL COMMUNITY EDUCATION PARTNERS  PRIOR KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE IN ALASKA AND ANCHORAGE, WHILE PREFERRED, IS NOT A REQUIREMENT

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): PROJECT GOALS - THE FY22 ANCESTRAL LANDS CONSERVATION CORPS (ALCC) NPS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE JOB AND SERVICE OPPORTUNITIES FOR UP TO 70 YOUNG ADULTS FROM UP TO 8 DISTINCT RURAL AND URBAN NATIVE AMERICAN COMMUNITIES. CRITICAL BACK LOG MAINTENANCE PROJECTS ON NPS UNITS WILL BE COMPLETED WITH THE ADDITIONAL GOAL OF BUILDING LONG TERM CAPACITY, PARTNERSHIPS, RESOURCES, TO ENSURE A STRONG WORKFORCE FOR THE FUTURE. THE PROJECT ADDITIONALLY WILL ALSO ENGAGE UP TO 60 SCHOOL AGED CHILDREN FROM HOPI AND LAS CRUCES WITH THEIR LOCAL NATIONAL PARKS, TO PROVIDE RECREATIONAL AND APPROPRIATE SERVICE OPPORTUNITIES, AND OPPORTUNITIES FOR PARKS TO HISTORICALLY CONNECT TO ADJACENT TRIBAL COMMUNITIES AND YOUTH. PROJECT OBJECTIVES - THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PARTNERSHIP IS TO COMPLETE IMPORTANT CONSERVATION PROJECTS WHILE PROVIDING YOUNG ADULTS WITH STRUCTURED, SAFE AND CHALLENGING WORK AND EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES THROUGH SERVICE THAT PROMOTE PERSONAL GROWTH, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, THE DEVELOPMENT OF LIFE SKILLS AND AN ETHIC OF NATURAL RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP. CONSERVATION LEGACY WORKS TOWARD MAKING THESE OPPORTUNITIES AVAILABLE TO A CONSISTENTLY DIVERSE GROUP OF YOUNG PEOPLE AND VETERANS AND TO THOSE WHO COULD MOST BENEFIT FROM THE EXPERIENCE.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): ZION NATIONAL PARK WILL PARTNER WITH GREAT BASIN INSTITUTE (GBI) TO RECRUIT A YOUTH HIRE WITH A BACKGROUND IN DIGITAL COMMUNICATIONS. THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE VALUABLE EXPERIENCE THAT PREPARES THE YOUTH HIRES FOR A CAREER IN FACILITIES RELATED TO INTERPRETATION (ESPECIALLY INTERPRETIVE MEDIA/SIGNAGE), PUBLIC AFFAIRS, AND VISUAL INFORMATION- NON-PERSONAL INTERPRETIVE SERVICES IN EITHER THE PRIVATE OR PUBLIC SECTOR. THE THESE PROJECTS WILL BE RELATED TO: (1) ENHANCE DIGITAL COMMUNICATIONS EFFORTS, (2) ASSIST PUBLIC AFFAIRS PROGRAM WITH INTERNAL AND EXTERNAL COMMUNICATIONS AND (3) SUPPORT PARK INTERPRETIVE MEDIA PROJECT. THE YOUTH HIRE WILL SUPPORT THE PARK'S PUBLIC AFFAIRS AND VISUAL INFORMATION OPERATIONS WHILE GAINING AN UNDERSTAND THE MISSION OF THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE, AND THE ROLE THESE TWO PROGRAMS PLAY IN ENHANCING AND MAINTAINING THE VISITOR EXPERIENCE.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THIS YOUTH HIRE WILL GAIN SKILLS IN INTERPRETATION, PUBLIC AFFAIRS, AND VISUAL INFORMATION. THEY WILL WORK ON THE ENHANCEMENT OF DIGITAL COMMUNICATIONS EFFORTS AT ZION NATIONAL PARK THROUGH: UPDATING AND CREATING CONTENT FOR THE PARK APP, WEBSITE, AND SOCIAL MEDIA, ASSIST IN PUBLIC AFFAIRS WITH INTERNAL AND EXTERNAL COMMUNICATIONS, AND IMPROVE THE PARK'S NON PERSONAL INTERPRETATION BY GENERATING CURATING DIGITAL.THE YOUTH HIRE WILL PARTICIPATE IN ZION'S FORMAL MENTORSHIP PROGRAM WITH WORKSHOPS AROUND ESTABLISHING GOALS, NETWORKING, AND RESUME BUILDING. COMPETITIVE AWARD AGREEMENT REQUIREMENTSFUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: N/AFUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT: N/AREQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSPURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):CAPULIN VOLCANO      NATIONAL MONUMENT AIMS TO FOSTER BENEFICIAL RELATIONSHIPS WITH      CONSERVATION ORGANIZATIONS THAT ADVOCATE FOR BALANCED STEWARDSHIP AND USE      OF OUR PUBLIC LANDS BY COLLABORATING WITH THE AMERICAN CONSERVATION      EXPERIENCE (ACE) YOUTH CREW IN IMPLEMENTING TRAIL WORK AT THE PARK. THE GOAL OF THIS LAVA FLOW TRAIL PROJECT IS TO COMPLETE TRAIL      MAINTENANCE DUE TO EROSION AND CINDER SLIDES CAUSED BY NUMEROUS MONSOONAL      WEATHER EVENTS OVER TIME. THIS      PROJECT WILL HELP THE SUSTAINABILITY AND FUNCTIONALITY OF THE LAVA FLOW      TRAIL. THE TRAIL WILL BE SAFER FOR      PARK VISITORS AND MORE EROSION RESISTANT. SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE ACE WORK CREW WILL PERFORM TRAIL MAINTENANCE ON THIS FRONT-COUNTRY TRAIL THAT INCLUDES CREATING/INSTALLING WATER BARS AND CHECK DAMS TO HELP CONTROL RUN-OFF, WIDENING THE TRAIL BY USING STRATEGIC VOLCANIC ROCK PLACEMENT AND USING HAND TOOLS, TRIMMING VEGETATION AND REMOVING INVASIVE PLANTS FROM THE LANDSCAPE. THE WORK MAY INVOLVE THE LIFTING, MOVING AND HAULING OF VOLCANIC ROCK FROM ROCK PILES TO THE WORK LOCATION; AND DRIVING OF A UTILITY VEHICLE.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:PERFORMANCE GOALS -THE      GOAL OF THIS LAVA FLOW TRAIL PROJECT IS TO COMPLETE TRAIL MAINTENANCE DUE      TO EROSION AND CINDER SLIDES CAUSED BY NUMEROUS MONSOONAL WEATHER EVENTS      OVER TIME. REHABILITATION WORK      WILL BE PART OF THE DUTIES REQUIRED IN THIS AREA TO RESTORE THE LANDSCAPE      FROM AN OLD TRAIL (TO THE EAST OF THE NEW TRAIL) STILL VISIBLE IN THE AREA      THAT IS NO LONGER BEING USED. THIS      TRAIL RESTORATION AND EROSION REPAIR WORK WILL REQUIRE THE TRANSPLANTING      OF PROPAGATED NATIVE PLANTS GROWN IN ON-SITE GREENHOUSES. THE TOTAL AREA OF REHABILITATION WILL      INVOLVE ABOUT 4000 SQUARE FEET OF ERODED AND DISTURBED LAND DUE TO THESE      NATURAL OR HUMAN CAUSES. AN ADDITIONAL 0.1-MILE-LONG SECTION OF NEW HIKING      TRAIL MAY BE BUILT ON AN ALREADY DISTURBED PATH CREATED BY A WATERLINE      PROJECT COMPLETED IN FEB/MARCH 2021.      THIS ADDITION WOULD CREATE ANOTHER LOOP OPTION FOR PARK VISITORS TO      USE ON THIS TRAIL AND PROVIDE A SAFER TRAIL ALTERNATIVE FOR ACCESSING FROM      THE MAIN VISITOR CENTER PARKING LOT TO THE PICNIC AREA. THE TRAIL WILL BE SAFER FOR      PARK VISITORS AND MORE EROSION RESISTANT.      THE GOAL OF THE TRAIL MAINTENANCE PROJECTS IS TO MEET MAINTENANCE      REQUIREMENTS, DEFERRED MAINTENANCE DEMANDS, RESTORE AND ENHANCE VISITOR      SAFETY AND GIVE OPPORTUNITIES FOR A SERIES OF DIVERSE PARK EXPERIENCES TO      MEMBERS OF THE YOUTH WORK CREWS.PROJECT OBJECTIVES - THIS PROJECT IS FOCUSED ON      TRAIL MAINTENANCE WORK. THIS TRAIL      MAINTENANCE WORK WILL IMPROVE THE SUSTAINABILITY OF THE TRAILS AND TRAIL      SYSTEM IN THE MONUMENT BY BUILDING WATER BARS, PERFORMING ROCK WORK,      WIDENING THE TRAILS, TRIMMING VEGETATION, EXOTIC PLANT REMOVAL, MITIGATING      TRIPPING HAZARDS, AND ANY OTHER NEEDED WORK TO IMPROVE THE TRAIL      CONDITIONS. THESE WORK EFFORTS WILL MAKE THE TRAILS SAFER FOR THE PUBLIC      AND PROVIDE FOR A MORE ENJOYABLE AND MEANINGFUL EXPERIENCE. BENEFICIARIES:AMERICAN CONSERVATION EXPERIENCE (ACE) CREWS

FUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT: THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO RECRUIT AND TRAIN A HIGHLY MOTIVATED INTERN WHO WILL PROVIDE WEEKLY SUPPORT TO TECHNICAL EXPERTS IN THE VANISHING TREASURES PROGRAM INCLUDING THE STRUCTURAL ENGINEER, ARCHITECTURAL CONSERVATOR, AND THE HISTORICAL ARCHITECT. REQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSPURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):TO PROVIDE WORK OPPORTUNITIES AND LEARNING EXPERIENCE IN ARCHITECTURE PRESERVATION FOR A NATIVE AMERICAN YOUTH INTERN FOR 26 WEEKS.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE INTERNSHIP PROJECT INCLUDES OFFICE AND FIELD SUPPORT FOR THE VANISHING TREASURES TECHNICAL TEAM IN SANTA FE, WHO ARE INVOLVED WITH VARIOUS PRESERVATION PROJECTS AT NATIONAL PARK SERVICE SITES IN NORTHERN NEW MEXICO AND ACROSS THE REGION. PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE CRITICAL CONSERVATION, EDUCATION, AND PRESERVATION SERVICES FOR DINOSAUR NATIONAL MONUMENT'S CULTURAL MUSEUM COLLECTIONS. THIS PROJECT SUPPORTS ONE 52-WEEK AND ONE 12-WEEK INTERN WHO WILL ASSIST WITH MUSEUM TASKS RELATED TO THE STABILIZATION, REHOUSING, INVENTORYING, AND DIGITIZATION OF THE MONUMENT'S ESTIMATED 100,000 ARCHAEOLOGICAL MUSEUM SPECIMENS.THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PREVENT AND SLOW THE DETERIORATION OF OBJECTS AND PRESERVE INFORMATION ON OBJECT PROVENIENCE THROUGH PROPER STORAGE AND CATALOGUING PRACTICES. THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE: CONSERVATION TREATMENTS TO SPECIMENS IN THE COLLECTION THAT ARE IDENTIFIED BY A NPS CURATOR AS FRAGILE AND HIGH RISK; UPDATED ICMS INFORMATION FOR ALL CATALOGUED SPECIMENS; AND DIGITIZED AND PHOTOGRAPHED IMAGES OF SPECIMENS THAT ARE DEEMED NOT CULTURALLY SENSITIVE AND ABLE TO BE SHARED WITH THE PUBLIC. ADDITIONALLY, THIS PROJECT WILL RESULT IN SELECTED INTERNS: DEVELOPING PROFESSIONAL SKILLS IN CULTURAL RESOURCE AND MUSEUM RELATED FIELDS; BEING GIVEN INSIGHT INTO CAREER OPPORTUNITIES WITHIN THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT; AND RECEIVING MENTORING, TRAINING, AND ASSISTANCE FROM DINO PERMANENT STAFF MEMBERS TO ACHIEVE PROJECT GOALS.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:AS PART OF THIS PROJECT, INTERNS WILL PARTICIPATE IN HIGH PRIORITY MUSEUM CONSERVATION PROJECTS IN THE AREAS OF CULTURAL RESOURCE RESEARCH, INVENTORY AND MONITORING, INTERPRETATION, AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION. FOR BOTH INTERNS, THE SELECTED INDIVIDUALS WILL: ASSESS CURRENT COLLECTIONS SPACE; UPDATE INVENTORY INFORMATION IN PARK MUSEUM AND CULTURAL RESOURCE DATABASES; REHOUSE ARCHAEOLOGICAL SPECIMENS TO MEET CURRENT BEST PRACTICES AND MUSEUM STANDARDS; AND PHOTOGRAPH SELECTED SPECIMENS FOR SHARING WITH RESEARCHERS AND THE PUBLIC.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:BY THE CONCLUSION OF THEIR INTERNSHIP, BOTH INTERNS WILL TURN IN FINAL PRODUCTS INCLUDING: UPDATED MUSEUM HOUSING AND INVENTORY INFORMATION IN DNM'S MUSEUM AND CULTURAL RESOURCE REGIONAL DATABASES; PHOTOGRAPHS OF ARCHAEOLOGICAL ARTIFACTS FOR USE IN FUTURE SOCIAL MEDIA, WEBSITE, AND OUTREACH PROJECTS; AND INFORMATION ON ISSUES OF CULTURAL RESOURCE MUSEUM MANAGEMENT AND STEWARDSHIP VIA GENERATED SOCIAL MEDIA CONTENT.OTHER FINAL PRODUCTS INCLUDE A SUMMARY REPORT OF ACTIVITIES FOR DNM RESOURCE MANAGEMENT ARCHIVES AND A PRESENTATION OF FINDINGS TO PARTNERS AND STAFF.BENEFICIARIES:THE BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE: THE PUBLIC, WHO WILL RECEIVE EDUCATIONAL CONTENT THAT INTERNS GENERATE; AND THE YOUTH INVOLVED WITH THIS PROJECT.

PROVIDE PRESERVATION TRADES TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES TO YOUNG ADULTS AND VETERANS ON NPS-LED PRESERVATION PROJECTS IN ORDER TO PROMOTE JOB SKILLS TRAINING IN THE TRADES SECTOR AND DEVELOP A STEWARDSHIP ETHIC FOR CULTURAL RESOURCE INFRASTRUCTURE ON PUBLIC LANDS. SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: THE HISTORIC PRESERVATION TRAINING CENTER PLACES INDIVIDUALS AGES 18-30 (UP TO 35 FOR VETERANS) IN APPROXIMATELY FIVE MONTH INTERNSHIPS AT NATIONAL PARK SITES ACROSS THE COUNTRY TO ASSIST IN THE COMPLETION OF A VARIETY OF PRESERVATION PROJECTS. THESE PROJECTS CAN ENCOMPASS SKILLS INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO CARPENTRY, MASONRY, WOODWORKING, TRADITIONAL ROOFING, TIMBER-FRAMING, PROJECT MANAGEMENT, CONDITION ASSESSMENTS, METALWORK, ADOBE WORK, AND EXTERIOR WOOD COMPONENT REPAIR. TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES WILL TAKE PLACE IN TANDEM WITH NPS-LED PRESERVATION PROJECTS AND FURTHER NPS GOALS TO MAINTAIN, PRESERVE, RESTORE, AND PROJECT CULTURAL RESOURCE INFRASTRUCTURE ON NPS SITES ACROSS THE COUNTRY.

PURPOSE OF AWARD:THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUNG PEOPLE TO WORK IN THE NATURAL ENVIRONMENT ALONGSIDE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE STAFF WHO WILL TEACH TRAIL WORK TECHNIQUES, DEFENSIBLE SPACE, AND PROVIDE CROSS-DIVISIONAL TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES WITH THE RESOURCES STAFF. THE CREW MEMBERS WILL MAINTAIN AND REPAIR THE TRAILS IN THE SANTA MONICA MOUNTAINS FOR VISITOR SAFETY AND RESOURCE PROTECTION AND PERFORM FUELS REDUCTION WORK NEAR BUILDINGS TO ENSURE DEFENSIBLE SPACE.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:PARTICIPANTS WILL WORK CLOSELY WITH SEASONED NPS TRAIL CREW LEADERS TO IMPROVE THEIR SKILLS AND UNDERSTANDING OF TRAIL CONSTRUCTION AND MAINTENANCE. THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ENHANCED TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES TO WORK WITH NPS FIELD STAFF AND ASSIST IN LEADING, ORGANIZING, AND INSTRUCTING YOUTH GROUPS, VOLUNTEERS, AND PARTNERS ON NPS TRAILS AND MAINTENANCE PROJECTS. THE SAMO FUND TRAILS CREW WILL RECEIVE TRAINING FROM THE SAMO FUND AND THE NPS TO PROVIDE THE CONFIDENCE TO ENGAGE THE PUBLIC FOR OUTREACH PURPOSES. IN TURN THE SAMO FUND TRAILS CREW WILL EDUCATE THE CONSERVATION CREWS, VOLUNTEERS, AND ASSISTING PARTNERS AND WORK TO INSPIRE THE NEXT GENERATION OF OUTDOOR LEADERS TO INSTILL A STRONG SENSE OF ENVIRONMENTAL ETHICS AND CIVIC ENGAGEMENT. SELECTED CANDIDATES WILL ASSIST THE NPS IN ORGANIZING AND LEADING GROUPS OF VOLUNTEERS FROM A DIVERSITY OF BACKGROUNDS AND DEMOGRAPHICS. THE SAMO FUND TRAILS CREW GAINS EXPERIENCE PLANNING, COORDINATING, TRAINING, AND SUPERVISING YOUTH CONSERVATION CORPS TRAIL MAINTENANCE AND RECONSTRUCTION PROJECTS. IN ADDITION TO INSTRUCTION ON TRAILS MAINTENANCE TECHNIQUES, THE NPS WILL PROVIDE FIELD-BASED EDUCATION ON THE NATIVE FLORA AND FAUNA OF THE MEDITERRANEAN ECOSYSTEM WITH SUBJECT MATTER EXPERTS. THE PUBLIC PURPOSE IS TO PROVIDE EDUCATION TO THE YOUTH PARTICIPANTS ABOUT THE IMPORTANCE OF ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP AND THE ROLE OF THE NPS ACROSS THE UNITED STATES AND SPECIFICALLY THE SANTA MONICA MOUNTAINS.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE A REWARDING LAND MANAGEMENT OPPORTUNITY FOR A YOUTH LABOR FORCE TO ASSIST IN THE REHABILITATION OF TRAILS IN THE SANTA MONICA MOUNTAINS NATIONAL RECREATION AREA. IMMEDIATELY ADJACENT TO LOS ANGELES AND THE GREATER LA AREA, THE RECREATION AREA PROVIDES OPPORTUNITIES FOR PEOPLE TO ESCAPE THE CITY AND PROVIDE ACCESS TO THE NATURAL SETTINGS. TRAIL MAINTENANCE IS A KEY COMPONENT OF PROVIDING ACCESS AND THIS AGREEMENT WILL IMPROVE THE OVERALL CONDITION, SERVICEABILITY AND DURABILITY TO THE SMMNRA TRAIL SYSTEM AND THE TRAIL SEGMENTS THAT COMPRISE; TO THE BENEFIT OF PUBLIC SAFETY AND ENJOYMENT.PROMOTE PUBLIC STEWARDSHIP, EXTEND LIMITED PUBLIC RESOURCES AND PROVIDE BETTER PUBLIC AWARENESS OF THE TRAIL SYSTEM, ITS NEEDS AND IMPORTANCE, TO THE BENEFIT OF THE TRAIL NETWORK TO THE NPS AND ITS PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS, AND TO THE OVERALL PURPOSES FOR WHICH THE PARK WAS ESTABLISHED BY THE U.S. CONGRESS.BENEFICIARIES: YOUTH, VETERANS, THE PUBLIC

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): PROVIDE PRESERVATION TRADES TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES TO YOUNG ADULTS AND VETERANS ON NATIONAL PARK SERVICE-LED PRESERVATION PROJECTS IN ORDER TO PROMOTE JOB SKILLS TRAINING IN THE TRADES SECTOR AND DEVELOP A STEWARDSHIP ETHIC FOR CULTURAL RESOURCE INFRASTRUCTURE ON PUBLIC LANDS. SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: WORK ON THIS PROJECT WILL BE COORDINATED BY MAINTENANCE ACTION TEAMS (MAT), MADE UP OF NATIONAL PARK SERVICE STAFF AND YOUTH CORPS MEMBERS, USING PUBLIC LANDS LEGACY RESTORATION FUNDS (LRF), AS AUTHORIZED BY THE GREAT AMERICAN OUTDOORS ACT (GAOA). WORK MAY INCLUDE BUT IS NOT LIMITED TO REPAIRS, MAINTENANCE, RESTORATION, AND STABILIZATION OF DETERIORATING COMPONENTS OF HISTORIC STRUCTURES. SKILLS GAINED FROM THESE PROJECTS INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO: CARPENTRY, MASONRY, WOODWORKING, TRADITIONAL ROOFING, TIMBER-FRAMING, CONDITION ASSESSMENTS, METALWORK, ADOBE WORK, AND EXTERIOR WOOD COMPONENT REPAIR.

COMPETITIVE AWARD AGREEMENT REQUIREMENTSFUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: P22AC01244FUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT:REQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSPURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE'S (NPS) INTERIOR REGION 1 (IR1) CULTURAL RESOURCES (CR) DIVISION SUPPORTS REGIONAL PARKS AND PROGRAMS TO MANAGE AND PRESERVE CULTURAL RESOURCES WHICH REFLECT OUR DIVERSE NATIONAL HERITAGE. THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE AN INTERN WITH THE OPPORTUNITY TO CONTRIBUTE TO THIS WORK BY WORKING DIRECTLY WITH IR1'S CR GIS COORDINATOR TO ADVANCE THE EFFECTIVE USE OF GIS TOOLS AND TECHNOLOGIES WITHIN THE CR DIVISION.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE INTERN WILL WORK WITH CR DIVISION STAFF TO ASSIST IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF WEB-BASED MAPPING PRODUCTS FOR INTERNAL REFERENCE AND EXTERNAL PUBLICATION; DRAFT GUIDANCE, TEMPLATES, AND OTHER RESOURCES TO ADDRESS COMMON GIS NEEDS; AND PROVIDE TECHNICAL SUPPORT TO CR DIVISION STAFF ENGAGED IN PROJECTS WITH GIS COMPONENTS.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:BY THE END OF THE PROJECT PERIOD, THE INTERN WILL HAVE GENERATED A COLLECTION OF TEMPLATES, GUIDANCE DOCUMENTS, AND WEB-BASED MAPPING PRODUCTS FOR USE BY INTERIOR REGION 1 (IR1) CULTURAL RESOURCES (CR) DIVISION PROGRAMS AND WILL HAVE PROVIDED THE CR DIVISION WITH GENERAL GIS SUPPORT AND ASSISTANCE.BENEFICIARIES:THE INTERN WILL GAIN EXPERIENCE IN THE PLANNING/DEVELOPMENT OF GIS PROJECTS WITH IMMEDIATE BENEFIT TO NATIONAL, REGIONAL, AND PARK INITIATIVES, IN ADDITION TO ADVANCING THEIR TECHNICAL SKILLS AND LEARNING NEW TECHNIQUES IN WEB MAPPING AND APPLICATION DESIGN. THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE (NPS) WILL BENEFIT FROM THE INTERN'S ASSISTANCE IN PROVIDING NEEDED GIS SKILLS AND SUPPORT, AND THE PUBLIC WILL BENEFIT FROM NEW AND ENGAGING MAPPING PRODUCTS.

A. PERFORMANCE GOALS - THE AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE AND AZCC IS DESIGNED TO PROVIDE YOUNG ADULTS WITH TRAINING AND TO ADDRESS MAINTENANCE OF HISTORIC RESOURCES AT CHIRICAHUA NATIONAL MONUMENT AND FORT BOWIE NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE.B. PROJECT OBJECTIVES - THE PROJECT IS DESIGNED TO PROVIDE YOUNG ADULTS PARTICIPATING IN AZCC'S INDIGENOUS PROGRAM WITH AN OPPORTUNITY TO LEARN AND RECEIVE HANDS ON TRAINING IN VARIOUS ASPECTS OF MANAGEMENT AND HISTORIC PRESERVATION WITHIN THE NPS SYSTEM. A PARTICULAR FOCUS WILL BE ON RECRUITING AND ENGAGING YOUNG PEOPLE FROM CULTURALLY AFFILIATED TRIBAL COMMUNITIES ON THESE PROJECTS, INCLUDING THOSE FROM THE TOHONO O'ODHAM NATION. IF FOR SOME REASON, AN INDIGENOUS CREW CANNOT BE FILLED DUE TO A LACK OF APPLICANTS, THEN A NON-INDIGENOUS CREW WILL BE OBTAINED FOR THIS PROJECT.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE INDIGENOUS CREW (5 MEMBERS+ 1 LEADER) WILL ASSIST FOR 6 HITCHES, EACH HITCH IS 8 DAYS (INCLUDING TRAVEL TO AND FROM THE MONUMENT, AND 1 EDUCATIONAL DAY PER HITCH) IN A VARIETY OF PROJECTS AT CHIRICAHUA NATIONAL MONUMENT (CHIR) AND FORT BOWIE NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE (FOBO). PROJECT WORK AT CHIR WILL INCLUDE ADDRESSING DEFERRED MAINTENANCE ON THE HISTORIC STAFFORD CABIN. PRESERVATION WORK WILL ADHERE TO THE SECRETARY OF INTERIOR STANDARDS OF HISTORIC PRESERVATION FOR HISTORIC BUILDING PRESERVATION. WORK WILL INCLUDE REPLACEMENT OF HISTORIC DETERIORATED LOGS WITHIN THE CABIN STRUCTURE, LEARNING THE TECHNIQUE OF PLACING LIME MORTAR AND ADOBE MORTAR, TECHNIQUES ON THE PROPER WAYS TO ADD NON-HISTORIC BOARD AND BATTEN MATERIAL TO HISTORIC BOARD AND BATTEN MATERIAL, LEARNING RE-POINTING TECHNIQUES ON A HISTORIC FIREPLACE, LEARNING THE PROPER MATERIALS AND TECHNIQUES TO USE TO ADDRESS INTEGRATED PEST MANAGEMENT (IPM) FOR A HISTORIC STRUCTURE, AND PAINTING THE HISTORIC CABIN. PPERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:SEPTEMBER 2022- MOBILIZE ON SITE AND BEGIN PRESERVATION WORK AT FOBO INDIAN AGENCY RUINS TO INCLUDE REMOVAL OF EXISTING LIME ENCAPSULATION.OCTOBER 2022- BEGIN APPLYING NEW LIME ENCAPSULATION TO INDIAN AGENCY RUINS, LIME ENCAPSULATION WILL BE COMPLETED BY THE MIDDLE OF NOVEMBER.NOVEMBER 2022- CONTINUE WITH LIME ENCAPSULATION UNTIL COMPLETE, THEN SHIFT FOCUS TO PRESERVATION OF STAFFORD CABIN EXTERIOR AT CHIRICAHUA.DECEMBER 2022- CONTINUE PRESERVATION OF STAFFORD CABIN EXTERIOR, MOVING TO INTERIOR ON DAYS OF INCLEMENT WEATHER.JANUARY 2023- BEGIN WORKING ON PRESERVATION OF STAFFORD CABIN INTERIOR.FEBRUARY 2023- CONTINUE PRESERVATION OF STAFFORD CABIN INTERIOR.MARCH 2023- FINISH PRESERVATION OF STAFFORD CABIN INTERIOR/EXTERIOR AND THEN SPEND 2-3 WEEKS BRUSHING AND COMPLETING MINOR TREAD-WORK ON FOBO TRAILS.BENEFICIARIES:THE BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT WILL BE:1) THE PUBLIC2) THE KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCES THE ARIZONA CONSERVATION CORPS CREW MEMBERS GAINED WORKING ON THE PROJECT.3) THE SOUTHEAST ARIZONA GROUP OF THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE BY REPAIRING A HIGH VISITATION SECTION OF THE TRAIL CORRIDOR

IN THIS POSITION YOU WILL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO BE A PART OF AN EXCITING AND INNOVATIVE EDUCATION AND INTERPRETATION TEAM. THE PRIMARY DUTIES OF THIS POSITION ARE TO ASSIST RANGERS WITH LONG DISTANCE CLASSES AND SUPPORT OUTREACH AND EDUCATION EFFORTS BY THE PARK. EDUCATION RANGERS CONDUCT CLASSES FOR APPROXIMATELY 3,000 STUDENTS AND TEACHERS THROUGHOUT THE COUNTRY THROUGH VIDEOCONFERENCING IN JANUARY AND FEBRUARY. USING GREENSCREEN TECHNOLOGY, RANGERS TAKE STUDENTS ON VIRTUAL VISITS TO GLACIER BAY. THIS POSITION WILL HELP WITH PRE-VISIT MAIL OUTS, TEST CONNECTIONS, RECORD KEEPING, AND SOME PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT AND PRESENTING. YOU WILL ALSO RESPOND TO STUDENT INFORMATION REQUESTS BY EMAIL AND LETTER, AND WILL HELP WITH THE UPDATING OF OUR STUDENT OUTREACH INFORMATION PACKETS. OTHER DUTIES MAY ALSO INCLUDE ASSISTING WITH PLANNING AND PREPARING FOR SUMMER DAY CAMP ACTIVITIES. THE PRIMARY FUNCTION OF THIS POSITION WILL BE TO KEEP THE LONG DISTANCE LEARNING PROGRAM RUNNING SMOOTHLY AND EFFECTIVELY.

THE RECIPIENT WILL SELECT AND OVERSEE QUALIFIED AND MOTIVATED UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE STUDENTS TO WORK ALONGSIDE NPS STAFF IN THE CULTURAL RESOURCES, INTERPRETATION, AND RELATED FIELDS IN DIFFERENT PARK UNITS/PROGRAMS AND FEDERAL OFFICES THROUGHOUT THE NATION. SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: FELLOWS' DUTIES WILL INVOLVE EXPOSURE TO GRANTS MANAGEMENT, WEBSITE AND PUBLICATION DEVELOPMENT, UNDERSTANDING OF THE FEDERAL PRESERVATION PROGRAM, AND DIRECT INTERACTION WITH NPS, STATE HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE (SHPO), AND CLG AND GIS STAFF. FELLOWS WILL DEVELOP WORKING RELATIONSHIPS WITH PRESERVATION PARTNERS AT THE STATE, TRIBAL AND LOCAL LEVELS. PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: INTERN(S) WILL BE RECRUITED, SELECTED, AND COMPLETE THEIR TERMS AS FEASIBLE. INTERNS WILL COMPLETE TASKS OUTLINED IN THE SCOPE OF WORK.

PROJECT STATEMENT - THIS PROJECT WILL ENGAGE A FIVE-PERSON YOUTH CREW (FOUR MEMBERS AND ONE LEAD) FOR SIX WEEKS TO ASSIST CONGAREE NATIONAL PARK (CONG) WITH CONTROLLING NUISANCE AND EXOTIC INVASIVE PLANTS IN UPLAND AREAS USING BOTH CHEMICAL (E.G., BACKPACK SPRAYERS, HAND SPRAYERS) AND MANUAL METHODS (E.G., LOPPERS, HAND PULLING, HAND SAWS).PERFORMANCE GOALS - THE PRIORITY GOAL IS TO IMPROVE THE CONDITION OF APPROXIMATELY 25 ACRES OF UPLAND FOREST BY REMOVING NUISANCE AND EXOTIC INVASIVE PLANTS.ACE AND CONG STAFF HAVE AGREED THAT THE CREW WILL BE FLEXIBLE FOR ALTERNATIVE WORK IN CASE OF INCLEMENT WEATHER OR OTHER INCIDENTS THAT COMPLICATE SAFE AND EFFECTIVE FIELD ACCESS (ESPECIALLY TO REMOTE SITES). THESE FLEXIBILITIES WILL DEPEND ON CONDITIONS, CONG NEEDS, AND ACE SUPERVISOR APPROVAL ON AN AS-NEEDED (CASE-BY-CASE) BASIS.   3. PERFORMANCE OBJECTIVES -THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE IS TO CONTROL SWEETGUM, CHINESE PRIVET, JAPANESE CLIMBING FERN, AND OTHER NUISANCE/INVASIVE PLANTS OVER APPROXIMATELY 25 ACRES OF UPLAND FOREST.A SECONDARY OBJECTIVE IS TO SELECTIVELY (AND IN CLOSE COORDINATION WITH PERMANENT CONG STAFF) REDUCE SHRUB LAYER DENSITY IN THESE SAME AREAS   4. PURPOSE OF AWARD:THIS PROJECT PROVIDES THE OPPORTUNITY FOR TWO YOUTH OR VETERANS TO ENGAGE IN PAID, TEN-WEEK, HANDS-ON INTERNSHIPS AT MINUTE MAN NATIONAL HISTORICAL PARK. THESE PARTICIPANTS WILL RECEIVE SKILLS AND SAFETY TRAINING WHILE COMPLETING NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE PROTECTION AND PRESERVATION PROJECTS.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:TRAINING AND PROJECT WILL INCLUDE LANDSCAPE ASSESSMENTS, INVENTORIES, INSPECTIONS, OBJECT CONSERVATION, HISTORICAL DOCUMENT REVIEW AND TEACH-BACKS, CULTURAL LANDSCAPE REPAIRS, HISTORIC TRAIL REPAIRS LINED WITH HISTORIC STONEWALLS, REVEGETATION, INVASIVE PLANT MANAGEMENT, AND RIPARIAN AREA CARE.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:(WEEK 1) ORIENTATION, SAFETY MEETINGS, REVIEW OF JOB HAZARD ANALYSES, PARK TOUR (2-5): ASSESS CONDITION OF CULTURAL LANDSCAPES WITH STONE WALLS AND ALONG HISTORIC TRAILS, IDENTIFY AND ADDRESS DEFICIENCIES. (6-8): FOCUS ON NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT TOPICS, ASSESS AND CARRY OUT RESOURCE PROTECTION PROJECTS ALONG RIPARIAN CORRIDORS, ATTEND TRAININGS AT METRO BOSTON PARKS, REVIEW DOCUMENTATION, PREPARE AND PRESENT TEACH BACK AS PART OF RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP CELEBRATION. (9-10): FOCUS ON NATURAL OR CULTURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT PRESERVATION PROJECT AND COMPLETE FINAL EVALUATIONBENEFICIARIES:INTERNS GAIN VALUABLE KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES IN THE TRADES SECTOR WHILE DEVELOPING RESPONSIBLE CITIZENSHIP AND STEWARDSHIP ETHICS. THE WORK COMPLETED THROUGH THESE SERVICE OPPORTUNITIES PROVIDED IN THIS AGREEMENT WILL BE IN SERVICE TO PUBLIC LANDS TO BE UTILIZED AND ENJOYED FOR CURRENT AND FUTURE GENERATIONS.

THE GOAL IS TO TRAIN YOUNG LEADERS IN PROVIDING COMMUNITY TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO OUTDOOR RECREATION AND CONSERVATION PROJECTS THROUGHOUT THE COUNTRY. THE OBJECTIVE IS: TO INTRODUCE A DIVERSITY OF YOUNG PROFESSIONALS TO THE WORK OF COMMUNITY ASSISTANCE IN CONSERVATION AND OUTDOOR RECREATION THROUGH A 11 TO 12-MONTH FELLOWSHIP AND THE 12-WEEK RIGOROUS INTERNSHIP. TO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATES TO ACCESS PERMANENT FEDERAL CONSERVATION POSITIONS USING THE PUBLIC LAND CORP AND DIRECT HIRE AUTHORITIES. SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: PARTICIPATING FELLOWS AND INTERNS WILL WORK WITH SKILLED PROFESSIONAL NPS EMPLOYEES ON CONSERVATION AND OUTDOOR RECREATION PROJECTS THAT MAY INCLUDE DEVELOPING AND RESTORING PARKS, CONSERVATION AREAS, RIVERS, AND WILDLIFE HABITATS, AS WELL AS CREATING OUTDOOR RECREATION OPPORTUNITIES AND PROGRAMS THAT ENGAGE FUTURE GENERATIONS IN THE OUTDOORS.

COMPETITIVE AWARD AGREEMENT REQUIREMENTSFUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: N/AFUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT: N/AREQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSPURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):GOALS -TO PROVIDE REAL WORLD EXPERIENCE TO YOUTH INTERN IN THE (GEOGRAPHIC INFORMATION SYSTEMS) GIS FIELD AND THE TASKS ASSOCIATED INCLUDING DIGITIZATION, MAP PRODUCTION, DATA MANAGEMENT, AND GIS PLATFORMS INCLUDING ARCGIS ONLINE AND THE ARCGIS SOFTWARE.DEVELOP A MORE COMPLETE RECREATIONAL/RETRACEMENT TRAIL DATASET FOR THE NATIONAL HISTORIC TRAILS (NHT) AND TRAIL MAPS TO BE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC AND ASSIST THE PUBLIC IN GETTING OUT ON THE TRAILS.TO PLAN FOR AND DEVELOP NHTS THROUGH ROAD/PEDESTRIAN SIGNING ALONG ALL NINE TRAILS THAT NATIONAL TRAILS OFFICE ADMINISTERS.TO PROVIDE AN OPPORTUNITY FOR A YOUTH INTERN TO GAIN COMMUNICATION SKILLS INTERACTING WITH COMMUNITIES, TRAIL PARTNERS, AND AGENCY STAFF, AS WELL AS EXPOSURE TO TECHNICAL SKILLS LIKE ARCGIS, INDESIGN, AND PHOTOSHOP.OBJECTIVES -DEVELOP COMMUNICATION AND COLLABORATION SKILLS OF A YOUTH INTERN THAT CAN BE USED TO FURTHER CAREER GOALSDEVELOP GIS SKILLS AND MAP PRODUCTION SKILLSENCOURAGE YOUTH PARTICIPATION AND ENGAGEMENT WITH NATIONAL HISTORIC TRAILS PROVIDE DAILY COMMUNICATION WITH A RANGE OF FEDERAL, STATE, NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS, AND OTHER TRAIL PARTNERS TO COLLABORATE ON SIGNING AND DEVELOPMENT ACTIVITIES.PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO PARTNERS SEEKING LOCAL OR STATE DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION APPROVAL TO INSTALL SIGNS.WORK DIRECTLY WITH LOCAL AND STATE DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION OFFICES FOR APPROVAL TO INSTALL SIGNSSUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE ACE FELLOW WILL PRIMARILY DEVELOP SPATIAL DATASETS AND MAPS RELATED TO RECREATIONAL/RETRACEMENT TRAILS ASSOCIATED WITH THE NHTS. DUTIES WILL INCLUDE:   I. DEVELOPING A RECREATIONAL/RETRACEMENT TRAIL DATASET FOLLOWING APPLICABLE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE/FEDERAL TRAIL DATA STANDARDS AND DEVELOPS PROFESSIONAL QUALITY MAPS ACCORDING TO NATIONAL TRAILS AND NATIONAL PARK SERVICE STANDARDS.   II. DEVELOP SIGN PLANS BASED ON NATIONAL TRAILS ESTABLISHED PROCESS AND SIGN SYSTEM, EITHER IN CLOSE COLLABORATION WITH PROJECT PARTNERS OR INDEPENDENTLY, AS PROJECTS REQUIRE.   III. PROVIDE GUIDANCE TO PARTNERS ON SIGN PLANNING, USE OF THE ONLINE PLANNING TOOL, WORKING WITH ROAD JURISDICTIONS TO OBTAIN SIGNED AGREEMENT FORMS, AND ORDERING, SHIPPING, AND INSTALLATION OF APPROVED SIGNS.   IV.   ASSIST NATIONAL TRAILS STAFF WITH OTHER NHT-RELATED ACTIVITIES AS NEEDED, INCLUDING ATTENDANCE AT PUBLIC EVENTS, OTHER GIS RELATED TASKS, PREPARATION OF SOCIAL MEDIA CONTENT, AND GENERAL OFFICE OPERATIONS.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THIS FUNDING ENABLES AN AMERICAN CONSERVATION EXPERIENCE (ACE) YOUTH INTERN TO WORK WITH NPS STAFF AND VOLUNTEERS ON NATIONAL TRAILS GIS PROJECTS SPECIFICALLY RECREATIONAL TRAILS DATASET DEVELOPMENT, SIGN PLANNING, AND OTHER NATIONAL HISTORIC TRAIL (NHT) PROJECTS. INTERN WORK WILL INCREASE VOLUNTEER CAPACITY; INCREASE SPATIAL DATA MANAGEMENT, INCREASE THE AMOUNT OF SIGNING COMPLETED IN A YEAR; INCREASE PUBLIC KNOWLEDGE OF/ACCESS TO NHT ASSOCIATED SITES, SEGMENTS, RECREATIONAL TRAILS; AND PROVIDE THE INTERN OPPORTUNITIES FOR PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE AND SKILL DEVELOPMENT.BENEFICIARIES:BOTH THE NPS AND THE INTERN WILL BENEFIT FROM THIS POSITION.

PROJECT STATEMENT - THE YOUTH LEADERSHIP PROGRAM COORDINATOR WILL DEVELOP AND PILOT A FORMAL MULTI-FACETED YOUTH LEADERSHIP PROGRAM FOR YOUNG ADULTS AGES 16-30 YEARS OLD AT EVERGLADES NATIONAL PARK.PROJECT GOALS - THE GOAL OF A FORMAL YOUTH LEADERSHIP PROGRAM IS TO CREATE LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENTAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUTH THROUGH PARTICIPATION IN INTERNSHIPS AND VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES.PERFORMANCE OBJECTIVES - THESE OPPORTUNITIES WOULD ACCOMPLISH MEANINGFUL WORK FOR THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE WHILE PROVIDING INTENTIONAL ENVIRONMENTAL LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT THAT EMPOWERS YOUNG ADULTS TO BECOME EMPOWERED AND PROFESSIONAL LEADERS IN CONSERVATION.MILESTONES -N/AASSISTANCE LISTING - TITLE - BENEFICIARIES CFDA 15.931 YOUTH AND VETERAN ORGANIZATIONS CONSERVATION ACTIVITIES.PRIVATE NON-PROFIT INSTITUTIONS AND ORGANIZATIONS; PUBLIC AND PRIVATE NON-PROFIT ACADEMIC INSTITUTIONS; STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENT AGENCIES; QUASI-PUBLIC NON-PROFIT INSTITUTIONS AND ORGANIZATIONS THAT SUPPORT YOUTH AND YOUNG ADULT CAREER TRAINING AND DEVELOPMENT, AND EDUCATION IN THE AREAS OF NATURAL AND/OR CULTURAL RESOURCE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT. INDIVIDUALS/FAMILIES; STUDENTS; AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC WILL RECEIVE A BENEFIT FROM THE DEVELOPMENT AND EXECUTION OF THESE PROGRAMS AND PROJECTS.

PROJECT STATEMENT - CULTURAL RESOURCES INTERN(S) ENGAGED IN ARCHEOLOGY, MUSEUM, AND ARCHIVES OUTREACH AND PRESERVATION. PERFORMANCE GOALS - THIS PROJECT FITS THE DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR STRATEGIC PLAN COMPONENT 3.2.1: ENHANCE THE ENJOYMENT AND APPRECIATION OF OUR NATURAL AND CULTURAL HERITAGE THROUGH DISSEMINATION OF INFORMATION RELATED TO THE ROLE THAT AFRICAN AMERICANS PLAYED IN THE CONSTRUCTION OF FORT JEFFERSON, IDENTIFICATION AND DIGITIZATION OF HISTORIC PHOTOGRAPHS TO INCREASE ACCESS, AND ENGAGEMENT OF UNDER-REPRESENTED YOUTH IN THE MANAGEMENT OF CULTURAL RESOURCES AND ARCHEOLOGICAL SITES IN NATIONAL PARKS WHILE FOSTERING A CONNECTION TO PROTECTION OF CULTURAL RESOURCES.C.PERFORMANCE OBJECTIVES - TWO INTERN WILL BE EMPLOYED: ONE FOR 12 WEEKS, THE SECOND FOR 29 WEEKS. THE INTERNS WILL COMPLETE AN ARCHIVAL PHOTOGRAPH DIGITIZING PROJECT AND WORK WITH PUBLIC VOLUNTEERS TO MANAGE THE TRANSCRIBING PROJECT OF HISTORIC ARMY DOCUMENTS. THE INTERNS WILL WORK WITH DRY TORTUGAS NATIONAL PARK HISTORIC DOCUMENTS IN WAYS THAT WILL EXPOSE THEM TO SOME CORE MUSEUM/ARCHIVES WORK WHILE ALSO GIVING THEM OPPORTUNITIES TO SEE HOW THE NPS MUSEUM PROGRAM INTERACTS WITH THE PUBLIC AND PROVIDES ARCHIVAL MATERIAL TO THE PUBLIC THROUGH NPS AND OTHER WEB SITES.D. PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):PROJECT GOALS - PROVIDE JOB TRAINING AND EDUCATION EXPERIENCE IN THE CONSERVATION OF NATURAL RESOURCES. BY MENTORING INTERNS, WE ARE ENSURING THAT WE PROVIDE FOR THE TRAINING, CAREER DEVELOPMENT, AND EDUCATION OF YOUNG PEOPLE WITH AN INTEREST IN THE MANAGEMENT OF PUBLIC LANDS AND WATERS. INTERNS WILL WORK ON PROJECTS CARRIED OUT BY THE PARK'S NATURAL RESOURCES STAFF.PROJECT OBJECTIVES - PROVIDE JOB TRAINING AND EDUCATION EXPERIENCE IN THE CONSERVATION OF NATURAL RESOURCES TO ITS PARTICIPANT. EDUCATE PARK VISITORS ABOUT PUBLIC LANDS AND NATURAL RESOURCES THREATS LIKE BUT NOT LIMITED TO AQUATIC INVASIVE SPECIES THREAT, SPECIFICALLY ZEBRA AND QUAGGA MUSSEL.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:AMIS NATIONAL RECREATION AREA WILL TRAIN AN INTERN FOR 45 WEEKS/40 HOURS PER WEEK (WEEKEND AND HOLIDAYS) PERFORMING A WIDE VARIETY OF PARK TASKS. THEIR DUTIES MIGHT INCLUDE:1) COLLECT AND ORGANIZE FIELD DATA.2) INSTALL, OPERATE, AND MAINTAIN RESOURCE MANAGEMENT EQUIPMENT.3) PERFORM BOAT INSPECTIONS TO GATHER DATA ON BIOLOGICAL THREAT OF INVASIVE SPECIES INTRODUCTIONS VIA WATERCRAFT.4) PROVIDE INFORMATION TO VISITORS AND PERFORM OUTREACH AT BOAT RAMPS TO INFORM BOATING PUBLIC OF AQUATIC INVASIVE SPECIES THREAT.5) ASSIST IN DESIGNING, DEVELOPING, TESTING, AND IMPLEMENTING SCIENTIFIC MONITORING PROTOCOLS FOR NATIVE AND INVASIVE SPECIES AND SPECIES OF CONSERVATION CONCERN6) PREPARE PROJECT AND SEASON REPORTS.7) ASSIST PARK STAFF DURING SPECIAL EVENTS8) ASSIST PARK STAFF DURING THE FALL BUTTERFLY MIGRATION9) ASSIST PARK STAFF WITH A VARIETY OF RESOURCE MANAGEMENT PROJECTS10) GPS DATA COLLECTION AND ANALYSIS, GIS DATA LAYER CREATION, GIS DATABASE CREATION AND IMPLEMENTATION, AND MAP PRODUCTION.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE PROJECT MOTIVATES ITS YOUTH PARTICIPANT TO BECOME INVOLVED WITH THE NATURAL RESOURCES' PROTECTION AND CONSERVATION OF THEIR COMMUNITIES AND BEYOND. BY MENTORING INTERNS, WE ARE ENSURING THAT WE PROVIDE TRAINING, CAREER DEVELOPMENT, AND EDUCATION OF YOUTH PEOPLE WITH AN INTEREST IN THE MANAGEMENT OF PUBLIC LANDS AND WATERS. THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO DIRECTLY BENEFIT THE PUBLIC THROUGH THE PROTECTION OF PUBLIC WATER BODIES.BENEFICIARIES:AMISTAD NATIONAL RECREATION AREA AND PARK VISITORS.THE YOUTH CREW MEMBERS WILL LEARN ABOUT THE LOCAL FLORA AND FAUNA, AND THEY WILL BE EXPOSED TO THE IDEALS OF THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE OF PRESERVATION AND APPRECIATION OF THE NATURAL ENVIRONMENT.

THIS PROGRAM SEEKS TO UTILIZE QUALIFIED NON-PROFIT YOUTH AND VETERAN SERVING ORGANIZATIONS TO CARRY OUT APPROPRIATE NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE CONSERVATION, EDUCATION, VOLUNTEER SERVICE AND EDUCATION PROJECTS ON DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR LANDS THROUGH AUTHORIZED NPS PROGRAMS.THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE PLANNING, MENTORING, RELATIONSHIP BUILDING, AND RECRUITMENT FOR YOSEMITE NATIONAL PARK TO FIELD A YOSEMITE TRIBAL CONSERVATION CORPS CREW IN 2023 BASED ON THE CONSERVATION LEGACY ANCESTRAL LANDS CONSERVATION CORPS MODEL. CRITICAL VEGETATION MANAGEMENT, FIRE AND FUEL PREPARATION, AND CULTURAL RESOURCE PROTECTION PROJECTS IN YOSEMITE NATIONAL PARK WILL BE PLANNED AND PILOTED. THE PROJECT WILL ENGAGE UP TO 50 POTENTIAL CREW MEMBERS AND OTHER YOUTH FROM THE SEVEN SIERRA NEVADA TRIBES AFFILIATED WITH YOSEMITE NATIONAL PARK. THIS ENGAGEMENT WITH YOSEMITE NATIONAL PARK WILL PROVIDE RECREATIONAL AND APPROPRIATE SERVICE OPPORTUNITIES.

REQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSPURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THIS PROJECT FULFILLS A PUBLIC PURPOSE BY ENGAGING RECIPIENTS AND PARTNERS IN SHARED ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP. THE PROJECT MOTIVATES PARTICIPANTS TO BECOME INVOLVED IN THE NATURAL RESOURCE PROTECTION OF THEIR COMMUNITIES AND BEYOND. PARTICIPANTS GAIN "REAL WORLD" AND HANDS-ON EXPERIENCE OUTSIDE OF THE CLASSROOM ON NATURAL RESOURCE PROJECTS.BY PARTICIPATING IN THE PROJECT, YOUTH WILL LEARN AND DEVELOP VALUABLE SKILLS IN INVASIVE NON-NATIVE PLANT INVENTORY, MAPPING, AND MANAGEMENT; NATIVE PLANT RESTORATION; AND RESTORATION EFFECTIVENESS MONITORING. INVASIVE SPECIES WILL BE TREATED AND HABITATS RESTORED.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:PROVIDE UTAH CONSERVATION CORPS CREWS TO PROVIDE INVASIVE NON-NATIVE PLANT INVENTORY, MAPPING, AND MANAGEMENT; NATIVE PLANT RESTORATION IN 2023 AND 2024 ALONG THE SAN JUAN RIVER.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:CONNECT YOUTH TO THEIR NATIONAL PARKS THROUGH RESTORATION AND INVASIVE PLANT TREATMENT PROJECTS. PROVIDE ON THE GROUND ASSISTANCE TO GLEN CANYON TO REMOVE INVASIVE SPECIES AND RESTORE NATIVE ECOSYSTEMS.IMPROVE RECREATION ACTIVITIES (E.G. CAMPING, WILDLIFE OBSERVATION AND PHOTOGRAPHY, FISHING ACCESS AND VISITOR SAFETY AT A MINIMUM OF 40 SITES (10 ACRES) ALONG 39 MILES OF THE SAN JUAN RIVER.BENEFICIARIES: UTAH STATE UNIVERSITY - UTAH CONSERVATION CORPS

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THE AMERICAN CONSERVATION EXPERIENCE (ACE)/ EMERGING PROFESSIONALS IN CONSERVATION (EPIC) HYDROLOGY FELLOW WILL PERFORM A VARIETY OF DUTIES TO MANAGE THE HYDROLOGY DATA AT GRAND CANYON NATIONAL PARK (GRCA) AND ASSIST WITH DATA COLLECTION FIELD WORK FOR THE GRAND CANYON GEOSCIENCE PROGRAM.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE FELLOW WILL WORK IN PARTNERSHIP WITH NPS TEAM TO COMPLETE HYDROLOGY MONITORING AND DATA MANAGEMENT PROJECTS. THE FELLOW WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR ASSISTING WITH THE PLANNING, PREPARATION, AND EXECUTION OF OVERNIGHT BACKCOUNTRY TRIPS INTO THE CANYON. THIS WILL INCLUDE CREATING FIELD ITINERARIES, COMPLETING NECESSARY FORMS AND PERMITS FOR BACKCOUNTRY WORK, AND CONDUCTING MAINTENANCE OF HYDROLOGIC MONITORING EQUIPMENT AT BACKCOUNTRY CAVE, SPRING, AND STREAM GAGE SITES. IN THE FIELD, THE FELLOW WILL ALSO PERFORM HYDROLOGY DATA COLLECTION OF WATER SAMPLES, DISCHARGE MEASUREMENTS, WATER QUALITY MEASUREMENTS, AND DOWNLOADED OF LOGGER DATA IN ACCORDANCE WITH PROTOCOLS. FIELD WORK WILL REQUIRE BACKCOUNTRY HIKING, CAMPING, AND CAVING. IN PREPARATION FOR FIELD WORK, THE FELLOW WILL ASSIST WITH RESEARCH OF PREVIOUS TRIP REPORTS AND RESEARCH OF EXISTING AND NEW GAGE SETUPS AND INSTRUMENTATION. THE FELLOW WILL ALSO BE RESPONSIBLE FOR THE DATA MANAGEMENT OF FIELD SAMPLES TO INCLUDE DATA MINING, COMPILATION, ORGANIZATION, ARCHIVING, AND PUBLISHING INTO PARK SYSTEMS TO BE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:AS A RESULT OF A SUCCESSFUL FELLOWSHIP, THE FELLOW WILL HAVE ADVANCED THE MONITORING AND MANAGEMENT OF THE HYDROLOGIC RESOURCE AT GRCA AND WILL HAVE CONTRIBUTED TO THE PUBLIC UNDERSTANDING OF THIS RESOURCE. THE FIELD WORK AND DATA MANAGEMENT WORK COMPLETED AS PART OF THIS FELLOWSHIP WILL CONTRIBUTE TO THE DATA AVAILABILITY OF GRCA HYDROLOGIC RESOURCES, WHICH IS CRUCIAL FOR THE ADVANCEMENT OF RESEARCH AND PUBLIC EDUCATION.BENEFICIARIES:YOUTH

STUDENT CONSERVATION ASSOCIATION INTERN WILL ASSIST WITH THE EXHIBIT INSTALLATION AT BOTH THE VISITOR CENTER AND TRADING POST, LEARN TO WRITE PRESS RELEASES AND PRODUCE MEDIA, BECOME ACQUAINTED WITH THE PROCESS OF PLANNING SPECIAL EVENTS IN THE NPS, AND ASSIST WITH THE DEVELOPMENT OF A VOLUNTEER MANAGEMENT PLAN FOR THE TRADING POST. INTERN WILL BE TRAINED IN CUSTOMER SERVICE, INFORMAL AND FORMAL INTERPRETATION, MEDIA DEVELOPMENTAND SPECIAL EVENT PLANNING.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:INTERN WILL ASSIST WITH INSTALLATION OF NEW EXHIBITS AT THE TRADING POST. WILL WORK WITH MUSEUM CURATOR AND FACILITIES STAFF ON FINAL PUNCH LIST ITEMS AND PROJECTS RELATED TO ACCESSIBILITY. INTERN WILL ASSIST WITH DATA COLLECTION, MAKE OBSERVATIONS AND RECOMMENDATIONS, AND ASSIST THE DIVISION WITH THE CREATION OF A DESIRED VISITOR EXPERIENCE PLAN.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:SEPTEMBER-OCTOBER 2022: ASSIST WITH EXHIBIT INSTALLATION, PUNCH LIST ITEMS, SPECIAL EVENTS PREPARATION, SOCIAL MEDIA AND PRESS RELEASES RELATED TO NEW VISITOR CENTER.NOVEMBER 2022- EXHIBIT INSTALLATION. SET TO BE COMPLETED MID-NOVEMBER.DECEMBER 2022- PUNCH LIST ITEMS COMPLETE, RIBBON CUTTING, SPECIAL EVENTS?JANUARY-SEPTEMBER 2023: COLLECT DATA REGARDING VISITOR USE OF THE NEW SITE, ASSIST WITH DEVELOPMENT OF VISITOR EXPERIENCE PLAN, ADDRESS VISITATION CONCERNS, ETC. BENEFICIARIES:INTERN WILL BENEFIT FROM THIS PROJECT. THE PUBLIC WILL RECIEVE THE BENEFIT WHEN VISITING THE PARK

COMPETITIVE AWARD AGREEMENT REQUIREMENTSFUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: N/AFUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT: N/AREQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSPURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PLACE COLLEGE-AGED INDIVIDUALS AND OTHER QUALIFIED PERSONS WHO VOLUNTEER THEIR SERVICES THROUGH CONSERVATION LEGACY IN EXCHANGE FOR TRAINING AND EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCE IN VISITOR SERVICES. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO SUPPORT AND STIMULATE WORK AND/OR EDUCATION AND TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUNG ADULTS THROUGH COLLABORATIVE PARTICIPATION IN VISITOR SERVICES AT MONTEZUMA CASTLE AND TUZIGOOT NATIONAL MONUMENTS IN ARIZONA.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE INTERN WILL CREATE ORIGINAL INTERPRETIVE PROGRAMING AT MONTEZUMA WELL FOCUSED ON BOTH NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES. INTERPRETIVE PROGRAMMING MAY INCLUDE FORMAL TALKS AND TOURS, TABLE DEMONSTRATIONS, SPECIAL EVENTS, AND SOCIAL MEDIA POSTS. THE INTERN WILL ALSO ASSIST PARK STAFF WITH CLASSROOM VISITS, FIELD TRIPS AND IN CREATING A JUNIOR RANGER PROGRAM AT MONTEZUMA WELL AND WILL SUPPORT COMMUNITY OUTREACH EVENTS SUCH AS FESTIVALS.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE INTERN WILL FOCUS ON PUBLIC EDUCATION AND DEVELOP INTERPRETIVE PROGRAMING AS A WAY TO INCREASE STEWARDSHIP RATES AMONG VISITORS AND STUDENTS. THE INTERNS WILL BE PROVIDED TRAINING AND SHADOWING OPPORTUNITIES TO HELP FACILITATE FUTURE CAREER OPPORTUNITIES.BENEFICIARIES:THE BENEFICIARIES ARE YOUTH THAT PARTICIPATE IN THE PROJECT AND THE GENERAL VISITING PUBLIC.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THIS PROJECT PROMOTES AWARENESS OF AND ACCESS TO THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE AND OTHER PUBLIC LANDS BY ENGAGING YOUTH LEADERS TO REACH OUT TO THEIR COMMUNITIES, LEAD THEM IN EXPERIENTIAL OUTDOOR ADVENTURES, TEACH THEM ABOUT THE NPS, AND HELP THEM UNDERSTAND HOW TO PLAN THEIR NEXT ADVENTURE. THE YOUNGER STUDENTS WHO GET THE OPPORTUNITY TO WORK WITH THE YOUTH RANGERS LEARN ABOUT FISHING, RESPONSIBLE OUTDOOR RECREATION, ARCHERY, AND ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE. THE PROJECT ALSO PROVIDES THESE 12 YOUTH RANGERS WITH THE OPPORTUNITY TO VISIT SEVERAL NATIONAL PARKS (MANY FOR THE FIRST TIME) AND MENTOR YOUNGER STUDENTS THROUGH THOSE TRIPS AS THEY LEARN HOW TO CAMP, HIKE, FISH.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THIS PROJECT HIRES 12 HIGH SCHOOL AND COLLEGE YOUTH LEADERS FROM THE DENVER METRO AREA AS "YOUTH RANGERS". THESE YOUTH WORK WITHIN THEIR COMMUNITIES TO EDUCATE 4,000+ YOUNGER STUDENTS AND THEIR FAMILIES ABOUT THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE, AND ENGAGE THEM IN FUN, SAFE, OUTDOORS ACTIVITIES LIKE - OFTEN FOR THE FIRST TIME. THIS IS A PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN THE NPS, COLORADO PARKS & WILDLIFE, ENVIRONMENTAL LEARNING FOR KIDS (A LOCAL NON-PROFIT), AND DENVER PARKS AND RECREATION. THE SUMMER EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY ALLOWS THE REGIONAL OFFICE TO LEVERAGE A "TRAIN THE TRAINERS" MODEL IN ORDER TO PROVIDE EDUCATION AND OUTREACH TO UNDERREPRESENTED COMMUNITIES IN THE DENVER AREA. THROUGHOUT THE SUMMER, THE YOUTH RANGERS RUN FISHING CLINICS, TEACH ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE AND ARCHERY CLASSES, LEAD AND MENTOR YOUNGER STUDENTS ON CAMPING TRIPS, ASSIST NPS RANGERS AT OUTREACH EVENTS, AND PARTICIPATE IN A VARIETY OF STEM-RELATED PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:1. BUILD THE CAPACITY OF THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE TO ENGAGE UNDERREPRESENTED YOUTH COMMUNITIES.  A. BUILD PARTNERSHIPS WITH COMMUNITY-BASED YOUTH-SERVING ORGANIZATIONS  B. PROVIDE POSITIVE OUTDOOR EXPERIENCES FOR YOUTH IN THE COMMUNITY (BOTH YOUTH RANGERS AND THE YOUNGER STUDENTS THEY TEACH AND MENTOR)  C. CULTIVATE ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP AND A SENSE OF CURIOSITY FOR THE OUTDOORS  D. PROVIDE A CONTINUUM OF EXPERIENCES FOR YOUTH, INCLUDING INTENTIONAL CAREER OPPORTUNITIES  E. THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FOR A ONE-YEAR DEVELOPMENTAL INTERNSHIP WITH THE ANZA TRAIL. THE INTERN WILL WORK CLOSELY WITH THE INTERPRETIVE PROGRAM MANAGER OF THE TRAILS OFFICE TO RESEARCH, MAKE COMMUNITY LEADERSHIP CONNECTIONS AND LAY THE FOUNDATION FOR MULTI-DIMENSIONAL, CROSS-CULTURAL INTERPRETIVE PROGRAMMING IN PREPARATION FOR THE ANZA TRAIL'S 250TH ANNIVERSARY OF THE ANZA EXPEDITION. THE 250TH ANNIVERSARY COINCIDES WITH THE US SEMI-QUINCENTENNIAL YEARS OF 2025/2026.THE INTERN WILL ENGAGE EXISTING COMMUNITY AND TRIBAL CONTACTS, REACH OUT TO ADDITIONAL COMMUNITY CONTACTS AND ORGANIZATIONS THAT WILL COLLABORATE WITH TRAIL STAFF. IN WORKING WITH THE CONTACTS, WE INTEND TO AMPLIFY AND CONNECT THOUGHTFUL PUBLIC PROGRAMS AND EVENTS THAT WILL LEAD UP TO A MULTIFACETED COMMEMORATION YEAR. THE INTENT IS TO DEVELOP COMMUNITY CONNECTIONS, TEST OUT AND DEVELOP THEMES IN THE YEARS LEADING UP TO A 250TH COMMEMORATION. CROSS CULTURAL PERSPECTIVES CAN BE AUTHENTICALLY VOICED IN THE 250TH COMMEMORATION OF THE ANZA EXPEDITION.THE INTERN WILL LAY THE GROUNDWORK OF CONTACTS AND COMMUNITY-BASED PROJECT CONCEPTS THAT WILL ENHANCE THE EXPERIENCE AND HERITAGE OF UNDER RECOGNIZED COMMUNITIES OF COLOR AND NATIVE AMERICAN COMMUNITIES ALONG THE ANZA TRAIL.1. REACHING OUT AND CONDUCTING CONVERSATIONS WITH INDIVIDUALS OR GROUPS. LISTENING TO STORIES ABOUT PLACES (40%)2. GATHERING, RESEARCHING, AND COORDINATING CONTACTS WITH THE OVER 40 TRIBAL ENTITIES ALONG THE ANZA TRAIL. (20%)3. ASSISTING IN FACILITATED MEETINGS AND DIALOGUES WITH COMMUNITY REPRESENTATIVES (15%)4. AMPLIFYING THE WORK OF THE COMMUNITIES AND SPACES IN COMMUNICATIONS AND SOCIAL MEDIA PLATFORMS. (15%)5. WORKING WITH STAFF TO DEVELOP AND PRESENT PUBLIC CONVERSATIONS WITH COMMUNITY MEMBERS (10%)FELLOWS WILL WORK AND COMMUNICATE WITH A HISPANIC ACCESS PROGRAM MANAGER DURING THEIR FELLOWSHIP. FELLOWS WILL BE EXPECTED TO PARTICIPATE IN SCHEDULED CONFERENCE CALLS, WEBINARS, AND MEETINGS CONDUCTED THROUGHOUT THEIR TERM. FELLOWS WILL CAPTURE PHOTOS AND/OR VIDEOS FOR REPORTING PURPOSES AND SUBMIT 3-5 BLOG POSTS HIGHLIGHTING THEIR EXPERIENCE AND DEVELOPMENT.THIS BENEFITS THE INTERN AND THE VISITOR TO THE ANZA TRAIL.

DUTIES INCLUDE FIELDWORK TO DOCUMENT AND ASSESS EXISTING CONDITIONS OF BUILDINGS, STRUCTURES, TRAILS, AND SMALL-SCALE FEATURES ASSOCIATED WITH DEVELOPED AREAS AND BACKCOUNTRY AREAS OF THE PARK; WRITING NARRATIVE DESCRIPTIONS; TAKING PHOTOGRAPHS; ENTERING TEXT AND PHOTOGRAPHS INTO NATIONAL PARK SERVICE (NPS) DATABASES; WORKING WITH PARK CULTURAL RESOURCES MANAGER AND REGIONAL STAFF TO IDENTIFY CRITICAL CONCERNS FOR PRESERVATION MAINTENANCE.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:INTERN(S) WILL BE RECRUITED, SELECTED, AND COMPLETE THEIR TERMS AS FEASIBLE. PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): TO ENHANCE THE VISITOR EXPERIENCE AT CHACO CULTURE NATIONAL HISTORICAL PARK BY MANAGING VEGETATION IN AREAS OF HIGH VISITOR USE, AND TO PROVIDE MEANINGFUL WORK EXPERIENCES FOR CONSERVATION CORPS YOUTH FOR THE PURPOSE OF BUILDING THE NEXT GENERATION OF CONSERVATION LEADERS.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:MANAGE VEGETATION AT PUEBLO BONITO AND OTHER FRONT COUNTRY ARCHEOLOGICAL SITES, AT TRAILHEADS, AND IN OTHER AREAS WITH HIGH VISITOR USE. OVERGROWN VEGETATION CAN RESULT IN TRIPPING HAZARDS IN AREAS OF HIGH VISITOR USE AND THESE VEGETATION ACTIVITIES WILL IMPROVE THE VISITOR EXPERIENCE AND HELP MAINTAIN ACCESSIBILITY TO HIGHLY VISITED SITES WITHIN CHCU.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:INITIAL MEETING WITH SOUTHWEST CONSERVATION CORPS STAFF IN SEPTEMBER 2022MEETING WITH SCC STAFF IN SPRING OF 2023 TO SCHEDULE CONSERVATION CORPS CREWSSUMMER CREWS IMPLEMENT VEGETATION MANAGEMENT IN SUMMER 2023BENEFICIARIES: PARK VISITORS, PARK MANAGEMENT, NATIONAL PARK SERVICE

THE VFC PROGRAM WILL ENGAGE UP TO 30 VETERANS IN PARTNERSHIP WITH NPS SITES IN THE INTERMOUNTAIN REGION, THE SOUTHEAST REGION, THE NORTHEAST REGION, AND THE NATIONAL CAPITAL REGION TO HELP VETERANS TRANSITION FROM MILITARY TO CIVILIAN SERVICE.SUMMARY OF PROJECT-SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:TRAINING & CERTIFICATION ALL VFC PARTICIPANTS WILL RECEIVE STANDARD ENTRY-LEVEL TRAINING AND CERTIFICATION IN FIRST AID/CPR, WILDLAND FIRE FIGHTER TYPE II, WILDLAND FIRE CHAINSAWS, CAREER READINESS, AND ON-THE-JOB TRAINING TO PREPARE THEM FOR WILDLAND FIRE CAREERS. PROJECT WORK THE VFC CREWS' PRIMARY WORK IS TO REDUCE HAZARDOUS FUELS IN HIGH-RISK WILDLAND URBAN INTERFACE (WUI) AREAS. WORK MAY INCLUDE THINNING VEGETATION, HAND PILING FUELS, LIMBING AND BRUSHING VEGETATION, PRESCRIBED FIRE PILE, AND BROADCAST BURNING. WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT EVERY VETERAN CORPSMEMBER WILL GAIN THE CERTIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE NECESSARY TO PREPARE THEM TO ENTER A NATURAL RESOURCE CAREER. ADDITIONALLY, THEY WILL UNDERSTAND THE VALUE OF THE SKILLS DEVELOPED AND HOW TO COMMUNICATE THEM TO PROSPECTIVE EMPLOYERS EFFECTIVELY. PERFORMANCE GOALS, INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMESPERFORMANCE GOALS, INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:UP TO THIRTY VETERANS WILL RECEIVE TRAINING, CERTIFICATIONS, AND EXPERIENCE NECESSARY TO QUALIFY AS A WILDLAND FIRE FIGHTER TYPE II.

COMPETITIVE AWARD AGREEMENT REQUIREMENTSFUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: N/AFUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT: N/AREQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSPURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE A LEARNING OPPORTUNITY FOR NATIVE AMERICAN YOUTH WHILE PERFORMING PRESERVATION MAINTENANCE AT SEVERAL PREHISTORIC STRUCTURES AT WALNUT CANYON AND WUPATKI NATIONAL MONUMENTS. SPECIFICALLY, THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE A SUSTAINED OPPORTUNITY TO LEARN FROM NATIONAL PARK SERVICE NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE MANAGERS AND ARCHEOLOGISTS. LEARNING TOPICS INCLUDE THE MISSION OF THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE AND ITS INFLUENCE ON THE DESIGN AND IMPLEMENTATION OF PRESERVATION PROJECTS, VARIOUS CHALLENGES FACING PUBLIC LAND MANAGERS (SPECIFICALLY THE THREE NATIONAL MONUMENTS SURROUNDING FLAGSTAFF, AZ) IN MEETING THE AGENCY'S MISSION, AND TECHNICAL FIELD SKILLS IN HISTORIC PRESERVATION. AS PART OF ORIENTATION AND DURING THREE EDUCATION DAYS, PARTICIPATING YOUTH WILL LEARN ABOUT HUMAN HISTORY AND VARIOUS ARCHEOLOGICAL SITES, WILDLIFE FOUND IN EACH OF THE THREE MONUMENTS, AND THE AREA'S GEOLOGY AND HYDROLOGY. PARTICIPATING YOUTH WILL ALSO LEARN FROM CURRENT NATIONAL PARK SERVICE EMPLOYEES ABOUT VARIOUS CAREERS IN THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT, REQUIREMENTS FOR SPECIALIZED FIELDS, SUCH AS ARCHEOLOGY, AND HOW TO EFFECTIVELY APPLY AND COMPETE FOR FEDERAL JOBS.PARTICIPATING YOUTH WILL DEVELOP RESOURCE MANAGEMENT ETHICS WHILE LEARNING FROM PARK EMPLOYEES WHILE ENGAGED IN PROJECT TASKS. FOR EXAMPLE, PARTICIPATING YOUTH WILL LEARN HOW THEIR PROJECT WAS DESIGNED TO ACCOUNT FOR AND MINIMIZE THE IMPACT OF DOING PRESERVATION WORK ON NATURAL RESOURCES SURROUNDING EACH SITE.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE PROJECT WILL INCLUDE CONDUCTING PRESERVATION MAINTENANCE AND ELIMINATING DEFERRED MAINTENANCE ON STANDING PREHISTORIC ARCHITECTURAL REMAINS AT WALNUT CANYON NATIONAL MONUMENT AND WUPATKI NATIONAL MONUMENT. WORK SITES INCLUDE 900-YEAR-OLD FRONT AND BACKCOUNTRY PUEBLOS AT WALNUT CANYON AND WUPATKI NATIONAL MONUMENTS. PRESERVATION MAINTENANCE INCLUDES REPOINTING ERODED MORTAR JOINTS, RESETTING LOOSE WALL STONES, RESETTING WALL CAPS, CLEANING WATER DRAINS, AND VEGETATION REHABILITATION. NATIONAL PARK SERVICE PRESERVATION SPECIALISTS WILL PROVIDE ORIENTATION, TRAINING, AND OVERSEE DAILY ACTIVITIES. ALL WORK WILL BE THOROUGHLY DOCUMENTED AND PHOTOGRAPHED. THE CONSERVATION LEGACY CREW WILL BE TRAINED IN BOTH HANDS-ON TREATMENTS AND DOCUMENTATION METHODS.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:CONSERVATION LEGACY WILL RECRUIT AND SELECT CREW MEMBERS DURING THE SPRING OF 2022. CONSERVATION LEGACY WILL CONDUCT A WEEK-LONG TRAINING AND ORIENTATION. THE NPS WILL CONDUCT AN ORIENTATION AND TRAINING WITH THE CREW AND OVERSEE SIX WEEKS OF PRESERVATION MAINTENANCE FIELDWORK AT WALNUT CANYON NATIONAL MONUMENT AND WUPATKI NATIONAL MONUMENT. THE CREW WILL COMPLETE FIELDWORK ON AUGUST 19, 2022. THE NPS WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR COMPLETING A DETAILED SUMMARY REPORT OF PRESERVATION MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES.BENEFICIARIES:PRIVATE NON-PROFIT INSTITUTIONS AND ORGANIZATIONS; PUBLIC AND PRIVATE NON-PROFIT ACADEMIC INSTITUTIONS; STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENT AGENCIES; QUASI-PUBLIC NON-PROFIT INSTITUTIONS AND ORGANIZATIONS THAT SUPPORT YOUTH AND YOUNG ADULT CAREER TRAINING AND DEVELOPMENT, AND EDUCATION IN THE AREAS OF NATURAL AND/OR CULTURAL RESOURCE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT. INDIVIDUALS/FAMILIES; STUDENTS; AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC WILL RECEIVE A BENEFIT FROM THE DEVELOPMENT AND EXECUTION OF THESE PROGRAMS AND PROJECTS.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THIS PROJECT WILL ENGAGE YOUTH THROUGH DIRECT EMPLOYMENT WITH AMERICAN CONSERVATION EXPERIENCE (ACE) TO COMPLETE NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP PROJECTS, DEFERRED MAINTENANCE PROJECTS, AND TO ASSIST WITH A NURDLE PATROL DAY EDUCATIONAL EVENT AT PADRE ISLAND NATIONAL SEASHORE FOR LOCAL SCHOOL GROUPS.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:ACE CREW MEMBERS WILL WORK PRIMARILY IN FIELD ENVIRONMENTS TO (1) REMOVE INVASIVE VEGETATION, (2) REMOVE MARINE DEBRIS FROM THE GULF OF MEXICO COASTLINE, (3) ASSIST WITH NURDLE PATROL DAY EVENT, (4) DOCUMENT MARINE DEBRIS AND COLLECT NURDLES AT ESTABLISHED MONITORING SITES, (5) REPLACE WEATHERED AND BROKEN BOLLARDS AND CABLES ALONG PARK ROADS, (6) ASSIST WITH PEDESTRIAN ARCHEOLOGICAL SURVEYS AND REPLACEMENT OF DETERIORATED WOODEN FEATURES WITHIN A CULTURAL LANDSCAPE, AND (7) VARIOUS DEFERRED MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES, SUCH AS PAINTING, BUILDING AND REPLACING PICNIC TABLES, ETC.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:MILESTONES WILL BE MEASURED BY NUMBER OF WEEKS OF PROJECT WORK COMPLETED. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE IMPROVED PUBLIC ENGAGEMENT, INCREASED ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP, AND PERSONAL AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT OF ACE MEMBERS, AS WELL AS IMPROVED CONDITION AND PROTECTION OF RESOURCES. MEASURABLE RESULTS ARE EXPECTED TO INCLUDE (1) TREATMENT OF AT LEAST 25 ACRES TO CLEAR INVASIVE VEGETATION, (2) REMOVAL OF APPROXIMATELY 5 TONS OF MARINE DEBRIS FROM AT LEAST 10 MILES OF SHORELINE, AND (3) DOCUMENTATION OF MARINE DEBRIS AND NURDLES AT LEAST TWICE AT EACH OF 12 SITES.BENEFICIARIES:AMERICAN CONSERVATION EXPERIENCE

PURPOSE OF AWARD: THE GOAL OF THIS TASK AGREEMENT IS TO SUPPORT WORK AND TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUNG ADULTS THROUGH COLLABORATIVE PARTICIPATION IN NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT IN ACADIA NATIONAL PARK. COLLECTIVELY THE PROJECTS FOSTER YOUTH INVOLVEMENT IN HISTORIC TRAILS MAINTENANCE THAT HELP PRESERVE AND PROTECT THE RESOURCES OF ACADIA NATIONAL PARK. THESE PROJECTS ALSO PROVIDE VALUABLE EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE YOUTH INTERESTED IN LEARNING ABOUT OR HELPING TO PROTECT NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: WORK WILL FOCUS ON LEARNING ABOUT AND ASSISTING WITH THE PRESERVATION AND MAINTENANCE OF THE HISTORIC HIKING TRAILS.SPECIFIC PROJECTS INCLUDE HANDS-ON PROJECTS WITH THE SUPPORT AND TRAINING FROM THE PARK STAFF TO LEARN ABOUT AND CONTRIBUTE TO HISTORIC TRAILS MAINTENANCE; INCLUDING WOODEN BRIDGE REPAIR, STONE RETAINING WALLS, DRAINAGE STRUCTURES, STONEWORK, AND GENERAL DITCH AND LANDSCAPING REQUIREMENTS ON A VARIETY OF TRAIL LOCATIONS.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: IMPLEMENTATION OF TRAILS MAINTENANCE PROGRAM USING NPS PROTOCOLS. PRESERVATION OF CULTURAL AND NATURAL RESOURCES IN PARK LANDSCAPES THROUGH MAINTENANCE WORK. WORKING WITH LOCAL MATERIALS SUCH AS WOOD, STEEL AND STONE TO REHABILITATE HISTORIC TRAIL FEATURES. IDENTIFICATION OF CULTURAL AND NATURAL RESOURCES ALONG THE HISTORIC TRAILSBENEFICIARIES: THE PUBLIC WILL BENEFIT FROM THE GENERAL INCREASED KNOWLEDGE OF ACADIA NATIONAL PARK'S NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES AND FROM TRAINING OF EARLY CAREER PROFESSIONALS.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):FLORISSANT FOSSIL BEDS NM DESIRES TO SPONSOR A 6 MEMBER AMERICAN CONSERVATION EXPERIENCE (ACE) WORK CREW TO ASSIST PARK STAFF IN THE CONTROL OF AGGRESSIVE, HIGH PRIORITY INVASIVE PLANTS IN THIS UNIT OF THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE. IN PARTICULAR, CANADA THISTLE, FIELD BINDWEED, AND YELLOW TOADFLAX REQUIRE MULTIPLE TREATMENTS THROUGHOUT THE GROWING SEASON AND THE PARK HAS NO RESOURCE MANAGEMENT STAFF MEMBERS CAPABLE OF GETTING TO ALL KNOWN LOCATIONS WITHIN A GIVEN YEAR. ALSO, THE PARK IS ENGAGED IN A WETLANDS MITIGATION PROJECT WHERE INVASIVE PLANTS NEED TO BE CONTROLLED AND NATIVE SEEDS COLLECTED FOR RESTORATION PURPOSES.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:ACE WILL PROVIDE A 6-PERSON YOUNG ADULT CREW FOR 80 HOURS FOR INVASIVE PLANT CONTROL, SEED COLLECTION, AND OTHER NATIVE VEGETATION CONSERVATION ACTIVITIES FOR EACH WORK PERIOD. THE NPS AND ACE WILL DETERMINE PROJECT TIMELINES AND WORKLOAD, PLAN LOGISTICS, DETERMINE EDUCATION AND TRAINING NEEDS, ETC. THE NORTHERN ROCKY MOUNTAIN INVASIVE PLANT MANAGEMENT TEAM (NPS) WILL ALSO ASSIST IN TRAINING AND SUPERVISING THIS WORK FORCE IN THE FIELD. SEASONAL FLEXIBILITY THROUGHOUT THE WORK PERIOD ALLOWS FOR CREWS TO PERFORM THE WORK WHEN INVASIVE PLANTS ARE MOST SUSCEPTIBLE TO PREFERRED TREATMENTS AND NATIVE SEEDS ARE ABLE TO BE COLLECTED. THE INTERN WILL BE PROVIDED THE TRAINING TO CONDUCT INFORMAL AND FORMAL EDUCATION ACTIVITIES FOR YOUTH PROGRAMS; RECRUIT YOUTH INTO PARK YOUTH ACTIVITIES; AND RECRUIT VOLUNTEERS TO ASSIST WITH YOUTH PROGRAMMING.

THIS PROJECT ENGAGES YOUTH WITH A HANDS-ON OPPORTUNITY TO CONTRIBUTE TO IMPORTANT CONSERVATION PROJECTS FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT AT CATOCTIN MOUNTAIN PARK. YOUNG ADULTS WILL ENCOUNTER STRUCTURED, SAFE, AND CHALLENGING TRAILS WORK AND EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES THAT PROMOTE PERSONAL GROWTH, THE DEVELOPMENT OF LIFE SKILLS, AN ETHIC OF NATURAL RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP, AND AN APPRECIATION OF PUBLIC LANDS. THE YOUTH WILL WORK ALONGSIDE RESOURCE PROFESSIONALS TO GAIN PRACTICAL TRAINING AND A RANGE OF EXPERIENCE IN PERFORMING TRAIL CONSTRUCTION AND MAINTENANCE IN A REMOTE SETTING AS FOLLOWS: (1) INSTALLING AND MAINTAINING TRAIL TREAD AND STRUCTURES, SUCH AS WATER BARS, TURNPIKES, ROLLING GRADE DIPS, STEPS, AND BRIDGES; (2) REMOVING FALLEN TREES THAT ARE BLOCKING THE TRAIL; (3) TRIMMING ENCROACHING VEGETATION; AND (4) CONSTRUCTING NEW TRAILS, INCLUDING BENCHING THE TREAD, THAT CONNECT THE CAMPS TO THE EAST AND WEST SIDE TRAIL SYSTEMS. AS THEY COMPLETE THE HANDS-ON PROJECTS, THEY WILL ASSIST THE PARK IN REDUCING THE BACKLOG OF WORK PROJECTS AND SUPPORT THE SECRETARY'S PRIORITIES TO IMPROVE INFRASTRUCTURE, ADDRESS DEFERRED MAINTENANCE, AND ENHANCE RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE PUBLIC.REPAIR AND MAINTAIN APPROXIMATELY 3 MILES OF TRAILS IN CATOCTIN MOUNTAIN PARK. PRODUCE A REPORT SUMMARIZING PROJECT COMPLETION, INCLUDING BEFORE AND AFTER PHOTOS.VISITORS TO CATOCTIN MOUNTAIN PARK WILL BENEFIT FROM THE PROJECT BECAUSE MAINTAINED TRAILS WILL BE SAFER AND MORE ENJOYABLE. NEW CONSTRUCTED TRAILS WILL ALLOW OVERNIGHT CAMPERS TO ACCESS THE TRAIL SYSTEM FROM THEIR CAMP AND WILL ALLOW HIKERS TO HIKE BETWEEN THE EAST AND WEST SIDES OF THE PARK, GIVING THEM MORE HIKING OPTIONS. THE TRAIL CREW WILL BENEFIT BY LEARNING LEADERSHIP AND TRAIL MAINTENANCE SKILLS.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): PROVIDE PRESERVATION TRADES TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES TO NATIVE AMERICAN YOUNG ADULTS AND VETERANS ON NPS-LED PRESERVATION PROJECTS THROUGH THE INDIAN YOUTH SERVICE CORPS PROGRAM IN ORDER TO PROMOTE JOB SKILLS TRAINING IN THE TRADES SECTOR AND DEVELOP A STEWARDSHIP ETHIC FOR CULTURAL RESOURCE INFRASTRUCTURE ON PUBLIC LANDS. THESE PROJECTS CAN ENCOMPASS SKILLS INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO: CARPENTRY, MASONRY, WOODWORKING, TRADITIONAL ROOFING, TIMBER-FRAMING, CONDITION ASSESSMENTS, METALWORK, ADOBE WORK, AND EXTERIOR WOOD COMPONENT REPAIR. PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS COMPLETE INTENSIVE TRAININGS ON SAFETY, PRESERVATION STANDARDS, AND MORE. PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: PROVIDE LONG-TERM, INTENSIVE TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES TO NATIVE AMERICAN YOUNG ADULTS AND VETERANS SEEKING TO DEVELOP PRESERVATION TRADE SKILLS THAT FOSTER COMPETITIVENESS IN THE PUBLIC AND PRIVATE SECTOR EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES. TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES WILL TAKE PLACE IN TANDEM WITH NPS-LED PRESERVATION PROJECTS AND FURTHER NPS GOALS TO MAINTAIN, PRESERVE, RESTORE, AND PROJECT CULTURAL RESOURCE INFRASTRUCTURE ON NPS SITES ACROSS THE COUNTRY.
