PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THIS PROJECT PREVENTS INVASIVE RUSSIAN OLIVE AND TAMARISK TREES FROM BECOMING REESTABLISHED IN PREVIOUSLY TREATED LOCATIONS IN CANYON DE CHELLY NATIONAL MONUMENT. THIS PROJECT WILL RESULT IN A REDUCTION IN THE LOSS OF NATIVE HABITAT AND FORAGE FOR LIVESTOCK AND WILDLIFE SPECIES; AN ENHANCEMENT OF NATIVE BIODIVERSITY AND GENERAL ECOSYSTEM HEALTH; A PARTIAL RECOVERY OF MORE NATURAL STREAM GEOMORPHOLOGIES AND ASSOCIATED PROCESSES; AN ENHANCEMENT OF THE VISITOR EXPERIENCE THROUGH IMPROVED AESTHETICS AND INTERPRETATION OF THE NATURAL AND CULTURAL LANDSCAPES WITHIN THE PARK; MITIGATION OF THREATS TO ARCHEOLOGICAL RESOURCES; AND IMPROVEMENTS TO DOWNSTREAM WATER AVAILABILITY FOR THE COLORADO RIVER BASIN.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:SPARSE TO MODERATELY DENSE RUSSIAN OLIVE AND TAMARISK TREE RESPROUT (IN PREVIOUSLY TREATED AREAS) STANDS WILL BE CUT, IF MEETING A HEIGHT THRESHOLD, AND TREATED WITH AN APPROVED HERBICIDE MIXTURE. A FOLIAR APPLICATION (HERBICIDE ONLY/NO CUTTING) METHOD WILL BE APPLIED IF TREES FALL UNDER THE PRESCRIBED SIZE THRESHOLD FOR STUMP CUTTING. VEGETATION THAT EXCEEDS FOLIAGE TREATMENT PARAMETERS WILL REQUIRE REMOVAL BY SAWYERS AND SWAMPERS. SLASH GENERATED FROM VEGETATION REMOVAL WILL BE CONSOLIDATED BY HAND IN PREPARATION FOR HAZARDOUS FUELS REDUCTION.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:APPROXIMATELY 100 ACRES OF SPARSE TO MODERATELY DENSE RUSSIAN OLIVE TREE STANDS IN PREVIOUSLY TREATED MANAGEMENT UNITS IN CANYON DE CHELLY WILL BE REMOVED, TREATED WITH HERBICIDE AND PREPARED FOR FUTURE PRESCRIBED BURNS TO REDUCE HAZARDOUS FUEL BUILDUP.BENEFICIARIES:THIS PROJECT WILL SUPPORT THE EMPLOYMENT OF FIVE LOCAL NATIVE AMERICAN YOUTH INCLUDING TWO PROJECT LEADERS AND THREE CREW MEMBERS FROM CONSERVATION LEGACY.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THE UTAH CONSERVATION CORPS (UCC) WILL ASSIST IN FUELS REDUCTION AROUND BRYCE CANYON NATIONAL PARK STRUCTURES TO REDUCE THE DENSITY OF PONDEROSA PINE AND TO CREATE DEFENSIBLE SPACE IN THE EVENT OF A WILDFIRE. CREWS WILL COMPLETE PRESCRIBED TREATMENTS IN SELECTED PONDEROSA STANDS. TREATMENTS MAY INCLUDE MECHANICAL THINNING, UNGULATE BARRIER INSTALLATION, AND SLASH PILING.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:RESTORATION ACTIONS WILL INCLUDE MECHANICAL THINNING USING POWER SAWS (IN NON-WILDERNESS AREAS) AND HANDSAWS (IN WILDERNESS AREAS) TO REDUCE THE DENSITIES OF PONDEROSA PINE STANDS AROUND PARK INFRASTRUCTURE. CREWS MAY BE REQUIRED TO FALL TREES UP TO 12 INCHES IN DIAMETER AT BREAST HEIGHT (DBH). CREWS MAY ALSO BE REQUIRED TO BUCK AND LIMB LARGER DIAMETER TREES AND PILE SLASH INTO APPROXIMATELY 6-FOOT X 6-FOOT BURN PILES TO BE BURNED IN THE WINTER MONTHS.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THIS PROJECT WILL RESULT IN IMPROVED FOREST STANDS BY THINNING AND WILDLAND URBAN INTERFACE (WUI) DEFENSIBLE SPACE IN THE EVENT OF A WILDFIRE.BENEFICIARIES:YOUTH

THE ALASKA PUBLIC LANDS INFORMATION CENTER IS SEEKING A DYNAMIC CANDIDATE WHO CAN HELP MAINTAIN AND GROW ITS EDUCATION PARTNERSHIPS. PREFERRED CANDIDATES WILL BE MOTIVATED SELF-STARTERS THAT HAVE A DESIRE TO MAKE CONNECTIONS WITH FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL COMMUNITY EDUCATION PARTNERS. PRIOR KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE IN ALASKA AND ANCHORAGE, WHILE PREFERRED, IS NOT A REQUIREMENT.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):VIEWING WILDLIFE IS A SPECIAL TREAT FOR PARK VISITORS. VISITORS FREQUENTLY INQUIRE AS TO WHERE VIEWING HOT SPOTS FOR WILDLIFE ARE LOCATED. THIS PROJECT WOULD RESTORE HABITAT ALONG POPULAR TRAILS IN ORDER TO CREATE WILDLIFE VIEWING AND PHOTOGRAPHY OPPORTUNITIES FOR VISITORS. WILDLIFE HABITAT HAS BEEN DEGRADED BY WEEDS, ESPECIALLY MEDITERRANEAN GRASS AND RED BROME. AT EACH OF THE THREE AREAS, FIVE ACRES OF HABITAT WOULD BE RESTORED FOR A TOTAL OF 15 ACRES. NON-NATIVE WEEDS WHICH CROWD OUT THE NATIVE PLANTS WOULD BE REMOVED WITH AN HERBICIDE APPLICATION. WILDFLOWER SPECIES THAT WILDLIFE LIKE TO EAT WOULD BE SEEDED INTO THESE AREAS. ADDITIONALLY, 300 WOODY PLANTS USED FOR COVER WOULD BE GROWN IN THE NURSERY AND PLANTED. SEEDINGS AND PLANTING WOULD RECEIVE SUPPLEMENTAL WATERING TO PROMOTE SUCCESSFUL ESTABLISHMENT.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:COLLECTION AND PROCESSING OF SEEDS OF NATIVE PLANT SPECIES, PROPAGATION OF PLANTS IN THE JOTR NURSERY, SEEDING AND OUTPLANTING NATIVE PLANT SPECIES, MANUAL AND CHEMICAL WEED CONTROL, MONITORING PLANT POPULATIONS, AND MITIGATING HABITAT DAMAGE CAUSED BY OFF-TRAIL FOOT TRAFFIC.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:COLLECTION AND PROCESSING OF SUFFICIENT NUMBER OF CLEANED AND VIABLE SEEDS OF EACH PLANT SPECIES USED (SEEDED OR PROPAGATED) TO MEET PROJECT NEEDS.PROPAGATION OF 1.3 TIMES THE NUMBER OF CONTAINER-GROWN PLANTS NEEDED FOR THE PROJECT, WITH THE NUMBER NEEDED FOR OUTPLANTING HEALTHY AND VIGOROUS AT SCHEDULED OUT PLANTING.ESTABLISHMENT OF PLANT SPECIES THAT PROVIDE FORAGE AND COVER TO WILDLIFE (E.G. DESERT TORTOISE) WITH SUCCESS DEFINED AS SURVIVAL OF 50% OF CONTAINER-GROWN PLANTS AND EMERGENCE AND ESTABLISHMENT OF SEEDED SPECIES AT A DENSITY OF 4 PLANTS PER METER2.CONTROL OF INVASIVE ALIEN PLANT SPECIES IN TREATED RESTORATION AREAS SUCH THAT POST-CONTROL DENSITY OF ALIEN INVASIVE PLANTS IS LESS THAN 0.25 PLANTS PER METER2 AT TIME OF SEEDING/OUTPLANTING.MONITORING OF SEEDED/PLANTED SPECIES FOR TWO YEARS TO DOCUMENT SURVIVAL AND MORTALITY.BENEFICIARIES:PARK VISITORS BENEFIT BY HAVING INCREASED OPPORTUNITIES TO VIEW AND PHOTOGRAPH WILDLIFE.JOSHUA TREE NP WOULD BENEFIT BY HAVING IMPROVED WILDLIFE HABITAT AND REDUCED ALIEN INVASIVE PLANT INFESTIONS.GBI RESEARCH ASSOCIATES WOULD GAIN EXPERIENCE AND EXPERTISE AND THEREBY BECOME MORE COMPETITIVE CANDIDATES FOR FUTURE PROFESSIONAL POSITIONS.
LYJO & WACO YOUTH INTERNS FOR FY22 AND FY23

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THIS AGREEMENT INCLUDES THE ENGAGEMENT OF LOCAL NATIVE AMERICAN YOUTH IN COOPERATIVE CULTURAL AND NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT INSIDE THE HISTORIC DISTRICT AT HUBBELL TRADING POST NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE. THESE YOUTH WILL BE ASSIGNED TO PROJECTS THAT HELP TO IMPROVE, PRESERVE, AND REHABILITATE CULTURAL LANDSCAPE FEATURES AND ELEMENTS INSIDE THE PARK. PARTICIPANTS WILL ALSO CONTRIBUTE TO LIVESTOCK CARE. THIS WORK ENHANCES THE INTERPRETIVE ALLURE OF HUBBELL TRADING POST NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE AS A LIVING FARM.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:CREW MEMBERS AND LEADERS WILL PARTICIPATE IN A VARIETY OF ACTIVITIES TO IMPROVE AND MAINTAIN THE CULTURAL LANDSCAPE AT HUBBELL TRADING POST NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE. THESE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE THE MAINTENANCE OF AN INTERPRETIVE GARDEN, AGRICULTURAL FIELDS, A TRAIL, AND FENCES; THE DAILY CARE OF THE PARK'S HORSE, SHEEP, GOATS, AND CHICKENS; THE SHEARING OF SHEEP, HOOF TRIMMING AND LIVESTOCK ROTATIONS; AND MAINTENANCE OF THE CULTURAL LANDSCAPE THROUGH TREE PRUNING, RAKING LEAVES, AND MOWING LAWN.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THROUGH THE CONTINUATION OF TRADITIONAL AGRICULTURAL PRACTICES AND CARE FOR LIVESTOCK BY LOCAL YOUTH, THESE PROJECT ACTIVITIES HELP TO EXPRESS THE OPERATIONS OF AN HISTORIC TRADING POST AND PRESERVE ITS ASSOCIATED CULTURAL LANDSCAPE. IT ALSO PROMOTES THE WELFARE AND EDUCATION OF THE NATIVE AMERICAN YOUTH THAT ARE EMPLOYED.BENEFICIARIES:THIS PROJECT WILL SUPPORT THE EMPLOYMENT OF THREE LOCAL NATIVE AMERICAN YOUTH INCLUDING ONE PROJECT LEADER AND TWO CREW MEMBERS FROM CONSERVATION LEGACY.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):PERFORMANCE GOALS - CONNECT VETERANS TO THEIR NATIONAL PARK THROUGH ENGAGEMENT IN NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP AND CITIZEN SCIENCE ACTIVITIES.PROJECT OBJECTIVES - BY PARTICIPATING IN THE PROJECT, VETERANS WILL LEARN AND DEVELOP VALUABLE SKILLS IN INVASIVE PLANT INVENTORY AND MANAGEMENT, CULTURAL RESOURCE PROTECTION, OUTDOOR LIVING, OUTDOOR RECREATION, AND CITIZEN SCIENCE. PROJECT PARTICIPANTS WILL LEARN AND DISCUSS THE NPS MISSION AND INCREASE THEIR NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE KNOWLEDGE BASE.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:CITIZEN SCIENCE ACTIVITIES: DOCUMENT MILKWEED AND MONARCH BUTTERFLY POPULATIONS.RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP ACTIVITIES: REMOVE OF VEGETATION ENCROACHING ON CAMPABLE AREAS, CONTROL INVASIVE NON-NATIVE SPECIES, AND PERFORM HABITAT RESTORATION ACTIVITIES (E.G., NATIVE SEED COLLECTION).ENGAGE IN ACTIVITIES THAT ENABLE PARTICIPANTS TO GAIN A BETTER UNDERSTANDING AND APPRECIATION OF NATIONAL PARK SERVICE NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THROUGH PROJECT ENGAGEMENT, FOSTER DEVELOPMENT OF THE NEXT GENERATION OF NPS AMBASSADORS.BENEFICIARIES:ALL YOUTH VETERAN PROJECT PARTICIPANTS.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THE GOAL OF THIS TASK AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING FOR TWO RECIPIENT MEMBERS TO DEVELOP YOUTH WORK AND LEADERSHIP SKILLS BY ASSISTING NPS STAFF WITH ARCHEOLOGICAL SURVEYING AND REPORT PREPARATION WITHIN THE SANTA MONICA MOUNTAINS NATIONAL RECREATION AREA (SAMO). THIS WORK IS NECESSARY TO FACILITATE SEVERAL TRAILS MAINTENANCE PROJECTS. BY COLLABORATING WITH AND WORKING ALONGSIDE NPS CULTURAL RESOURCES STAFF, THE TWO RECIPIENT MEMBERS WILL GAIN VALUABLE EXPERIENCE AND KNOWLEDGE OF PUBLIC LAND MANAGEMENT, WHICH WILL BROADEN THEIR UNDERSTANDING OF CONSERVATION AND LAND STEWARDSHIP. NPS AND THE TWO RECIPIENT MEMBERS WILL COLLABORATE TO PROVIDE THE NECESSARY COMPLIANCE DELIVERABLES THAT WILL ALLOW THE PLANNED TRAILS MAINTENANCE PROJECTS TO BE IMPLEMENTED BRINGING THE CONDITION OF SAMO TRAILS TO THEIR DESIGNED STANDARDS AND PROVIDE FOR SAFE VISITOR USESUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE END RESULT OF THIS PROJECT WILL BE TO PROVIDE A VALUABLE EXPERIENCE FOR YOUTH IN PUBLIC LAND MANAGEMENT AND A SAFE EXPERIENCE FOR VISITORS ON SAMO TRAILS. THIS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED BY HAVING NPS STAFF WORKING ON-SITE WITH THE TWO RECIPIENT MEMBERS. NPS STAFF WILL PROVIDE LOCAL KNOWLEDGE AND BACKGROUND OF THE ARCHEOLOGICAL RESOURCES IN SAMO THAT WILL FACILITATE SURVEYING AND REPORT PREPARATION ACTIVITIES. WORK ACCOMPLISHED BY THIS PARTNERSHIP WILL INCLUDE ARCHEOLOGICAL SURVEYING, PREPARATION OF REPORTS AND DEPARTMENT OF PARKS AND RECREATION FORMS FOR SUBMITTAL TO THE STATE OFFICE OF HISTORIC PRESERVATION. THESE COMPLIANCE EFFORTS WILL ENABLE THE PLANNED TRAILS MAINTENANCE PROJECTS TO BE IMPLEMENTED, PROVIDING SAFE, PASSABLE ROUTES THROUGH PUBLIC LAND FOR VISITORS TO ENJOYPERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THE PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE JOB TRAINING AND EXPOSURE TO THE TYPES OF ACTIVITIES THAT ARE ENTAILED IN THE FIELD OF CULTURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT ON A ROUTINE BASIS BY HAVING RECIPIENT MEMBERS TO ASSIST IN THE ARCHEOLOGICAL SURVEYING AND REPORT PREPARATION. THEY WILL LEARN THE SKILLS AND UNDERSTANDING OF ARCHEOLOGICAL SURVEYING AND THE REPORTING REQUIREMENTS ESSENTIAL FOR COMPLIANCE WITH SECTION 106 OF THE NATIONAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION ACT OF 1966. KNOWLEDGE OF THESE ELEMENTS IS ESSENTIAL TO DEVELOPING A CAREER AS AN ARCHEOLOGIST IN PUBLIC SERVICE. ULTIMATELY, THE DOCUMENTATION PRODUCED FOR COMPLIANCE WILL ENABLE THE IMPLEMENTATION OF PLANNED TRAILS MAINTENANCE PROJECTS, WHICH WILL DIRECTLY BENEFIT THE PUBLIC AS IT WILL RESULT IN SAFE, PASSABLE ROUTES THROUGH PUBLIC LAND FOR VISITORS TO ENJOY.BENEFICIARIES: YOUTH, PUBLIC BENEFIT

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): THIS TASK AGREEMENT AIMS TO IMPROVE YOUTH INVOLVEMENT IN CULTURAL AND NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES, INCLUDING IMPROVED WILDLIFE HABITAT AND VISITOR EXPERIENCE. THE ARIZONA CONSERVATION CORPS (AZCC), A PROGRAM OF CONSERVATION LEGACY, WILL PROVIDE CREWS FOR 12 WEEKS TO ASSIST THE PARK RESOURCE MANAGEMENT DIVISION WITH RESTORATION OF HAZARDOUS ABANDONED MINE LANDS IN WILDERNESS BACKCOUNTRY AREAS.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: UNDER GUIDANCE OF PARK RESOURCE MANAGERS, THE YOUTH CONSERVATION CREWS WILL USE HAND TOOLS TO PARTIALLY BACKFILL MINE PROSPECTS, CREATING WILDLIFE-FRIENDLY RAMPS. BARBED WIRE FENCE BARRIERS WILL BE REMOVED AND PACKED OUT.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: TO MITIGATE HUMAN AND WILDLIFE HAZARDS AT APPROXIMATELY 25 BACKCOUNTRY SITES. THIS WORK WILL RESULT IN IMPROVED VISITOR AND WILDLIFE SAFETY AND HELP RESTORE WILDERNESS CHARACTER. YOUTH CREWS WILL ALSO LEARN ABOUT THE MINING HISTORY OF ARIZONA, HISTORIC PRESERVATION, WILDLIFE HABITAT AND WILDERNESS MANAGEMENT.BENEFICIARIES: ARIZONA CONSERVATION CORPS (AZCC), ORGAN PIPE CACTUS NATIONAL MONUMENT, AND VISITING PUBLIC.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THE PRINCIPAL PURPOSE OF THIS TASK AGREEMENT IS TO SUPPORT THE GOVERNMENT'S OBJECTIVE TO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUTH TO LEARN ABOUT THE ENVIRONMENT AND OUR NATION'S HERITAGE. IT ALSO SERVES A PUBLIC PURPOSE BY PROMOTING AND STIMULATING EDUCATION, JOB TRAINING, DEVELOPMENT OF CITIZENSHIP, PRODUCTIVE COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT, AND FURTHERING UNDERSTANDING, APPRECIATION, AND CONSERVATION OF NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES. THIS TASK AGREEMENT WILL INSPIRE A YOUNG ADULT TO LEARN, SERVE, AND ENJOY WORKING IN THE GREAT OUTDOORS AND HELPING THE PUBLIC TO LEARN MORE ABOUT PETROGLYPH NATIONAL MONUMENT (MONUMENT OR PETR).THE OBJECTIVES OF THIS AGREEMENT INCLUDES PARTNERING WITH CONSERVATION LEGACY, TO RECRUIT A YOUTH INTERN FOR VISITOR USE AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH PROJECTS IMPLEMENTED AT PETR IN MEETING PROGRAM GOALS, WHICH WILL ASSIST THE MONUMENT IN IMPROVING PUBLIC AWARENESS AND VISITOR EXPERIENCE. THE YOUTH INTERN WILL PROVIDE CUSTOMER SERVICE AND GUIDE SERVICES, WHICH WILL INFORM VISITORS IN PLANNING A SAFE AND ENJOYABLE VISIT. THE YOUTH INTERN WILL PROVIDE ESTABLISHED TALKS AND GUIDED TOURS AND HIKES TO THE VISITING PUBLIC, EDUCATING THEM ON THE NATURAL AND HUMAN HISTORY OF THE MONUMENT.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE INTERN WILL ASSIST THE PETR INTERPRETATION AND VISITOR SERVICES TEAM IN PROVIDING MEMORABLE AND MEANINGFUL LEARNING AND RECREATIONAL EXPERIENCES TO THE PUBLIC, FOSTER DEVELOPMENT OF A PERSONAL STEWARDSHIP ETHIC, AND BROADEN PUBLIC SUPPORT FOR PRESERVING MONUMENT RESOURCES. THESE PROGRAMS WILL BE SUCCESSFUL WHEN THEY FORGE EMOTIONAL AND INTELLECTUAL CONNECTIONS AMONG MONUMENT RESOURCES, VISITORS, THE COMMUNITY, AND PETR MANAGEMENT. THE INTERN WILL ASSIST THE NPS IN PROVIDING VISITORS WITH AN EXPERIENCE THAT IS ENJOYABLE AND MEANINGFUL WITHIN THE CONTEXT OF THE MONUMENT'S RESOURCES AND THE VALUES THEY REPRESENT. THE INTERN WILL BE INVOLVED IN PUBLIC EDUCATION WHICH WILL STRENGTHEN COMMUNITY UNDERSTANDING OF THE FULL MEANING AND RELEVANCE OF HERITAGE RESOURCES, BOTH CULTURAL AND NATURAL, BY CREATING PUBLIC DIALOGUE AND FOSTERING CIVIC ENGAGEMENT.IN ADDITION TO PROVIDING GENERAL INFORMATION, THE INTERN WILL INFORM THE VISITING PUBLIC OF THE PURPOSES AND SCOPE OF THE NATIONAL PARK SYSTEM. THE INTERN WILL BENEFIT BOTH THE COMMUNITY AND ENVIRONMENT THROUGH PROVIDING INFORMAL INTERPRETATION AND COMMUNICATING TO VISITORS THE IDEAS OF PRESERVATION OF NATIONAL PARKS AND THE PARK RESOURCES THEMSELVES. IN AN URBAN PARK SUCH AS PETR, IT IS ESSENTIAL THAT THE PRESERVATION AND PROTECTION OF ALBUQUERQUE'S NATIONAL PARK REACHES BEYOND PARK BOUNDARIES TO THE WIDER GENERAL COMMUNITY.BENEFICIARIES: YOUTH CORPS INTERN, PETROGLYPH NATIONAL MONUMENT, VISITORS, COMMUNITY

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):YELL SEEKS TO ASSESS AND IMPROVE FOREST HEALTH AND INCREASE FOREST RESILIENCY. TO ACHIEVE THIS PROJECT GOAL, YELL DESIRES TO SPONSOR INTERNS WITH AMERICAN CONSERVATION EXPERIENCE (ACE) AND THEIR EMERGING PROFESSIONALS IN CONSERVATION (EPIC) PROGRAM. ACE EPIC INDIVIDUAL PLACEMENTS AND FELLOWSHIPS PROVIDE RECENT GRADUATES WITH FOCUSED, HANDS-ON OPPORTUNITIES TO WORK ALONGSIDE AND UNDER THE GUIDANCE OF AGENCY MENTORS AS THEY APPLY THEIR KNOWLEDGE OF RESOURCE MANAGEMENT ON THEIR PATH TO BECOMING THE NEXT GENERATION OF RESOURCE AND LAND MANAGERS.THE PROJECT GOAL WILL BE MET BY THE FOLLOWING OBJECTIVES: CONDUCT FOREST HEALTH SURVEYS AND MONITORING; CONDUCT FOREST AND VEGETATION PROTECTION AND MITIGATION; ASSESS, PLAN, AND IMPLEMENT REMOVALS OF HAZARDOUS TREES; CONDUCT REVEGETATION EFFORTS AND COLLECT SEED; RECORD TREATMENT DATA; STEWARD AGENCY DATABASES AND CONDUCT ANALYSES; ASSIST FOREST AND VEGETATION STEWARDSHIP PLANNING; PERFORM NURSERY WORK; AND CONDUCT RESTORATION SITE MAINTENANCE.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:ACE WILL PROVIDE ONE EPIC INTERN EACH YEAR TO YELL TO ASSIST WITH FIELD AND OFFICE WORK IN FOREST AND VEGETATION PROJECTS WHERE THE INTERN WILL:WORK UNDER THE SUPERVISION OF PARK STAFF AND WITH PARK STAFF, YOUTH CORPS, OTHER COOPERATORS, AND VOLUNTEERS TO:A. ASSIST WITH FOREST HEALTH SURVEYS AND MONITORING.B. ASSIST WITH FOREST AND VEGETATION PROTECTION AND MITIGATION ACTIVITIES.C. ASSESSING, PLANNING, AND IMPLEMENTING REMOVALS OF HAZARDOUS TREES.D. ASSISTING WITH REVEGETATION EFFORTS.E. RECORDING TREATMENT INFORMATION (I.E., DATA COLLECTION) (GPS, FORMS), HELPING INFORM AND WORKING WITH AGENCY DATABASES, AND CONDUCTING ANALYSIS (GIS).F. ASSIST WITH FOREST AND VEGETATION STEWARDSHIP PLANNING PROJECTS.G. ASSIST WITH SEED COLLECTION, NURSERY WORK, AND RESTORATION SITE MAINTENANCE.FOLLOW YELLOWSTONE NP AND NPS GUIDELINES, WRITTEN PROJECT SPECIFICATIONS, AND ALL BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES WHEN COMPLETING NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT TASKS. ENSURES SAFETY IS ACCOUNTED FOR DURING ALL ASPECTS OF CONSERVATION WORK.LEAD VOLUNTEERS AND OTHER CONSERVATION YOUTH CORPS IN THE PERFORMANCE OF VEGETATION AND FOREST ASSESSMENT AND RESTORATION WORK. COMMUNICATES IMPORTANT INFORMATION TO SUPERVISOR, PEERS, AND PROJECT LEADERS REGARDING PROJECT STATUS.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:COMPLETED FIELD PROJECTS WITH PHOTOGRAPHS, WRITTEN WORK PLANS, GIS DOCUMENTATION, AND A SUMMARY OF WORK PERFORMED.BENEFICIARIES:NATIONAL PARK SERVICE (YELL) AND AMERICAN CONSERVATION EXPERIENCE.

NORTHWEST YOUTH CORPS CREWS WILL ASSIST CRATER LAKE NATIONAL PARK WITH TRAIL RESTORATION PROJECTS, PROVIDING MUCH NEEDED MAINTENANCE AND INCREASING VISITOR ENJOYMENT AND SAFETY BY PROVIDING A PROPER TRAIL CORRIDOR/TREAD SURFACE ON OVER 31 MILES OF TRAIL.THE PROJECT WILL INVOLVE CLEARING OF DOWNED TREES AND DEBRIS FROM WINTER STORMS ALONG THE TRAIL AND TRAIL CORRIDOR USING MANUAL CROSSCUTTING SAWS TO MIMIC HISTORIC WORK AND TO LIMIT DISTURBANCES TO WILDLIFE AND VISITORS, TREAD MAINTENANCE TO IMPROVE/REPAIR DRAINAGE ISSUES, AND BRUSHING OF ENCROACHING VEGETATION TO MAINTAIN A PROPER TRAIL CORRIDOR.THE YOUTH CREWS WILL RECEIVE TECHNICAL SKILLS AND WORK EXPERIENCE. BENEFICIAIRES INCLUDE THE NORTHWEST YOUTH CORPS.

IN 2008, LEWIS AND CLARK NATIONAL HISTORICAL PARK (LEWI) COLLABORATED WITH THE US GEOLOGICAL SURVEY (USGS) AND THE NPS NORTH COAST AND CASCADES NETWORK (NCCN) INVENTORY AND MONITORING PROGRAM TO DEVELOP A PROTOCOL FOR MONITORING LONG-TERM CHANGES IN THE MAGNITUDE AND SPATIAL PATTERNS OF ELK USE WITHIN AND ADJACENT TO LEWIS AND CLARK NHP (GRIFFIN ET AL. 2011). SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES OF THE MONITORING PROGRAM ARE TO MEASURE TRENDS IN (1) RELATIVE USE OF THE FORT CLATSOP UNIT BY ELK DURING WINTER; (2) THE PROPORTION OF AREAS WHERE ELK SIGN IS PRESENT IN THE FORT CLATSOP UNIT IN WINTER; AND (3) THE FREQUENCY OF ELK SIGHTINGS FROM ROADS IN AND AROUND THE FORT CLATSOP UNIT. A TREND ANALYSIS FOR THE FIRST 4 YEARS (2008-2012) WAS PUBLISHED IN 2014.MAINTAINING ELK (CERVUS ELAPHUS ROOSEVELTI) HERDS THAT FREQUENT LEWI IS CENTRAL TO THE PARK'S PURPOSE OF PRESERVING THE HISTORIC, CULTURAL, SCENIC, AND NATURAL RESOURCES ASSOCIATED WITH THE WINTER ENCAMPMENT OF THE LEWIS AND CLARK EXPEDITION. ELK WERE CRITICALLY IMPORTANT TO THE LEWIS AND CLARK EXPEDITION IN PROVIDING FOOD AND HIDES THAT SUSTAINED THE EXPEDITION DURING THE WINTER OF 1805-06 AND SUPPLIED THEM FOR THEIR RETURN EAST IN 1806. TODAY, ELK REMAIN A KEY COMPONENT OF INTERPRETING THE LEWIS AND CLARK STORY TO OVER 200,000 PARK VISITORS EACH YEAR AT THE FORT CLATSOP VISITOR CENTER. ELK HERDS AT LEWI DO NOT STAY WITHIN THE PARK; THEY ROAM ACROSS A LANDSCAPE BISECTED BY HIGHWAYS, NEIGHBORHOODS, GOLF COURSES, AND STRIP MALLS. IN RECENT YEARS, AN INCREASE IN ELK-HUMAN CONFLICT IN LANDS SURROUNDING THE PARK HAS LED TO A COLLABORATIVE EFFORT SUPPORTED BY THE OREGON GOVERNOR'S OFFICE TO DEVELOP A COHESIVE STRATEGY AMONG MULTIPLE JURISDICTIONS AND INTEREST GROUPS TO EFFECTIVELY ADDRESS THESE CONFLICTS. DATA ANALYSIS AND VISUALIZATIONS COMPLETED BY THE SIP INTERN WILL BE SHARED WITH THIS COLLABORATIVE, TO PROVIDE INFORMATION FOR BETTER INFORMED DECISION MAKING, AND PROTECTION OF THE HERDS THAT UTILIZE LANDS WITHIN LEWI.COMPLETE DATA ANALYSIS AND VISUALIZATIONS TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE COMPLETION OF A COMPREHENSIVE ANALYSIS AND REPORT OF THE RESULTS OF INVENTORY AND MONITORING ELK PROTOCOLS AROUND THE FORT CLATSOP UNIT OF LEWIS AND CLARK NATIONAL HISTORICAL PARK.WORK CLOSELY WITH I&M ECOLOGIST TO USE APPROPRIATE ANALYSIS TOOLS TO COMPLETE THIS WORK.UPON COMPLETION OF THIS PROJECT, RESULTS WILL BE USED TO INFORM PARK MANAGEMENT AND THE PUBLIC TO IMPROVE THE STEWARDSHIP OF ROOSEVELT ELK HERDS WITHIN PARK LANDS.THIS SCIENTISTS IN PARKS (SIP) RESEARCH INTERN WILL UPDATE EXISTING ANALYSIS SCRIPTS, DEVELOP INTERACTIVE DASHBOARDS, AND CONDUCT ADDITIONAL DATA EXPLORATION AND VISUALIZATION IN SUPPORT OF A FOLLOW-UP ANALYSIS OF DATA COLLECTED SINCE 2012. IN ADDITION TO THE ESTABLISHED MONITORING PROTOCOL, WE HAVE ALSO COLLECTED SOME ELK MOVEMENT DATA FROM A FEW COLLARED INDIVIDUALS IN THE HERDS AND RAN A PILOT STUDY USING CAMERA TRAPS CO-LOCATED WITH A SUBSET OF THE PROTOCOL SURVEY POINTS. DEPENDING UPON THE SKILLS AND ABILITIES OF THE INTERN, THEY MAY ALSO BE ABLE TO ASSIST WITH ANALYSIS AND/OR VISUALIZATION OF THESE ADDITIONAL DATA SETS.

REPAIR AND RESTORE HISTORIC TRAILS IN DUMBARTON OAKS PARK TO PROVIDE SAFE VISITOR ACCESS. THE PROJECT IS IDENTIFIED AS NEEDED WORK IN THE CULTURAL LANDSCAPE REPORT: DUMBARTON OAKS PARK (NPS, 2000) AND SUPPORTS THE PARKMISSION TOPRESERVE AND PROTECT RESOURCES IN OUR CARE. PUBLIC LAND CORPS FUNDS WILL BE UTILIZED TO HIRE THE CREW AND PURCHASE MATERIALS.THROUGH THIS TASK AGREEMENT, A PARTNER WILL RECRUIT AND MANAGE A CREW OF 2 LEADERS AND 6 MEMBERS TO WORK WITH PARK STAFF ON TRAIL RESTORATION.APPROXIMATELY 2000 SQUARE FEET OF TRAIL WILL BE RESTORED AS IDENTIFIED IN THE CULTURAL LANDSCAPE REPORT. WORK WILL INCLUDE CUTTING BACK ENCROACHING VEGETATION, REPLANTING NATIVE SPECIES, REESTABLISH HISTORIC TRAIL ALIGNMENT; BLOCKING OFF SOCIAL TRAILS; REPAIRING ERODED AREAS, AND INSTALLING WATER BARS, CHECK STEPS, AND BERMS WHERE NECESSARY TO ACHIEVE PROPER STORM WATER MITIGATION.BENEFICIARIES: SCA. REHABILITATION OF THE TRAILS HELP TO PRESERVE THIS CULTURAL LANDSCAPE AND IMPROVE VISITOR SATISFACTION AND SAFETY. YOUTH WILL LEARN: HARD SKILLS FOR TRAIL AND LANDSCAPE RESTORATION; ABOUT PUBLIC LANDS AND THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE; AND ABOUT THE IMPORTANCE OF STEWARDSHIP BY THE COMMUNITY.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF PERSONNEL AVAILABLE TO COLLECT, DRY, CLEAN AND BAG NATIVE PLANT SEED FOR USE IN RESTORATION OF DISTURBED SITES WITHIN THE PARK, PARTICULARLY ALONG THE PARK'S SOUTHERN BOUNDARY WHERE APPROXIMATELY 5.5 ACRES WERE DISTURBED DURING THE CONSTRUCTION OF NEW BORDER INFRASTRUCTURE.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THIS FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS TO COLLECT SEED FROM NATIVE SHRUB SPECIES. FIVE NATIVE SHRUB SPECIES WILL BE THE PRIMARY SPECIES FROM WHICH SEED WILL BE COLLECTED: CREOSOTE (LARREA TRIDENTATA), WHITE BURSAGE (AMBROSIA DUMOSA), TRIANGLE-LEAF BUR SAGE (A. DELTOIDEA), NARROW-LEAF SALTBUSH (ATRIPLEX LINEARIS), DESERT SALTBUSH (A. POLYCARPA). IF AVAILABLE, SEED FROM OTHER SPECIES MAY ALSO BE COLLECTED AS DIRECTED BY THE PARK BOTANIST.ORPI STAFF WILL PROVIDE TRAINING IN SEED COLLECTION, SEED DRYING, SEED CLEANING, AND STORAGE METHODS. ORPI WILL PROVIDE ALL EQUIPMENT AND MATERIALS TO COLLECT, DRY, CLEAN AND STORE THE SEED. AMERICAN CONSERVATION EXPERIENCE WILL PROVIDE CREWS TO COLLECT, DRY, CLEAN AND BAG THE SEED FOR STORAGE.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:COLLECTION TIMES FOR EACH SPECIES ARE AS FOLLOWS:LARREA TRIDENTATA2022AUGUST OR SEPTEMBERATRIPLEX POLYCARPA, A. LINEARIS2022OCTOBER, NOVEMBER, OR DECEMBERAMBROSIA DUMOSA, A. DELTOIDEA2023APRIL OR MAYLARREA TRIDENTATA2023JUNE (IF NO SEED IN PREVIOUS AUGUST/SEPTEMBER)WE EXPECT A SUFFICIENT AMOUNT OF SEED TO BE COLLECTED TO BEGIN REVEGETATING DISTURBED SITES WITHIN THE PARK.BENEFICIARIES: ORGAN PIPE CACTUS NATIONAL MONUMENT; AMERICAN CONSERVATION EXPERIENCE (ACE). CREW MEMBERS THAT PARTICIPATE IN THE PROJECT WILL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO LEARN HOW TO COLLECT, DRY, CLEAN AND BAG SEED FOR LONG-TERM STORAGE.

YOUTH EMPOWERMENT STEWARDS (YES) - YES SERVICE MEMBERS WILL SUPPORT NPSSUPPORT NPS PARK STAFF TO CARE FOR THE HEALTH OF OUR PARK PROGRAMMING AND TO HELP SOLVE THE COMPLEX PROBLEMS PUBLIC LANDS ENTITIES FACE. CONSERVATION LEGACY SUPPORTS THE SELF-EMPOWERMENT AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOP OF PEOPLE OF ALL ABILITIES TO: PROVIDE JOBS, HANDS-ON WORK EXPERIENCE, AND LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR DIVERSE AND YOUTH; CONNECT YOUTH TO OUR NATION'S HERITAGE AND CULTURAL VALUES THROUGH THE NATIONAL PARKS; COMPLETE CRITICAL PROJECTS AT NATIONAL PARKS EXPOSE YOUTH TO POTENTIAL CAREERS WITH PUBLIC LAND MANAGEMENT AGENCIES AND THE PRIVATE SECTOR. PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): PROJECT OBJECTIVES - THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PARTNERSHIP IS TO COMPLETE IMPORTANT CONSERVATION PROJECTS WHILE PROVIDING YOUNG ADULTS WITH STRUCTURED, AND CHALLENGING WORK AND EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES THROUGH SERVICE THAT PROMOTE PERSONAL GROWTH, ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITY, THE DEVELOPMENT OF LIFE SKILLS, AND AN ETHIC OF NATURAL RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP. CONSERVATION LEGACY WORKS TOWARD MAKING THESE OPPORTUNITIES AVAILABLE TO A CONSISTENTLY DIVERSE GROUP OF YOUNG PEOPLE AND VETERANS AND TO THOSE WHO COULD MOST BENEFIT FROM THE EXPERIENCE.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:SUCCESSFULLY RECRUIT AND PLACE FIVE (5) INDIVIDUALS WHO IDENTIFY AS HAVING A DISABILITY IN AN AMERICORPS NATIONAL SERVICE POSITION WITH FIVE (5) DIFFERENT NATIONAL PARK UNITS IN SUPPORT OF THE PARK'S ON-GOING PROGRAMMING AND ACCESSIBILITIES FOCUS GOALS ENSURE ALL INDIVIDUALS PLACED WITHIN THIS PROGRAM ARE PROVIDED WITH CONSISTENT, APPROPRIATE, AND ACCESSIBLE SUPPORT THROUGHOUT THEIR SERVICE TERM. PROVIDE NPS PARK STAFF AND VOLUNTEERS WITH FEEDBACK ON PARK USABILITY IN A VARIETY OF ASPECTS PROVIDE AN EXPERIENTIAL WORK ENVIRONMENT FOR A DIVERSE GROUP OF YOUNG ADULTS WITH THE GOAL OF PREPARING THEM FOR FEDERAL CAREER PATHS SUPPORT AND ENRICH NPS PARK INITIATIVES THROUGH VARIOUS DUTIES AS IDENTIFIED BY PARK MENTORS, STAFF, AND VOLUNTEERS.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): THE RECIPIENT WILL SELECT AND OVERSEE QUALIFIED AND MOTIVATED UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE STUDENTS TO WORK ALONGSIDE NPS STAFF IN THE CULTURAL RESOURCES, INTERPRETATION, AND RELATED FIELDS IN DIFFERENT PARK UNITS/PROGRAMS AND FEDERAL OFFICES THROUGHOUT THE NATION. SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: THE CULTURAL RESOURCES ASSISTANT WILL WORK WITH WIND CAVE AND OTHER PARKS IN THE BLACK HILLS TO DEVELOP PRIORITIES FOR: ? STRENGTHENING THE RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN THE PARKS AND NATIVE COMMUNITIES ? INCREASING NATIVE AMERICAN DIVERSITY IN THE WORKFORCE ? HELPING THE PARKS COMMUNICATE THE CULTURAL SIGNIFICANCE OF THE LAND AND ITS RESOURCES TO THE PUBLIC. TO ACCOMPLISH THESE OBJECTIVES, THE CULTURAL RESOURCES ASSISTANT WILL HAVE OPPORTUNITIES FOR RESEARCH AND WOULD BE PUT IN TOUCH WITH OTHER PARKS WHO HAVE SUCCESSFULLY IMPLEMENTED NATIVE AMERICAN RECRUITMENTS AND ENHANCED PROGRAMMING IN THEIR PARKS. PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: INTERN(S) WILL BE RECRUITED, SELECTED, AND COMPLETE THEIR TERMS AS FEASIBLE. INTERNS WILL COMPLETE TASKS OUTLINED IN THE SCOPE OF WORK.
THIS POSITION WILL WORK WITH A DYNAMIC INTERPRETIVE PROGRAM TO DEVELOP CONTENT FOR THE PARK'S WEBSITE AND SOCIAL MEDIA STREAMS AND CREATE NEW INTERPRETIVE CONTENT FOR EXHIBITS AND PUBLICATIONS.

JOSHUA TREE NATIONAL PARK AND MOJAVE NATIONAL PRESERVE WILL ESTABLISH A LARGE SEEDBANK IN PREPARATION FOR FUTURE RESTORATION NEEDS AND CLIMATE CHANGE RESPONSE ACTIONS. THERE IS URGENCY AS 2022 IS A MAST YEAR FOR JOSHUA TREES, MEANING TREES ARE PRODUCING SEED RANGE-WIDE, AN EVENT THAT ONLY HAPPENS EVERY THREE TO TEN YEARS. A TASK AGREEMENT WILL BE CREATED WITH A YOUTH CONSERVATION ORGANIZATION TO HIRE ONE CREW LEAD AND TWO INTERNS TO HELP COORDINATE A SMALL ARMY OF VOLUNTEERS IN COLLECTING JOSHUA TREE SEED, AS WELL AS OTHER NURSE PLANT SEED, FROM 25 HIGH PRIORITY AREAS WITHIN EACH PARK (50 TOTAL). SEED WILL BE DRIED AND CLEANED WITH THE HELP OF SEED PROCESSING EXPERTS. ONCE SEED HAS BEEN COLLECTED IT WILL BE PLACED UNDER COLD STORAGE TO MAXIMIZE LONG TERM VIABILITY FOR FUTURE RESTORATION NEEDS. SOME SEED WILL BE PROPAGATED IMMEDIATELY TO RESTORE DEGRADED LANDS DUE TO WILDFIRE AND OTHER ANTHROPOGENIC CAUSES.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:ONE 12-MONTH VEGETATION TECHNICIAN AND TWO 21-WEEK VEGETATION INTERNS WILL BE HIRED TO HELP COORDINATE FIELD ACTIVITIES INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO: SCOUTING SEED RIPENESS, CORRESPONDING TO VOLUNTEER INFORMATION REQUESTS, ARRANGING CAMPSITE LOCATIONS/ACCOMMODATIONS, SEED COLLECTION, GIS DATA MANAGEMENT, SEED DRYING/CLEANING, AND PRELIMINARY REPORT WRITING. ACE WILL PROVIDE VEHICLE FOR TECHNICIAN TO USE. TECHNICIANS WILL WORK UNDER THE CLOSE SUPERVISION OF NPS STAFF. CREW AND LEADS WILL BE PROVIDED TRAINING BY NPS PARK STAFF TO LEARN ABOUT PROJECT GOALS, METHODS, PLANT IDENTIFICATION, AND AGENCY STEWARDSHIP PRINCIPLES. NPS WILL DESIGN THE PROJECT OBJECTIVES AND DEVELOP MAPS AND ESRI PRODUCTS TO AID TECHNICIAN. NPS WILL PROVIDE SEED COLLECTION, DRYING, AND CLEANING EQUIPMENT. THE CREW LEAD WILL DOCUMENT PROGRESS, CHECK IN WITH NPS VEGETATION PROGRAM LEADS, AND SUBMIT A SHORT REPORT DOCUMENTING ACCOMPLISHMENTS, LESSONS LEARNED, AND ANY RECOMMENDATIONS FOR SIMILAR WORK IN THE FUTURE.VEGETATION TECHNICIANS MAY ASSIST MOJAVE NATIONAL PRESERVE AND JOSHUA TREE NATIONAL PARK WITH OTHER PROJECTS RELATED TO CLIMATE CHANGE MITIGATIONS AND VISITOR USE MANAGEMENT IN THE FIELDS OF VEGETATION, WILDLIFE, GEOLOGY, INTERPRETATION, AND ENVIRONMENTAL COMPLIANCE.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:ROUGHLY 10-20 GALLON BUCKETS FULL OF JOSHUA TREE FRUIT WILL BE COLLECTED FROM 25 AREAS WITHIN EACH PARK (50 TOTAL). AFTER JOSHUA TREE SEED HAS BEEN DRIED AND CLEANED, WE EXPECT TO HAVE ROUGHLY 50 POUNDS OF SEED. SOME JOSHUA TREE SEED WILL BE PROPAGATED IMMEDIATELY TO RESTORE DEGRADED LANDS. WE ALSO EXPECT TO ACCRUE OVER 2,000 VOLUNTEER HOURS DURING THIS PROJECT.BENEFICIARIES:VISITORS TO MOJAVE NATIONAL PRESERVE AND JOSHUA TREE NATIONAL PARK

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):TO PROVIDE A MEANINGFUL, HANDS-ON WORK EXPERIENCE FOR ONE COLLEGE-LEVEL INTERN IN A NATIONAL PARKSUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE INTERN WILL WORK WITH NATURAL RESOURCE STAFF ON A VARIETY OF RESOURCE MANAGEMENT PROJECTS INCLUDING NON-NATIVE SPECIES SUPPRESSION, REPORTING, NATIVE VEGETATION PROTECTION, AND WILDLIFE MONITORINGPERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:SUPPRESSION OF NON-NATIVE VEGETATION ON 5 ACRES OF PARK PROPERTYCOMPLETION OF DATA ANALYSIS AND REPORTING FOR CRAYFISH REMOVAL EFFORTSCOMPLETION OF SAMPLING EFFORTS TO MONITOR DEER HERD HEALTHINSTALLATION AND MAINTENANCE OF FENCING AROUND PLANT COMMUNITIES OF INTEREST - SPECIFICALLY RIPARIAN BUGGERSBENEFICIARIES:INTERN GAINS VALUABLE EMPLOYMENT, RESUME BUILDING EXPERIENCE, AND AN UNDERSTANDING OF PARK MANAGEMENTPARK VISITORS GAIN BENEFITS OF IMPROVED NATURAL RESOURCES AND A BETTER EXPERIENCE WITHIN THE PARK

COMPETITIVE AWARD AGREEMENT REQUIREMENTSFUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: N/AFUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT: N/AREQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSPURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THE GOAL OF THIS AWARD IS TO CREATE AN INTERNSHIP THAT WILL ASSIST ORPI'S CULTURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM WITH ONGOING PROJECTS THAT WILL COLLECTIVELY ADDRESS THE CRITICAL ISSUES EFFECTING THE MONUMENT'S MANAGEMENT OF CULTURAL RESOURCES, INCLUDING: THE LOW PERCENTAGE OF AREA THAT HAS BEEN SURVEYED, THE NEED FOR ARCHAEOLOGICAL SITE MONITORING, AND HISTORIC STRUCTURE PRESERVATION.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THIS POSITION WILL WORK WITHIN THE CULTURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM AT ORGAN PIPE CACTUS NATIONAL MONUMENT. THE INTERN WILL WORK ASSIST THE ARCHAEOLOGICAL TECHNICIAN AND CULTURAL RESOURCE PROGRAM MANAGER WITH ON-GOING PROJECTS RELATED TO MANAGEMENT OF ARCHAEOLOGICAL SITES, HISTORIC STRUCTURES, AND CULTURAL LANDSCAPES. FIELD BASED ASKS WILL INCLUDE ARCHAEOLOGICAL SURVEY, RECORDATION OF NEW ARCHEOLOGICAL SITES, AND MONITORING OF PREVIOUSLY RECORDED ARCHEOLOGICAL SITES. OFFICE WORK WILL INCLUDE VARIOUS DATA AND RECORD MANAGEMENT TASKS. POSSIBLE PROJECTS INCLUDE HANDS ON HISTORIC PRESERVATION, CULTURAL LANDSCAPE DOCUMENTATION, AND OTHER OPPORTUNITIES AS THEY ARISE.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:DURING THE 20-WEEK INTERNSHIP, THE INTERN WILL (WITH ASSISTANCE FROM NPS STAFF):- SURVEY AT LEAST 500 ACRES OF PREVIOUSLY UN-SURVEYED AREAS.- MONITOR APPROXIMATELY 25 ARCHAEOLOGICAL SITES.- PARTICIPATE IN AT LEAST ONE HANDS-ONE HISTORIC PRESERVATION PROJECT.- PATRICIATE AS A TEAM MEMBER IN A FEDERAL CULTURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM AND TO BUILD VITAL SKILLS WITHIN PROFESSIONAL PRACTICE OF ARCHAEOLOGY.- EXPOSURE TO NPS PROFESSIONALS FOR NETWORKING AND FEDERAL HIRING INFORMATION.-  DEVELOP OR DEEPEN AN APPRECIATION FOR AMERICA'S PUBLIC LANDS IN A YOUNG, EMERGINGPROFESSIONAL.BENEFICIARIES:THIS INTERNSHIP IS MEANT TO FACILITATE PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT IN THE FIELD OF ARCHAEOLOGY AND CULTURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT AND PROMOTES EXPOSURE TO LAND MANAGEMENT AGENCIES AND NETWORKING WITH RESOURCE MANAGEMENT PROFESSIONALS FOR THE SELECTED INTERN. THIS COULD INCLUDE GAINING EXPERIENCE IN DIFFERENT CONSERVATION FIELDS AND SHADOWING DIFFERENT WORK GROUPS.

PERFORMANCE GOALSTHIS TASK AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE AN OPPORTUNITY FOR ONE SINGLE IDENTITY INCLUSION CREW TO CAMP, UNDERTAKE RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP ACTIVITIES UNDER PROFESSIONAL NPS GUIDANCE, AND RECEIVE EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS AT LEWIS AND CLARK NATIONAL HISTORICAL PARK. NWYC'S MISSION IS TO OFFER A CHALLENGING EDUCATION AND JOB-TRAINING EXPERIENCE THAT HELPS YOUTH AND YOUNG ADULTS FROM DIVERSE BACKGROUNDS DEVELOP THE SKILLS THEY NEED TO LEAD FULL AND PRODUCTIVE LIVES. NPS IS LIKEWISE COMMITTED TO OFFERING ELIGIBLE YOUNG ADULTS AN INTRODUCTION TO CAREERS IN CONSERVATION (NATURAL RESOURCES MANAGEMENT, INTERPRETATION AND EDUCATION, HABITAT PROTECTION) THROUGH ITS NATURAL RESOURCES MANAGEMENT PROGRAMS. LEWIS AND CLARK NATIONAL HISTORICAL PARK HAS A LONG HISTORY OF DEVELOPING EFFECTIVE PROGRAMS SPECIFICALLY TO CONNECT WITH AND EMPLOY YOUTH. THESE PROGRAMS HAVE SUCCESSFULLY LED YOUTH TO PURSUE CAREERS WITH THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE OR WITH CONSERVATION AGENCIES.SIMILARLY, BOTH ORGANIZATIONS ARE COMMITTED TO PROVIDING OPPORTUNIPROJECT OBJECTIVES -1. UNDERTAKE A HANDS-ON RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP PROJECT WITH YOUTH. 2. PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS ON ECOLOGY AND HISTORY TO YOUTH. 3. PROVIDE CAMPING AND HIKING OPPORTUNITIES TO YOUTH. 4. IMPROVE ACCESSIBILITY AND DIVERSITY OF THESE PROGRAMS BY USING AN AMERICAN SIGN LANGUAGE INTERPRETER TO COORDINATE BETWEEN NPS AND A YOUTH CREW WITH MEMBERS THAT ARE DEAF OR HARD OF HEARING. 5. TREAT INVASIVE PLANTS ON APPROXIMATELY TEN ACRES OF PARK LANDS. 6. LEARN ABOUT THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE MISSION STATEMENT.THE CREW WILL BE INSTRUCTED ON THE PRINCIPALS OF INTEGRATED PEST MANAGEMENT (IPM),AND GIVEN TRAINING IN SAFE USE OF A VARIETY OF TOOLS TO MANUALLY AND MECHANICALLY TREAT INVASIVE SHRUBS AT THE PROJECT SITE. THEY WILL BE GIVEN A TABLET LOADED WITH FIELD MAPS SOFTWARE AND PROVIDED WITH EDUCATION ON USING IT BOTH FOR NAVIGATING AROUND THE PROJECT SITE AND FOR MAPPING INFESTATIONS AND TREATED AREAS.PARK PERSONNEL WILL PROVIDE BACKGROUND INFORMATION ON THE ECOLOGY OF THE AREA, INSTRUCT ON METHODS OF RESTORATION, AND PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE YOUTH. PARK INTERPRETIVE STAFF WILL PROVIDE A GUIDED NATURE HIKE OR KAYAK TRIP DURING ONE DAY OF THE CREW'S TIME AT THE PARK AS WELL AS A TOUR OF THE FORT CLATSOP RECONSTRUCTION. PARK RESOURCE STAFF WILL PROVIDE A LECTURE ON THE IMPACTS THAT INVASIVE PLANTS HAVE ON NATIVE PLANT COMMUNITIES AND WILDLIFE, LEAD A SESSION ON PLANT IDENTIFICATION, AND ANSWER ON-GOING QUESTIONS ABOUT PLANTS, SOILS, AND WILDLIFE FROM THE CREW.FOLLOWING THIS INSTRUCTION, THE CREW WILL PROCEED WITH CUTTING, LOPPING, PILING, AND DIGGING SCOTCH BROOM, SPURGE LAUREL, AND OTHER INVASIVE PLANTS ON 10 ACRES OF PRIORITY HABITAT IN THE PROJECT AREA. WHEN THE WORK IS COMPLETE, THE CREW WILL TRANSFER THE TABLET BACK TO NPS STAFF WITH THE AREAS TREATED INDICATED BY MAPPED POLYGONS.TIES FOR DIVERSE YOUTH. THIS PROJECT IS DESIGNED SPECIFICALLY TO REACH YOUTH WHO ARE DEAF OR HARD OF HEARING. THE NPS HAS A HISTORY OF IMPROVING ACCESSIBILITY IN INTERPRETIVE MEDIA, PROGRAMS AND BUILDINGS ACCESS; THIS PROJECT WILL MAKE ACTIVE RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP MORE ACCESSIBLE.THIS BENEFITS THE PARTICIPANTS OF THIS PROJECT.

FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: P-P-YOUTH-22-005PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THE RECIPIENT WILL SELECT AND OVERSEE QUALIFIED AND MOTIVATED UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE STUDENTS TO WORK ALONGSIDE NPS STAFF IN THE CULTURAL RESOURCES, INTERPRETATION, AND RELATED FIELDS IN DIFFERENT PARK UNITS/PROGRAMS AND FEDERAL OFFICES THROUGHOUT THE NATION.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:INTERNS WILL HELP THE CULTURAL ANTHROPOLOGIST/NAGPRA COORDINATOR WITH NAGPRA, ETHNOGRAPHIC, AND ANTHROPOLOGICAL WORK IN THE REGIONAL OFFICE. MOST WORK WILL OCCUR IN THE REGIONAL OFFICE IN DENVER, BUT TRAVEL TO PARKS, PHONE AND VIDEO CALLS, WORKSHOPS, AND TRAININGS WILL LIKELY BE A PART OF THE INTERNSHIPS. WORK IS VARIED AND MAY INCLUDE: WORKING WITH NAGPRA ITEMS FOUND IN THE PARK COLLECTIONS THAT SHOULD BE REPATRIATED. WORKING ON INADVERTENT DISCOVERIES OF NATIVE AMERICAN HUMAN REMAINS ON PARK LANDS. ASSISTING IN DATA ENTRY AND MANAGEMENT OF THE CULTURAL RESOURCE INFORMATION SYSTEM - ETHNOGRAPHIC RESOURCES (CRIS-ER).PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:INTERN(S) WILL BE RECRUITED, SELECTED, AND COMPLETE THEIR TERMS AS FEASIBLE. INTERNS WILL COMPLETE TASKS OUTLINED IN THE SCOPE OF WORK.BENEFICIARIES: INTERNS, NATIONAL COUNCIL FOR PRESERVATION EDUCATION

KEY DUTIES WILL INCLUDE:REVIEWING AND PROCESSING HABS/HAER/HALS DOCUMENTATION FOR TRANSMITTAL TO THE LOC.MAINTAINING AND UPDATING THE HDP COLLECTIONS DATABASE TO CATALOGUE NEW DOCUMENTATION, EDIT RECORDS, AND IMPROVE EXISTING DATA.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:INTERN(S) WILL BE RECRUITED, SELECTED, AND COMPLETE THEIR TERMS AS FEASIBLE. PURPOSE OF AWARD:THIS PROJECT ENGAGES YOUTH WITH A HANDS-ON OPPORTUNITY TOCONTRIBUTE TO AN IMPORTANT CONSERVATION PROJECT FOR THE PUBLIC BENEFIT AT SHENANDOAHNATIONAL PARK. YOUNG ADULTS WILL ENCOUNTER STRUCTURED, SAFE, AND CHALLENGING WORKAND EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES THROUGH THIS TRAILS PROJECT THAT PROMOTES PERSONALGROWTH, THE DEVELOPMENT OF LIFE SKILLS, AN ETHIC OF NATURAL RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP, ANDAN APPRECIATION OF PUBLIC LANDS.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE YOUTH WILL WORK ALONGSIDE RESOURCE PROFESSIONALS TO GAIN PRACTICAL TRAINING AND A RANGE OF EXPERIENCE IN SAFELY TRAVELING AND PERFORMING TRAIL MAINTENANCE IN A BACKCOUNTRY SETTING AS FOLLOWS: (1) INSTALLING AND CLEANING TRAIL STRUCTURES, SUCH AS WATER BARS, STEPS, BRIDGES AND LATERAL DRAINS; (2) REMOVING FALLEN TREES THAT ARE BLOCKING THE TRAIL; AND (3) TRIMMING ENCROACHING VEGETATION (4) REMOVING INVASIVE PLANTS. AS THEY COMPLETE THE HAND-ON PROJECT THEY WILL ASSIST THE PARK IN REDUCING THE BACKLOG OF WORK PROJECTS AND SUPPORT THE SECRETARY'S PRIORITIES TO IMPROVE INFRASTRUCTURE, ADDRESS DEFERRED MAINTENANCE, AND ENHANCE RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE PUBLIC.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:CREW OF 6 YOUTH (INCLUDES CREW LEADERSHIP) FOR 16 WEEKS, BEGINNING JUNE 13TH AND ARE ENGAGED IN HANDS-ON OPPORTUNITIES INCLUDING:CONSTRUCT, REPLACE OR REPAIR 20 TRAIL STRUCTURES (EVERY 10' OF LATERAL COUNTS AS 1 STRUCTURE). CLEAN WATER BARS ALONG OVER 5 MILES OF TRAIL. REMOVE FALLEN TREES ALONG 12 MILES OF WILDERNESS TRAILS.CUT VEGETATION ALONG 12 MILES OF WILDERNESS TRAILS.REMOVE INVASVIE PLANT SPECIES FROM VARIOUS AREAS THROUGHOUT THE PARKTRIM VEGETATION AROUND PARK STRUCTURES AND ALONG THE 105 MILE CORRIDOR OF SKYLINE DRIVE.BENEFICIARIES:THE YOUTH CREW PARTICIPANTS AND PUBLIC WILL BENEFIT FROM THIS PROJECT. THE YOUTH WILL GAIN VALUABLE JOB SKILLS AS THEY LEARN ABOUT THE MANAGEMENT AND STEWARDSHIP OF PUBLIC LANDS AND RESOURCES WHILE WORKING IN SHENANDOAH NATIONAL PARK. THIS PROJECT PROVIDES THE CREW PARTICIPANTS WITH AN UNDERSTANDING AND APPRECIATION FOR CONSERVATION EFFORTS AS WELL AS DEVELOPING LEADERSHIP SKILLS THAT CAN TRANSFER TO REAL WORLD SITUATIONS AND FUTURE JOB OPPORTUNITIES AND RESPONSIBLE CITIZENSHIP. THE GENERAL PUBLIC WILL ALSO BENEFIT DIRECTLY FROM HAVING BETTER, MORE FREQUENTLY MAINTAINED TRAILS TO HIKE AND FEWER INVASIVE PLANTS ALONG THE TRAIL AND THROUGHOUT THE PARK.

PERFORMANCE GOALS - - MAINTAINING AND INTERPRETING DATABASE RECORDS, AND PERFORMING REGULATORY COMPLIANCE SAMPLING AND RELATED ANALYSIS.COORDINATING REGULATORY RECORDS AND ACTIONS FOR THE PARK;OBTAINING TECHNICAL AND POLICY ANALYSIS OF EXTERNAL PROPOSALS;PREPARING AND MANAGING CONTRACTS FOR COMPLIANCE-RELATED AND WATER-SYSTEMS WORK;DEVELOPING CONTRACT SPECIFICATIONS, INCLUDING SCOPE OF WORK AND COST ESTIMATES FOR PROJECTS;PERFORMING RESEARCH AND PREPARING DOCUMENTATION IN ALIGNMENT WITH NPS GUIDELINE CRITERIA;PROVIDING BRIEFINGS ON ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES TO PARK STAFF;PROVIDE TECHNICAL SUPPORT TO ENGINEERING AND OTHER AGENCY PERSONNEL FOR ENVIRONMENTAL, REGULATORY, AND HEALTH-CONTROL ASPECTS OF VARIOUS FACILITIES;AS A MEMBER OF AN INTERDISCIPLINARY TEAM, COLLECT ENVIRONMENTAL DATA, PREPARE ENVIRONMENTAL REPORTS, ASSIST IN EVALUATING PROPOSALS, AND PREPARE ENVIRONMENTAL COMPLIANCE DOCUMENTATION (E.G., ENVIRONMENTAL ASSESSMENTS, ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT STATEMENTS);PROVIDE TECHNICAL CONSULTATION ABOUT WATER/WASTEWATER PLANNING PROJECTS FOR POTENTIAL ENVIRONMENTAL EFFECTS, AND ASSESS COMPLIANCE WITH APPLICABLE POLICIES AND REGULATIONS;ENSURE DOCUMENTS ARE TECHNICALLY ADEQUATE TO CONFORM WITH NATIONAL ENVIRONMENTAL POLICY ACT, WILDERNESS REGULATIONS, AND NPS REGULATIONS, POLICIES AND GUIDELINES.PROJECT OBJECTIVES - COORDINATE REGULATORY RECORDS AND ACTION TO ENSURE THAT PARK STAFF AND REGULATORY AGENCIES HAVE ACCURATE DOCUMENTATION AS REQUIRED. DEVELOP PROJECT PROPOSALS TO IMPROVE UTILITY FACILITIES UTILIZING MULTIPLE FUNDING SOURCES WORKING WITH FMSS STAFF IN CREATIONS AND SUBMISSIONS. COLLECT, FILE AND MAINTAIN RECORDS IN AN EFFICIENT MANNER FOR STAFF, MANAGEMENT AND REGULATORY AGENCY'S NEEDS. BE A MEMBER OF THE TEAM TO IMPROVE COMMUNICATION AND EFFICIENCY OF THE BRANCH BY ENGAGING IN DAILY ACTIVITIES OF THE BRANCH TO INCLUDE SAMPLING AND REPORTING FOR BOTH ARIZONA AND NEVADA LOCATIONS.RESEARCH ASSOCIATE AS AN ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION SPECIALIST TO SUPPORT THE DIVISION OF MAINTENANCE, UTILITY SYSTEMS BRANCH IN REGULATING WATER/WASTEWATER SYSTEMS IN THE PARK. THE PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THIS POSITION IS TO SUPPORT COMPLIANCE WITH NEPA AND OTHER ENVIRONMENTAL STATUTES IN PARK AND RESOURCE PLANNING, AND TO PROVIDE PROJECT MANAGEMENT SERVICES IN SUPPORT OF MAINTAINING THE ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY OF THE PARK. THROUGH EARLY CONSIDERATION OF ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES AND PARK RESOURCE VALUES, THIS POSITION SUPPORTS THE LONG-TERM MANAGEMENT OBJECTIVES OF THE NPS.THE PARK VISITOR AT LAKE BENEFITS.

COMPETITIVE AWARD AGREEMENT REQUIREMENTSFUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: N/AFUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT: N/AREQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSPURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE WILL PARTNER WITH GROUNDWORK USA TO PROVIDE 4 YOUTH CREWS FROM ACROSS THE COUNTRY TO COMPLETE DEFERRED MAINTENANCE AND OTHER RESOURCE PROJECTS FOR YELLOWSTONE. THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE YOUTH THE OPPORTUNITY TO LEARN ABOUT PARK RESOURCES AND COMPLETE SPECIFIC FACILITY MAINTENANCE AND OTHER WORK PROJECTS.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:GROUNDWORK USA URBAN YOUTH CREWS WILL WORK WITH YELLOWSTONE IN ONE OF TWO SESSIONS-SESSION 1 IS AUGUST 18-26 OR SESSION 2 AUGUST 26-SEPTEMBER 2. WORK PROJECTS INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO: TRAIL WORK MAINTENANCE; INSTALLING LARGE FOOD STORAGE BOXES IN CAMPSITES; REPLACING BUMPER LOGS IN PARKING LOTS; REPAIRING AND BUILDING FENCES; LOG WORK; UPGRADING HISTORIC STRUCTURES; CAMPGROUND AND PICNIC AREA REHAB WORK; AND REMOVING SOCIAL TRAILS.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:GROUNDWORK USA AND NPS STAFF WORK COOPERATIVELY TO IMPROVE PUBLIC ACCESS TO THE FRONTCOUNTRY AREAS OF YELLOWSTONE.PROJECTS WILL BE SELECTED FROM A LONG LIST OF NPS PRIORITIES FOR THIS SUMMER. PARTICIPATING IN THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE MEANINGFUL LIFE AND WORK EXPERIENCE AND TRAINING; LAND AND RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP EDUCATION AND APPRECIATION; AND TECHNICAL, SAFETY AND TEAMBUILDING OPPORTUNITIES TO AMERICAN YOUTH WHILE SERVING AND PROTECTING ONE OF THE NATION'S PREMIER PUBLIC RESOURCES.BENEFICIARIES:THE INTERNS THAT LEARN ABOUT THE ENVIRONMENT BY SPENDING TIME WORKING ON PROJECTS IN NATIONAL PARKS.

PURPOSE OF AWARD: TWO COHORTS OF FIVE YOUTH EACH WILL PARTICIPATE IN A TOTAL OF TWO SERVICE PROJECTS THAT WILL INCLUDE TWO ART PROJECTS - ONE OF EACH IN HARTFORD AND WILTON, CT AT COLTSVILLE AND WEIR FARM NHPS. THE YOUTH WILL CREATE AND PUBLICLY DISPLAY ORIGINAL ARTWORK THAT IS BASED ON THEIR STEWARDSHIP ACTIVITIES THAT THEY COMPLETE IN HARTFORD AND IN WILTON FOR THE NATIONAL PARK SITES IN THE RESPECTIVE AREAS.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: TWO COHORTS OF 5 YOUTH EACH WILL PARTICIPATE IN STEWARDSHIP ACTIVITIES AT BOTH NATIONAL PARK SITES. THEY WILL ALSO EACH WORK WITH AN ARTIST TO ATTEND A WORKSHOP TO CREATE ART IN A RURAL AND URBAN SETTING HARTFORD, CT AND WILTON, CTTHIS ORIGINAL ARTWORK WILL BE FRAMED AND DISPLAYED AT A PUBLIC ART GALLERY WITH A FORMAL EXHIBIT OPENING RECEPTION.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:GROUNDWORK USA RECRUITS AND ONBOARDS THE 10 YOUTH PARTICIPANTSART WORKSHOP WEIR FARM NHP/COLTSVILLE NHPSTEWARDSHIP PROJECTS AT WEIR FARM NHP/COLTSVILLE NHPART BRIDGEPORT ART SHOW HOSTED IN BRIDGEPORT, CT TO SHARE MESSAGES OF STEWARDSHIP AND RESOURCE PROTECTIONBENEFICIARIES: THIS PROJECT PROVIDES PAID, HANDS-ON SERVICE OPPORTUNITIES THAT HELP DEVELOP A GENERATION OF SKILLED WORKERS, EDUCATED AND ACTIVE CITIZENS, FUTURE LEADERS AND STEWARDS OF NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES.THE PROJECT BUILDS RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP ETHICS IN ITS PARTICIPANTS AND MOTIVATES ITS YOUTH PARTICIPANTS TO BECOME INVOLVED IN THE NATURAL, CULTURAL AND /OR HISTORICAL RESOURCE PROTECTION OF THEIR COMMUNITIES AND BEYOND. THE PROJECT ALSO ASSISTS IN THE PROMOTION AND FACILITATION OF THE PUBLIC'S UNDERSTANDING OF NATURAL, CULTURAL, HISTORIC AND RECREATION OPPORTUNITIES AVAILABLE IN THE COLTSVILLE NATIONAL HISTORICAL PARK AND WEIR FARM NATIONAL HISTORICAL PARK.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THIS PROJECT IS TO REPAIR TRAILS ON THE COLORADO RIVER DISTRICT OF ROCKY MOUNTAIN NATIONAL PARK THAT WERE SEVERELY DAMAGED AND DESTROYED IN A WILDFIRE EVENT. REPAIRS WILL TAKE PLACE THROUGHOUT THE BACKCOUNTRY OF THE PARK DISTRICT. PORTIONS OF THE DISTRICT'S TRAIL SYSTEM REMAIN CLOSED DUE TO THE FIRE EVENT AND THIS PROJECT WILL ASSIST IN THE RE-OPENING OF THOSE TRAILS.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:SPECIFIC WORK TO REPAIR THE TRAILS WILL INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING: CONSTRUCT BOTH ROCK AND LOG EROSION STRUCTURES THROUGHOUT THE TRAILS, BUILD ROCK RETAINING WALLS TO STABILIZE ERODING TRAIL SURFACES, BUILD TURNPIKES TO REPLACE THE PREVIOUSLY BURNED STRUCTURES AND MAINTAIN THE TRAIL CORRIDOR BY BRUSHING VEGETATION, CLEARING WATER DRAINS, REMOVING DOWN TREES FROM THE TRAIL AND REMOVING IMPEDIMENTS FROM THE TRAIL SURFACE.THIS PROJECT WILL REQUIRE BOTH FRONTCOUNTRY AND BACKCOUNTRY CAMPING DEPENDING ON THE VARIOUS PROJECT LOCATIONS.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:SEVERAL MILES OF PARK HIKING TRAIL WILL BE REPAIRED THROUGH TRAIL INFRASTRUCTURE REPAIRS COMPLETED BY THE WORK CREWS. WORK CREWS WILL OBTAIN VALUABLE EXPERIENCE WORKING ALONGSIDE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE TRAIL CREWS.THE TRAILS WILL BE RE-OPENED ONCE REPAIRED.BENEFICIARIES:THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT SEVERAL STAKEHOLDERS AND PARTIES:THE PARK VISITOR WILL OBTAIN ACCESS TO THE TRAIL AREAS ONCE THEY ARE REPAIRED AND RE-OPENED.PARK STAFF WILL HAVE THE TRAILS REPAIRED AND AVAILABLE FOR ADMINISTRATIVE USES SUCH AS RESEARCHTHE WORK CREWS THAT WORK UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL OBTAIN VALUABLE EXPERIENCE IN TRAIL CONSTRUCTION AND REPAIRS

HE CANDIDATE SELECTED WILL WORK UNDER THE GUIDANCE OF THE CURATOR ON PROJECTS RELATED TO BOTH ARCHIVAL AND OBJECT COLLECTIONS. PRINCIPAL DUTIES WILL INCLUDE REHOUSING AND STABILIZING PRIORITY OBJECTS FROM THE MUSEUM COLLECTION; CONDUCTING OBJECT RESEARCH; CATALOGING OBJECTS AND UPDATING CATALOG RECORDS WITH ADDITIONAL INFORMATION; CREATING SOCIAL MEDIA POSTS PERTAINING TO CULTURAL RESOURCES AND THE COLLECTIONS IN THE PARK; PHOTOGRAPHING OBJECTS; ASSISTING RESEARCHERS; CONDUCTING ANNUAL INVENTORY; AND IMPLEMENTING MUSEUM ENVIRONMENTAL MONITORING AND HOUSEKEEPING TASKS IN COLLECTIONS AREAS.

THIS AWARD WILL PROVIDE AN OPPORTUNITY FOR INTERNS TO LEARN ABOUT THE NATURAL AND CULTURAL HISTORY OF WHITMAN MISSION NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE (WHMI). THEY WILL SERVE AS VISITOR SERVICES INTERNS ON-SITE FULL-TIME, FOR APPROXIMATELY 16 WEEKS.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:INTERNS WILL BE MENTORED AND TRAINED TO PERFORM VARIOUS DUTIES INCLUDING INTERPRETATION, VISITOR SERVICES, SCHOOL GROUP PROGRAMS, RESOURCE MANAGEMENT, AND ROUTINE MAINTENANCE WORK.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:INTERNS WILL RECEIVE TWO WEEKS OF ORIENTATION TRAINING WHERE THEY WILL LEARN ABOUT THE NPS, THE PARK, AND THE SURROUNDING ENVIRONMENT. THEY WILL RECEIVE CPR AND FIRST AID CERTIFICATION, AND THE OPPORTUNITY TO WORK WITH OTHER PARK STAFF. IN THE FIRST MONTH OF THEIR INTERNSHIPS, THEY WILL BECOME PROFICIENT IN ASSISTING WITH STAFFING THE WHMI VISITOR CENTER, ANSWERING QUESTIONS, ASSISTING THE PUBLIC WITH GENERAL INFORMATION, AND SELLING MERCHANDISE FROM THE COOPERATING ASSOCIATION BOOKSTORE. THEY WILL BE ABLE TO ASSIST YOUTH WITH COMPLETING THE PARK'S JR. RANGER PROGRAM. IN THE SECOND MONTH OF THEIR INTERNSHIP, THEY WILL BE ABLE TO RESEARCH THE HISTORY OF THE SITE IN ORDER TO CREATE CONTENT FOR 2-3 SOCIAL MEDIA POSTS. THEY WILL ALSO BE ABLE TO ASSIST WITH LEADING AN INTERPRETIVE PROGRAM FOR THE PUBLIC. IN THEIR THIRD MONTH OF THE INTERNSHIP, THEY WILL BE ABLE TO INDEPENDENTLY LEAD 1-2 DIFFERENT INTERPRETIVE/EDUCATION PROGRAMS FOR THE PUBLIC.BENEFICIARIES:YOUTH PARTICIPATING IN THIS PROGRAM WILL BENEFIT FROM THE INCREASED KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE THEY RECEIVE WORKING IN A NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE.NATIONAL PARK SERVICE STAFF WILL BENEFIT FROM THE INCREASED EXPERIENCE WITH MENTORING YOUTH.PUBLIC VISITORS WILL BENEFIT FROM THE INCREASED ABILITY OF THE HISTORIC SITE TO HAVE IN-PERSON INTERPRETIVE AND EDUCATION PROGRAMS.

PURPOSE OF AWARD:THIS PROJECT WILL ENGAGE TWO INTERNS IN FIELD-BASED WORK RELATED TO NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT AND NATIONAL PARK SERVICE CAREER OPPORTUNITIES. THIS PROJECT PROVIDES FOR HIGH PRIORITY CRITICAL RESOURCE PROTECTION AT PRINCE WILLIAM FOREST PARK WHILE DEVELOPING DIVERSE AND EMPLOYABLE FUTURE NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGERS.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:DURING THE 11 WEEKS THAT THE SCA BATHYMETRY INTERNS WILL BE AT THE PARK, THEIR PRIMARY DUTY WILL BE CONDUCTING BOAT AND WADING SURVEYS OF 6 PARK LAKES TO PROVIDE DETAILED CURRENT CONDITIONS OF THE LAKE BEDS TO HELP THE PARK TO DETERMINE THE AMOUNT OF SEDIMENT DEPOSITION IN THESE HISTORIC FEATURES. THEY WILL UTILIZE GPS/GIS TO PRODUCE LAKEBED MAPS AND PROFILES TO INFORM THE PARK ON FUTURE MANAGEMENT DECISIONS REGARDING LAKE MANAGEMENT.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE GOAL OF THE PROGRAM IS TO DEVELOP A STEADY STREAM OF DIVERSE AND EMPLOYABLE FUTURE NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGERS, WHILE MAINTAINING THE ECOLOGICAL INTEGRITY OF A 12,000 ACRE PIEDMONT FOREST UNIT OF THE NPS. THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE BASELINE DOCUMENTATION OF THE PARK'S LAKES CURRENT CONDITIONS TO INFORM MANAGEMENT DECISIONS TO MAINTAIN THESE HISTORIC FEATURES.

PURPOSE OF AWARDPERFORMANCE GOALS - A COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WAS ENTERED INTO BY AND BETWEEN THE DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR, NATIONAL PARK SERVICE (NPS) AND THE CONSERVATION CORPS NORTH BAY (CCNB) FOR THE PURPOSE OF CARRYING OUT THE PUBLIC PURPOSES OF TRAINING, EDUCATING AND PROVIDING WORK EXPERIENCE YOUTH WHO VOLUNTEER THEIR SERVICES TO GOLDEN GATE NATIONAL RECREATION AREA THROUGH CCNB WHICH FURTHERS THEIR EDUCATIONAL, CAREER OR PERSONAL GOALS. IN ADDITION, THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT ALLOWS FOR CARRYING OUT OTHER PUBLIC PURPOSES OF NATIONAL PARK SERVICE PROGRAMS. THE EXPECTED OUTCOME OF THIS TASK AGREEMENT IS FOR YOUTH PARTICIPANTS TO FURTHER THEIR EDUCATIONAL AND CAREER GOALS AS WELL AS TO CONTINUE TO ONGOING EFFORTS TO RESTORE AND ENHANCE THE PARK'S VARIED CULTURAL LANDSCAPES AND NATURAL RESOURCES FOR THE ENJOYMENT OF MORE THAN 15 MILLION ANNUAL VISITORS.SUMMARY OF PROJECTTHE OBJECTIVE OF THIS TASK AGREEMENT IS TO COLLABORATE ON YOUTH EXPERIENTIAL EDUCATION THROUGH HABITAT RESTORATION, WILDLAND FUELS MITIGATION, NATURAL RESOURCES PROJECT SUPPORT AND OUTDOOR FACILITY WORK (SUCH AS TRAILS AND FENCING) AT PARK SITES ACROSS DIVERSE LANDSCAPES OF MARIN COUNTY. THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE WILL BE TO PROVIDE CCNB YOUTH CREWS MEANINGFUL WORK EXPERIENCES AND EXPERIENTIAL EDUCATION THROUGH ON-THE-GROUND WORK IN MARIN COUNTY. THIS WORK WILL ALSO SUPPORT NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE GOALS FOR FORT BAKER WHICH WERE IDENTIFIED IN THE FINAL ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACT STATEMENT (FEIS) FOR THE SITE.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE PROJECT MAY BE CONDUCTED IN MULTIPLE PHASES. THIS AGREEMENT INITIALLY FUNDS PHASE 1 WORK FOR CREWS OF 6-8 CORPSMEMBERS IN YEAR 1, BUT MAY BE MODIFIED TO ADD FUTURE PHASES, SUBJECT TO THE AVAILABILITY OF FUNDING AND SATISFACTORY PROGRESS OF PROJECT WORK. FUTURE PHASES WOULD CONTINUE THE TASKS AND OBJECTIVES OF THIS FIRST PHASE, AS DESCRIBED BELOW.FORT BAKER- PROJECT WORK WILL FOCUS ON VEGETATION MANAGEMENT TO REDUCE INVASIVE PLANT POPULATIONS AND MITIGATE ROADSIDE HAZARDOUS FUELS. APPROXIMATELY 6 ACRES OF HIGHLY INVASIVE WOODY SHRUBS AND TREES INCLUDING FRENCH BROOM (GENISTA MONSPESSULANA), CHILEAN MAYTEN (MAYTENUS BOARIA), EUCALYPTUS (EUCALYPTUS GLOBULUS), PRIDE OF MADEIRA (ECHIUM SPP.), AND BLACKWOOD ACACIA (ACACIA MELANOXYLON), AMONG OTHERS WILL BE TARGETED FOR REMOVAL IN THE FALL MONTHS OUTSIDE OF BIRD NESTING SEASON FOR THE RESTORATION OF COASTAL SCRUB AND PRAIRIE GRASSLAND HABITAT. ADDITIONALLY, 3 MILES OF ROADSIDE VEGETATION ALONG EAST RD & BUNKER RD WILL BE CUT AND CHIPPED ONSITE TO MAINTAIN A LOW FUEL LOAD AND MITIGATE WILDLAND FIRE HAZARDS THAT COULD ORIGINATE FROM ROADSIDE IGNITION SOURCES.DURING THE WINTER SEASON, WORK WILL FOCUS ON THE REVEGETATION OF NATIVE PLANT COMMUNITIES THAT SUPPORT THE FEDERALLY ENDANGERED MISSION BLUE BUTTERFLY (ICARICIA ICARIOIDES VAR. MISSIONENSIS)REDWOOD CREEK WATERSHED - PROJECT WORK WILL FOCUS ON MAINTAINING HEALTHY COASTAL GRASSLANDS THROUGH THE REMOVAL OF ENCROACHING SCRUB AND INVASIVE TREES WITH CHAINSAWS AND MANUAL TOOLS. EROSION CONTROL WORK MAY ALSO BE IMPLEMENTED WITHIN MUIR WOODS NATIONAL MONUMENT.BENEFICIARIES:THE PUBLIC WILL BENEFIT SUBSTANTIALLY FROM THIS PROJECT THROUGH YOUTH EDUCATION AND ON THE JOB TRAINING IN NATURAL RESOURCES MANAGEMENT.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): THE HBCUI PROGRAM ENGAGES RECIPIENTS, PARTNERS, COMMUNITIES, AND/OR VISITORS IN SHARED ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP. THE PROGRAM BUILDS RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP ETHICS IN ITS PARTICIPANTS. THE PROGRAM ACTIVITIES DEVELOPED BY THIS PROGRAM WILL BE SHARED THROUGH A VARIETY OF STRATEGIES TO INCREASE PUBLIC AWARENESS, KNOWLEDGE, AND SUPPORT FOR CONSERVATION AND STEWARDSHIP OF THE NATION'S RICH CULTURAL AND HISTORICAL HERITAGE. THE PRINCIPAL PURPOSE OF THE PROGRAM IS TO SUPPORT THE GOVERNMENT'S OBJECTIVE TO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUTH TO LEARN ABOUT THE ENVIRONMENT BY SPENDING TIME WORKING ON PROJECTS IN NATIONAL PARKS. THE NPS RECEIVES THE INDIRECT BENEFIT OF COMPLETING CONSERVATION PROJECTS. IT MOTIVATES THE YOUTH PARTICIPANTS TO BECOME INVOLVED IN THE NATURAL, CULTURAL AND /OR HISTORICAL RESOURCE PROTECTION OF THEIR COMMUNITIES AND BEYOND. THE PROGRAM ASSISTS IN THE CREATION, PROMOTION, FACILITATION, AND/OR IMPROVEMENT OF THE PUBLIC'S UNDERSTANDING OF NATURAL, CULTURAL, HISTORIC, RECREATIONAL, AND OTHER ASPECTS OF AREAS SUCH AS ECOLOGICAL CONSERVATION AREAS, AND STATE AND LOCAL PARKS. GREENING YOUTH FOUNDATION (GYF) IS RECOMMENDED TO CARRY OUT THIS PROGRAM AS THIS NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION HAS BEEN VETTED AND IS ONE OF THE 40 NATIONAL COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT HOLDERS DEDICATED TO YOUTH DEVELOPMENT. GYF HAS PARTNERED ON THIS PROJECT SINCE INCEPTION, NOW IN ITS EIGHTH YEAR AND HAS SUCCESSFULLY DESIGNED, IMPLEMENTED AND PROVIDED A VERY EFFECTIVE PROGRAMMING AND ADMINISTRATION, RECRUITMENT, SELECTION, MEMBER SUPPORT AND SITE ASSIGNMENT. GREENING YOUTH FOUNDATION HAS RELATIONSHIPS WITH HBCUS ACROSS THE COUNTRY AND ACTIVELY WORKING TO BUILD NEW ONES.

PERFORMANCE GOALS - APPROXIMATELY 1,245,566 SF OF HISTORIC FIELDS ALONG OVER 155,700 LINEAR FEET OF WOOD LINE WILL BE RECLAIMED FROM YEARS OF ENCROACHMENT, AFTER WHICH PARK STAFF CAN PERFORM PREVENTIVE MAINTENANCE IN THE RECLAIMED AREAS. PROJECT OBJECTIVES - HISTORIC VIEW SHEDS WILL BE PRESERVED, AND VISITORS WILL ENJOY A MORE ACCURATE DEPICTION OF THE LANDSCAPE AS IT APPEARED DURING THE 1861 AND 1862 BATTLES THAT OCCURRED.THE PARK IS CHALLENGED TO MAINTAIN OVER 2027 ACRES OF HISTORIC OPEN PASTURES AND FIELDS TO PRESERVE THE BUCOLIC APPEARANCE OF THE 1861 AND 1862 BATTLES FOUGHT. ON A REPEATING BASIS, IT IS NECESSARY TO RECLAIM HISTORIC BATTLEFIELD LAND ALONG TREE LINES THAT HAVE ENCROACHED THROUGH NATURAL TREE FALLS, LIMB DROPS AND UNRESTRAINED GROWTH OF INVASIVE VEGETATION. APPROXIMATELY 28 ACRES OF LOST FIELD AREAS ALONG 155,700 LINEAR FEET OF TREE LINES IN SEVERAL HISTORIC LANDSCAPES WILL BE RECLAIMED THROUGHOUT THE PARK. OVER SEVERAL YEARS, WORK WILL PROCEED FROM HENRY HILL AND THE ROBINSON FARM TO THE GROVETON CONFEDERATE CEMETERY, BATTERY HEIGHTS, CHINN RIDGE, AND AT OTHER SIGNIFICANT LANDSCAPES IN THE PARK. DUE TO THE SENSITIVE NATURE OF THIS HISTORIC EARTHEN FEATURE, ALL VEGETATION REMOVAL MUST BE DONE USING HAND AND HAND-HELD POWER TOOLS. IT IS METICULOUS, TIME-CONSUMING WORK WHICH IF LEFT UNDONE, WILL RESULT IN THE ENTIRE AREA BEING OVERGROWN AND DAMAGED BY ROOT SYSTEMS BY WAY OF INTRUSION INTO THE FABRIC THROUGH NATURAL GROWTH, OR COMPLETE DISTURBANCE CAUSED BY THE ROOT-BALLS AS TREES AND LARGE BUSHES ARE UPROOTED DURING SEVERE STORMS.BENEFICIARIES: CONSERVATION LEGACYFOR FY22, THE CHAINSAW CERTIFIED CREW WILL RECLAIM THE LOST FIELD AREAS ALONG HENRY HILL, BATTERY HEIGHTS, AND BALD HILL TREE LINES. MOST OF THE WORK WILL BE COMPLETED BY USING HAND TOOLS REMOVING FALLEN TREES, LIMBS, AND EXOTIC PLANTS. FOR FY23, THE CHAINSAW CERTIFIED CREW WILL RECLAIM THE LOST FIELD AREAS AT THE THORNBERRY HOUSE AND CHINN RIDGE TREE LINES.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): THE INDIAN YOUTH SERVICE CORPS (IYSC) WAS ESTABLISHED BY THE DINGELL CONSERVATION, MANAGEMENT AND RECREATION ACT (PL 116-9, MARCH 2019) UNDER THE JOHN S. MCCAIN 21ST CENTURY CONSERVATION SERVICE CORPS ACT (21 SCS) WHICH AMENDS AND EXPANDS THE PUBLIC LANDS CORPS ACT. THE PURPOSE OF THE IYSC PROGRAM IS TO PROVIDE A DIRECT BENEFIT TO NATIVE AMERICAN, ALASKA NATIVE AND NATIVE HAWAIIAN YOUTH THROUGH MEANINGFUL EDUCATION, EMPLOYMENT AND TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES. PARTICIPANTS ENROLLED IN THE PROGRAM MUST BE BETWEEN THE AGES OF 16 AND 30 INCLUSIVE AND VETERANS UP TO AGE 35 OR YOUNGER. PROJECTS MAY INCLUDE ASSISTING FEDERAL AND TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS IN PERFORMING RESEARCH AND PUBLIC EDUCATION TASKS ASSOCIATED WITH NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES. THE PRIMARY GOAL OF IYSC IS TO PROVIDE EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUTH AND YOUNG ADULTS WITH THE GOAL OF DEVELOPING GAINFUL CAREERS, IN THE PUBLIC OR PROVIDE SECTORS, IN CONSERVATION CAREERS BY EXPOSING THEM TO CONSERVATION PROFESSIONALS IN FEDERAL OR TRIBAL LAND MANAGEMENT AGENCIES. PROGRAM AREAS WHICH MAY BE INCLUDED THROUGH THE IYSC INCLUDE CLIMATE CHANGE, RACE EQUITY, CULTURAL RESOURCES, EDUCATION, RECREATION, TOURISM, FACILITIES MANAGEMENT AND NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP AND SCIENCE.
THE INTERN WILL HELP INTERPRET STORIES OF THE KLONDIKE GOLD RUSH BY WORKING ALONGSIDE PARK STAFF TO ASSIST WITH EDUCATION SPECIALIST DUTIES, LEARN OPERATIONS AND ASSIST VISITORS.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): THE RECIPIENT WILL SELECT AND OVERSEE QUALIFIED AND MOTIVATED UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE STUDENTS TO WORK ALONGSIDE NPS STAFF IN THE CULTURAL RESOURCES, INTERPRETATION, AND RELATED FIELDS IN DIFFERENT PARK UNITS/PROGRAMS AND FEDERAL OFFICES THROUGHOUT THE NATION. SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: THE EVERGLADES CULTURAL HISTORY EDUCATOR WILL WORK WITH THE PARK'S DIVISION OF RESOURCE EDUCATION AND INTERPRETATION, OUR ARCHIVES PROGRAM UNDER THE SOUTH FLORIDA COLLECTION MANAGEMENT CENTER AND PARK SCIENTIST UNDER THE SOUTH FLORIDA NATURAL RESOURCE CENTER TO RESEARCH AND DEVELOP CURRICULUM ABOUT THE AREA IN THE PARK IDENTIFIED AS THE "HOLE IN THE DONUT" (HID). PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: INTERN(S) WILL BE RECRUITED, SELECTED, AND COMPLETE THEIR TERMS AS FEASIBLE. INTERNS WILL COMPLETE TASKS OUTLINED IN THE SCOPE OF WORK.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):TO PROVIDE A MEANINGFUL, HANDS-ON 36-WEEK WORK EXPERIENCE FOR A ONE YOUTH INTERN IN A NATIONAL PARKSUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE INTERN WILL REMOVE AND SUPPRESS NON-NATIVE INVASIVE SPECIES, HELP MAINTAIN THE HISTORIC APPLE ORCHARD, ASSIST WITH VISITOR ORIENTATION AND INFORMATION, ASSIST WITH PARK EVENTS, ASSIST WITH GROUNDS, TRAILS, AND INFRASTRUCTURE MAINTENANCEPERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:MAINTAIN THE ORCHARD, CONTINUE SUPPRESSION OF NON-NATIVE SPECIES, EXPANDED PUBLIC OUTREACH ON A DAILY BASIS AND THROUGH VARIOUS PLANNED EVENTSBENEFICIARIES:YOUTH GAINS VALUABLE EMPLOYMENT AND UNDERSTANDING OF PARK MANAGEMENTPARK VISITORS WILL HAVE AN IMPROVED EXPERIENCE IN THE PARK

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): THIS PROGRAM SEEKS TO UTILIZE QUALIFIED NON-PROFIT YOUTH AND VETERAN SERVING ORGANIZATIONS TO CARRY OUT APPROPRIATE NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE CONSERVATION, EDUCATION, VOLUNTEER SERVICE AND EDUCATION PROJECTS ON DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR LANDS THROUGH AUTHORIZED NPS PROGRAMS.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: THIS PROJECT WILL PROMOTE AND STIMULATE EDUCATION, JOB TRAINING, DEVELOPMENT OF RESPONSIBLE CITIZENSHIP, PRODUCTIVE COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT, AND FURTHERING THE UNDERSTANDING, APPRECIATION, AND CONSERVATION OF NATURAL RESOURCES TO YOUTH AND ACCOMPLISH TRAIL REHABILITATION AND RESTORATION.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: UPON COMPLETION OF THE PROJECT, THE CCC AND PAINTED CANYON TRAIL WILL BE EASIER TO NAVIGATE THROUGH BRUSH CLEARING AND TRAIL MARKING AND MORE ENJOYABLE FROM MINOR TREAD SURFACE REPAIRS, CHECK STEP CONSTRUCTION AND SHALLOW STREAM FORDS.BENEFICIARIES: PRIVATE NON-PROFIT INSTITUTIONS AND ORGANIZATIONS; PUBLIC AND PRIVATE NON-PROFIT ACADEMIC INSTITUTIONS; STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENT AGENCIES; QUASI-PUBLIC NON-PROFIT INSTITUTIONS AND ORGANIZATIONS THAT SUPPORT YOUTH AND YOUNG ADULT CAREER TRAINING AND DEVELOPMENT, AND EDUCATION IN THE AREAS OF NATURAL AND/OR CULTURAL RESOURCE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT. INDIVIDUALS/FAMILIES; STUDENTS; AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC WILL RECEIVE A BENEFIT FROM THE DEVELOPMENT AND EXECUTION OF THESE PROGRAMS AND PROJECTS.

BY MENTORING INTERNS, WE ARE ENSURING THAT WE PROVIDE TRAINING, CAREER DEVELOPMENT, AND EDUCATION OF YOUTH PEOPLE WITH AN INTEREST IN THE MANAGEMENT OF PUBLIC LANDS AND WATERS. THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO DIRECTLY BENEFIT THE PUBLIC THROUGH THE PROTECTION OF PUBLIC WATER BODIES.BENEFICIARIES:PARK VISITORSTHE YOUTH CREW MEMBERS WILL LEARN ABOUT THE LOCAL FLORA AND FAUNA, AND THEY WILL BE EXPOSED TO THE IDEALS OF THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE OF PRESERVATION AND APPRECIATION OF THE NATURAL ENVIRONMENT.

COMPETITIVE AWARD AGREEMENT REQUIREMENTSFUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: N/AFUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT: N/AREQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSPURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THIS PROJECT WILL PLACE INTERNS TO SERVE ALONGSIDE NPS VEGETATION PROGRAM STAFF TO HELP RESTORE NATIVE VEGETATION IN DISTURBED AND DEGRADED AREAS OF THE NATIONAL PARK, AS WELL AS PROTECT AREAS FROM FURTHER DISTURBANCE.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:SPECIFIC WORK WILL INCLUDE COLLECTION AND SOWING OF NATIVE SEED, SALVAGE AND TRANSPLANT OF BIOLOGICAL SOIL CRUST, OUTPLANTING AND CARE OF NATIVE NURSERY STOCK, INVASIVE PLANT CONTROL (MANUAL AND CHEMICAL METHODS), AND FENCING OR FENCE REPAIR TO PROTECT FROM FUTURE DISTURBANCE.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:AT LEAST TWO INTERNS WILL BE HIRED OVER THE COURSE OF THIS AGREEMENT, FOR A TOTAL OF 40 INTERN-WEEKS. THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE WORK EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATE GREAT BASIN INSTITUTE YOUTH CREWS IN FIRE MANAGEMENT AND HISTORIC PRESERVATION PROJECTS IN REDWOOD NATIONAL PARK.FIRE MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES INCLUDE HAZARD FUELS REDUCTION AROUND HISTORIC STRUCTURES; BURN UNIT PREP INCLUDING THE CLEARING OF BRUSH AND TREES, CHIPPING, SPLITTING FIREWOOD, ETC; SHADED FUEL BREAK MAINTENANCE; MAINTENANCE OF HISTORIC VEGETATION AND ASSISTANCE WITH ARCHAEOLOGICAL FIELD SURVEYS.PROJECT ACTIVITIES WILL ASSIST IN THE PROTECTION AND RESTORATION OF PARK RESOURCES AND WILL HELP REDUCE WILDFIRE RISK IN THE PARK. BENEFIACIARES INCLUDE THE GREAT BASIN INSTITUTE YOUTH CREWS.

THE      PROJECT PROVIDES OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUTH TO LEARN ABOUT THE ENVIRONMENT BY      SPENDING TIME WORKING ON PROJECTS IN NATIONAL PARKS.THE NPS RECEIVES      THE INDIRECT BENEFIT OF COMPLETING CONSERVATION PROJECTS THAT IMPROVE      VISITOR EXPERIENCE AND RECREATION.PROJECT OBJECTIVES - THIS PROJECT INVOLVES      IMPROVING RESOURCE CONDITION AND ENHANCING VISITOR      EXPERIENCE IN SELECTED AREAS OF CURECANTI NATIONAL RECREATION AREA NRA AND      BLACK CANYON OF THE GUNNISON NP BY: 1) CONTROLLING INVASIVE EXOTIC      PLANTS BY CHEMICALLY OR MECHANICALLY TREATING TARGETED SPECIES, AND 2)      RESTORING DISTURBED AND DAMAGED NATURAL AREAS WITH NATIVE VEGETATIONSUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT AGREES TO PROVIDE EQUIPMENT, MATERIAL, TRANSPORTATION, SUBSISTENCE, AND LABOR TO CHEMICALLY OR MECHANICALLY CONTROL INVASIVE PLANT SPECIES AND PERFORM RESTORATION WORK THAT INVOLVES SOIL PREPARATION, ROCK DAM CONSTRUCTION, PLANTING, SEEDING AND WATERING NATIVE PLANTS, CONTROLLING EROSION, AND INSTALLING, REMOVING OR REPAIRING FENCE IN SELECTED PROJECT AREAS AT CURECANTI NATIONAL RECREATION AREA.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: IMPROVED RESOURCE CONDITIONS AND ENHANCED VISITOR EXPERIENCE IN SELECTED AREAS OF CURECANTI NATIONAL RECREATION AREA NRA AND BLACK CANYON OF THE GUNNISON NP.BENEFICIARIES: YOUTH CORPS PARTICIPANTS AND THE AMERICAN PUBLIC VISITING THE NPS UNITS
