RECIPIENT WILL ASSIST NPS STAFF AS NEEDED TO ACCOMPLISH THE GOALS OF THIS PROJECT.3. RECIPIENT WILL BRUSH VEGETATION FROM THE BOUNDARY WALL, AND PAINT THE BOUNDARY WALL, RECIPIENT WILL COMPLETE PRESERVATION WORK AND OTHER RESOURCE MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES UNDER DIRECT SUPERVISION OR INDEPENDENTLY WITH MEASURABLE SUCCESS AS AGREED UPON BY NPS AND RECIPIENT WORK LEADERS. DAILY ACTIVITIES WILL VARY IN SCOPE AND COMPLEXITY.4. PROVIDE BASIC PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT INCLUDING GLOVES, SAFETY GLASSES,ORANGE SAFETY VESTS, HARDHATS, ETC.5. PROVIDE ALL FOOD, TRANSPORTATION AND CAMPING EQUIPMENT TO THEIR WORK CREW.6. PROVIDE A SUMMARY REPORT OF WORK ACCOMPLISHED. BENEFICIARIES: THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE REPAIRS TO THE PARKS HIGHLY VISIBLE CINDER BLOCK BOUNDARY WALL, WHILE PROVING YOUTH WITH AN EXPERIENCE IN WORKING AT A NATIONAL PARK UNIT. THE DIRECT PUBLIC BENEFIT IS THE WALL WILL BE REPAIRED, AND WILL HAVE A FRESH COAT OF PAINT, PRESERVING IT FOR ANOTHER 7-10 YEARS.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THE AWARD WILL PROVIDE TRAIL MANAGEMENT AND OTHER CONSERVATION TRAINING EXPERIENCE TO EIGHT YOUTH AT APPOMATTOX COURT HOUSE NHP. THESE YOUTH HIRES WILL GAIN HANDS-ON WORK EXPERIENCE ON TRAIL RESTORATION AND IMPROVEMENT, POLLINATOR HABITAT MANAGEMENT AND NON-NATIVE INVASIVE PLANT CONTROL. THEY WILL WORK CLOSELY WITH PARK STAFF, GAIN WORK EXPERIENCE, AND DEVELOP A RELATIONSHIP WITH THE PARK AND THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE. IN TURN, THESE YOUTH WILL PROVIDE KEY SUPPORT IN TRAIL AND CONSERVATION PROJECTS IN THE PARK.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE EIGHT PARTICIPANTS WILL GAIN PRACTICAL TRAINING AND RANGE OF EXPERIENCE IN TRAIL PLANNING AND REPAIR BY DEVELOPING NEW TRAIL ROUTES TO AVOID ERODED AND UNSAFE SECTIONS OF TRAILS AND INSTALLING EROSION CONTROL MEASURES. PARTICIPANTS WILL ALSO GAIN KNOWLEDGE OF CONSERVATION PRACTICES BY ASSISTING WITH PROJECTS THAT WILL PROMOTE NATIVE GRASSLAND HABITAT IN THE PARK AND REDUCE NON-NATIVE INVASIVE PLANTS.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:PROJECT GOALS INCLUDE REPAIRING THE ERODED STREAMBANK ON THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE LOW-WATER BRIDGE ON THE CONNECTOR TRAIL, REROUTING A SHORT SECTION OF CONNECTOR TRAIL TO IMPROVE VISITOR SAFETY ON THE CONNECTOR TRAIL, INSTALLING WATER DIVERSION BARS, ASSISTING WITH INVASIVE PLANT CONTROL IN NATIVE GRASSLANDS TO IMPROVE HABITAT FOR NATIVE WILDFLOWERS. THE PROJECT IS SCHEDULED FOR A TWO-WEEK PERIOD DURING THE SUMMER OF 2022.BENEFICIARIES:YOUTH PARTICIPANTS, PARK VISITORS, AND NATIONAL PARK SERVICE

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):PROJECT GOALS - THE COOPERATOR WILL PROVIDE TWO YOUTH WITH DIVERSE FIELD EXPERIENCES AND TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES TO DEVELOP PROFESSIONALISM AND SOLID UNDERSTANDING OF CULTURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT AND VISITOR SERVICES AND EDUCATION OPERATIONS AT A NATIONAL PARK SITE. THE YOUTH WILL WORK DIRECTLY WITH THE CHIEF OF INTERPRETATION AND RESOURCE MANAGEMENT AND PARK STAFF TO LEARN AND SUPPORT ASPECTS OF OPERATIONS AT BOWA INCLUDING CARE AND MONITORING OF THE FARM ANIMALS, SUPPORT OF VOLUNTEERS FOR THE HEIRLOOM GARDEN AND DEMONSTRATION CROP AREAS, TREATMENT OF INVASIVE SPECIES, AND SUPPORT FOR INTERPRETIVE OPERATIONS INCLUDING ORIENTATION AND INFORMAL PROGRAMS TO THE PUBLIC AND DIGITAL MEDIA OUTREACH THROUGH SITE BULLETINS, PARK WEBSITE, AND SOCIAL MEDIA.PROJECT OBJECTIVES - THE YOUTH WILL RECEIVE TRAINING AND WORK DIRECTLY WITH NATIONAL PARK SERVICE INTERPRETATION AND RESOURCE MANAGEMENT STAFF AT THE PARK. YOUTH WILL LEARN ABOUT COMPLEX NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES IN THE PARK THROUGH INTERACTIVE WORK ASSIGNMENTS. YOUTH WILL ALSO LEARN ABOUT VISITOR SERVICES OPERATIONS, PROVIDING ORIENTATION AND INFORMAL PROGRAMMING AS WELL AS SUPPORT FOR DIGITAL OUTREACH. PARK STAFF WILL PROVIDE FIRST-HAND EXPOSURE TO THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE MISSION, WHILE DEVELOPING LEADERSHIP AND WORK SKILLS FOR THE INTERNS.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE YOUTH WILL GAIN REAL WORLD EXPERIENCE ASSISTING THE INTERPRETATION AND RESOURCE MANAGEMENT STAFF AT BOOKER T. WASHINGTON NATIONAL MONUMENT IN PROVIDING EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR VISITING PUBLIC OF ALL AGES, CARING FOR LIVING EXHIBITS SUCH AS FARM ANIMALS AND GARDENS THAT HELP TELL BOOKER T. WASHINGTON'S AMAZING STORY, AND PROTECTING TREASURED CULTURAL AND NATURAL RESOURCES FOR FUTURE GENERATIONS TO EXPERIENCE, LEARN FROM, AND ENJOY! THE RESOURCE MANAGEMENT AND INTERPRETATION YOUTH WILL WORK DIRECTLY WITH NATIONAL PARK SERVICE INTERPRETATION AND RESOURCE MANAGEMENT STAFF TO LEARN ABOUT COMPLEX NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES IN THE PARK THROUGH INTERACTIVE WORK ASSIGNMENTS. THEY WILL ALSO LEARN ABOUT VISITOR SERVICES OPERATIONS, PROVIDING ORIENTATION AND INFORMAL PROGRAMMING AS WELL AS SUPPORT FOR DIGITAL OUTREACH.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE INTENT OF THIS OPPORTUNITY IS TO ALLOW THE YOUTH TO BUILD ON AND UTILIZE THEIR EXISTING SKILLS, ALL WHILE PROVIDING EDUCATION AND TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES THAT WILL ENABLE THE INTERN TO BE READY TO SEEK PARK POSITIONS AT THE COMPLETION OF THEIR TERM. PERFORMANCE GOALS WITH PERIODIC PROGRESS CHECK INS, A MID-TERM PROGRESS REVIEW, AND FINAL EVALUATION WILL INCLUDE VISITOR USE, ENJOYMENT, EDUCATION, AND PARK OPERATIONS, CARE OF CULTURAL AND NATURAL RESOURCES, TEAMWORK AND COLLABORATION, AND SPECIAL PROJECTS.BENEFICIARIES:YOUTH AND AMERICAN PUBLIC

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): THIS PROJECT WILL DIRECTLY BENEFIT PARK VISITORS BY PROVIDING THEM WITH REPAIRED HIKING TRAILS IN THE WILDERNESS AREAS OF SAGUARO NATIONAL PARK (SAGU) AND VALLES CALDERA NATIONAL MONUMENT (VALL). ONCE COMPLETED, VISITORS WILL BE ABLE TO HIKE MORE EFFECTIVELY, IMPROVE VISITOR EXPERIENCE IN WILDERNESS AREAS, AND MITIGATE RESOURCE DAMAGE. IF THIS WORK IS NOT PERFORMED ON THESE TRAILS, FAILING TRAIL FEATURES/ASSETS WILL RESULT IN HAZARDOUS CONDITIONS AND RESOURCE DAMAGE CAN OCCUR.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: THE AMERICAN CONSERVATION EXPERIENCE (ACE) SHALL ADHERE TO THE APPROVED STATEMENT OF WORK AS DESCRIBED BELOW AND ELSEWHERE IN THIS TASK AGREEMENT. THIS PROJECT IS ASSIGNED TO ACE TO WORK WITH THE TRAILS PROGRAM AT SAGU. A PERSON OF CONTACT (POC) FROM SAGU WILL LEAD AND OVERSEE THE PARTICIPANTS IN TRAIL MAINTENANCE STANDARDS FOLLOWED BY SAGU STAFF. ACE CORPS MEMBERS WILL ALSO BE EDUCATED OF SENSITIVE SPECIES FOUND IN THE SAGU/VALL WILDERNESS. THESE CREWS WILL ACCOMPLISH CYCLIC MAINTENANCE ON APPROXIMATELY 4.8 MILES OF TRAIL THROUGH THE WILDERNESS AT SAGU/VALL. ACE WILL QUANTITATIVELY REPORT TO THE POC THE PRODUCTIVITY OF THEIR WORK (WORK COMPLETED, HOURS SPENT, ETC.) AND KEEP THE POC INFORMED OF ANY INJURY AND WORK NEEDS.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: PERFORMANCE GOALS AS OUTLINED BY THE SAGU TRAILS PROGRAM WILL BE SCORED ON THE FOLLOWING CRITERIA: A) MAINTAINING A SAFE WORK ENVIRONMENT B) CUSTOMER SERVICE AND COMMUNICATION C) TECHNICAL SKILLS AND WORK/CAMP AREA MANAGEMENT. SUCCESSFUL OUTCOMES ARE A COMPLETED INJURY FREE SEASON WITH AN EMPHASIS ON SAFETY AND PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT, BEING A RESPECTFUL AND COMMUNICATIVE MEMBER OF A TEAM WHILE PROVIDING EXCELLENT COMMUNICATION WITH COWORKERS AND THE PUBLIC AND WORKING PROFESSIONALLY IN A BACKCOUNTRY SETTING BY GAINING NEW SKILLS IN TRAILS MAINTENANCE, WORK/CAMPSITE SITE MANAGEMENT, AND IN WILDERNESS VALUES.BENEFICIARIES: YOUTH

FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: P-P-YOUTH-22-005PURPOSE OF AWARD:THE PUBLIC PURPOSE AND OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROGRAM IS TO CREATE CAREER DEVELOPMENTAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR QUALIFIED STUDENTS AND ASSIST NATIONAL PARK SERVICE (NPS) EMPLOYEES IN LOCAL ASSIGNMENTS FOCUSING ON INTERPRETATION, MEDIA, CONSERVATION, ACCESSIBILITY, AND MUSEUM SERVICES. THE GOAL OF THIS PROGRAM IS FOR THE NPS AND THE RECIPIENT TO COLLABORATE ON PROJECTS INVOLVING YOUTH THAT PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL WORK EXPERIENCES FOR ABOUT 5-10 STUDENTS WHILE COMPLETING CRITICAL MEDIA SERVICE PROJECTS TO ENHANCE PARKS' VISITOR EXPERIENCES.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: PROJECTS WILL VARY FROM PROVIDING SUPPORT TO MEDIA PLANNING AND DESIGN TEAMS, CONDUCTING RESEARCH TO INFORM INTERPRETIVE PROJECTS, CREATING INTERPRETIVE MATERIALS, PARTICIPATING IN PLANNING AND DESIGN MEETINGS WITH PARK TEAMS, WORKING ON NPS MUSEUM COLLECTION MANAGEMENT PROJECTS, AND ASSISTING WITH PUBLIC OUTREACH THROUGH SOCIAL MEDIA CAMPAIGNS. THE RECIPIENT WILL WORK WITH PROGRAM PARTNERS TO ADMINISTER EDUCATIONAL WEBINARS AND COORDINATE A CAREER WORKSHOP FOR PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS. IN ADDITION, THE RECIPIENT WILL SHARE ANY EVALUATION DATA COLLECTED IN THE END OF YEAR ACCOMPLISHMENT REPORT.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT NUMBER P20AC00125 WAS ENTERED BETWEEN THE NPS AND THE RECIPIENT FOR THE PURPOSE OF ENGAGING THE NEXT GENERATION OF CONSERVATION STEWARDS. THE PROGRAM WILL RAISE AWARENESS OF OUR NATIONAL PARKS AND HISTORIC SITES, THEIR ACCESSIBILITY AND INTERPRETATION, AND THE NEED FOR THE LATINO COMMUNITY'S INVOLVEMENT IN THEIR PRESERVATION. THE PROGRAM WILL ADVANCE EMPLOYMENT AND COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT OPPORTUNITIES WITH AN EMPHASIS ON RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP AND INTERPRETATION ISSUES.THE MEDIA SERVICES INTERNSHIP PROGRAM WILL TARGET UNDERGRADUATES AND GRADUATE STUDENTS, WHILE DEVELOPING MISSION CRITICAL INTERNSHIP PROJECTS THAT WILL SUPPORT NPS AND DOI GOALS AND OBJECTIVES. THE EXPERIENCE WILL CREATE STRONG MENTOR AND PROTEGE RELATIONSHIPS AND SUPPORT THE CAREER GROWTH OF TALENTED STUDENTS. IN ADDITION, IT WILL HELP TO EXPAND NPS OUTREACH INTO COMMUNITIES NATIONALLY AND DEVELOP DEEP AND SUSTAINABLE PARTNERSHIPS. UNLESS OTHERWISE SPECIFIED HEREIN, THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS AS STATED IN THE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WILL APPLY TO THIS TASK AGREEMENT.BENEFICIARIES:THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE, HARPERS FERRY CENTER, STUDENTS, AND VISITORS TO NPS SITES.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE WILL PARTNER WITH MONTANA CONSERVATION CORPS (MCC) TO PROVIDE ONE YOUNG ADULT CREW AND FOUR YOUTH CREWS (10 CREW WEEKS) TO COMPLETE DEFERRED MAINTENANCE AND OTHER RESOURCE PROJECTS FOR YELLOWSTONE. THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE YOUTH THE OPPORTUNITY TO LEARN ABOUT PARK RESOURCES AND COMPLETE SPECIFIC FACILITY MAINTENANCE AND OTHER WORK PROJECTS.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THESE 5 MCC CREWS WILL BE IN THE PARK STARING IN JUNE AND CONTINUING THROUGH END OF SEPTEMBER. WORK PROJECTS INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO: TRAIL WORK MAINTENANCE; REPLACING BUMPER LOGS IN PARKING LOTS; REPAIRING AND BUILDING FENCES; LOG WORK; REMOVING TREES AND BRUSH FROM ROADWAYS, NEAR BUILDINGS, AND IN HOUSING AREAS; REMOVING OLD ASPHALT IN PARKING LOTS; CAMPGROUND AND PICNIC AREA REHAB WORK; REMOVING SOCIAL TRAILS; AND COLLECTING NATIVE SEED FOR RE-VEGETATION PROJECTS.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:MONTANA CONSERVATION CORPS AND NPS STAFF WORK COOPERATIVELY TO IMPROVE PUBLIC ACCESS TO THE FRONTCOUNTRY OR BACKCOUNTRY AREAS OF YELLOWSTONE.PROJECTS WILL BE SELECTED FROM A LONG LIST OF NPS PRIORITIES FOR THIS SUMMER. PARTICIPATING IN THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE MEANINGFUL LIFE AND WORK EXPERIENCE AND TRAINING; LAND AND RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP EDUCATION AND APPRECIATION; AND TECHNICAL, SAFETY AND TEAMBUILDING OPPORTUNITIES TO AMERICAN YOUTH WHILE SERVING AND PROTECTING ONE OF THE NATION'S PREMIER PUBLIC RESOURCES.BENEFICIARIES:THE PROJECT PROMOTES GREATER PUBLIC AND PRIVATE PARTICIPATION IN NATURAL AND CULTURAL PRESERVATION PROGRAMS AND ACTIVITIES. THE PROJECT BUILDS RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP ETHICS IN ITS PARTICIPANTS.THE PROJECT SUPPORT THE GOVERNMENT'S OBJECTIVE TO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUTH TO LEARN ABOUT THE ENVIRONMENT BY SPENDING TIME WORKING ON PROJECTS IN NATIONAL PARKS. THE NPS RECEIVES THE INDIRECT BENEFIT OF COMPLETING MUCH NEEDED CONSERVATION PROJECTS.
YOSEMITE VALLEY TRAILS MAINTENANCE IN THE MERCED AND TUOLUMNE WATERSHEDS

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THESE YEAR LONG INTERN POSITIONS WILL WORK WITH SAGUARO'S VISITOR SERVICES, INTERPRETATION, EDUCATION, AND COMMUNITY PROGRAMMING.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:SPECIFIC PROJECTS WILL INCLUDE REPRESENTING THE PARK AT COMMUNITY EVENTS, HELPING COORDINATE IN PARK SPECIAL EVENTS, PRACTICE CUSTOMER SERVICE IN PARK VISITOR CENTERS, GAIN INTERPRETIVE SKILLS AND PRESENT INTERPRETIVE PROGRAMS AND/OR EDUCATION PROGRAMS TO GENERAL AND INVITED AUDIENCES.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:INTERNS WILL JOIN TEAM INTERPRETATION WITH GENERAL PARK ORIENTATION, LEARN FROM RESOURCE MANAGERS ABOUT PARK CONDITIONS AND RESOURCES, PRACTICE INTERPRETIVE SKILLS WITH AUDIENCE CENTERED INTERPRETIVE OPPORTUNITIES, HAVE OPPORTUNITIES TO CROSS TRAIN WITH OTHER WORK GROUPS, PRESENT PROGRAMS AND FACILITATE GUIDED HIKES WITH GENERAL AND INVITED AUDIENCES. ADDITIONALLY, WORK WITH THE COMMUNITY PROGRAMS OFFICE TO ATTEND COMMUNITY FESTIVALS AND CREATE RECREATION OPPORTUNITIES FOR UNDER-REPRESENTED GROUPS. THIS PROGRAM OFFERS GROWTH FOR INTERNS TO FIND THEIR LEADERSHIP STYLE AND VOICE, ENCOURAGE PROBLEM SOLVING SKILLS, IMPROVE AND PERFECT SOCIAL SKILLS AS WELL AS OFFERING AN OPPORTUNITY TO TAKE OWNERSHIP IN THEIR PROGRAM.BENEFICIARIES: YOUTH WILL BE HIRED AT A LIVING WAGE TO GAIN EXPERIENCE IN CONSERVATION FIELDS AND RECOGNIZE CAREER FIELDS AVAILABLE TO THEM. IN ADDITION, THE GENERAL PUBLIC WILL RECEIVE ADDITIONAL BENEFIT FROM INCREASED PUBLIC PROGRAMMING AND COMMUNITY SERVICES IN THE PARK.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO PROVIDE YOUNG ADULTS WITH STRUCTURED, SAFE, CHALLENGING WORK AND EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES THROUGH EMPLOYMENT PROJECTS THAT PROMOTE PERSONAL GROWTH, THE DEVELOPMENT OF LIFE SKILLS AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT, AND AN ETHIC OF NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP. IN ADDITION, THE AGREEMENT WILL AID IN THE NATIONAL HERITAGE AREAS' EFFORTS TO INVOLVE AND ENGAGE YOUTH THROUGH THE IMPLEMENTATION OF PROJECTS THAT PROMOTE ACCESS TO RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES AND DEVELOPMENT OF HISTORIC PRESERVATION STEWARDSHIP, WHILE CONNECTING AND STRENGTHENING RELATIONSHIPS WITH LOCAL COMMUNITIES WITHIN THE HERITAGE AREAS.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE OBJECTIVES OF THE AGREEMENT INCLUDE: PARTNERING WITH CONSERVATION LEGACY, TO RECRUIT YOUTH INTERNS FOR NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE CONSERVATION PROJECTS IMPLEMENTED BY THE NATIONAL HERITAGE AREAS IN MEETING THEIR MANAGEMENT PLAN GOALS; ASSIST NATIONAL HERITAGE AREAS IN IMPROVING PUBLIC AWARENESS AND VISITATION TO NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES, AS WELL AS INCREASE PUBLIC PARTICIPATION IN RECREATIONAL, HERITAGE, AND EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FOUND WITHIN HERITAGE AREAS; ENGAGE YOUTH THROUGH UNIQUE HERITAGE AREA INTERNSHIPS THAT PROVIDE FOR PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT AND IMPROVE STEWARDSHIP OF OUR NATION'S SIGNIFICANT NATIONAL HERITAGE AREAS.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE WILL WORK IN PARTNERSHIP WITH CONSERVATION LEGACY TO RECRUIT YOUTH TO SERVE AS INTERNS FOR SELECTED NATIONAL HERITAGE AREAS. A TOTAL OF 2 INTERNS WILL BE RECRUITED AND PLACED IN NATIONAL HERITAGE AREAS LOCATED IN REGIONS 6, 7, AND 8. SELECTED INTERNS WILL LEARN VALUABLE PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT SKILLS BY PARTICIPATING IN POTENTIAL PROJECTS WHICH MAY INCLUDE THOSE THAT IMPROVE ACCESS AND VISITATION TO TRAILS AND HISTORIC SITES FOUND WITHIN A HERITAGE AREA, PROMOTE SAFE RECREATION ALONG AND WITHIN HERITAGE AREA TRAIL/RIVER CORRIDORS, IMPROVE INTERPRETATION AND HISTORIC PRESERVATION OF HISTORIC SITES, PROMOTE OUTREACH AND PUBLIC INTEREST IN HERITAGE AREA EDUCATIONAL AND COMMUNITY EVENTS, ARCHIVE OR DOCUMENT THE HISTORY OF THE AREA, AND PARTICIPATE IN PARTNERSHIP EFFORTS WITH HERITAGE AREAS TO PRESERVE NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE ARTIFACTS.BENEFICIARIES:NATIONAL HERITAGE AREAS IN REGIONS 6, 7, & 8, AS WELL AS YOUTH/YOUNG ADULTS RECRUITED WITH CONSERVATION LEGACY.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): THIS PROGRAM SEEKS TO UTILIZE QUALIFIED NON-PROFIT YOUTH AND VETERAN SERVING ORGANIZATIONS TO CARRY OUT APPROPRIATE NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE CONSERVATION, EDUCATION, VOLUNTEER SERVICE AND EDUCATION PROJECTS ON DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR LANDS THROUGH AUTHORIZED NATIONAL PARK SERVICE PROGRAMS.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: PARK IS BOTH CULTURALLY AND ENVIRONMENTALLY SIGNIFICANT SITE. THERE IS A NEED FOR AN INTERN WHO CAN HELP PLAN AND IMPLEMENT ONE OR MORE EVENTS IN 2022 THAT WILL HONOR THE CULTURE AND ORAL TRADITIONS OF THE TRIBAL NATIONS WHO ARE ASSOCIATED WITH PARK AND WILL CELEBRATE THE FUNDAMENTAL AND LIFE-GIVING CONNECTION THAT NATIVE PEOPLE HAVE WITH THE BISON.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: RECRUIT, SELECT, AND PLACE ONE INTERN FOR 21 WEEKS TO PARTICIPATE IN THE PARK NATIVE AMERICAN DAY THAT CELEBRATES CULTURE AND CULTURAL PRACTICES, COMMUNICATES THE ORAL HISTORY OF THE PARK, AND PROMOTES THE CONNECTION OF INDIGENOUS PEOPLE TO THE PARK AND ITS RESOURCES.BENEFICIARIES: INDIVIDUAL/FAMILY, PRIVATE NONPROFIT INSTRUCTION/ORGANIZATION, QUASI PUBLIC NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION, ANYONE/GENERAL PUBLIC, GRADUATE STUDENT, STATE, LOCAL.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): THE ARIZONA CONSERVATION CORPS (AZCC), A PROGRAM OF CONSERVATION LEGACY, WILL PROVIDE CREWS TO ASSIST THE PARK BOTANY PROGRAM WITH LANDSCAPE RESTORATION AND INVASIVE PLANT MANAGEMENT. THE PERFORMANCE GOAL IS TO ACCOMPLISH WORK IN THESE TWO AREAS AS WELL AS PROVIDE CORPS MEMBERS WITH THE OPPORTUNITY FOR ON-THE-JOB TRAINING IN THE MANAGEMENT OF PUBLIC LANDS AND NATURAL RESOURCES.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: TO ACCOMPLISH WORK IN THE AREAS OF 1) LANDSCAPE RESTORATION WHICH WILL INVOLVE TASKS SUCH AS REMOVING OFF-ROAD VEHICLE TRACKS, OUT-PLANTING NURSERY GROWN PLANTS, AND COLLECTING NATIVE PLANT SEED FOR USE IN RESTORATION OF DISTURBED SITES, AND 2) INVASIVE PLANT MANAGEMENT USING MANUAL, MECHANICAL AND CHEMICAL MEANS TO CONTROL NON-NATIVE, INVASIVE PLANT SPECIES WITHIN THE PARK.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE SUCCESSFUL REDUCTION IN THE NUMBER OF DISTURBED SITES AND THE DEGREE OF DISTURBANCE WITHIN THE PARK. THE SUCCESSFUL REDUCTION IN INVASIVE PLANT POPULATIONS WITHIN THE PARK.BENEFICIARIES: ORGAN PIPE CACTUS NATIONAL MONUMENT, ARIZONA CONSERVATION CORPS (AZCC). AZCC CREW MEMBERS WHO PARTICIPATE WILL GAIN EXPERIENCE WITH LANDSCAPE RESTORATION AND INVASIVE PLANT MANAGEMENT. ORPI WILL BENEFIT BY BEING ABLE TO COMPLETE MORE RESTORATION AND INVASIVE PLANT WORK WITH THE ASSISTANCE OF ADDITIONAL PERSONNEL PROVIDED BY AZCC.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THIS TASK AGREEMENT AIMS TO PROMOTE AND STIMULATE EDUCATION, JOB TRAINING, DEVELOPMENT OF RESPONSIBLE CITIZENSHIP, PRODUCTIVE COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT, AND TO FURTHER THE UNDERSTANDING AND APPRECIATION OF NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES THROUGH THE INVOLVEMENT OF LOCAL YOUTH IN THE CARE AND ENHANCEMENT OF PUBLIC RESOURCES. THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE LOCAL YOUTH WITH AN OUTDOOR EXPERIENCE AND JOB TRAINING SKILLS, ASSIST AND LEARN FROM NPS STAFF, ENGAGE IN ACTIVITIES THAT ENHANCE VISITOR EXPERIENCE AT THE MONUMENT, PROTECT THE MONUMENT'S NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES, AND MAINTAIN INFRASTRUCTURE.THIS TASK AGREEMENT CONTINUES THE LONGSTANDING EFFORTS FOR THE NPS TO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR PUBLIC SERVICE YOUTH EMPLOYMENT, MINORITY YOUTH DEVELOPMENT AND TRAINING, AND THE PARTICIPATION OF LOCAL YOUTH IN ACCOMPLISHING CONSERVATION-RELATED WORK WHICH CLEARLY REPRESENTS A PUBLIC BENEFIT. THIS PROGRAM SERVES THE PUBLIC BY PROVIDING A SAFE AND ENJOYABLE TRAIL SYSTEM TO VIEW THE MONUMENT'S PETROGLYPHS, LEADING TO AN ENHANCED VISITOR EXPERIENCE; AND WILL PROTECT MONUMENT RESOURCES BY ENSURING THE MONUMENT'S FENCING IS INTACT AND EFFECTIVE.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:PARTICIPANTS WILL COOPERATE IN THE DESIGN AND IMPLEMENTATION OF CONSERVATION-RELATED PROJECTS. PROJECTS WILL INCLUDE MAINTENANCE OF THE MONUMENT'S TRAIL SYSTEM TO PROVIDE AN ENHANCED VISITOR EXPERIENCE AND MAINTENANCE AND REPAIRS TO THE MONUMENT'S FENCING. THE PARTICIPANTS WILL LEARN ABOUT THE IMPORTANCE OF REPAIRING AND MAINTAINING TRAILS AND REPAIRING AND MAINTAINING BOUNDARY FENCING WITHIN AN URBAN AREA AND WILL LEARN HOW TO SAFELY UTILIZE HAND TOOLS AND SMALL POWER TOOLS TO ACCOMPLISH THIS WORK. PARTICIPANTS WILL LEARN ABOUT THE IMPORTANCE OF ENSURING AN AESTHETICALLY PLEASING, CLEAN, AND SAFE ENVIRONMENT BY ENGAGING IN MAINTENANCE WORK ON TRAILS IN AREAS WHERE THE PUBLIC FREQUENTLY VISITS. ROUTINE TRAIL MAINTENANCE, SUCH AS POST AND CABLE REPAIR, BRUSHING TRAILS, MAINTAINING SAND LADDERS, VEGETATION REMOVAL, EROSION CONTROL, POST AND CABLE REPAIRS, SIGNAGE REPLACEMENT AND INSTALLATION, AND RESTORATION ACTIVITIES WILL OCCUR. INSTALLATION OF BOUNDARY FENCING AND FENCE MAINTENANCE, SUCH AS FENCE REPAIRS, SIGN INSTALLATION, GROUNDS IMPROVEMENTS, HAZARDOUS FUELS REMOVAL, WILL OCCUR. ENVIRONMENTAL AWARENESS EDUCATION WILL BE PROVIDED. NPS RESOURCE MANAGERS AND INTERPRETERS WILL PROVIDE INFORMATION ON IMPORTANT NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES AND DESCRIBE WHY THE WORK ACTIVITIES THE YOUTH ARE PERFORMING ARE IMPORTANT TO THE SUSTAINABILITY AND PRESERVATION OF THOSE RESOURCES. YOUTH PARTICIPANTS WILL LEARN ABOUT OPERATIONAL LEADERSHIP AND WILL ENGAGE IN DAILY RISK ASSESSMENTS AND SAFETY TAILGATE SESSIONS, LED BY NPS STAFF, TO ENHANCE SITUATIONAL AWARENESS.BENEFICIARIES: YOUTH CORPS PARTICIPANTS, PETROGLYPH NATIONAL MONUMENT, VISITORS

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):VALLES CALDERA NATIONAL PRESERVE WILL HOST TWO NATIVE AMERICAN INTERNS IN THE INTERPRETATION DIVISION TO PROVIDE HANDS-ON EXPERIENCE WITH VISITOR INTERPRETATION AND EDUCATION WITH RESPECT TO ASTRONOMY PROGRAMS AND SCIENTIFIC MONITORING OF NIGHT SKY RESOURCES USING CITIZEN SCIENCE APPROACHES. THE INTERNS WILL BE RECRUITED IN COLLABORATION WITH THE CONSERVATION LEGACY, ANCESTRAL LANDS CONSERVATION CORPS.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE INTERNS WILL DEVELOP SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH METHODS AND IMPLEMENT A CITIZEN SCIENCE PROJECT TO MONITOR NIGHT SKY RESOURCES ON THE PRESERVE. IN ADDITION, THEY WILL PREPARE WRITTEN AND ORAL MATERIALS FOR INTERPRETING NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES TO THE PUBLIC ON THE PRESERVE.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE INTERNS WILL GAIN EXPERIENCE AND CONFIDENCE IN NATIONAL PARK SERVICE INTERPRETATION AND SCIENTIFIC RESEARCH PROTOCOLS AND APPROACHES.BENEFICIARIES:THE PUBLIC VISITORS WILL BENEFIT FROM THE ENHANCED KNOWLEDGE OF THE PRESERVE'S RESOURCES, INCLUDING NIGHT SKY RESOURCES, AS WELL AS KNOWLEDGE OF TRIBAL CULTURAL ASPECTS OF THE PRESERVE'S HUMAN HISTORY.

COMPETITIVE AWARD AGREEMENT REQUIREMENTSFUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: N/AFUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT: N/AREQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSPURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):STABILIZATION OF THE STANDING PREHISTORIC ARCHITECTURE AT HOVENWEEP NATIONAL MONUMENT IN AN ONGOING EFFORT TO FULFILL THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE'S MISSION TO PRESERVE AND PROTECT CULTURAL RESOURCES. THIS PROJECT WILL IMPROVE STRUCTURAL CONDITIONS PROVIDING A SAFE AND INFORMATIVE VISITOR EXPERIENCE FOR CURRENT AND FUTURE GENERATIONS OF VISITORS. THESE SITES ARE IMPORTANT TO MANY NATIVE AMERICAN TRIBES IN THE SOUTHWEST.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:PARTICIPANTS WILL APPLY APPROVED PRESERVATION TREATMENTS TO STANDING MASONRY WALLS AT HOVENWEEP NATIONAL MONUMENT. THIS WORK WILL INCLUDE COLLECTING SOILS FOR MIXING MORTARS, CLEANING MORTAR JOINTS FOR REPOINTING WITH NEW AMENDED MORTARS, SHAPING STONE FOR REPLACEMENT IN WALL VOIDS, RESETTING DISPLACED MASONRY ELEMENTS AND FINALLY CLEANUP OF DETRITUS FROM WORK AREA.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:PROJECT INVOLVES TWO EIGHT-DAY WORK HITCHES WORKING ALONGSIDE NPS STAFF TO IMPLEMENT STABILIZATION TREATMENTS TO STANDING PREHISTORIC ARCHITECTURE IN THE SQUARE TOWER UNIT OF HOVENWEEP NATIONAL MONUMENT. JOHNS WORT REQUIRES MULTIPLE TREATMENTS THROUGHOUT THE GROWING SEASON AND THE PARK HAS FEW RESOURCE MANAGEMENT STAFF MEMBERS CAPABLE OF GETTING TO ALL KNOWN LOCATIONS WITHIN A GIVEN YEAR.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:MCC WILL PROVIDE A 4-5-PERSON YOUNG ADULT CREW FOR A MINIMUM OF 160 HOURS FOR INVASIVE PLANT CONTROL, SEED COLLECTION, AND OTHER NATIVE VEGETATION CONSERVATION ACTIVITIES FOR EACH WORK PERIOD. SEASONAL FLEXIBILITY THROUGHOUT THE WORK PERIOD ALLOWS FOR CREWS TO PERFORM THE WORK WHEN INVASIVE PLANTS ARE MOST SUSCEPTIBLE TO PREFERRED TREATMENTS AND NATIVE SEEDS ARE ABLE TO BE COLLECTED. COMPETITIVE AWARD AGREEMENT REQUIREMENTSFUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: N/AFUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT: N/AREQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSPURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):SAND CREEK MASSACRE NHS PLANS TO FOSTER BENEFICIAL RELATIONSHIPS WITH CONSERVATION ORGANIZATIONS THAT ADVOCATE FOR BALANCED STEWARDSHIP AND USE OF OUR PUBLIC LANDS BY COLLABORATING WITH THE AMERICAN CONSERVATION EXPERIENCE (ACE) TO IMPLEMENT PRAIRIE RESTORATION ACTIVITIES AT THE PARK.THIS WORK WILL BE PERFORMED BY CONTROLLING EXOTIC VEGETATION GROWTH IN THE PARK WHILE SIMULTANEOUSLY SUPPORTING GROWTH OF NATIVE SPECIES ASSOCIATED WITH THE HIGH PLAINS OF SOUTHEASTERN COLORADO.IN ADDITION, DEBRIS REMOVAL OF FALLEN TREE LIMBS AND TUMBLEWEEDS WILL MAINTAIN THE LANDSCAPE IN PRISTINE CONDITION, AS CLOSE AS PRACTICABLE TO 1864.TRAINING AND OVERSIGHT FOR ALL ACTIVITIES WILL BE PROVIDED BY NPS STAFF. ON-SITE SAFETY BRIEFINGS WILL BE HELD DAILY OR AS NEEDED.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:EXOTIC VEGETATION CONTROL VIA MANUAL, CHEMICAL, OR MECHANICAL REMOVAL.MOWER/TRACTOR OPERATIONSEEDINGWATERINGDEBRIS REMOVALPERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:PROJECT GOAL IS TO USE AN EFFICIENT INTEGRATED PEST MANAGEMENT APPROACH TO ALLOW THE PARK TO TARGET ANNUAL INVASIVE PLANTS AT THE SOURCE (SEEDS) AND IMPROVE SMALL AMOUNTS OF ACREAGE IN MINIMAL TIME. THE COMBINED EFFECT OF BOTH CHEMICAL TREATMENT AND MANUAL REMOVAL HAS BEEN PROVEN THROUGH UNIVERSITY RESEARCH REDUCE FUEL LOADS, LIMIT IMPACTS FROM INVASIVE SPECIES, RESTORE WILDLIFE HABITAT, AND INCREASE PLANT BIODIVERSITY.THE MANAGEMENT OF EXOTICS, REVEGETATION AND DEBRIS REMOVAL WILL MAKE SUBSTANTIAL PROGRESS WITH THE MANDATE IN THE SAND ESTABLISHMENT ACT, P.L. 106-465, WHICH STATES THAT THE PROTECTION AND PRESERVATION OF THE CULTURAL LANDSCAPE OF THE SITE SHALL BE MANAGED TO PRESERVE, AS CLOSELY AS PRACTICABLE, AS IT APPEARED IN 1864.BENEFICIARIES:THE VISITING PUBLIC, TRIBAL PARTNERS AND LOCAL COMMUNITIES WILL BENEFIT FROM THIS PROJECT WITH HISTORICALLY ACCURATE MAINTAINED LANDSCAPES THAT ACCURATELY REPRESENT THE HISTORIC ECO-SYSTEM.

PERFORMANCE      GOALS - WE WILL PROVIDE INTERNSHIP OPPORTUNITIES WITH A VARIETY OF NATURAL      RESOURCE RELATED PROJECTS. PROJECT      OBJECTIVES - INTERNS WILL BE SELECTED TO WORK ALONGSIDE NPS SCIENTISTS TO      HELP CONDUCT LONG TERM ECOLOGICAL MONITORING WITHIN THE MOJAVE DESERT      NETWORK OF NATIONAL PARK UNITS. INTERNSHIPS MAY RANGE FROM 3-6 MONTHS AND      FOCUS ON ONE OF 4 TYPES OF PROJECTS BUT MAY HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO ASSIST      WITH OTHER PROJECTS AS NEEDED. THESE INCLUDE HYDROLOGY MONITORING,      VEGETATION MONITORING, BAT MONITORING, OR DATA MANAGEMENT. CONSERVATION LEGACY AND NPS WILL COLLABORATE TO PROVIDE UP TO FOUR INTERN POSITIONS FOR LONG TERM NATURAL RESOURCE MONITORING WITH THE MOJAVE DESERT I&M NETWORK (MOJN) AND POSSIBLY OTHER I&M NETWORKS IN THE FUTURE. POSITIONS WILL WORK ON A VARIETY OF PROJECTS BUT WILL HAVE ONE OF 4 FOCUS AREAS: HYDROLOGY, VEGETATION, WILDLIFE, DATA MANAGEMENT. TYPES OF WORK INCLUDE WATER QUALITY AND WATER QUANTITY MONITORING USING A VARIETY OF TECHNIQUES, VEGETATION MONITORING USING SPECIES RICHNESS, DENSITY, AND OTHER MEASUREMENTS, WILDLIFE MONITORING INCLUDING BAT ACOUSTIC AND CAPTURE SURVEYS, AND DATA MANAGEMENT USING SQL DATABASES, R CODING, AND OTHER SIMILAR DATABASES. OFFICE WORK WILL INCLUDE USING A COMPUTER AT A WORKSTATION TO ENTER OR REVIEW DATA IN VARIOUS APPLICATIONS, CLEAN AND MAINTAIN EQUIPMENT AND SUPPLIES AND OTHER GENERAL TASKS.PROJECT WORK WILL BE BROKEN INTO DIFFERENT FIELD SEASONS. HYDROLOGY FOCUSED INTERNS WILL BEGIN WORK IN OCTOBER, VEGETATION AND/OR WILDLIFE POSITIONS WILL BEGIN IN JANUARY OR FEBRUARY. DATA MANAGEMENT POSITIONS MAY BEGIN AT ANY TIME OF THE YEAR, DEPENDING ON NEED AND AVAILABILITY. ADDITIONAL INTERNS IN FUTURE YEARS WILL BE CONTINGENT ON FUTURE FUNDING AND AMENDMENT/MODIFICATION OF THIS AGREEMENT.

COMPETITIVE AWARD AGREEMENT REQUIREMENTSFUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: N/AFUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT: N/AREQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSPURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): THE PROJECT OBJECTIVES INCLUDE REPAIRS TO AND REHABILITATION OF TRAIL SURFACES, TRAIL FEATURES (WATER BARS, DRAINAGE APRONS, ETC.) AND HISTORIC WPA-ERA RETAINING WALLS ALONG 1 MILE OF THE TRAIL. THIS PROJECT WILL EMPLOY AN ALCC YOUTH CREW TO WORK RESTORING THE TRAIL AND CONDUCTING MUCH-NEEDED PRESERVATION MAINTENANCE TO WPA-ERA TRAIL FEATURES ALONG THE SWITCHBACKS LEADING TO THE TOP OF INSCRIPTION ROCK. TRAIL SURFACES AND DRAINAGE FEATURES ARE CURRENTLY IN POOR CONDITION. THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE IS TO BRING THESE FEATURES AND TRAIL SURFACES TO GOOD CONDITION ALONG THIS 1-MILE SEGMENT OF TRAIL.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT AGREES TO PROVIDE A 4-PERSON YOUTH CREW CONSISTING OF 3 CREW MEMBERS AND 1 CREW LEADER TO COMPLETE DEFERRED MAINTENANCE REPAIRS ALONG 1 MILE OF THE HEADLAND TRAIL.1. IMPROVE 1 MILE BY 4 FEET WIDE OF TRAIL SURFACE REMOVING AND REPLACING BROKEN ASPHALT WITH STALOK.2. WATER CONTROL FEATURES SUCH AS BARS AND DRAINAGE BOXES WILL BE BUILT TO DIRECT RUNOFF FROM THE TRAIL.3. THE CREW WILL REPOINT AND REPAIR 20 LINEAR FEET OF WPA-ERA RETAINING WALLS ON THE SWITCHBACKS.4. THE CREW WILL DOCUMENT ALL WORK ACTIVITIES IN FIELD NOTES, WITH DIGITAL PHOTOGRAPHS, AND MAPS AND\OR DRAWINGS. ALL FIELD NOTES, PHOTOS, AND ILLUSTRATIONS WILL BE MAINTAINED DAILY AND TRANSFERRED TO NPS VT STAFF AT THE END OF THE PROJECT.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE YOUNG PEOPLE EMPLOYED ON THIS PROJECT WILL DEVELOP AN APPRECIATION FOR ACCOMPLISHMENT THROUGH PUBLIC SERVICE THAT BOTH IMPROVES PARK INFRASTRUCTURE FOR PUBLIC BENEFIT AND SUPPORTS PUBLIC LANDS MANAGEMENT OBJECTIVES FOR RECREATION AND RESOURCE PROTECTION AND CONSERVATION. THE WORKERS WILL RECEIVE TRAINING AND MENTORSHIP IN HISTORIC PRESERVATION METHODS AND TECHNIQUES AND EXPOSURE TO THE NPS PRESERVATION PRINCIPLES AND PHILOSOPHY.BENEFICIARIES: THIS PROJECT ENCOURAGES PUBLIC LANDS SERVICE AND WILL INSPIRE YOUTH TO EMBRACE THE ETHOS OF PUBLIC LANDS CONSERVATION AND STEWARDSHIP. IT ALSO SERVES NPS LONG-TERM GOALS OF EXPANDING OPPORTUNITIES TO UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES TO BETTER CONNECT YOUTH WITH ANCESTRAL LANDS NOW MANAGED BY THE NPS. THE WORK EXPERIENCES, MENTORSHIP, EDUCATIONAL AND RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES WILL STRENGTHEN AND DEEPEN CONNECTIONS BETWEEN THE YOUTH WORKERS, EL MORRO, AND PUBLIC LANDS THAT ARE CULTURALLY IMPORTANT TO TRADITIONAL NATIVE AMERICAN COMMUNITIES SURROUNDING THE MONUMENT. THIS PROJECT WILL INSPIRE THE NEXT GENERATION OF HISTORIC PRESERVATION WORKERS AND SUPERVISORS THAT CAN SERVE THE NPS AND THEIR LOCAL COMMUNITIES WHERE MANY OF THE MOST IMPORTANT HISTORIC SITES AND STRUCTURES IN NEW MEXICO ARE FOUND.

THE GOAL OF THIS AGREEMENT IS TO PROVIDE LEADERSHIP TO A HIGH SCHOOL AGE YOUTH CONSERVATION CORPS (YCC), AND ALSO TO PROVIDE YOUTH CREWS TO PERFORM ROAD MAINTENANCE, BOUNDARY FENCE REPAIRS, TRAIL MAINTENANCE, AND INVASIVE WEED MITIGATION.PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THE GOALS OF THE AGREEMENT ARE TO PROVIDE MAINTENANCE NECESSARY FOR THE USE AND ENJOYMENT OF VISITORS WHO WILL BE VISITING THE MONUMENT, HIKING THE TRAILS AND DRIVING ALONG RIM ROCK DRIVE. ELIMINATION OF TRIPPING HAZARDS, ENSURING DIRECTIONAL AND INFORMATIONAL SIGNS ARE REASONABLE AND IN GOOD FUNCTIONAL CONDITION, REPAIRING FENCING TO KEEP CATTLE OUT OF THE MONUMENT AND OFF THE ROAD, MITIGATING INVASIVE WEEDS, AND GENERAL CLEANING/CLEARING OF DEBRIS WILL ENSURE A MORE ENJOYABLE AND SAFE EXPERIENCE FOR ALL VISITORS USING THE TRAILS AND ROADWAYS.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:PROVIDE LEADERSHIP FOR YOUTH CONSERVATION CORPS (YCC) CREW.RIM ROCK DRIVE ROAD CLEARING.TRAIL MAINTENANCEBOUNDARY FENCE REPAIR AND MAINTENANCE.WEED MITIGATION.BENEFICIARIES:THE VISITING PUBLIC WILL BENEFIT FROM ALL OF THESE ACTIVITIES.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THIS PROJECT IS TO REPAIR TRAILS ON THE COLORADO RIVER DISTRICT OF ROCKY MOUNTAIN NATIONAL PARK THAT WERE SEVERELY DAMAGED AND DESTROYED IN A WILDFIRE EVENT. REPAIRS WILL TAKE PLACE THROUGHOUT THE BACKCOUNTRY OF THE PARK DISTRICT. PORTIONS OF THE DISTRICT'S TRAIL SYSTEM REMAIN CLOSED DUE TO THE FIRE EVENT AND THIS PROJECT WILL ASSIST IN THE RE-OPENING OF THOSE TRAILS.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:SPECIFIC WORK TO REPAIR THE TRAILS WILL INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING: CONSTRUCT BOTH ROCK AND LOG EROSION STRUCTURES THROUGHOUT THE TRAILS, BUILD ROCK RETAINING WALLS TO STABILIZE ERODING TRAIL SURFACES, BUILD TURNPIKES TO REPLACE THE PREVIOUSLY BURNED STRUCTURES AND MAINTAIN THE TRAIL CORRIDOR BY BRUSHING VEGETATION, CLEARING WATER DRAINS, REMOVING DOWN TREES FROM THE TRAIL AND REMOVING IMPEDIMENTS FROM THE TRAIL SURFACE.THIS PROJECT WILL REQUIRE BOTH FRONTCOUNTRY AND BACKCOUNTRY CAMPING DEPENDING ON THE VARIOUS PROJECT LOCATIONS.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:SEVERAL MILES OF PARK HIKING TRAIL WILL BE REPAIRED THROUGH TRAIL INFRASTRUCTURE REPAIRS COMPLETED BY THE WORK CREWS. WORK CREWS WILL OBTAIN VALUABLE EXPERIENCE WORKING ALONGSIDE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE TRAIL CREWS.THE TRAILS WILL BE RE-OPENED ONCE REPAIRED.BENEFICIARIES:THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT SEVERAL STAKEHOLDERS AND PARTIES:THE YOUTH WORK CREWS THAT WORK UNDER THIS AGREEMENT WILL OBTAIN VALUABLE EXPERIENCE IN TRAIL CONSTRUCTION AND REPAIRS

FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: P-P-YOUTH-22-005PURPOSE OF AWARD:THE RECIPIENT WILL SELECT AND OVERSEE QUALIFIED AND MOTIVATED UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE STUDENTS TO WORK ALONGSIDE NPS STAFF IN THE CULTURAL RESOURCES, INTERPRETATION, AND RELATED FIELDS IN DIFFERENT PARK UNITS/PROGRAMS AND FEDERAL OFFICES THROUGHOUT THE NATION.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:WORKS WITH NPS CULTURAL RESOURCES STAFF ON CULTURAL LANDSCAPE AND HISTORIC STRUCTURE INVENTORY INFORMATION THAT IS STORED IN THE CULTURAL RESOURCES INVENTORY SYSTEM DATABASE. INTERNS WILL BE BASED EITHER IN PARKS OR REGIONAL OFFICES. WORK INCLUDES FIELD INVESTIGATION, RESEARCH, ANALYSIS, AND WRITING OF HISTORIC LANDSCAPES, BUILDINGS, AND STRUCTURES WITH A TEAM OF CULTURAL RESOURCE PROFESSIONALS. DUTIES INCLUDE WRITING NARRATIVE DESCRIPTIONS, TAKING PHOTOS, COLLECTING GPS DATA, WRITING DESCRIPTIONS OF RESOURCES, AND ENTERING TEXT AND PHOTOS INTO DATABASES. KNOWLEDGE OF REGIONAL HISTORY, NATIONAL REGISTER CRITERIA, ARCHITECTURE, LANDSCAPE ARCHITECTURE, AND HISTORIC PRESERVATION ARE PREFERRED.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:INTERN(S) WILL BE RECRUITED, SELECTED, AND COMPLETE THEIR TERMS AS FEASIBLE. FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: P-P-YOUTH-22-005PURPOSE OF AWARD:THE RECIPIENT WILL SELECT AND OVERSEE QUALIFIED AND MOTIVATED UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE STUDENTS TO WORK ALONGSIDE NPS STAFF IN THE CULTURAL RESOURCES, INTERPRETATION, AND RELATED FIELDS IN DIFFERENT PARK UNITS/PROGRAMS AND FEDERAL OFFICES THROUGHOUT THE NATION.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THIS PROJECT HAS A THREEFOLD APPROACH THAT INVOLVES 1) ENGAGING THE DIRECT DESCENDANTS OF KATMAI VILLAGE (NOW INCORPORATED IN KATMAI NATIONAL PARK & PRESERVE) IN THE EXPLORATION AND MANAGEMENT OF THEIR HISTORY AND HERITAGE, 2) DOCUMENTING CULTURAL RESOURCES IN REMOTE SUBARCTIC ENVIRONMENTS USING A MAGNETIC GRADIOMETER, AND 3) PERFORMING SMALL TEST EXCAVATIONS AT THE SITE OF KATMAI VILLAGE TO EXPLORE THE LONG-TERM RESILIENCY OF ALASKA PENINSULA COMMUNITIES.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:INTERN(S) WILL BE RECRUITED, SELECTED, AND COMPLETE THEIR TERMS AS FEASIBLE. THIS CORPS TEAM WILL SERVE WITH THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE AT LAKE CLARK NATIONAL PARK AND PRESERVE. LAKE CLARK IS LOCATED IN SOUTHWEST ALASKA. THIS TEAM WILL BE BASED OUT OF PT. ALSWORTH. THE PROJECTS FOR THIS CREW WILL INCLUDE BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO TRAIL MAINTENCE AND STRUCTURE PROJECTS FOR 12 WEEKS.THIS TASK AGREEMENT SPECIFIES A PARTNERSHIP PROJECT BETWEEN THE NPS AND THE SCA WHICH INVOLVES PLACEMENT OF ONE CORE TRAIL CREW AT LAKE CLARK NATIONAL PARK AND PRESERVE WITHIN THE DIVISION OF FACILITY MAINTENANCE TO PARTICIPATE IN THE PARK'S MAINTENANCE PROGRAMS.FOUR MILES OF EXISTING TRAIL IN THE UPPER TWIN LAKES TRAIL SYSTEM WILL BE BRUSHED TO FACILITATE VISITOR HIKING EXPERIENCE. THE 4 MILES WILL INCLUDE 3 MILES FOR THE HOPE CREEK AND TEETERING ROCK TRAILS, AND 1 MILE OF TRAIL AROUND THE RICHARD PROENNEKE CABIN SITE. A VARIETY OF HAND-TOOLS WILL BE USED FOR CLEARING VEGETATION FROM THE VARIOUS TRAILS. THE REMOTE NATURE OF THIS SITE WILL REQUIRE THE CREW TO LIVE IN TENTS FOR THE DURATION OF THIS WORK. THE NPS WILL PROVIDE STAFF AND SUPERVISION ON-SITE.ADDITIONALLY, THE TANALIAN FALLS AND TANALIAN MOUNTAIN TRAILS WILL BE BRUSHED AND BOARDWALK TREAD REPLACED WHERE NEEDED. IF DETERMINED TO BE NEEDED, DRAINAGE BARS WILL BE INSTALLED TO REDUCE THE POTENTIAL FOR EROSION. DOWNED VEGETATION WILL BE REMOVED TO CLEAR THE TRAILS OF OBSTRUCTIONS.LEARN HOW TO SAFELY AND EFFICIENTLY USE HAND-TOOLS.LEARN THE BASIC AND ADVANCED ASPECTS OF TRAIL DESIGN, CONSTRUCTION, AND MAINTENANCE.LIVE AND WORK IN A REMOTE FIELD CAMP FOR AN EXTENDED PERIOD OF TIME.RECEIVE EDUCATIONAL TRAINING ON CULTURAL RESOURCES, NATURAL RESOURCES, AND BEAR SAFETY.

PURPOSE OF AWARDTHE PURPOSE OF THIS AGREEMENT ARE TO WORK WITH DIVERSE, UNDERSERVED AND UNDERREPRESENTED CHILDREN, YOUTH AND YOUNG ADULTS TO DEVELOP AND NURTURE ENTHUSIASTIC AND RESPONSIBLE ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDS. PROJECT STATEMENT - PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO RESOURCE EDUCATION PROGRAMS TO OUR VISITORS TO GRSM. PROGRAMS PRESENTED BY THE INTERNS WILL BE ON THE GRSM'S NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES. INTERNS MAY PERFORM BOTH FORMAL AND INFORMAL PROGRAMS INCLUDING WALK, TALK, AND JR RANGER PROGRAMS AND PERFORM INFORMAL ROVING INTERPRETATION AT SEVERAL SITES WITHIN GREAT SMOKY MOUNTAIN NATIONAL PARK (GRSM).PERFORMANCE GOALS - THE OVERARCHING GOAL IS TO PROVIDE A GATEWAY TO LIFELONG ENGAGEMENT IN NPS STEWARDSHIP. TO BE RELEVANT, INTERNS WILL ENGAGE IN PROJECTS THAT WILL INCREASE OPPORTUNITIES FOR PEOPLE TO LEARN ABOUT AND ENJOY PARKS WITH A FOCUS ON DIVERSE AUDIENCES THAT MAY NOT TRADITIONALLY VISIT NATIONAL PARKS. KEY TO THIS GOAL IS THE FOCUS ON EDUCATING THE COMMUNITY THROUGH INTERNSHIPS BY PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES FOR PERSONAL, ACADEMIC AND PROFESSIONAL GROWTH RELATED TO NPS RESOURCES.PERFORMANCE OBJECTIVES -OBJECTIVE 1: PROVIDE VISITOR ORIENTATION AND RECREATION INFORMATION SERVICES AT VISITOR CENTERS AND BUSY AREAS IN THE PARK THAT MEET THE DIVISION OF RESOURCE EDUCATION'S PROGRAMMATIC GOALS. OBJECTIVE 2: PROVIDE POP-UP (UNSCHEDULED) PROGRAMS AT BUSY AREAS OF THE PARK AS DESIGNATED BY THE DISTRICT LEAD RESOURCE EDUCATION RANGEROBJECTIVE 3: LEARN ABOUT OTHER PARK SERVICE CAREERS BY ASSISTING WITH THE WORK OF OTHER DIVISIONS BASED ON THE PERSONAL INTEREST OF THE INTERN. OBJECTIVE 4: PARTICIPATE IN APPROXIMATELY 2-WEEKS OF TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES THROUGHOUT THE INTERNSHIP THAT WILL PROVIDE CONTENT FOR PROGRAMS AND INFORMATIONAL SERVICES AS WELL AS ADVICE ON NAVIGATING THE FEDERAL HIRING SYSTEM. TRAINING WILL INCLUDE TECHNIQUES ON HOW TO ENGAGE AUTHENTICALLY WITH DIVERSE AUDIENCES AND INFORMATION THAT RELATES TO THE UNDER-REPRESENTED STORIES AND EXPERIENCES OF SMOKIES INHABITANTS. PURPOSE OF AWARD:THIS PROJECT ENGAGES A YOUNG ADULT IN A JOB EXPERIENCE AS AN INTERPRETER WHERE THEY WILL RESEARCH, AND AMPLIFY THE STORIES OF THE WOMEN WHO HELPED SHAPE SHENANDOAH AND HELD NATIONAL SIGNIFICANCE. AS THE INTERN GAINS JOB SKILLS AND APPRECIATION OF CULTURAL RESOURCES AND PUBLIC LANDS HE/SHE/THEY WILL ADD TO THE RICH TROVE OF UNTOLD STORIES THAT EXIST HERE AND ENHANCE OPPORTUNITIES FOR SHENANDOAH NATIONAL PARK TO SHARE THESE WOMEN'S STORIES WITH THE PUBLIC. .SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: THE INTERN WILL WORK 40 HOURS PER WEEK FOR A 18-WEEK TERM ON A PROJECT TO RESEARCH AND SHARE FINDINGS ON WOMEN WHO WERE IMPORTANT TO SHENANDOAH AND TO THE NATION. THE INTERN WILL DELIVER TALKS, CREATE A TOUR SCRIPT FOR THE PARK'S APP AND HELP WITH EVENTS AND LEARN TO ORGANIZE AND PREPARE MATERIALS FOR INCLUSION THE PARK'S ARCHIVES. PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:ASSISTS IN MANAGING THE "WOMEN OF SKYLAND" EXHIBIT IN MASSANUTTEN LODGE AT SKYLAND. MASSANUTTEN LODGE CONDUCTS ADDITIONAL RESEARCH AND SHARES FINDINGS CREATES A TOUR SCRIPT TO ADD TO SHENANDOAH'S APP SO THAT THOSE WHO CANNOT VISIT DURING OPEN HOUSE HOURS CAN LEARN THE STORIES OF HISTORIC SKYLAND AND THE WOMEN WHO GATHERED THERE. CONDUCTS NEW RESEARCH ON TWO ADDITIONAL WOMEN WHO WERE IMPORTANT TO SHENANDOAH AND TO THE NATION, LOU HENRY HOOVER AND MITTIE TUTT, FOR INCLUSION IN UPCOMING PROJECTS AND INTERPRETIVE PRODUCTS. ORGANIZES ALL RESEARCH MATERIALS FOR INCLUSION IN SHENANDOAH'S ARCHIVES TO PRESERVE THESE STORIES AND MAKE THEM ACCESSIBLE TO FUTURE INTERPRETERS AND RESEARCHERS.BENEFICIARIES:THE INTERN AND PUBLIC WILL BENEFIT FROM THIS PROJECT, THE YOUTH GAINS VALUABLE JOB SKILLS AS THEY LEARN ABOUT THE MANAGEMENT AND STEWARDSHIP OF PUBLIC LANDS AND RESOURCES WHILE WORKING IN SHENANDOAH NATIONAL PARK. THIS PROJECT PROVIDES THE INTERN WITH AN UNDERSTANDING AND APPRECIATION FOR CONSERVATION EFFORTS AS WELL AS DEVELOPING LEADERSHIP SKILLS THAT CAN TRANSFER TO REAL WORLD SITUATIONS AND FUTURE JOB OPPORTUNITIES AND RESPONSIBLE CITIZENSHIP. THE GENERAL PUBLIC WILL ALSO BENEFIT DIRECTLY FROM HAVING GREATER, MORE FREQUENT ACCESS TO MASSANUTTEN LODGE AND THROUGH THE LAUNCH OF THE TOURS CREATED BY THIS POSITION AND THROUGH ACCESS TO THE ADDITIONAL RESEARCH COMPILED.

THIS PROJECT WILL EDUCATE AND TRAIN YOUTH CREW MEMBERS PROVIDING THEM DIRECT TECHNICAL EXPERIENCE WITH A WIDE RANGE OF LANDSCAPE RESTORATION ACTIVITIES. ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE MANAGEMENT AND CONTROL OF INVASIVE NON-NATIVE PLANTS, NATIVE HABITAT RESTORATION, AND ACTIVE FUEL MITIGATION AND MANAGEMENT AT MULTIPLE NATIONAL PARKS IN THE SIERRA NEVADA AREA OF CALIFORNIA. THESE PARKS MAY INCLUDE YOSEMITE NATIONAL PARK, DEVIL'S POSTPILE NATIONAL MONUMENT, AND SEQUOIA AND KINGS CANYON NATIONAL PARKS. THIS PARTNERSHIP WILL PROVIDE COACHING FOR YOUTH TO ATTAIN FUTURE EMPLOYMENT WITH FEDERAL LAND MANAGEMENT AGENCIES. IT WILL ALSO PROVIDE OUTDOOR OPPORTUNITIES IN NATIONAL PARKS FOR YOUTH FROM UNDERREPRESENTED COMMUNITIES. PROJECT WORK WILL PROMOTE THE PRESERVATION OF NATIVE PLANT AND ANIMAL BIODIVERSITY AND PROMOTE FOREST HEALTH, PROTECTING VALUES AT-RISK BY REDUCING FUEL LOADING AND OVERGROWN FORESTS SUSCEPTIBLE TO FOREST MORTALITY.

THE RECIPIENT WILL SELECT AND OVERSEE QUALIFIED AND MOTIVATED UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE STUDENTS TO WORK ALONGSIDE NPS STAFF IN THE CULTURAL RESOURCES, INTERPRETATION, AND RELATED FIELDS IN DIFFERENT PARK UNITS/PROGRAMS AND FEDERAL OFFICES THROUGHOUT THE NATION. SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: THE ACE ARCHEOLOGY MEMBER WILL PREPARE DOCUMENTATION OF TWO PREHISTORIC ARCHEOLOGICAL SITES WITHIN PARK BOUNDARIES IN ACCORDANCE WITH SECTION 110 OF THE NATIONAL HISTORIC PRESERVATION ACT. DUTIES INCLUDE CONDUCTING HISTORICAL RESEARCH USING PRIMARY AND SECONDARY SOURCES; CONDUCTING ON-SITE VISITS OF EACH ARCHEOLOGICAL SITE; PREPARING COMPLETE, ACCURATE, AND RELIABLE SECTION 110 DETERMINATIONS OF ELIGIBILITY (DOE) COMPLETED IN ACCORDANCE WITH NATIONAL REGISTER OF HISTORIC PLACES BULLETINS AND MARYLAND HISTORIC TRUST (MHT) DOE GUIDELINES; PREPARING SUBMISSIONS TO THE STATE HISTORIC PRESERVATION OFFICE (MHT); AND PRESENTING FINDINGS TO PARK AND REGIONAL STAFF. PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: INTERN(S) WILL BE RECRUITED, SELECTED, AND COMPLETE THEIR TERMS AS FEASIBLE. INTERNS WILL COMPLETE TASKS OUTLINED IN THE SCOPE OF WORK.

THE SCIENTISTS IN PARKS PROGRAM PROVIDES OPPORTUNITIES FOR PARTICIPANTS TO MEET NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT NEEDS IN NATIONAL PARK UNITS, ADVANCE THEIR ACADEMIC AND PROFESSIONAL GOALS, INCREASE DIVERSITY AND INCLUSION WITHIN NATURAL RESOURCE FIELDS OF THE NPS, AND FOSTER LIFE-LONG CONNECTIONS TO NATIONAL PARK RESOURCES.COMPLETE INTERNSHIP PROJECTS IN NATIONAL PARK UNITS THAT ADDRESS NATURAL RESOURCE ISSUES OF THE NATIONAL PARK SYSTEM. THE OBJECTIVES AND OUTCOMES FOR EACH PROJECT ARE DEFINED BY THE BENEFITING NPS UNIT THAT HOSTS THE INTERN.

INTERN WORK WILL INCREASE VOLUNTEER CAPACITY; INCREASE THE AMOUNT OF SIGNING COMPLETED IN A YEAR; INCREASE PUBLIC KNOWLEDGE OF/ACCESS TO NHT SITES AND SEGMENTS; AND PROVIDE THE INTERN OPPORTUNITIES FOR PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE AND SKILL DEVELOPMENT.BENEFICIARIES:BOTH THE NPS AND THE INTERN WILL BENEFIT FROM THIS POSITION.

DURING A TYPICAL INTERNSHIP, YOU'LL HONE PUBLIC SPEAKING AND COMMUNICATION SKILLS BY PROVIDING ORIENTATION AND SAFETY INFORMATION AND PARK FEE/PASS SERVICES TO VISITORS AT THE VISITOR CENTER, CHECK STATION OR OVER THE PHONE (40%), DEVELOP ORIGINAL, FORMAL INTERPRETIVE/EDUCATION PROGRAMS SUCH AS A TRAIL HIKE, CAMPGROUND PROGRAM AND PRESENT IN-PERSON PROGRAMS FOR VISITORS (25%), PROJECT WORK TO SUSTAIN INTERPRETATION TEAM OPERATIONS AND ACTIVITIES (20%), AND ROVE/HIKE PARK TRAILS TO MAKE INFORMAL VISITOR CONTACTS (15%). ADDITIONALLY, THE PARTICIPANT WILL WORK COLLABORATIVELY WITH OTHER INTERPRETERS TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE PARK'S SOCIAL MEDIA OUTREACH PROGRAM, TRYING TO CONNECT VIRTUAL VISITORS WITH DENALI. DURING PROJECT TIME, THE PARTICIPANT WILL ASSIST WITH ELECTRONIC REQUESTS FOR PARK INFORMATION, HELP WITH DATA COLLECTION EFFORTS TO MONITOR VEHICLE IMPACTS TO THE DENALI PARK ROAD AT THE CHECK STATION, AND COMPLETE OTHER TASKS DEPENDING ON INTERPRETATION TEAM NEEDS AND THE PARTICIPANT'S INTERESTS.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD: WILL INVOLVE WORK ON THE PARK BOARDWALKS, REPAIRS TO A BRIDGE, INSTALLATION OF STEPS AND MINOR TRAIL MAINTENANCE AT FLORISSANT FOSSIL BEDS NATIONAL MONUMENT.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE PROJECT WORK WILL REPLACE APPROXIMATELY 4 BOARDWALKS, REPLACE HANDRAILS, BOARDS ON THE WALKWAY AND HELP BUILD STEPS UP TO A NEW LOOKOUT POINT IN THE PARK. THE CREWS WILL ALSO HELP WORK ON TRAIL MAINTENANCE IN THESE AREAS TO REHABILITATE THE AREAS.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE GOALS OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE ASSISTING WITH THE REPLACEMENT OF 4 BOARDWALKS PARKWIDE, REPAIRS TO A BRIDGE, STEPS GOING TO A LOOKOUT VANTAGE POINT IN THE PARK AND SOME MINOR TRAIL MAINTENANCE. THE PROJECT WILL INCLUDE THE CREW MENTORING, CAREER EXPLORATION IN THE OUTDOORS, ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION AND RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES INCLUDING HIKING.BENEFICIARIES:THE PROJECT WILL PROVIDE MEANINGFUL LIFE AND WORK EXPERIENCE AND TRAINING; LAND AND RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP EDUCATION AND APPRECIATION; TECHNICAL, SAFETY AND TEAMBUILDING OPPORTUNITIES TO YOUNG ADULTS.

COMPETITIVE AWARD AGREEMENT REQUIREMENTSFUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: N/AFUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT: N/AREQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSPURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE A LEARNING OPPORTUNITY FOR NATIVE AMERICAN YOUTH WHILE PERFORMING PRESERVATION MAINTENANCE AT SEVERAL PREHISTORIC STRUCTURES AT WALNUT CANYON AND WUPATKI NATIONAL MONUMENTS. SPECIFICALLY, THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE A SUSTAINED OPPORTUNITY TO LEARN FROM NATIONAL PARK SERVICE NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE MANAGERS AND ARCHEOLOGISTS. LEARNING TOPICS INCLUDE THE MISSION OF THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE AND ITS INFLUENCE ON THE DESIGN AND IMPLEMENTATION OF PRESERVATION PROJECTS, VARIOUS CHALLENGES FACING PUBLIC LAND MANAGERS (SPECIFICALLY THE THREE NATIONAL MONUMENTS SURROUNDING FLAGSTAFF, AZ) IN MEETING THE AGENCY'S MISSION, AND TECHNICAL FIELD SKILLS IN HISTORIC PRESERVATION. AS PART OF ORIENTATION AND DURING FOUR EDUCATION DAYS, PARTICIPATING YOUTH WILL LEARN ABOUT HUMAN HISTORY AND VARIOUS ARCHEOLOGICAL SITES, WILDLIFE FOUND IN EACH OF THE THREE MONUMENTS, AND THE AREA'S GEOLOGY AND HYDROLOGY. PARTICIPATING YOUTH WILL ALSO LEARN FROM CURRENT NATIONAL PARK SERVICE EMPLOYEES ABOUT VARIOUS CAREERS IN THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT, REQUIREMENTS FOR SPECIALIZED FIELDS, SUCH AS ARCHEOLOGY, AND HOW TO EFFECTIVELY APPLY AND COMPETE FOR FEDERAL JOBS.PARTICIPATING YOUTH WILL DEVELOP RESOURCE MANAGEMENT ETHICS WHILE LEARNING FROM PARK EMPLOYEES WHILE ENGAGED IN PROJECT TASKS. FOR EXAMPLE, PARTICIPATING YOUTH WILL LEARN HOW THEIR PROJECT WAS DESIGNED TO ACCOUNT FOR AND MINIMIZE THE IMPACT OF DOING PRESERVATION WORK ON NATURAL RESOURCES SURROUNDING EACH SITE.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE PROJECT WILL INCLUDE CONDUCTING PRESERVATION MAINTENANCE AND ELIMINATING DEFERRED MAINTENANCE ON STANDING PREHISTORIC ARCHITECTURAL REMAINS AT WALNUT CANYON NATIONAL MONUMENT AND WUPATKI NATIONAL MONUMENT. WORK SITES INCLUDE 900-YEAR-OLD FRONT AND BACKCOUNTRY PUEBLOS AT WALNUT CANYON AND WUPATKI NATIONAL MONUMENTS. PRESERVATION MAINTENANCE INCLUDES REPOINTING ERODED MORTAR JOINTS, RESETTING LOOSE WALL STONES, RESETTING WALL CAPS, CLEANING WATER DRAINS, AND VEGETATION REHABILITATION. NATIONAL PARK SERVICE PRESERVATION SPECIALISTS WILL PROVIDE ORIENTATION, TRAINING, AND OVERSEE DAILY ACTIVITIES. ALL WORK WILL BE THOROUGHLY DOCUMENTED AND PHOTOGRAPHED. THE CONSERVATION LEGACY CREW WILL BE TRAINED IN BOTH HANDS-ON TREATMENTS AND DOCUMENTATION METHODS.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:CONSERVATION LEGACY WILL RECRUIT AND SELECT CREW MEMBERS DURING THE SPRING OF 2022. CONSERVATION LEGACY WILL CONDUCT A WEEK-LONG TRAINING AND ORIENTATION. THE NPS WILL CONDUCT AN ORIENTATION AND TRAINING WITH THE CREW AND OVERSEE FOUR WEEKS OF PRESERVATION MAINTENANCE FIELDWORK AT WALNUT CANYON NATIONAL MONUMENT AND WUPATKI NATIONAL MONUMENT. THE CREW WILL COMPLETE FIELDWORK ON AUGUST 26, 2022. THE NPS WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR COMPLETING A DETAILED SUMMARY REPORT OF PRESERVATION MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES.BENEFICIARIES:PRIVATE NON-PROFIT INSTITUTIONS AND ORGANIZATIONS; PUBLIC AND PRIVATE NON-PROFIT ACADEMIC INSTITUTIONS; STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENT AGENCIES; QUASI-PUBLIC NON-PROFIT INSTITUTIONS AND ORGANIZATIONS THAT SUPPORT YOUTH AND YOUNG ADULT CAREER TRAINING AND DEVELOPMENT, AND EDUCATION IN THE AREAS OF NATURAL AND/OR CULTURAL RESOURCE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT. INDIVIDUALS/FAMILIES; STUDENTS; AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC WILL RECEIVE A BENEFIT FROM THE DEVELOPMENT AND EXECUTION OF THESE PROGRAMS AND PROJECTS.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THE PRINCIPAL PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE HANDS-ON SERVICE OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUTH IN NATIONAL PARKS AND PUBLIC LANDS. THIS PROJECT PROMOTES GREATER PUBLIC AND PRIVATE PARTNERSHIP IN CONSERVATION AND ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP PROGRAMS AND ACTIVITIES.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT WILL WORK WITH YOUTH SERVICE ORGANIZATIONS TO COMPLETE FOUR TRAIL REHABILITATION PROJECTS ALONG THE APPALACHIAN NATIONAL SCENIC TRAIL IN THE STATES OF MAINE, VERMONT, CONNECTICUT, AND MASSACHUSETTS. YOUTH WILL RECEIVE TRAINING TO ADDRESS DEFERRED MAINTENANCE NEEDS, INCLUDING MINOR TRAIL RELOCATIONS AND THE INSTALLATION, REPAIR, AND REPLACEMENT OF CRITICAL TRAIL AND EROSION CONTROL STRUCTURES.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:REHABILITATION OF APPALACHIAN TRAIL TREADWAY IN MAINE SOUTH OF RT 4 BY SOUTH POND, IN VERMONT FROM LOWER COLD RIVER TO LOTTERY RD, IN CONNECTICUT AT TRAIL WEST CORNWALL NORTH, AND IN MASSACHUSETTS IN THE TYNE ROAD AND PITTSFIELD WATERSHED AREAS. WORK WILL REHABILITATE THE TREADWAY AND IMPROVE VISITOR SAFETY, MITIGATE RESOURCE DEGRADATION, AND REDUCE THE MAINTENANCE BACKLOG BY INSTALLING/REPLACING DRAINAGE AND EROSION CONTROL FEATURES INCLUDING WATERBARS, ROCK STEPS, STEP STONES, AND DRAINAGE DITCH.BENEFICIARIES:PRIMARY BENEFICIARIES ARE YOUTH CORPS PARTICIPANTS; PROJECT OUTCOMES WILL ALSO BENEFIT PARK VISITORS AND TRAIL HIKERS.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): THE "PEFO FENCE SUPPORT FY22" PROJECT WITH INVOLVE THE PLACEMENT OF ONE FENCE CREW TO PROVIDE BOUNDARY FENCE SUPPORT IN THE PLANNING AND MAINTENANCE OF THE BOUNDARY FENCE AT PETRIFIED FOREST NATIONAL PARK.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: THE FENCE CREW WILL ASSIST THE PARK BY PROVIDING MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES ON BOUNDARY FENCES TO INCLUDE BOTH THE INSTALLATION AND REMOVAL OF FENCING.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:CONDUCT FENCE CONDITION ASSESSMENTS ALONG THE 19 MILES OF NORTH AND NORTHWESTERN PARK BOUNDARY.MAKE FENCE REPAIRS ALONG THE 19 MILES OF NORTH AND NORTHWESTERN PARK BOUNDARY.REMOVE FENCING ALONG THE PARK'S ORIGINAL WESTERN BOUNDARY.MAKE FENCE REPAIRS AND/OR REPLACEMENT ON THE SOUTH AND SOUTHWESTERN PARK BOUNDARY.BENEFICIARIES: THIS PROJECT WILL SUPPORT YOUNG ADULTS BY SUPPORTING AND STIMULATING WORK, EDUCATION, AND TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES IN PETRIFIED FOREST NATIONAL PARK, NEAR HOLBROOK, ARIZONA.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THIS TASK AGREEMENT AIMS TO PROMOTE AND STIMULATE EDUCATION, JOB TRAINING, AND DEVELOPMENT OF RESPONSIBLE CITIZENSHIP, PRODUCTIVE COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT, AND FURTHERING THE UNDERSTANDING, APPRECIATION, AND CONSERVATION OF NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES. THE PROGRAM WILL MOTIVATE YOUTH AND YOUNG ADULTS WITH CONSERVATION LEGACY TO BE INVOLVED WITH THE NATURAL, CULTURAL, AND HISTORICAL RESOURCE PROTECTION OF THEIR COMMUNITIES AND BEYOND. IN ADDITION, IT WILL PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUTH AND WILL INSPIRE YOUNG PEOPLE TO LEARN, SERVE, AND ENJOY WORKING IN THE GREAT OUTDOORS.THIS TASK AGREEMENT CONTINUES THE LONGSTANDING EFFORTS FOR THE NPS TO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR PUBLIC SERVICE YOUTH EMPLOYMENT, MINORITY YOUTH DEVELOPMENT AND TRAINING, AND THE PARTICIPATION OF LOCAL YOUTH IN ACCOMPLISHING CONSERVATION-RELATED WORK WHICH CLEARLY REPRESENTS A PUBLIC BENEFIT. THIS PROJECT SERVES THE PUBLIC BY DELINEATING TRAILS AND MAINTAINING THE INTEGRITY OF THE TRAIL SYSTEM IN THE PIEDRAS MARCADAS CANYON AREA AND IMPLEMENTS COMPONENTS OF THE RECENTLY APPROVED VISITOR USE MANAGEMENT PLANNING EFFORT. PROJECT WORK WILL ALSO INCLUDE REMOVING VEGETATION ALONG THE MONUMENT'S FENCE LINE, THEREBY MINIMIZING THE RISK OF UNWANTED FIRE THAT COULD AFFECT ADJACENT NEIGHBORHOODS AND MONUMENT RESOURCES. REPAIRS TO BOUNDARY FENCING WILL BETTER IDENTIFY THE MONUMENT'S BOUNDARY AND PROTECT RESOURCES. ENSURING THE INTEGRITY OF THE CYCLITRAIL SYSTEM AND BOUNDARY FENCING PROVIDES THE PUBLIC WITH AN AESTHETICALLY PLEASING AND SAFE ENVIRONMENT IN WHICH THEY CAN BETTER ENJOY THE MONUMENT.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE YOUTH CORPS WILL INSTALL METAL ANCHOR EYE RODS AND WIRE ROPE CABLE AND SIGNAGE ALONG TRAILS WITHIN THE PIEDRAS MARCADAS CANYON AREA, TO BETTER DELINEATE THE ROUTE, PROTECT MONUMENT RESOURCES, AND REDUCE THE POTENTIAL FOR VISITORS TO BECOME LOST OR DISORIENTED. THE YOUTH CORPS WILL ALSO PERFORM CYCLIC BRUSH CLEARING AND FENCE REPAIRS ALONG THE MONUMENT'S BOUNDARY FENCING TO REMOVE WEEDY VEGETATION AND ENSURE THE FENCING IS STABLE AND EFFECTIVE. THIS WORK WILL HELP TO PROTECT THE MONUMENT'S NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES AND PROVIDE FOR VISITOR USE AND ENJOYMENT. FIVE YOUTH PARTICIPANTS AND YOUNG ADULTS SELECTED FOR THIS PROGRAM WILL WORK CLOSELY WITH CONSERVATION LEGACY'S PROGRAM COORDINATOR, AND WITH NPS STAFF ON A DAY-TO-DAY BASIS, RECEIVING MENTORING AND SUPPORT.BENEFICIARIES: YOUTH CORPS PARTICIPANTS, PETROGLYPH NATIONAL MONUMENT, VISITORS

THE WOMEN'S FIRE CREW (WFC) PROGRAM WILL TRAIN AND DEVELOP 6 WOMEN IN WILDLAND FIRE OPERATION AND WORK ON ACTIVE FUELS MANAGEMENT PROJECTS IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE FIRE AND AVIATION PROGRAM IN DOI REGION 6,7, & 8. WOMEN WILL BE HIRED BY MONTANA CONSERVATION CORP AND BE BASED OUT OF BOZEMAN, MT; THEY WILL HELP COMPLETE PROJECTS BETWEEN MAY 17 AND AUGUST 9 TO REDUCE THE RISK OF WILDLAND FIRES AND PROTECT PARK VALUES AT PARKS IN THE WYOMING PARK GROUP (GRAND TETON NATIONAL PARK, JOHN D. FOREST COMMUNITIES WILL BE MORE RESILIENT TO DISTURBANCES, SUCH AS WILDFIRE, WHICH WILL IMPROVE THE SAFETY OF THE VISITING PUBLIC AND PARK INFRASTRUCTURE.THE PUBLIC WILL BENEFIT FROM THE IMPROVEMENT OF PARK NATURAL LANDSCAPES.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): THE OBJECTIVES INCLUDE REPOINTING ALL 5 WALLS (4 EXTERIOR, 1 INTERIOR) AND OTHER ARCHITECTURAL FEATURES FOR A TOTAL OF ABOUT 200 SQUARE FEET OF TREATMENTS. AN NPS EL MORRO AND EL MALPAIS NATIONAL MONUMENTS (ELMAO) VANISHING TREASURES (VT) CREW WILL ASSIST THE ALCC CREW AT THE BEGINNING OF THE PROJECT TO PROVIDE TRAINING IN THE USE OF SPECIALIZED HISTORIC PRESERVATION TECHNIQUES. THIS SUPPORTS ALCC'S TRAINING AND EDUCATION GOALS FOR HISTORIC PRESERVATION FIELD CREWS. FOLLOWING THE COMPLETION OF THE FIELDWORK, A STANDARD VT REPORT WILL BE PRODUCED FROM THE ALCC'S WORK BY ELMAO STAFF DOCUMENTING PRE-TREATMENT ARCHITECTURAL CONDITION, TREATMENTS ACTIONS, RESULTS, AND ANNUAL MAINTENANCE RECOMMENDATIONS.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: THE RECIPIENT AGREES TO PROVIDE A 4-PERSON YOUTH CREW CONSISTING OF 3 CREW MEMBERS AND 1 CREW LEADER TO CONDUCT HISTORIC PRESERVATION TREATMENTS TO THE 19TH CENTURY ALBEN HOMESTEAD.1. THE CREW WILL REPOINT MASONRY WALLS AND REPAIR DAMAGED MASONRY UNITS AND DAMAGE TO WALLS AND ARCHITECTURAL FEATURES CAUSED BY PRECIPITATION, RODENT BURROWING, AND EROSION FROM VISITOR USE TRAIL.2. THE CREW WILL REPAIR AND\OR REPLACE HARD MORTARS (CONCRETE) FROM PREVIOUS STABILIZATION PROJECTS WITH DURABLE AND MORE EFFECTIVE AMENDED MUD MORTAR.3. THE CREW WILL PREPARE MORTAR MIXES TO MATCH THE COLOR AND TEXTURE OF EXISTING AND ORIGINAL MORTAR IN THE WALLS. MORTAR RECIPES WILL BE DOCUMENTED ALONG WITH THEIR LOCATION OF USE. MORTAR RECIPES WILL CONTAIN MICRO-GLASS BEADS TO DISTINGUISH THEM FROM FABRIC ORIGINAL TO THE STRUCTURE.4. THE CREW WILL DOCUMENT ALL WORK ACTIVITIES (E.G., REPOINTING, REPAIRING VOIDS, REPLACING MASONRY) IN FIELD NOTES, WITH DIGITAL PHOTOGRAPHS, AND MAPS AND\OR DRAWINGS. ALL FIELD NOTES, PHOTOS, AND ILLUSTRATIONS WILL BE MAINTAINED DAILY AND TRANSFERRED TO NPS VT STAFF AT THE END OF THE PROJECT.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS PROJECT WILL UTILIZE YOUTH CREWS FROM THE NONPROFIT CONSERVATION LEGACY'S ANCESTRAL LANDS CONSERVATION CORPS (ALCC) TO TACKLE DEFERRED MAINTENANCE TREATMENTS AT THE ALBEN HOMESTEAD, EL MALPAIS NATIONAL MONUMENT. THE RECOMMENDED PRESERVATION TREATMENTS FOR THE SITE CONSISTS ALMOST ENTIRELY (ABOUT 98 PERCENT) OF REPOINTING COMBINED WITH MINIMAL REPAIRS TO MASONRY WHERE RODENT BURROWING AND VISITOR TRAFFIC THREATEN ARCHITECTURAL INTEGRITY. THE PRESERVATION CREW WILL REPOINT AND REPAIR 4 WALLS AND 2 DOORWAYS. THE TREATMENTS WILL BRING THE WALLS AND ARCHITECTURAL FEATURES FOR THE ROOMS AT BOTH SITES UP TO GOOD, MAINTAINABLE CONDITION.BENEFICIARIES: YOUTH

ELIAS NATIONAL PARK AND PRESERVE. THE PROJECT SEEKS TO ENGAGE AND EDUCATE YOUTH WORKERS USING RESOURCE MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES WITHIN THE PARK, FOCUSING ON THE MAINTENANCE OF OUTDOOR RECREATIONAL FACILITIES SUCH AS TRAILS, WAYSIDES, AND CAMPING AREAS.PROJECT OBJECTIVES - THIS PROJECT PROPOSES ROUTINE "IN-KIND CYCLIC" MAINTENANCE, STABILIZATION AND REHABILITATION OF EXISTING TRAIL, WAYSIDE, AND CAMPING AREA FACILITIES LOCATED WITHIN WRANGELL-ST. ELIAS NATIONAL PARK AND PRESERVE.THIS PROJECT SEEKS TO ENGAGE AN SCA YOUTH CORP CREW IN PUBLIC RESOURCE MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES, AS WELL AS INCREASE THEIR UNDERSTANDING AND ENJOYMENT OF THE PARK AND ITS RESOURCES, BY APPLYING THEIR LABOR, SKILLS, AND TALENTS IN THE COMPLETION OF CYCLIC MAINTENANCE OF TRAILS, WAYSIDES, AND CAMPING AREAS AT WRANGELL-ST. ELIAS NATIONAL PARK & PRESERVE.THE CYCLIC TRAIL MAINTENANCE WORK PROPOSED IN THIS PROJECT INCLUDES: LOG-OUTS OF WINDFALL TREES, FELLING OF HAZARD TREES, TRIMMING VEGETATION TO STANDARD CORRIDOR WIDTHS/HEIGHTS, REMOVING BACK-SLOPE MATERIAL THAT HAS SLOUGHED ONTO THE TRAIL, CLEARING MATERIAL FROM DRAINS, CULVERTS, AND OTHER WATER-CONTROL STRUCTURES TO RETURN THEM TO FUNCTIONALITY, RESHAPING TREAD TO THE PROPER GEOMETRY TO SHED WATER, MAKING BASIC REPAIRS TO BRIDGES, BRIDGE ABUTMENTS, GABION, RETAINING WALLS, PUNCHEON, GEO-BLOCK, DURA-DECK, AND OTHER TREAD-HARDENING/CONSTRUCTED FEATURES, AS WELL AS MAKING BASIC REPAIRS TO INSTALLED SIGNS, KIOSKS, AND WAYSIDE/PARKING AREA FEATURES SUCH AS PICNIC TABLES, FIRE-RINGS, CAMPING AREAS, AND VAULT TOILETS.THIS SEASON'S PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON NABESNA ROAD CAMPING AREAS, WAYSIDES, AND TRAILHEADS, NUGGET CREEK TRAIL, ERIE MINE TRAIL, AND YOUNG CREEK TRAIL, BUT ANY AND ALL OF THE FOLLOWING TRAILS ARE POSSIBLE PROJECT LOCATIONS, DEPENDING ON TIMING AND NEED: JUMBO MINE, ERIE MINE, ROOT GLACIER, BONANZA MINE, WEST-SIDE KENNICOTT GLACIER, CRYSTALINE HILLS, GILAHINA WAYSIDE, NUGGET CRK, NUGGET CREEK (UPPER), DIXIE PASS, KOTSINA, BREMNER AIRSTRIP/BREMNER BUNKHOUSE TRAIL, BREMNER AIRSTRIP/GOLCONDA CREEK TRAIL, GLACIER CREEK CABIN TRAIL, AMPHITHEATER CABIN TRAIL, CARIBOU CREEK, SODA LAKE TRAIL, COPPER LAKE TRAIL, BOOMERANG LAKE TRAIL, VIKING LODGE TRAIL, TRAIL CREEK TRAIL, LOST CREEK TRAIL, TANADA LAKE TRAIL, SKOOKUM VOLCANO TRAIL, RAMBLER MINE TRAIL, REEVES FIELD TRAIL, JACKSINA CREEK TRAIL, MAY CREEK/COOK CABIN TRAIL, MAY CREEK/NIZINA RIVER TRAIL, MAY CREEK TO YOUNG CREEK TRAIL, CHITITU TRAIL, CHISANA AIRSTRIP TRAILS, AND COPPER CENTER HQ/VC INTERP TRAIL.

COMPETITIVE AWARD AGREEMENT REQUIREMENTSFUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: N/AFUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT: N/AREQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSPURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):NPS AND ACE CREWS WILL WORK AS A TEAM TO COMPLETE HISTORIC PRESERVATION AND STABILIZATION WORK ON THE PARKS PRIMARY VISITOR USE AREA, TRAIL REPAIR PARK-WIDE, AND FENCE REPAIR ALONG THE PARK'S BOUNDARY.THIS WORK WILL INCLUDE MIXING ADOBE-BASED MORTARS TO MATCH HISTORIC COLORS AND TEXTURES, APPLYING MORTARS TO HISTORIC WALLS TO PREVENT ENVIRONMENTAL DAMAGE. REPAIRING HISTORIC WALLS WITH ADOBE BLOCK IN A MANNER TO MATCH HISTORIC BUILDING METHODS. TRAIL REPAIR WILL INCLUDE BASIC HAND TOOL USE TO REDISTRIBUTE SOIL, REMOVE VEGETATION AND CREATE WALKING SURFACES. FENCE REPAIR WILL INCLUDE BASIC HAND TOOL USE TO REMOVE AND INSTALL WOODEN SPLIT-RAIL TYPE FENCING.TRAINING FOR BOTH TOOL USE AND PROPER MAINTENANCE TECHNIQUES WILL BE PROVIDED BY NPS STAFF. ON-SITE SAFETY BRIEFINGS WILL BE HELD DAILY. CREWS WILL SOMETIMES BE EXPECTED TO WORK AND LIVE IN BACK-COUNTRY STYLE CAMPS FOR UP TO NINE-DAY PERIODS WHILE PERFORMING MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES.PROJECT WORK WILL INCLUDE BUT IS NOT LIMITED TO THE FOLLOWING: HISTORIC MASONRY REPAIR, ADOBE BLOCK REPAIR, ADOBE MORTAR MIXING AND APPLICATION TO HISTORIC STRUCTURES, AND BASIC HAND TOOL USE.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:ADOBE STRUCTURE REPAIR AND STABILIZATION, MASONRY REPAIR, TRAIL REPAIR AND FENCE REPAIRPERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:PROJECT GOALS ARE REDUCING DEFERRED MAINTENANCE TO A HISTORIC STRUCTURE, FENCE REPAIR TO MAINTAIN PARK OWNED LIVESTOCK AND LIVESTOCK FACILITIES, AND TRAIL REPAIR TO PROVIDE UNIVERSAL ACCESS TO PARK VISITORS.MILESTONES WILL BE TO MITIGATE COVER THE ENTIRE STRUCTURE WITH ADOBE RENDER TO PREVENT WATER INTRUSION AND STRUCTURAL DAMAGE TO THE FORT, PROVIDE EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITY TO THE YOUTH GROUP STAFF, PROVIDE RECURRING MAINTENANCE TO STRUCTURE, AND DETERMINE BEST MANAGEMENT TECHNIQUES TO SUPPORT A NON-TRADITIONAL AMENDED ADOBE STRUCTURE.BENEFICIARIES:THIS PROJECT WILL DIRECTLY BENEFIT APPROXIMATELY 20,000 VISITORS ANNUALLY AT BENT'S OLD FORT - NHS. WORK WILL IMPROVE THE VISITOR EXPERIENCE BY PROVIDING A WELL MAINTAINED VISITOR USE AREA THAT IMPROVES IMMERSION, IMPROVES PHOTO OPPORTUNITIES, AND THE HISTORIC LIVING HISTORY PROGRAMS THAT THE PARK PROVIDES.THIS PROJECT WILL ALSO REDUCE THE PARK'S DEFERRED MAINTENANCE BACKLOG AND IMPROVE OVERALL CONDITIONS OF THE FACILITY, PROVIDING THE VISITING PUBLIC WITH A WELL-MAINTAINED FACILITY THAT EXHIBITS A STRONG SENSE OF STEWARDSHIP TO THE PROPERTIES PLACE WITHIN THE CARE OF THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE.ADDITIONALLY, WORKING WITH YOUTH GROUPS TO PERFORM MAINTENANCE WORK, AND TEACHING BASIC JOB SKILLS BENEFITS ALL AMERICAN'S BY TRAINING OUR FUTURE WORK FORCE.

THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO COMPLETE AQUATIC AND PHYSICAL SCIENCE MONITORING AT MULTIPLE NETWORK PARKS. THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT WILL BE TO COLLECT WATER QUALITY AND QUANTITY MEASUREMENTS, MACROINVERTEBRATE SAMPLES, EDNA AND CHANNEL CROSS-SECTION DATA AT 9 PARKS, INCLUDING FIELD DATA COLLECTION AND LABORATORY AND OFFICE PROCESSING OF DATA. IN ADDITION, THIS INTERNSHIP WILL SUPPORT OTHER PARK RESOURCE MONITORING EFFORTS (VEGETATION AND WILDLIFE) IN THESE UNITS.THE PUBLIC PURPOSE IS FOR COLLEGE-AGED INDIVIDUALS AND OTHER QUALIFIED PERSONS TO VOLUNTEER THEIR SERVICES IN EXCHANGE FOR TRAINING AND EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCE IN RESOURCE MONITORING PROGRAMS.

COMPETITIVE AWARD AGREEMENT REQUIREMENTSFUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: N/AFUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT: N/AREQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSPURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):STUDENT CONSERVATION ASSOCIATION INC WILL ASSIST FORT LARAMIE NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE WITH A VARIETY OF ONGOING DATA COLLECTION AND PRESERVATION EFFORTS RELATING TO THE VEGETATION AND ECOLOGICAL RESOURCES WITHIN THE PARK'S 833 ACRES. EXTENSIVE WORK WILL BE CONDUCTED TO IDENTIFY AND TREAT EXOTIC PLANT SPECIES IN AN EFFORT TO RESTORE NATIVE PLANT SPECIES FOR SUSTAINABLE ECOLOGICAL GROWTH.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THIS PROJECT WILL PRODUCE MATERIALS INCLUDE COLLECTING, MOUNTING AND CATALOGING OF PLANT SPECIMENS, MAPPING, MITIGATION, AND SURVEY THROUGHOUT THE PARKS 833 ACRES OF NATIVE AND INVASIVE PLANT SPECIES, PRODUCTION OF MAPS AND SHAPE FILES THROUGH ARCGIS, SUBMISSION OF SURVEY DATA INTO ARCCOLLECTOR, DEVELOPMENT AND DISTRIBUTION OF INTERPRETIVE BULLETINS HIGHLIGHTING THE PARK'S NATURAL RESOURCE THREATS AND CHALLENGES.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:FORT LARAMIE NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE ENCOMPASSES OVER 833 ACERS AND THE PARK CURRENTLY HAS IDENTIFIED OVER 30 INVASIVE SPECIES INFESTING NO LESS THAN 60% OF PARK LAND. SIGNIFICANT ENVIRONMENTAL CHANGES THROUGHOUT THE REGION, INCLUDING RECENT PERIODS OF DROUGHT, HAS RESULTED IN ECOLOGICAL THREAT RESPONSE DELAYS CAUSING IRREPARABLE RESOURCE DAMAGE, SUCH AS ALLOWING CHEATGRASS AND INVASIVE BROME SPREAD. NATURAL RESOURCE PROTECTION THERE IS NEED AT THIS PARK TO CONDUCT ADAPTIVE RESEARCH AND MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES. IN ORDER TO ADDRESS THESE ISSUES, THE PARTICIPANT WILL PRODUCE MATERIALS INCLUDE COLLECTING, MOUNTING AND CATALOGING OF PLANT SPECIMENS, MAPPING, MITIGATION, AND SURVEY THROUGHOUT THE PARKS 833 ACRES OF NATIVE AND INVASIVE PLANT SPECIES, PRODUCTION OF MAPS AND SHAPE FILES THROUGH ARCGIS, SUBMISSION OF SURVEY DATA INTO ARCCOLLECTOR, DEVELOPMENT AND DISTRIBUTION OF INTERPRETIVE BULLETINS HIGHLIGHTING THE PARK'S NATURAL RESOURCE THREATS AND CHALLENGES.BENEFICIARIES:PATRONS THAT WALK ALONG TRAILS THROUGHOUT THE HISTORIC, RIPARIAN, AND CONFLUENCE TRAIL AREAS. THE PARK HAS A UNIQUE SET OF NORTHERN MIXED-GRASS PRAIRIE COMMUNITIES AND CRITICAL RIVER AND RIPARIAN HABITATS. THESE PLANT COMMUNITY COMPOSITIONS AND STRUCTURES ARE IMPORTANT HABITAT ELEMENTS OF THE PARK. KNOWING THE STATUS AND TRENDS OF PLANT COMMUNITIES HELPS DETERMINE THE HEALTH OF PARK'S ECOSYSTEM. IN ADDITION TO PROVIDING INFORMATION ABOUT THE PARK VEGETATION, PLANT MONITORING DATA HELP CHARACTERIZE PARK-WIDE ECOSYSTEM RESPONSES TO OTHER ENVIRONMENTAL DRIVERS, INCLUDING WEATHER AND CLIMATE, LAND COVER CHANGES, INVASIVE/EXOTIC PLANTS, AND HABITAT CONDITIONS FOR SPECIES OF INTEREST. INCREASED INTELLECTUAL AND PHYSICAL UNDERSTANDING OF THE PARK'S ECOLOGY WILL IMPROVE NATIVE VEGETATION RESTORATION EFFORTS, AN INTEGRAL PART OF FORT LARAMIE NATIONAL HISTORIC SITES STRATEGIC GOALS FOR THE PARK'S LAND HELD IN THE PUBLIC TRUST. IN ADDITION, THIS PROJECT SUPPORTS THE RESEARCH AND EDUCATIONAL MISSION OF THE SCA OF RESOURCE SUSTAINABILITY.

THIS PROJECT WILL IMPROVE CONDITIONS IN AREAS THAT ARE DEGRADED BY THE INVASION OF AGGRESSIVE NON-NATIVE VEGETATION AND IMPROVE VISITOR EXPERIENCE, ACCESS AND SAFETY IN RECREATION SITES.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:REMOVING RIPGUT BROME FROM UPPER CORDOVA WASH AT ARCHES NATIONAL PARK WILL PROTECT THE HEALTH OF THE NATIVE RIPARIAN VEGETATION COMMUNITY DOWNSTREAM OF THIS INFESTATION. RIPGUT IS AN ANNUAL GRASS THAT SENESCES EARLY IN THE SEASON, SO WILL CREATE FUEL LOADS AND INCREASE WILDFIRE DANGER IF LEFT UNCHECKED.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS PROJECT WILL IMPROVE CONDITIONS IN AREAS THAT ARE DEGRADED BY THE INVASION OF AGGRESSIVE NON-NATIVE VEGETATION AND IMPROVE VISITOR EXPERIENCE, ACCESS AND SAFETY IN RECREATION SITES.

ULTIMATELY, THIS PROGRAM WILL DEVELOP A GENERATION OF SKILLED WORKERS, ACTIVE CITIZENS, FUTURE STEWARDS OF NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES.BENEFICIARIES:YOUTH FROM THE LOCAL AREA.

ALL WORK WILL BE COMPLETED UNDER THE GUIDANCE OF HIGHER SKILLED, JOURNEYMAN LEVEL, NATIONAL PARK SERVICE EMPLOYEES FROM CATOCTIN MOUNTAIN PARK. PROVIDE SCA MEMBERS TO LEAD YOUTH CONSERVATION CORPS (YCC) MEMBERS AT THE PARK. THE YCC, AGES 15-18 WILL MAINTAIN THE PARK TRAILS BY TRIMMING VEGETATION, RE-GRADING THE TRAIL TREAD, AND INSTALLING EROSION PREVENTION DEVICES. THEY WILL ALSO STAIN HISTORIC CABINS, REMOVE INVASIVE PLANTS, CONDUCT LANDSCAPING IN THE CABIN CAMPS, AND RESTORE NATIVE FORESTS BY INSTALLING TREE TUBES AROUND SEEDLINGS. WORK WILL BE CONDUCTED UNDER THE GUIDANCE OF AN NPS BIOLOGIST.PROJECT ACTIVITIESTHE STUDENT CONSERVATION ASSOCIATION WILL ASSIST WITH RECRUITMENT AND SELECTION OF SCA MEMBERS TO SERVE AS HISTORIC PRESERVATION ASSISTANTS AND YOUTH CONSERVATION CORPS (YCC) LEADERS AT CATOCTIN MOUNTAIN PARK. THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVES WILL BE TO PERFORM WORK ON NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE PROJECTS TO BOTH PROTECT THE RESOURCES AND IMPROVE THE VISITOR EXPERIENCE. THE INTERNS WILL BE DUTY STATIONED AT CATOCTIN MOUNTAIN PARK IN THURMONT, MD. HOUSING WILL BE PROVIDED IN CLOSE PROXIMITY TO THE DUTY STATION, IF NEEDED.BENEFICIARIES: STUDENT CONSERVATION ASSOCIATION
