COMPETITIVE AWARD AGREEMENT REQUIREMENTS FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: N/AFUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT: N/AREQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSPURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):BRYCE CANYON NATIONAL PARK WILL SEEK TO INSTALL 64 NEW WAYSIDE PANELS AND BASES AT VIEWPOINTS, ALONG TRAILS, AND AT FACILITIES THROUGHOUT THE PARK. WAYSIDES WILL ASSIST WITH PARK AND TRAIL ORIENTATION AS WELL AS RESOURCE EDUCATION ON A VARIETY OF TOPICS TIED TO THE PARK'S FOUNDATIONAL THEMES. WHILE MOST OF THESE WAYSIDES WILL REPLACE EXISTING PANELS-SOME MANY DECADES OLD NOW-THE PARK ALSO SEEKS TO REMOVE ANY OLDER WAYSIDE PANELS/BASES NOT BEING REPLACED. ULTIMATELY THIS WILL ACCOMPLISH A COMPLETE REPLACEMENT OF ALL PARK WAYSIDES.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:ACE CREWS WILL ASSIST PARK STAFF IN THE ASSEMBLY AND INSTALLATION OF 64 WAYSIDE PANELS AND ASSOCIATED BASES, AS WELL AS THE REMOVAL/REPLACEMENT OF 29 EXISTING PANELS AND BASES (23 OF WHICH WILL BE REPLACEMENTS, 6 OF WHICH WILL BE SIMPLE REMOVALS). INSTALLATION WILL BE CONDUCTED IN ACCORDANCE WITH MANUFACTURER INSTRUCTIONS (ATTACHED).ACE CREWS WILL ASSIST PARK STAFF IN TRANSPORTING WAYSIDE MATERIALS AND TOOLS TO STAGING AREAS AT EACH LOCATION AND RETURNING EXCESS/SCRAP MATERIALS TO A DESIGNATED COLLECTION AREA.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:INSTALLATION REPLACEMENT AND REMOVAL: AMERICAN CONSERVATION EXPERIENCE (ACE) CREWS WILL ASSEMBLE AND INSTALL 64 NEW WAYSIDE PANELS INCLUDING (5) SINGLE-STAKE TRAIL SIGNS, (15) TWO-LEG UPRIGHT PANELS, (4) THREE-LEG DOUBLE INLINE UPRIGHT PANELS, (1) FOUR-LEG TRIPLE INLINE PANEL, (32) TWO-LEG LOW PROFILE PANELS, (4) WALL-MOUNTED PANELS, (1) SINGLE-LEG TRAIL REGISTER, AND (2) SEE COAST TELESCOPES. INSTALLATIONS WILL OCCUR IN ACCORDANCE WITH MANUFACTURER INSTRUCTIONS (PANNIER FOR BASES, SEE COAST FOR TELESCOPES, AND ROCK ART FOR TRAIL REGISTER) AND IN ACCORDANCE WITH BEST ACCESSIBILITY PRACTICES (I.E. FOR A LOW-PROFILE EXHIBIT THE RECOMMENDED HEIGHT IS 32 INCHES FROM THE BOTTOM OF THE EXHIBIT FRAME TO THE FINISHED GRADE. FOR AN UPRIGHT OR BULLETIN BOARD, THE RECOMMENDED HEIGHT IS BETWEEN 24 AND 36 INCHES FROM THE BOTTOM OF THE EXHIBIT FRAME TO THE FINISHED GRADE, DEPENDING ON THE PANEL SIZE.)THE COMPLETED OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROJECT WILL RESULT IN 64 NEW WAYSIDE PANELS AND BASES AND THE REMOVAL OF 29 EXISTING PANELS AND BASES.BENEFICIARIES:NON-PERSONAL SERVICES SUCH AS INTERPRETIVE WAYSIDES, TRAILHEADS, AND OTHER SIGNAGE ARE ESSENTIAL TO MEETING PARK VISITORS WHERE THEY ARE. WHILE ONLY A SMALL PERCENTAGE OF PARK VISITORS WILL INTERACT WITH A RANGER AT THE VISITOR CENTER, VISIT THE PARK WEBSITE, OR ATTEND AN INTERPRETIVE PROGRAM ALMOST ALL OF THEM WILL COME ACROSS SIGNAGE WITHIN THE PARK. UNFORTUNATELY, THE PARK'S CURRENT WAYSIDES ARE FROM VARYING ERAS IN VARYING STATES OF FADING AND DECAY. THIS HAS RESULTED IN A MISSED OPPORTUNITY TO PROVIDE INFORMATION THAT CAN DEEPEN A VISITOR'S CONNECTION TO BRYCE CANYON NATIONAL PARK, ANSWER AND PROVOKE NEW QUESTIONS ABOUT IT, ASSIST THEM IN NAVIGATING THE PARK, HELP THEM PLAN THEIR VISIT, AS WELL AS TO HELP PROTECT THEMSELVES AND PARK RESOURCES. THIS AGREEMENT WILL PROVIDE A VALUABLE OPPORTUNITY FOR YOUNG ADULTS INTERESTED IN PUBLIC LAND MANAGEMENT TO GAIN EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCES WHILE REJUVENATING SIGNAGE THAT THE PUBLIC WILL ENJOY AND RELY UPON FOR DECADES TO COME.

THE SOUND TO SUMMIT CREW WILL CAMP AND WORK IN MOUNT RAINIER NATIONAL PARK FOR ONE WEEK IN LATE SUMMER. THEY WILL ASSIST PARK REVEGETATION STAFF WITH RESTORATION WORK.THIS AGREEMENT FUNDS A HIGH-SCHOOL AGE SERVICE YOUTH CREW, NORTHWEST YOUTH CORPS SOUND TO SUMMIT CREW, TO PARTICIPATE IN A WEEK OF PRIORITY MEADOW RESTORATION WORK IN MOUNT RAINIER NATIONAL PARK.PERFORMANCE GOALS - THIS PROJECT WILL BRING A NORTHWEST YOUTH CORPS TOGETHER FOR A SOUND TO SUMMIT YOUTH CREW. THIS YOUTH CREW WILL BE AT MOUNT RAINIER NATIONAL PARK FOR ONE WEEK TO WORK ALONGSIDE NPS CREWS AND ASSIST WITH MEADOW RESTORATION. THIS INCLUDES SITE AND MATERIAL PREPARATION, RESTORATION TRAINING, AND PLANTING NATIVE MEADOW PLANTS.PROJECT OBJECTIVES - THE OBJECTIVES ARE FOR THE CREW TO GAIN "REAL WORLD" EXPERIENCE CAMPING AND WORKING TOWARDS CONSERVATION GOALS IN A NATIONAL PARK AND FOR THE CREW TO ASSIST IN MEADOW RESTORATION PLANTINGS TO FURTHER RESTORATION OBJECTIVES. THIS RESTORATION WORK WILL HELP FUTURE GENERATIONS ENJOY MOUNT RAINIER NATIONAL PARK.

THIS AWARD PROVIDES TWO NON-FEDERAL INTERNSHIP OPPORTUNITIES FOR PROJECTS THAT ADDRESS NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT ISSUES FOCUSED ON HYDROLOGY WITHIN YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK. THIS AGREEMENT WILL SUPPORT AND STIMULATE WORK AND/OR EDUCATION AND TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUNG ADULTS THROUGH COLLABORATIVE PARTICIPATION IN NATURAL RESOURCE MONITORING WITHIN YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK. THE SELECTED CANDIDATE(S) WILL BE PROVIDED WITH A FULLTIME INTERNSHIP(S) AS A HYDROLOGY ASSISTANT. THE PRIMARY DUTY OF THE PARTICIPANT(S) WILL BE TO ASSIST NPS SCIENTISTS IN HYDROLOGIC MONITORING AND RELATED TASKS WITHIN YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK. THE INTERN(S) WILL GAIN EXPERIENCE IN HYDROLOGICAL AND ECOLOGICAL FIELD METHODS, AND WILL HAVE A CHANCE TO PARTICIPATE IN ALL PHASES OF THE MONITORING PROCESS, FROM PLANNING TO REPORTING. THEY WILL WORK CLOSELY WITH NPS SCIENTISTS, AND LEARN WHAT IT IS LIKE TO WORK AS A SCIENTIST FOR A FEDERAL AGENCY.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: EACH INTERN WILL BE ASSIGNED SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES TO BE UNDERTAKEN, MAJOR TASKS TO BE COMPLETED, AND PROJECT MILESTONES AND DELIVERABLES. PROJECT DESCRIPTIONS ARE DEVELOPED FOR EACH PROJECT AND WILL BE USED TO RECRUIT QUALIFIED APPLICANTS FOR THE PROJECTS. THE ONSITE TECHNICAL COORDINATOR/MENTOR IS RESPONSIBLE FOR DEVELOPING AND IMPLEMENTING A DETAILED WORKPLAN WITH THEIR INTERN(S). PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES INCLUDE MULTI-FACETED HYDROLOGIC FIELD WORK, SUCH AS COLLECTING WATER QUALITY DATA; DEPLOYING/MAINTAINING/DOWNLOADING DATA LOGGERS; SAMPLING MICROBIAL BIOMASS; MEASURING IN-SITU WATER QUALITY PARAMETERS SUCH AS PH, DISSOLVED OXYGEN, AND CONDUCTIVITY; AND ANALYZING TIME-SERIES DATA. PERSONNEL FROM CONSERVATION LEGACY AND NPS WILL COLLABORATE IN ALL ASPECTS OF THIS INTERNSHIP OPPORTUNITY.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE THE DEVELOPMENT OF A POSITION DESCRIPTION FOR EACH INTERN, ADVERTISEMENT AND RECRUITMENT FOR EACH POSITION, IMPLEMENTATION OF INDIVIDUAL PROJECT DEVELOPMENT AND REPORTING FRAMEWORK, AND GENERAL PROGRAMMATIC AND ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPORT FOR THE DURATION OF EACH INTERNSHIP. MAJOR MILESTONES ARE SUCCESSFUL RECRUITMENT, ONBOARDING, INTERN PERFORMANCE AND EVALUATION.BENEFICIARIES: THIS AGREEMENT WILL SUPPORT AND STIMULATE WORK AND/OR EDUCATION AND TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUNG ADULTS THROUGH COLLABORATIVE PARTICIPATION IN NATURAL RESOURCE MONITORING WITHIN YELLOWSTONE NATIONAL PARK.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS FOR A NWYC INTERN TO ASSIST THE OLYMPIC NATIONAL PARK RESOURCE MANAGEMENT DIVISION IN THE CONDUCT OF ANNUAL LONG-TERM MONITORING PROJECTS IN THE PARK'S MARINE INTERTIDAL ZONE AND MOUNTAIN LAKES. THE INTERN WILL ASSIST A CREW OF BIOLOGICAL TECHNICIANS IN FIELD AND LABORATORY WORK TO ACCOMPLISH THESE ANNUAL MONITORING ACTIVITIES.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:CONDUCTING LONG-TERM MONITORING OF SANDY BEACH MARINE INVERTEBRATE COMMUNITIES.CONDUCTING LONG-TERM MONITORING OF ROCKY INTERTIDAL COMMUNITIESRETRIEVING DATA AND MAINTAINING A NETWORK OF INTERTIDAL TEMPERATURE DATALOGGERSCONDUCTING A POPULATION ASSESSMENT OF RAZOR CLAMSCOLLECTING FIELD WATER SAMPLES, AND RETRIEVING, MAINTAINING AND DOWNLOADING INSTRUMENTS ASSOCIATED WITH LONG-TERM MONITORING OF OCEAN ACIDIFICATION.CONDUCTING PHYSICAL/CHEMICAL AND NUTRIENT PROFILES OF SELECTED LAKESCONDUCTING SHORELINE HABITAT, FISH, AMPHIBIAN AND ZOOPLANKTON SURVEYSDEPLOYING, DOWNLOADING, AND MAINTAIN MULTI-PROBE DATA SONDES TO MEASURE WATER QUALITY PARAMETER.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE PERFORMANCE GOAL IS TO CONSTRUCTIVELY CONTRIBUTE TO THE ACCOMPLISHMENT OF THE SPECIFIC ACTIVATES LISTED ABOVE. MILESTONES AND PERFORMANCE. IN A COLLABORATIVE EFFORT, THE WORK SHALL BE REVIEWED WITH THE INTERN AT THE END OF EACH OF THE ACTIVITIES AND AT THE MID-SEASON SHIFT FROM THE MARINE INTERTIDAL ZONE TO THE MOUNTAIN LAKES. EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE THE SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF THE LISTED ACTIVITIES AND THE GAINING OF EXPERIENCE CONDUCT FIELD ECOLOGICAL RESEARCH BY THE NWYC INTERN.

FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: P-P-YOUTH-22-005PURPOSE OF AWARD:THE ACE MEMBER WILL ASSIST WITH UPDATING NATIONAL HISTORIC LANDMARK (NHL) DOCUMENTATION FOR AN NHL IN THE REGION TO REFLECT THE FULL HISTORY OF THE SITE. THIS UPDATE WILL INCORPORATE NEW SCHOLARSHIP TO ADDRESS THE SITE'S HISTORY ALONG WITH OTHER AREAS OF SIGNIFICANCE THAT MIGHT BE IDENTIFIED. THE ACE MEMBER WILL ASSIST WITH THE PREPARATION OF A NATIONAL REGISTER NOMINATION UNDER THE MULTIPLE PROPERTY DOCUMENTATION FORM (MPDF) FOR A RESOURCE IN THE REGION. THEY WILL IDENTIFY GAPS IN CURRENT INFORMATION WORKING WITH A GIS SPECIALIST, DEVELOP A RESEARCH PLAN FOR OBTAINING THE MISSING INFORMATION, AND CARRY OUT THE PUBLIC RECORDS RESEARCH NECESSARY TO FILL THE GAPS.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:INTERN(S) WILL BE RECRUITED, SELECTED, AND COMPLETE THEIR TERMS AS FEASIBLE. INTERNS WILL COMPLETE TASKS OUTLINED IN THE SCOPE OF WORK.BENEFICIARIES: AMERICAN CONSERVATION EXPERIENCE; INTERNS

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):PERFORMANCE GOALS - PROJECT WILL REHABILITATE THE JOHNSON LAKE TRAIL IN THE SNAKE CREEK CANYON. THIS TRAIL IS 7.8 MILES LONG IN HIGH ELEVATIONS OF THE PARK. PROJECT OBJECTIVES - REHABILITATION OF THE TRAIL WILL INCLUDE RE-ESTABLISHING TREAD RETENTION STRUCTURES AND DRAINAGE FEATURES. NEW STEPS, WATER BARS, STONE RETAINING WALLS AND TRAIL SURFACE WILL BE CONSTRUCTED OR REPAIRED AS NEEDED. FALLEN TREES, ENCROACHING VEGETATION AND DEBRIS WILL BE REMOVED AS WELL. THE MEASURABLE RESULTS WILL BE A SAFE UPGRADED HIKING TRAIL FOR THE VISITOR TO IMPROVE LIFE, HEALTH, AND SAFETY FOR PARK VISITORS.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:JOHNSON LAKE TRAIL REHABILITATION WILL INCLUDE RE-ESTABLISHING TREAD RETENTION STRUCTURES AND DRAINAGE FEATURES. NEW STEPS, WATER BARS, STONE RETAINING WALLS AND TRAIL SURFACES WILL BE CONSTRUCTED OR REPAIRED AS NEEDED. THE MEASURABLE RESULTS WILL BE A SAFE UPGRADED HIKING TRAIL FOR THE VISITOR TO IMPROVE LIFE, HEALTH, AND SAFETY MEASURES. FALLEN TREES AND ENCROACHING VEGETATION AND DEBRIS WILL BE REMOVED.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: JOHNSON LAKE TRAIL SYSTEM WILL BE REHABILITATED FOR PARK VISITOR'S TO ENJOY.BENEFICIARIES: VISITORS TO GREAT BASIN NATIONAL PARK WILL ENJOY A REHABILITATED JOHNSON LAKE TRAIL SYSTEM.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):PERFORMANCE GOALS - THE NPS AND GBI WILL COLLABORATE TO IMPLEMENT POST-FIRE HABITAT PROTECTION AND RESTORATION TREATMENTS AND EFFECTIVENESS MONITORING IN GREAT BASIN NATIONAL PARK. RESTORATION ACTIONS WILL BENEFIT NATIVE VEGETATION AND WILDLIFE, CONTROL THE SPREAD OF NON-NATIVE PLANTS AND STABILIZE AND PROTECT RIPARIAN AND STREAM HABITATS.PROJECT OBJECTIVES - THE NPS, GBI AND GBI-SUPPORTED NEVADA CONSERVATION CORPS (NCC) WILL WORK TOGETHER TO MEET THE FOLLOWING OBJECTIVES:WORK WITH NPS STAFF ON POST-FIRE RESTORATION TREATMENTS AND MONITORING.ASSIST NPS STAFF WITH INSTALLATION AND MAINTENANCE OF INSTREAM STRUCTURES (E.G., POST-ASSISTED LOG STRUCTURES) TO SUPPORT POST-FIRE STREAM AND FISH HABITAT RESTORATION IN STRAWBERRY CREEK.ASSIST NPS STAFF WITH MONITORING OF HABITAT RESTORATION TREATMENTS AS PART OF AN ADAPTIVE MANAGEMENT STRATEGY TO DETERMINE TREATMENT SUCCESS.MAINTAIN OR CONSTRUCT WILDLIFE-FRIENDLY FENCE, INCLUDING VEGETATION REMOVAL, TO EXCLUDE CATTLE FROM NPS LANDS.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE NPS AND GBI WILL COLLABORATE ON POST-FIRE HABITAT PROTECTION AND RESTORATION IN THE STRAWBERRY CREEK WATERSHED THROUGH IMPLEMENTATION OF HABITAT RESTORATION TREATMENTS AND PRE- AND POST-TREATMENT MONITORING OVER TWO FIELD SEASONS IN 2022 AND 2023. FIELD WORK IS PLANNED FOR FALL 2022 AND AGAIN IN THE FALL OF 2023. GBI WILL HIRE, TRAIN AND SUPPORT NEVADA CONSERVATION CORPS (NCC) CREWS TO ASSIST NPS WITH FIELD WORK. THE NPS WILL PROVIDE PROJECT COLLABORATION, SUPPLIES NECESSARY TO COMPLETE IMPLEMENTATION TASKS, TRAINING, AND EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR NCC CREWS.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE FOLLOWING SHALL BE COMPLETED BY THE TIMEFRAMES LISTED.HIRE NCC CREW LEADER(S) AND CREW MEMBERS WITH APPLICABLE SKILLS (E.G., CHAINSAW CERTIFICATION) TO START WORK IN FALL 2022 AND FALL 2023.ENSURE NCC CREWS ARE PROPERLY TRAINED TO SAFELY USE HAND TOOLS, OPERATE CHAINSAWS AND WORK AND LIVE IN REMOTE, OUTDOOR SETTINGS BEFORE FIELD WORK STARTS.ASSIST WITH INSTALLATION AND MAINTENANCE OF INSTREAM STRUCTURES (E.G., POST-ASSISTED LOG STRUCTURES) TO SUPPORT THE POST-FIRE RECOVERY OF STRAWBERRY CREEK. USE CHAINSAWS OR HAND TOOLS TO CUT MATERIAL NEEDED FOR INSTREAM STRUCTURES.ASSIST NPS STAFF WITH DATA COLLECTION AND MONITORING OF RESTORATION TREATMENTS OVER THE TERM OF THE AGREEMENT.PROVIDE ANNUAL ACCOMPLISHMENT REPORTS TO THE NPS INCLUDING MAPS, SPATIAL DATA OF WORK COMPLETED AND PHOTOS.ASSIST WITH OTHER PROJECT TASKS OR FIELD WORK IN STRAWBERRY CREEK, AS NEEDED.BENEFICIARIES:VISITORS TO GREAT BASIN NATIONAL PARK

THIS TASK AGREEMENT AIMS TO IMPROVE YOUTH INVOLVEMENT IN CULTURAL AND NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES, INCLUDING IMPROVED STEWARDSHIP FOR RESOURCES, SCIENCE-BASED APPROACHES TO MANAGEMENT DECISION MAKING, AND IMPROVED VISITOR EXPERIENCE AND ACCESS. YOUTH INVOLVEMENT IS IMPROVED BY PROVIDING YOUTH WITH AMERICORPS POSITIONS TO GAIN EXPERIENCE WITH FEDERAL LAND MANAGEMENT AGENCIES. THE STEWARDSHIP IS IMPROVED BY UTILIZING SCIENCE-BASED APPROACHES TO UNDERSTANDING NATURAL AND CULTURAL SYSTEMS AND SUPPORTING MANAGEMENT DECISIONS WITH SCIENTIFIC DATA. IN ADDITION, VISITOR ACCESS AND QUALITY OF ACCESS ARE IMPROVED FOR THE PUBLIC THROUGH IMPROVEMENT OF RESOURCE ACCESS AND AVAILABILITY.THIS TASK AGREEMENT IS FOR 8 WEEKS (4 HITCHES) OF NON-TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE OF YOUTH CONSERVATION CORPS TO HELP WITH NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE PROJECTS CENTERED ON HISTORIC ORCHARDS IN CAPITOL REEF NATIONAL PARK. WE WOULD LIKE TO ENGAGE YOUTH STEWARDSHIP TO FACILITATE SCIENCE-BASED MANAGEMENT OF THE ORCHARDS IN ORDER TO IMPROVE RESOURCE QUALITY AND VISITOR EXPERIENCE OF THE FRUITA RURAL HISTORIC DISTRICT.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE CORPS CREWS WILL PARTICIPATE IN NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE IMPROVEMENT PROJECTS CENTERED ON SUSTAINING THE HISTORIC LANDSCAPE OF THE FRUITA HISTORIC DISTRICT. THE CREW WILL PERFORM HISTORIC LANDSCAPE PRESERVATION PROJECTS INCLUDING PRUNING HISTORIC TREES, REMOVING DISEASED AND DYING TREES, CLEARING AND MAINTAINING HISTORIC IRRIGATION DITCHES, FENCING REPAIRS, AND ASSISTANCE WITH THE INTEGRATED PEST MANAGEMENT PROGRAMS CULTURAL AND MECHANICAL COMPONENTS. THE YOUTH CREWS MAY ALSO ASSIST WITH VISITOR USE MONITORING, TRAIL MAPPING, VEGETATION REMOVAL, SIGN REPAIR, AND WILDLIFE MONITORING.BENEFICIARIES: YOUTH CORPS PARTICIPANTS, CAPITOL REEF NATIONAL PARK

BOARD OF EDUCATION NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: PROVIDE THE INTERNS THE ABILITY TO ENGAGE THE PUBLIC A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF THE PARK CULTURAL AND HISTORIC IMPORTANCE THROUGH VISITS AT THE PARK AND EXTEND TO THE PUBLIC ON SOCIAL MEDIA. ASSIST ADDITIONAL PARK NICODEMUS NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE DURING ANNUAL HOMECOMING CELEBRATION TO BROADEN THE EXPERIENCE IN INTERPRETATION AT DIFFERENT PROGRAMMING SITES.BENEFICIARIES: GREENING YOUTH FOUNDATION, INC.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS FOR YOUTH INTERNS TO GAIN PRACTICAL, HANDS-ON EXPERIENCE IN NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT, AND ESPECIALLY IN FUEL REDUCTION AND MANAGEMENT OF INVASIVE PLANTS. THE INTERN WILL PARTICIPATE IN ACTIVE FUEL REDUCTION AND ECOLOGICAL RESTORATION, INCLUDING REMOVING INVASIVE PLANTS AND OTHER FINE FUELS THROUGH MECHANICAL AND CHEMICAL MEANS.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES, ESPECIALLY: 1) REDUCING OF INVASIVE PLANT FUEL IN DESERT ECOSYSTEMS THAT ARE NOT ADAPTED TO FIRE; 2) ECOLOGICAL RESTORATION; 3) AND ECOLOGICAL MONITORING OF AIR QUALITY, WILDLIFE, HYDROLOGY, POLLINATOR SPECIES, AND PLANTS. PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: 1) TREAT/REMOVE MINIMUM OF 200 ACRES OF INVASIVE PLANTS; 2) DIRECT WORK OF VOLUNTEERS FOR AT LEAST 800 HOURS TO REMOVE ADDITIONAL INVASIVE PLANTS 2) WORK ON RESTORATION OF AT LEAST 4 SITES.BENEFICIARIES: BENEFITS WILL BE TO YOUTH INTERNS WHO WILL GAIN CAREER SKILLS IN NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):HIRE A TRAIL CREW FOR 12 WEEKS WORK TO ASSIST WITH TRAIL MAINTENANCE, REPAIR AND CONSTRUCTION AT ANTIETAM NATIONAL BATTLEFIELD.THE YOUTH WILL WORK ALONGSIDE RESOURCE PROFESSIONALS TO GAIN PRACTICAL TRAINING AND A RANGE OF EXPERIENCE IN SAFELY TRAVELING AND PERFORMING TRAIL MAINTENANCE IN A FOREST SETTING AS FOLLOWS: 1) REMOVING DETERIORATED, INSTALLING NEW AND CLEANING TRAIL STRUCTURES, SUCH AS WATER BARS, STEPS, BRIDGES AND LATERAL DRAINS; 2) REMOVING FALLEN TREES THAT AREA BLOCKING THE TRAIL; 3) TRIMMING ENCROACHING VEGETATION.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:EACH YEAR FOR 3 YEARS, THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE AN OPPORTUNITY FOR A CREW OF 6 AMERICORPS MEMBERS, ONE AMERICORPS ASSISTANCE CREW LEADER AND ONE STAFF CREW LEADER TO COMPLETE TRAIL CONSTRUCTION, REPAIR AND MAINTENANCE USING ONLY HAND TOOLS.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:COMPLETION OF TRAIL REPAIRS AND CONSTRUCTION OF TRAILS AND TRAIL STRUCTURES. THE WORK WILL BE IN AREAS THROUGHOUT ANTIETAM NATIONAL BATTLEFIELD. THE WORK INCLUDES REPAIR AND MAINTENANCE OF TRAILS THAT WILL FACILITATE SAFE, PUBLIC ACCESS TO PARK LOCATIONS WITH NATURAL, CULTURAL AND RECREATIONAL RESOURCES.THE PROJECT ENGAGES YOUTH IN SHARED STEWARDSHIP AND AN UNDERSTANDING AND APPRECIATION FOR CONSERVATION EFFECTS AS WELL AS DEVELOPING LEADERSHIP SKILLS.BENEFICIARIES: CONSERVATION LEGACY

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): TO PROVIDE FOUR YOUTH WITH AN OPPORTUNITY TO WORK ALONGSIDE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE RESOURCE PROFESSIONALS TO GAIN HANDS-ON EXPERIENCE IN RESOURCE PROTECTION, CAREER AWARENESS, AND DEVELOP SKILLS RELEVANT TO THEIR FIELD OF ACADEMIC STUDY AND/OR CAREER INTEREST.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: THE SHOREBIRD INTERNS WILL WORK ALONGSIDE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE BIOLOGISTS AND BE INTRODUCED TO THE MANAGEMENT AND PROTECTION OF STATE AND FEDERALLY PROTECTED SHOREBIRD SPECIES, SPECIFICALLY PIPING PLOVER, LEAST TERN AND AMERICAN OYSTERCATCHER. THEY WILL SPEND MOST OF THE SUMMER LOCATING POTENTIAL BREEDING PAIRS AND NESTS, MONITORING NESTS AND TRACKING THE STATUS AND MOVEMENTS OF CHICKS UNTIL THEY FLEDGE. INTERNS WILL CONDUCT THEIR WORK ON FOOT AS WELL AS USING ATVS AND THE WORK CAN BE PHYSICALLY AND TECHNICALLY DEMANDING. INTERNS WILL ASSIST IN THE INSTALLATION AND MAINTENANCE OF FENCING SIGNAGE AND PREDATOR EXCLOSURES.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: PERFORMANCE GOALS FOR THIS PROJECT INCLUDE SUCCESSFULLY RECRUITING INTERNS, TRAINING INTERNS AND SUCCESSFULLY IMPLEMENTING THE SHOREBIRD MANAGEMENT AND MONITORING PROTOCOLS.BENEFICIARIES: YOUTH INTERNS AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC.THIS PROJECT PROVIDES HANDS-ON SERVICE OPPORTUNITIES IN CONSERVATION SCIENCE, AND NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT THAT HELP DEVELOP A GENERATION OF SKILLED WORKERS, EDUCATED AND ACTIVE CITIZENS, FUTURE LEADERS, AND STEWARDS OF NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES. THROUGH THIS PROJECT, YOUTH WILL LEARN ABOUT THE ENVIRONMENTAL CAREER OPTIONS AND WILL GAIN VALUABLE JOB SKILLS. THROUGH THE WORK OF THE NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT AND SCIENCE INTERNS, THE PUBLIC WILL HAVE GREATER ACCESS TO PUBLIC LANDS AND RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES AND DEVELOP A DEEPER UNDERSTANDING OF NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES.

PROJECT STATEMENT - THIS PROJECT WILL ASSIST GREAT SMOKY MOUNTAIN NATIONAL PARK (GRSM) IN MEETING ITSGOALS TO HAVE A MORE INCLUSIVE AND DIVERSE WORK FORCE. THROUGH THE PROJECT, INTERESTED STUDENTS FROM TUSKEGEE INSTITUTE, A HISTORICALLY BLACK COLLEGE, WILL COME TO GRSM FOR A FIVE-DAY, FOUR-NIGHT RESIDENTIAL EXPERIENCE. THEY WILL WORK IN THE FIELD WITH VARIOUS PARK STAFF TO LEARN ABOUT DIFFERENT PARK SERVICE CAREERS, HOW THE NPS CARES FOR AMERICA'S PUBLIC LANDS AND THE CRITICAL ISSUES FACING PARK RESOURCES. THEY WILL ALSO LEARN ABOUT FUTURE OPPORTUNITIES AND HOW TO APPLY FOR THEM AS WELL. NPS WILL BE COORDINATING, DIRECTING AND PRESENTING THE PROJECTS AND ACTIVITIES THE STUDENTS ARE INVOLVED WITHPERFORMANCE GOALS - GOALS FOR THIS PROJECT INCLUDE INTRODUCING THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE AND GREAT SMOKY MOUNTAINS NATIONAL PARK AS A POTENTIAL FUTURE EMPLOYER TO CANDIDATES FROM TRADITIONALLY MARGINALIZED COMMUNITIES. ADDITIONALLY, THROUGH HANDS-ON FIELD EXPERIENCE, STUDENTS WILL LEARN ABOUT THE CULTURAL AND NATURAL RESOURCES IN THE SMOKIES AND THE ISSUES IMPACTING THEM.PERFORMANCE OBJECTIVES - LEARN ABOUT PARK RESOURCES AND CRITICAL RESOURCE ISSUES WHILE THEY WORK OUT IN THE FIELD ALONGSIDE NPS PROFESSIONALS LEARNING ABOUT PARK PROTECTION. DURING THEIR PARK VISIT, STUDENTS WILL LEARN ABOUT NPS CAREERS, HOW TO APPLY FOR FUTURE INTERNSHIPS AND JOBS, AND WHO THEY CAN CONTACT QUESTIONS.CFDA 15.931 YOUTH AND VETERAN ORGANIZATIONS CONSERVATION ACTIVITIES

THE ADDITION OF THIS INTERNS WILL ALLOW OR A GREATER, MORE FULL-TIME STAFFING AT THE UNIT, 5 DAYS A WEEK, DURING THE SUMMER SEASON TO ALLOW FOR THE PRESENTATION OF QUALITY INTERPRETIVE PROGRAM THEREBY INCREASING VISITOR UNDERSTANDING AND SATISFACTION.C. PERFORMANCE OBJECTIVES -- OPEN AND STAFF THE KNOB CREEK VISITOR CENTER FOR 5 DAYS PER WEEK DURING THE SUMMER SEASON- INTERPRET AND MANAGE THE HISTORIC INTERPRETIVE GARDEN- CONNECT VISITORS TO THE DIVERSE RESOURCES AND PROGRAMMING AT THE PARK.- DIVERSITY THE PARK'S WORKFORCE.- TRAIN AND MENTOR NEXT GENERATION OF YOUTH STEWARDS OF PUBLIC LANDD. MILESTONES - N/AASSISTANCE LISTING - TITLE - BENEFICIARIES CFDA 15.931 YOUTH AND VETERAN ORGANIZATIONS CONSERVATION ACTIVITIES.PRIVATE NON-PROFIT INSTITUTIONS AND ORGANIZATIONS; PUBLIC AND PRIVATE NON-PROFIT ACADEMIC INSTITUTIONS; STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENT AGENCIES; QUASI-PUBLIC NON-PROFIT INSTITUTIONS AND ORGANIZATIONS THAT SUPPORT YOUTH AND YOUNG ADULT CAREER TRAINING AND DEVELOPMENT, AND EDUCATION IN THE AREAS OF NATURAL AND/OR CULTURAL RESOURCE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT. INDIVIDUALS/FAMILIES; STUDENTS; AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC WILL RECEIVE A BENEFIT FROM THE DEVELOPMENT AND EXECUTION OF THESE PROGRAMS AND PROJECTS.

THIS POSITION WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR SUPPORTING A VARIETY OF NATURAL RESOURCE PROJECTS OCCURRING IN VARIOUS NATIONAL PARKS AND INVENTORY AND MONITORING NETWORKS ACROSS ALASKA. THE INTERN WILL HELP PREPARE AND MAINTAIN FIELD GEAR AND RESEARCH EQUIPMENT FOR VARIOUS FOR FIELD CREWS, ENTER RESEARCH DATA AND ASSIST ON NATURAL RESOURCE PROJECTS FIELDWORK AND OUTREACH IN BIRDS, RAPTORS, SMALL MAMMALS, BOTANY, WATER-QUALITY. PROJECTS ON WHICH THE INTERN MAY ASSIST INCLUDE: SNOWSHOE HARE SURVEYS IN GATES OF THE ARCTIC NATIONAL PARK AND PRESERVE (GAAR), PEREGRINE FALCON SURVEYS IN YUKON-CHARLEY RIVERS NATIONAL PRESERVE (YUCH) AND SMALL-MAMMAL SURVEYS IN DENALI NATIONAL PARK AND PRESERVE (DENA), AMONG OTHERS.

BY THE END OF THE YOUTH CONSERVATION INTERNSHIPS, INDIVIDUALS WILL ADVANCE A VARIETY OF EDUCATION, INTERPRETATION, AND VISITOR SERVICES PROJECTS INTERACTING WITH VISITORS AT HIGH VISITATION AREAS, EDUCATING K-8TH GRADE STUDENTS DURING ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION PROGRAMMING, PARTICIPATING AND ASSISTING WITH SPECIAL EVENTS, AND SUPPORTING VISITOR SERVICES. INTERNS WILL REACH OVER 5,000 VISITORS PER DAY WHEN WORKING AT THE VISITOR CENTER DESK OR ROVING IN PARK RESOURCES.INTERNS WILL RECEIVE ON-THE JOB PROFESSIONAL SKILLS TRAINING AND PARTICIPATE IN PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT WORKSHOPS THAT FOCUS ON INTERVIEW SKILLS, RESUME BUILDING, PRESENTATION SKILLS, AS WELL AS MEET WITH SUBJECT MATTER EXPERTS OR TAKE FIELD TRIPS TO LEARN ABOUT PARK RESOURCES.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:PROVIDE 4-8 HOURS PER WEEK OF CUSTOMER SERVICE ASSISTANCE AT THE PARK VISITOR CENTER. INTERACT WITH VISITORS WHILE ROVING DESTINATION AREAS AND TRAILS, 2-4 HOURS PER WEEK.ASSIST WITH THE PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT OF THE PARK'S ANNUAL JUNIOR RANGER DAY EVENT IN AUGUST.ASSIST WITH THE PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT OF K-8TH GRADE EDUCATION PROGRAMS FROM JULY THROUGH OCTOBER.ANSWER VISITOR INQUIRIES ON THE PHONE AND IN PERSON.PARTICIPATE IN MONTHLY TALKS, PRESENTATIONS, FIELD TRIPS AND HANDS ON DEMONSTRATIONS, 2-3 TIMES PER MONTH.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: POSITIVE INTERACTIONS DURING EVERY VISITOR CONTACT.INTERACT WITH APPROXIMATELY 1-2,000 VISITORS PER WEEK DURING ROVING INTERACTIONS AND VISITOR CENTER CONTACTS. PRESENT EDUCATION PROGRAMS TO APPROXIMATELY 100 K-8TH GRADE STUDENTS. REVIEW AND UPDATE CURRICULUM-BASED PROGRAMS.BENEFICIARIES:LOCAL COMMUNITY, APPROXIMATELY 400,000 VISITORS, SCHOOL GROUPS, FRIENDS OF THE DUNES ORGANIZATION, PARK EMPLOYEES WHO MENTOR AND TRAIN THE INTERNS.

PURPOSE OF AWARD: THE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WILL BE USED TO RECRUIT, TRAIN, AND ENGAGE TWO MAINE CONSERVATION CORPS (MCC) FIELD TEAMS AT KATAHDIN WOODS AND WATERS NATIONAL MONUMENT IN NORTHERN MAINE. THE PRIMARY TASK FOR THE CONSERVATION CORPS WILL BE TO ASSIST WITH BUILDING NEW HIKING TRAILS AND MAINTAINING EXISTING TRAILS AND VISITOR FACILITIES IN THE MONUMENT. THEY WILL ASSIST WITH PROMOTING AND LEADING VOLUNTEER TRAIL EVENTS. THE YOUTH WILL ENGAGE IN ONGOING TRAINING TO FACILITATE THE ESTABLISHMENT OF A FUTURE CONSERVATION WORKFORCE.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: SUBJECT TO THE AVAILABILITY OF FUNDING AND RESOURCES, THREE OR MORE MAINE CONSERVATION CORPS MEMBERS WILL BE ENGAGED ANNUALLY IN CREWS TO GAIN EXPERIENCE WITH TRAIL REPAIR, IMPROVEMENTS, AND MAINTENANCE IN KATAHDIN WOODS & WATERS NATIONAL MONUMENT.COMMUNITY VOLUNTEERS WILL BE ENGAGED BY TEAMS TO CONTRIBUTE TO AND CONTINUE THE ENVIRONMENTAL EFFORTS OF CORPS MEMBERS. VOLUNTEERS WILL BENEFIT FROM INCREASED COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT AND LEARN TECHNICAL SKILLS TO INFLUENCE MAINE'S LANDS AND WATERS IN A POSITIVE MANNER. CREWS WILL BE EXPANDING OUTREACH TO THE PUBLIC AND WILL BENEFIT BY GAINING HANDS-ON LEADERSHIP AND PROJECT MANAGEMENT EXPERIENCE.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:SUBJECT TO THE AVAILABILITY OF FUNDING AND RESOURCES OF BOTH PARTIES, MAINE CONSERVATION CORPS MEMBERS WILL FOCUS ON A DISTINCT APPROPRIATE CONSERVATION PROJECT EACH YEAR, TYPICALLY IDENTIFIED AS A BACKLOG MAINTENANCE NEED.BENEFICIARIES: YOUTH AND VETERANS, LOCAL COMMUNITIES, PARK VISITORS

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): PERSONNEL FROM THE SCA AND NPS WILL COLLABORATE TO CREATE EXPERIENCES AND EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUTH THROUGH THE PROTECTION OF NPS BUILDINGS AND THE CULTURAL RESOURCES UNDER THE SERVICE'S PROTECTION. SCA INTERNS WILL GET VALUABLE WORK EXPERIENCE AND CRITICAL ON THE JOB TRAINING THAT WILL HELP THEM IN THEIR FUTURE CAREERS. SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: STRUCTURAL FIRE PROTECTION INTERNS WILL HELP FACILITY MAINTENANCE PERSONNEL WITH LEGISLATIVELY MANDATED FIRE PROTECTION SYSTEM INSPECTION AND TESTING WORK ORDERS. STUDENTS WHO WILL BE ENTERING CAREERS IN FIRE PROTECTION ENGINEERING AND STRUCTURAL FIRE MANAGEMENT WILL GAIN AN UNDERSTANDING OF THE UNIQUE NEEDS OF PROTECTING CULTURAL RESOURCES. STUDENTS WILL ALSO GAIN CRITICAL THINKING SKILLS THAT WILL USE KNOWLEDGE GAINED IN UNIVERSITY COURSEWORK IN A PRACTICAL SETTING. THE PROJECT WILL FURTHER STRUCTURAL FIRE PREVENTION GOALS IN THE VARIOUS PARKS THAT HOST AN INTERN THROUGH A 10-WEEK INTENSE FOCUS ON STRUCTURAL FIRE PROTECTION AND PREVENTION. PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE HAS A HISTORY OF DEVASTATING STRUCTURAL FIRES THAT HAVE RESULTED IN THE LOSS OF MANY CULTURAL RESOURCES THAT THE NPS IS TASKED TO PROTECT. FIRES HAVE DESTROYED MOST OF THE RUSTIC LODGES DESIGNED BY GILBERT STANLEY UNDERWOOD ALONG THE GRAND CIRCLE, CULTURAL RESOURCES AT FLIGHT 93 NATIONAL MEMORIAL, EMPLOYEE DORMS, AND OTHER IMPORTANT STRUCTURES NEEDED TO SUPPORT OUR PARKS. THE NPS HIRES FEW EMPLOYEES WHO ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR STRUCTURAL FIRE PROTECTION IN OUR PARKS, PRIMARILY RELYING ON COLLATERAL DUTY EMPLOYEES TO ACCOMPLISH THIS WORK. THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE KNOWLEDGEABLE ASSISTANCE TO OUR PARKS FOR 10 WEEKS THIS SUMMER TO SOLELY FOCUS ON PARK FIRE PROTECTION AND PREVENTION NEEDS.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THESE TWO POSITIONS WILL WORK FOR THREE MONTHS HELPING TO LEAD SAGUARO'S YOUTH CONSERVATION CORPS (YCC) PROGRAM UNDER THE DIRECTION OF A SAGUARO'S TRAIL CREW YCC COORDINATOR. THE YCC PROGRAM IS EIGHT WEEKS LONG AND THE NEXGEN'S WILL HAVE THREE WEEKS OF PREP WORK BEFORE THE PROGRAM STARTS AND ONE WEEK TO WRAP UP AFTER THE PROGRAM CONCLUDES. A YCC CREW LEAD POSITION IS VERY UNIQUE IN THE WAY THAT THE DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE (BUT NOT LIMITED TO) THE OVERSIGHT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF A SAFE ENVIRONMENT (BOTH MENTAL AND PHYSICAL; AT WORK AND AT CAMP), LEADING THE YOUTH IN COOKING NUTRITIOUS MEALS, LEADING ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION LESSONS AS WELL AS PERSONAL DEVELOPMENT SKILLS INCLUDING RESILIENCY SKILLS, WORKING AS AN INTEGRAL MEMBER OF A CREW, TEACHING OUTDOOR SKILLS INCLUDING FRONT AND BACKCOUNTRY CAMPING AND HIKING, MANAGING AFTER WORK ACTIVITIES SUCH AS TEAM BUILDING GAMES AND/OR RECREATIONAL HIKES, JOURNALING/REFLECTION ACTIVITIES, AS WELL AS CREATING A COMMUNITY OF RESPECTFUL, FUN, HARDWORKING INDIVIDUALS.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THEY WILL BE EXPOSED TO A VARIETY OF SKILLS INCLUDING: HOW TO PROPERLY PERFORM TRAIL MAINTENANCE IN RELATION TO SAGUARO'S TRAIL STANDARDS (REMOVING OVERGROWN VEGETATION FROM THE TRAILS, CLEARING DRAINAGE STRUCTURES), OVERSEEING A CREW OF 10 YOUTH AT WORK AND AT CAMP, FOSTERING A SAFE ENVIRONMENT AT WORK AND AT CAMP FOR ALL MEMBERS INVOLVED, MANAGING AND TEACHING ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION LESSONS, PROMPTING REFLECTION AND JOURNALING ACTIVITIES, TEACHING AND PREPARING NUTRITIOUS MEALS FOR THE CREW, WORKING AND LIVING TOGETHER AS A CREW FOR UP TO TEN DAYS AT A TIME IN SAGUARO'S WILDERNESS.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE FIRST THREE WEEKS WILL BE CREW LEADER TRAINING WHERE SAGUARO TRAIL MAINTENANCE STANDARDS WILL BE TAUGHT, POLICY AND PROCEDURE WILL BE LEARNED, BEHAVIORAL MANAGEMENT SKILLS WILL BE DISCUSSED, PROGRAM ORIENTATION AND COLLABORATIVE LEARNING FOCUSING ON WORKING AS A TEAM; WORKING WITH THE YOUTH AND UNDERSTANDING THE OVERALL YCC PROGRAM GOALS OF FACILITATING A TRANSFORMATIVE EXPERIENCE OF GROWTH AND EMPOWERMENT FOR ALL YOUTH PARTICIPANTS AS WELL AS ADULT LEADERS. THE PROGRAM WITH THE YOUTH CREW WILL LAST 8 WEEKS IN TOTAL WHERE LEADERS WILL TEACH AND ENCOURAGE YOUTH PARTICIPANTS TO LEARN HOW TO NAVIGATE AS AN INTEGRAL PART OF A TEAM WHILE WORKING AND CAMPING, LIVING COLLECTIVELY ALL THE WHILE FOSTERING AN ENVIRONMENT OF OPEN, HONEST AND A SAFE (MENTAL AND PHYSICAL) SPACE FOR ALL PARTICIPANTS. TASKS INCLUDE TEACHING ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION, RESILIENCY SKILLS, LEARNING ABOUT CONSERVATION AND PUBLIC LANDS, COOKING NUTRITIOUS MEALS TOGETHER, LEADING RECREATIONAL HIKES, CAREER DEVELOPMENT SKILLS SUCH AS RESUME WRITING AND JOB OPPORTUNITIES WITH LAND MANAGEMENT AGENCIES. THIS PROGRAM OFFERS GROWTH TO THE CREW LEADERS TO FIND THEIR LEADERSHIP STYLE AND VOICE, ENCOURAGE PROBLEM SOLVING SKILLS, IMPROVE AND PERFECT SOCIAL SKILLS AS WELL AS OFFERING AN OPPORTUNITY TO TAKE OWNERSHIP IN THE PROGRAM. WE WANT TO EDUCATE, INSPIRE AND EMPOWER THE YOUTH IN THIS 8 WEEK PERIOD.BENEFICIARIES: YOUTH

THIS POSITION WILL BE BASED OUT OF THE NATURAL RESOURCES DIVISION OF SITKA NATIONAL HISTORICAL PARK; IT IS AN EXCELLENT OPPORTUNITY TO GAIN HANDS ON EXPERIENCE IN THE DAY-TO-DAY TASKS THAT OCCUPY A BIOLOGIST. WORK WILL INCLUDE FIELDWORK, FIELD DATA COLLECTION, MICROSCOPY, DATA ENTRY, GIS, AND OTHER OPPORTUNITIES. FIELD WORK WILL LARGELY INCLUDE SALMONID AND COSTAL BROWN BEAR MONITORING WITH THE OPPORTUNITY TO ASSIST WITH VARIOUS ENVIRONMENTAL MONITORING PROJECTS THROUGHOUT THE PARK. OLIVIA_MAGNI@NPS.GOV

FUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT: THE GOALS OF THIS FUNDING OPPORTUNITY ARE TO PARTNER WITH AN AGENCY TO PERFORM YOUTH CAREER DEVELOPMENT VIA VEGETATION MANAGEMENT AT GRAND TETON NATIONAL PARK.PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES FOCUS ON YOUTH ENGAGEMENT IN NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT, EDUCATION, JOB TRAINING, AND FURTHERING THE UNDERSTANDING AND APPRECIATION OF NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES THROUGH MANAGEMENT ACTIONS ASSOCIATED WITH VEGETATIVE ECOSYSTEM MANAGEMENT AT GRAND TETON NATIONAL PARK.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: VEGETATION MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES MAY INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING: NATIVE SEED COLLECTION, PLANT SALVAGE, PLANT SURVEYS, INVASIVE SPECIES REMOVAL, PLANT POPULATION DATA MAPPING, DATA COLLECTION AND MONITORING, AND ANY OTHER VEGETATION RELATED MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE A SHARED ACHIEVEMENT OF RESOURCE MANAGEMENT SKILL DEVELOPMENT IN AMERICA'S YOUTH BY PERFORMING FIELD-BASED VEGETATION MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES. AN EMPHASIS OF QUALITY OF QUANTITY WILL BE ENCOURAGED. AS SUCH, MILESTONES OF QUANTITY OF SEED COLLECTED OR ACREAGE OF INVASIVE SPECIES REMOVAL ARE NOT PERTINENT.BENEFICIARIES: THE PUBLIC, AMERICA'S YOUTH, GRAND TETON NATIONAL PARK LAND MANAGERS, AND SURROUNDING COMMUNITY MEMBERS.

FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: P-P-YOUTH-22-005PURPOSE OF AWARD:THE RECIPIENT WILL SELECT AND OVERSEE QUALIFIED AND MOTIVATED UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE STUDENTS TO WORK ALONGSIDE NPS STAFF IN THE CULTURAL RESOURCES, INTERPRETATION, AND RELATED FIELDS IN DIFFERENT PARK UNITS/PROGRAMS AND FEDERAL OFFICES THROUGHOUT THE NATION.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE ACE RESEARCH ASSISTANT WOULD SUPPORT THE PARK'S COMMEMORATION WORK AND CREATE LEGACY MATERIALS BY ENGAGING WITH HISTORIC RESEARCH INTO THE HUSBANDS OF THE WOMEN WHO ORGANIZED THE 1848 CONVENTION. THEY WILL COMPILE RESEARCH MATERIALS ON EACH OF THE HUSBANDS, INCLUDING THEIR RELATIONSHIPS TO REFORM MOVEMENTS OF THEIR TIME.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:INTERN(S) WILL BE RECRUITED, SELECTED, AND COMPLETE THEIR TERMS AS FEASIBLE. INTERNS WILL COMPLETE TASKS OUTLINED IN THE SCOPE OF WORK.BENEFICIARIES: AMERICAN CONSERVATION EXPERIENCE; INTERNS

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):PERFORMANCE GOALS - PROTECT NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES AT DEATH VALLEY NATIONAL PARK. THIS COLLABORATIVE EFFORT WILL HELP WITH RESTORATION ACTIVITIES THAT PROTECT AND PRESERVE THE UNIQUE CHARACTERISTICS OF DEATH VALLEY NATIONAL PARKPROJECT OBJECTIVES - PROTECT DEATH VALLEY DESERT SPRINGS, RIPARIAN AREAS, DUNE HABITAT, DESERT PLAYAS, FOREST FLOORS AND CULTURAL LANDSCAPE FROM INVASIVE VEGETATION. ALSO, MONITOR AND RECORD THE IMPACTS THAT INVASIVE VEGETATION HAS ON LANDSCAPES AND THE ENVIRONMENT WITHIN DEATH VALLEY NATIONAL PARK. THIS ALSO INCLUDES REMOVE HAZARDOUS WILDFIRE FUEL LOADS AND FLOOD PROMOTING DEBRIS FROM AROUND VALUABLE RESOURCES LIKES HISTORIC BUILDINGS, CULTURAL LANDSCAPES, AND CRITICAL HABITAT AREAS.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:CONDUCT INVASIVE PLANT MANAGEMENT OPERATIONS IN DEATH VALLEY NATIONAL PARK. THE LOCATION OF ACE ACTIVITIES IN DEATH VALLEY NATIONAL PARK WILL BE IN THE AREAS OF COW CREEK, FURNACE CREEK, GRAPEVINE, WILDROSE, SCOTTY'S CASTEL, STOVEPIPE WELLS, BUT NOT LIMITED TO JUST THOSE AREAS. ACE CREWS WILL CONDUCT MECHANICAL REMOVAL OF POPULATIONS OF SALT CEDAR, PALM TREES, OLEANDER, THISTLES, AND MUSTARDS, IN THE AREAS OF SCOTTY'S CASTLE AND LOWER VINE RACH AREA. CONTROL OF INVASIVE VEGETATION IN SPRINGS, RIPARIAN AREAS, AND OTHER SENSITIVE DESERT HABITATS. CRITICAL AREAS MAY INCLUDE EUREKA AND MESQUITE DUNES, SALINE VALLEY, BUTTE VALLEY, TRAVERTINE AND NEVARES SPRINGS, TOWNE PASS, DAYLIGHT PASS, SCOTTY'S CASTLE, LOWER VINE RANCH, AND EMIGRANT CANYON. THE MANUAL METHODS OF REMOVAL INCLUDE, BUT NOT LIMITED TO HOES, RAKES, SHOVELS, DIGGING, GRUBBING, CUTTING AND HAND PULLING WILL BE UTILIZED TO REMOVE PLANT MATERIAL.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:REMOVAL ON NON-NATIVE PLANT SPECIES.BENEFICIARIES:THE VISITING PUBLIC TO DEATH VALLEY NATIONAL PARK

COMPETITIVE AWARD AGREEMENT REQUIREMENTSFUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: N/AFUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT: N/AREQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSPURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):(1) DETECTION, DOCUMENTATION, AND CARE OF SEA TURTLE NESTS AND HATCHLINGS, (2) DETECTION, DOCUMENTATION, AND PROTECTION OF STRANDED JUVENILE AND ADULT SEA TURTLES, (3) PUBLIC EDUCATION TO INVOLVE THE PUBLIC IN SEA TURTLE RESTORATION EFFORTS, AND (4) ENCOURAGING PARK STEWARDSHIP AMONG YOUTH THROUGH SERVICE LEARNING.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:SCA MEMBERS WILL WORK IN OFFICE AND FIELD ENVIRONMENTS TO COMPLETE SEA TURTLE CONSERVATION TASKS, INCLUDING (1) DATA COLLECTION AND ENTRY TO DOCUMENT SEA TURTLE NESTS AND STRANDING EVENTS, (2) NEST PROTECTION, HATCHLING RELEASES, PUBLIC EDUCATION, AND RELATED RESTORATION TASKS, AND (3) TRAINING AND MENTORSHIP SESSIONS.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:MILESTONES DEPEND UPON ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS, WHICH GENERALLY INCLUDE STRANDING THROUGHOUT THE PROJECT PERIOD, NESTING THROUGH JUNE, AND HATCHING/RELEASES THROUGH AUGUST. OTHER MILESTONES INCLUDE PUBLIC EDUCATION AND DATA ENTRY AND ANALYSIS THROUGHOUT THE PROJECT PERIOD, WITH REPORT WRITING AUGUST THROUGH OCTOBER. TANGIBLE OUTCOMES WILL INCLUDE WRITTEN REPORTS, THE NUMBER OF NESTS DETECTED, NUMBER OF EGGS EXTRACTED AND INCUBATED, NUMBER OF HATCHLINGS EMERGED AND RELEASED, AND NUMBER OF PUBLIC EDUCATION EVENTS AND CONTACTS MADE, AS WELL AS THE NUMBER OF JUVENILE AND ADULT SEA TURTLES RECOVERED, REHABILITATED, AND RELEASED. OTHER OUTCOMES ARE EXPECTED TO INCLUDE IMPROVED PUBLIC ENGAGEMENT, INCREASED ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP, AND PERSONAL AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT OF SCA MEMBERS.BENEFICIARIES:INTERNS OF THE THE STUDENT CONSERVATION ASSOCIATION, INC.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): THIS PROJECT WILL MOTIVATE YOUTH AND YOUNG ADULTS TO BE INVOLVED WITH THE NATURAL, CULTURAL, AND HISTORICAL RESOURCE PROTECTION AND WILL PROVIDE EXPERIENCE WORKING WITH PARK ON PRESERVATION PROJECTS THAT IMPROVE RESOURCE CONDITIONS FOR THE PARK AND PARTNERS. YOUTH WILL RECEIVE HANDS-ON EXPERIENCE WITH PROJECTS AND EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCES WHILE CONTRIBUTING IN A MEANINGFUL WAY.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: THE CREW WILL CONSIST OF FIVE HIGH SCHOOL STUDENT WORKERS WHO WILL WORK A TOTAL OF EIGHT WEEKS DURING THE SUMMER SEASON. THE CREW YOUTH LEADER WILL WORK A TOTAL OF NINE WEEKS TO ALLOW FOR ADDITIONAL TRAINING. THE RECIPIENT WILL RECRUIT THE TEAM OF YOUTH WHO WILL PROVIDE TRAINING, EQUIPMENT, PERSONAL PROTECTIVE EQUIPMENT, AND TRANSPORTATION TO THE PARK PROJECT LOCATIONS. YOUTH CREW WILL BE WORKING ON RESERVATION OF HISTORIC STRUCTURES LISTED OR ELIGIBLE FOR LISTING ON THE NATIONAL REGISTER. UP TO TWENTY-ONE HERITAGE SITES WILL HAVE INCREASED EXPOSURE TO PARK PERSONNEL AND YOUTH ENGAGEMENT.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS COLLABORATION BUILDS TRUST AND UNDERSTANDING ACROSS GENERATION AND PROVIDES PARTICIPANTS WITH THE OPPORTUNITY TO DEVELOP LEADERSHIP SKILLS, CONFIDENCE, AND A SENSE OF ACCOMPLISHMENT AND CIVIC PRIDE.BENEFICIARIES: CHILD & FAMILY SERVICES OF NORTHWESTERN MICHIGAN, INC.

GOAL - THIS AGREEMENT IS ESTABLISHED FOR THE PURPOSE OF ACCOMPLISHING NEEDED CONSERVATION AND ENVIRONMENTAL RESTORATION PROJECTS. PROJECT OBJECTIVES - MCC WILL ASSIST THE PARK'S REVEGETATION AND IPM CREWS WITH WORK ON A VARIETY OF PROJECTS ON THE WEST AND EAST SIDES OF GLACIER NATIONAL PARK.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: PROJECTS INCLUDE PLANTING ALONG THE GTSR, POSSIBLE WHITEBARK AND LIMBER PINE PLANTING, AND OTHER RESOURCE MANAGEMENT PROJECTS. ADDITIONAL ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE ASSISTANCE WITH NURSERY CLOSING, SEED COLLECTION AND NURSERY MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES AT PARK HEADQUARTERS. LOGISTICS FOR THIS CREW WILL BE ARRANGED BETWEEN DAWN LAFLEUR/REBECCA LAWRENCE (CREW SUPERVISOR) AND CLIFF KIPP (MCC). THIS CREW WILL REPORT TO REBECCA LAWRENCE, AT THE NATIVE PLANT NURSERY AT PARK HEADQUARTERS AT 8 AM MAY 16, 2022 FOR ORIENTATION.MCC AND NPS HAVE A MUTUAL INTEREST IN ACCOMPLISHING NEEDED CONSERVATION AND ENVIRONMENTAL RESTORATION PROJECTS IN PARK UNITS WITHIN THE STATE OF MONTANA. THE INVOLVEMENT OF YOUNG ADULTS IN THE CARE AND ENHANCEMENT OF PUBLIC RESOURCES STIMULATES THE PUBLIC PURPOSE OF ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION, DEVELOPMENT OF RESPONSIBLE CITIZENSHIP AND PRODUCTIVE COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT.MCC IS UNIQUELY QUALIFIED FOR CONSERVATION DEVELOPMENT PROJECTS RELATED TO ENVIRONMENTAL RESOURCES. THE MISSION OF MCC IS TO PROTECT AND ENHANCE THE ENVIRONMENT WHILE DEVELOPING YOUNG ADULTS; AGES 15 TO AGE TWENTY-FIVE, TO INSPIRE YOUNG PEOPLE THROUGH HANDS-ON CONSERVATION SERVICE TO BE LEADERS, STEWARDS OF THE LAND AND ENGAGED CITIZENS WHO IMPROVE OUR COMMUNITIES.

COMPETITIVE AWARD AGREEMENT REQUIREMENTSFUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: N/AFUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT: N/AREQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSPURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):GOALS:RECRUIT AN INTERN AND PROVIDE THEM WITH PLANNING AND PARTNERSHIP EXPERIENCE THROUGH WORK WITH COMMUNITIES, AGENCIES, AND PARTNERS TO CELEBRATE THE OREGON NATIONAL HISTORIC TRAIL VIA THE AMERICAN SOLAR CHALLENGE, WHICH WILL FOLLOW THE TRAIL FROM INDEPENDENCE, MO TO TWIN FALLS, ID.INCREASE AWARENESS OF THE OREGON TRAIL AND THE NATIONAL TRAILS SYSTEM THROUGH SOCIAL MEDIA AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH; HIGHLIGHT PRESERVATION EFFORTS BY PARTNERS AND AGENCIES; CREATE ACTIVITIES FOR VISITORSOBJECTIVES:TEACH THE INTERN THE COMPLEXITIES OF PARTNERSHIP WORKDEVELOP THE INTERN'S COMMUNICATION AND COLLABORATION SKILLSENCOURAGE YOUTH INTEREST BY CREATING MEDIA THAT IS COHESIVE, ACCESSIBLE, RELEVANT, AND INCLUSIVESUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE INTERN WILL WILL SUPPORT LOGISTICS, SOCIAL MEDIA, COMMUNITY OUTREACH, AND PARTNER PLANNING.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:PROVIDE THE INTERN WITH REAL-WORLD PLANNING AND PARTNERSHIP EXPERIENCEINCREASE NATIONAL AWARENESS OF THE OREGON TRAIL, THE NATIONAL TRAILS SYSTEM, AND OUTSIDE ORGANIZATIONS.BENEFICIARIES:THE INTERN BY STRENGTHENING COMMUNICATION, COLLABORATION, AND LOGISTICAL SKILLSTHE NATIONAL TRAILS OFFICE WILL LEARN BEST PRACTICES FOR COMMUNICATING WITH YOUTH AND THE COLLABORATION EFFORTS WILL CREATE NEW AND STRENGTHEN EXISTING RELATIONSHIPS.THE PARTNERS AND THE PUBLIC THE INTERN WILL WORK WITH PARTNERS TO CREATE ACTIVITIES FOR THE PUBLIC, SHARE INFORMATION THROUGH SOCIAL MEDIA ABOUT THE NATIONAL HISTORIC TRAILS SYSTEM'S VALUE TO THE AMERICAN PEOPLE, HOW THEY CAN EXPLORE AND PROTECT IT.

COMPETITIVE AWARD AGREEMENT REQUIREMENTSFUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: N/AFUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT: N/AREQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSPURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THE PURPOSE OF THE AWARD IS TO COMPLETE NEEDED MAINTENANCE AND IMPROVEMENTS TO THE INNER CANYON CORRIDOR TRAILS SUCH AS THE NORTH KAIBAB, SOUTH KAIBAB AND BRIGHT ANGEL TRAIL AND OTHER FORESTED TRAILS ON THE NORTH RIM.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:WILL CLEAN DRAINS, PRUNE BACK VEGETATION,, AND REPLACE TRAIL TREAD ON 1.5 MILE OF THE NORTH KAIBAB TRAIL AND ON 1.5 MILE OF THE SOUTH KAIBAB TRAIL AND .5 MILE OF THE BRIGHT ANGEL. WILL ALSO COMPLETE DRAINAGE MAINTENANCE AND BRUSHING/PRUNING, AND CLEARING OF DEBRIS ON 2 MILES OF THE FORESTED TRAILS ON THE NORTH RIM.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:1.5 MILE OF NORTH KAIBAB AND SOUTH KAIBAB FULLY MAINTAINED BY CLEARING TREES AND DEBRIS, REMOVING FALLEN ROCKS AND BOULDERS, AND CLEANING DRAINS TO INCLUDE INSIDE DRAINS AND WATER BARS AND GRADE DIPS.WILL ALSO DO MAINTENANCE AND IMPROVEMENTS TO 2 MILES OF FORESTED TRIALS ON THE NORTH RIM SUCH AS ALONG 2 MILES OF THE UNCLE JIM LOOP. WORK WILL CONSIT OF REMOVING DOWNED TREES, REMOVING DEBRIS AND ROCKS, OUTSLOPING TRAIL TREAD TO APPROXIMATE 120 LINEAR FEET, CAN CLEANING DRAINS ON 2 MILES OF THE UNCLE JIM LOOP.BENEFICIARIES: ALL VISITORS TO GRAND CANYON THAT HIKE THESE MAGNIFICENT INNER CANYON CORRIDOR TRAILS AND THE NORTH RIM FORESTED TRAILS.

NPS FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROJECT ABSTRACTCOMPETITIVE AWARD AGREEMENT REQUIREMENTSFUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: N/AFUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT: N/AREQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSA. PROJECT STATEMENT -RECREATIONAL PROGRAMS AND STEWARDSHIP OUTREACH AMBASSADORS. THE GROUP OF AT LEAST SEVEN YOUTH LEADERSHIP AND STEWARDSHIP AMBASSADORS (YLSA) INTERNS WILL WORK WITH RESOURCE EDUCATION STAFF TO LEARN HOW TO CREATE AND DELIVER PROGRAMS TO TEACH LOCAL COMMUNITIES ABOUT RECREATION AND VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUTH IN GULF ISLANDS NATIONAL SEASHORE'S FLORIDA AND MISSISSIPPI AREAS.B. PERFORMANCE GOALS - THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVE OF THE INTERNSHIP IS TO ACCOMPLISH THE INTERIOR SECRETARY'S GOAL OF IMPROVING DIALOGUE AND RELATIONSHIPS WITH PERSONS AND ENTITIES BOARDING THE NATIONAL SEASHORE'S LANDS. IN DOING THIS, INTERNS WILL GAIN VALUABLE KNOWLEDGE ABOUT THE PARK, ITS RESOURCES, AND HOW THE PARK PROTECTS THOSE RESOURCES WHILE PROVIDING FOR VISITOR EDUCATION AND ENJOYMENT. FINALLY, INTERNS WILL DEVELOP EXPERIENCE IN PUBLIC SPEAKING, CUSTOMER SERVICE, PROFESSIONAL WRITING, AND TEAMWORK.C. PERFORMANCE OBJECTIVES -  FACILITATE OPPORTUNITIES TO IMPROVE PEOPLE'S UNDERSTANDING OF THE PURPOSE OF NATURAL, CULTURAL, AND RECREATIONAL  RESOURCES WITHIN GULF ISLANDS NATIONAL SEASHORE. STRENGTHEN RELATIONSHIPS WITH LOCAL PARTNERS TO PROMOTE RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP AND RECRUIT VOLUNTEERS. ESTABLISH A CONNECTION WITH THE LOCAL RESERVE OFFICERS' TRAINING CORPS, JUNIOR RESERVE OFFICERS' TRAINING CORPS,  BOYS AND GIRLS OF AMERICA, YMCA, AND OTHER YOUTH ORGANIZATIONS. PLAN AND PARTICIPATE IN LIVING HISTORY DEMONSTRATIONS, WATER-BASED PROGRAMS, OUTREACH, AND SPECIAL EVENTS. PROVIDE SERVICE TO VISITORS SUCH AS MANNING VISITOR CENTER DESK, ANSWERING PHONES, AND INQUIRIES. RESEARCH AND WRITE ONE NEW PROGRAM PER INTERN. MILESTONES - N/AASSISTANCE LISTING - TITLE - BENEFICIARIESCFDA 15.931 YOUTH AND VETERAN ORGANIZATIONS CONSERVATION ACTIVITIES.PRIVATE NON-PROFIT INSTITUTIONS AND ORGANIZATIONS; PUBLIC AND PRIVATE NON-PROFIT ACADEMIC INSTITUTIONS; STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENT AGENCIES; QUASI-PUBLIC NON-PROFIT INSTITUTIONS AND ORGANIZATIONS THAT SUPPORT YOUTH AND YOUNG ADULT CAREER TRAINING AND DEVELOPMENT, AND EDUCATION IN THE AREAS OF NATURAL AND/OR CULTURAL RESOURCE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT. INDIVIDUALS/FAMILIES; STUDENTS; AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC WILL RECEIVE A BENEFIT FROM THE DEVELOPMENT AND EXECUTION OF THESE PROGRAMS AND PROJECTS.

THIS PROJECT PROMOTES INNOVATION BY ADDRESSING BARRIERS REGARDING ACCESSIBILITY OF ASTRONOMY PROGRAMS. THIS WILL BE DONE BY:DEVELOPING PROGRAMS AND MATERIALS TO INCREASE THE ACCESSIBILITY OF NIGHT SKY PROGRAMMING AND TELESCOPE STAR PARTIES ENGAGE WITH YOUTH WHO ARE BLIND OR VISUALLY IMPAIRED AND/OR DEAF OR HARD OF HEARING (BVI/DHH)RAISE AWARENESS FOR ACCESSIBLE ASTRONOMY INITIATIVES THROUGH SOCIAL MEDIA AND NPS.GOVSUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE ACCESSIBLE ASTRONOMY TEAM WILL DEVELOP PROGRAMS AND MATERIALS TO INCREASE THE ACCESSIBILITY OF NIGHT SKY PROGRAMMING AND TELESCOPE STAR PARTIES. THEY WILL UTILIZE AND ADAPT ACCESSIBLE RESOURCES THROUGH NASA, INCLUDING TACTILE GRAPHIC BOOKS AND 3D PRINTING TEMPLATES. THE TEAM WILL COLLABORATE WITH OTHER INTERPRETERS TO IMPROVE ACCESSIBILITY OF NIGHT SKY PROGRAMS. THEY WILL ALSO COLLABORATE WITH OTHERS ON SPECIAL EVENTS TARGETED FOR FAMILIES, SUCH AS THE DARK SKY FESTIVAL AND INTERNATIONAL DARK SKY WEEK.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE ACCESSIBLE ASTRONOMY TEAM WILL REACH AT LEAST 1,500 YOUTH WITH DISABILITIES AND THEIR FAMILIES THROUGH PROGRAMS IN THE PARK. THE ACCESSIBLE ASTRONOMY TEAM WILL COLLABORATE WITH OTHER INTERPRETERS ON AT LEAST TWO SPECIAL DARK SKY EVENTS TARGETED FOR FAMILIES. THE ACCESSIBLE ASTRONOMY TEAM WILL CREATE AT LEAST TWO ARTICLES FOR SOCIAL MEDIA AND THE NPS.GOV WEBSITE THAT CAN BUILD AWARENESS FOR ACCESSIBILITY IN DARK SKY PROGRAMMING. THE TEAM WILL ALSO DEVELOP AN INTERNAL BEST PRACTICES/CASE STUDY DOCUMENT TO SHARE WITH OTHER PARKS.THE ACCESSIBLE ASTRONOMY TEAM WILL MEASURE SUCCESS THROUGH INFORMAL FEEDBACK FROM THE YOUTH ORGANIZATIONS INVOLVED IN THE PROGRAMS. STAFF WILL ALSO ASSESS THE PROGRAMS THROUGH REFLECTION, RECORDING SUCCESSES, AND IDENTIFYING ROOM FOR IMPROVEMENT.BENEFICIARIES:VISITORS ACCESSIBLE NIGHT SKY PROGRAMMING WILL BE PROVIDED TO ALL VISITORS. PROGRAMS WILL BE DESIGNED TO TEACH VISITORS ABOUT THE SCIENCE, HISTORY, AND LORE SURROUNDING THE NIGHT SKIES WITH THE GOAL OF CREATING CONNECTIONS BETWEEN VISITORS AND DARK PLACES SUCH AS DEATH VALLEY NATIONAL PARK.NATIONAL PARK SERVICE: DEATH VALLEY NATIONAL PARK WILL BE ABLE TO USE THE MATERIALS CREATED BY THIS PROJECT FOR FUTURE NIGHT SKY AND ACCESSIBILITY INITIATIVES. ADDITIONALLY, THE TEAM WILL SHARE RESOURCES AND BEST PRACTICES WITH OTHER PARK UNITS. THIS INCREASES THE IMPACT AND LONGEVITY OF THIS PROJECT.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THE NPS AND THE RECIPIENT WISH TO COOPERATE IN ENGAGING AND EMPOWERING YOUTH COMMUNITY MEMBERS TO FIND THEIR RELEVANCY IN THE THEMES AND STORIES OF THREE NATIONAL HISTORIC SITES THROUGH COLLABORATIVE PROGRAMMING AND PERSONAL EXPERIENCES.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS TASK AGREEMENT IS TO CREATE AN ENGAGING AND PRODUCTIVE YOUTH DEVELOPMENT AND EMPLOYMENT PROGRAM. SPECIFICALLY, THE NPS AND THE RECIPIENT WILL WORK TOGETHER TO SELECT AND ONBOARD A YOUTH WORK LEAD (21-30) AND YOUTH CREW (15-18). THE RESULTING CREW WILL WORK WITH PARK STAFF TO CREATE A PUBLIC PROGRAM THAT CAPTURES THE RELEVANCE OF SITE THEMES TO YOUTH.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:BEGINNING IN MAY 2022, A YOUTH WORK LEAD WILL WORK WITH PARK STAFF TO RECRUIT AND SELECT A CREW; AS WELL AS DEVELOP AN EFFECTIVE SUMMER CURRICULUM. WORKING WITH THE RECIPIENT, NPS WILL ENGAGE WITH THE SELECTED CREW TO RESEARCH SITE STORIES AND DEVELOP A YOUTH-LED PROGRAM HIGHLIGHTING THE THEMES YOUTH FIND MOST RELEVANT AND APPLICABLE TO THEIR PERSONAL CONTEMPORARY STORIES.BENEFICIARIES:THE BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT ARE THE YOUTH EMPLOYED BY THIS PROJECT AS WELL AS THE SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES, SPECIFICALLY YOUTH IN THESE COMMUNITIES, WHO WILL GAIN BROADER AWARENESS AND ACCESS TO THE SITES; AS WELL AS AN UNDERSTANDING AND APPRECIATION FOR THE CONTEMPORARY RELEVANCE OF HISTORIC THEMES.

PURPOSE OF AWARDSUMMARY OF PROJECT-SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: SUPPORT FOR RESOURCE PROTECTION AND RESTORATION AT ZION NATIONAL PARK; SPECIFICALLY, VEGETATION MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES (THINNING, EXOTIC PLANT CONTROL, NATIVE PLANT MATERIAL COLLECTION AND PRODUCTION, REVEGETATION) AND HISTORIC STRUCTURE PRESERVATION.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THROUGH THIS AGREEMENT CORPS MEMBERS WILL RECEIVE HANDS-ON TRAINING IN RESOURCE PROTECTION AND RESTORATION IN NATIONAL PARKS, INCLUDING SEED COLLECTION, SEED CLEANING, OUT-PLANTING, AND EXOTIC PLANT TREATMENTS. THE GOAL IS TO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR PUBLIC SERVICE AND YOUTH EMPLOYMENT AND TRAINING IN CONSERVATION-RELATED WORK. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE REVEGETATION OF HISTORIC AND HIGH VISITOR-USE AREAS, MAINTENANCE AND MONITORING ASSISTANCE OF EXISTING AREAS WITH EXOTIC PLANT MANAGEMENT AND REVEGETATION EFFORTS.BENEFICIARIES: BECAUSE THE PROJECTS INVOLVING UTAH STATE UNIVERSITY/UTAH CONSERVATION CORPS (UCC) ARE IN SUCH VISIBLE AND HIGH-VISITATION AREAS, BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE VISITORS TO ZION NP (EXCEEDING 5 MILLION PEOPLE ANNUALLY), ZION NP MANAGERS, AND THE CORPS MEMBERS THEMSELVES, WHO RECEIVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO LEARN NEW SKILLS, INTERACT WITH PEOPLE FROM ACROSS THE GLOBE, AND EXPERIENCE LAND-MANAGEMENT EFFORTS AND PROJECT COMPLETION.

THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE ONE STUDENT CONSERVATION ASSOCIATION INTERN WITH TRAINING AND HANDS-ON LEARNING EXPERIENCE WITH POPULATION ANALYSIS, MONITORING, AND RESEARCH AT OREGON CAVES NATIONAL MONUMENT AND PRESERVE.MONITORING TASKS MAY INCLUDE CAMERA-TRAP MONITORING, ACOUSTIC MONITORING, BAT ROOST LOCATING AND CLIMATE MODELLING, BAT MIST NETTING FOR BAT BODY MASS, MEASUREMENT, IDENTIFICATION AND WHITE-NOSE SYNDROME (WNS) INSPECTION; TELEMETRY TRACKING FLIGHT ACTIVITY PATTERNS; AND ADDITIONAL VARIOUS RESOURCE MONITORING TASKS.THIS INTERNSHIP WILL PROVIDES HANDS-ON EXPERIENCE AND OPPORTUNITIES TO APPLY CLASSROOM-LEARNED SKILLS IN A MEANINGFUL WORK ENVIRONMENT AND HELP PREPARE THEM FOR FUTURE EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES. THE MONITORING ACTIVITIES WILL PROVIDE VALUABLE DATA TOWARDS THE REDUCTION OF PERMANENT EXTIRPATION OR EVEN EXTINCTION OF SPECIES FOR RESEARCHERS AND BIOLOGISTS THROUGHOUT NORTH AMERICA.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THIS COLLABORATION PROVIDES AN OPPORTUNITY FOR AN INTERN TO ACTIVELY ASSIST AND GAIN EXPERIENCE WITH HISTORIC SITE INTERPRETATION BY WORKING ALONGSIDE PARK STAFF AND PARTNERS TO INCREASE YOUTH INTEREST IN FEDERAL LANDS AND STEWARDSHIP PRACTICES AS WELL AS DEVELOP NEW SKILLS FOR THE WORKFORCE.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:BECOME FLUENT IN THE SITE'S HISTORY AND THE KENNEDY FAMILY'S THIRTEEN YEARS IN BROOKLINE, MA.PRODUCE ENGAGING PUBLIC PROGRAMS THAT UTILIZE 21ST CENTURY INTERPRETIVE SKILLS AND SOUND RESEARCH.WORK INDEPENDENTLY AND WITHIN SMALL TEAMS TO IMPROVE SITE RESOURCES AND ACCESS.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:DIGITIZING A BACKLOG OF CONTENT CREATED FOR WEBSITE USE AND PREPARING DIGITAL RESOURCES FOR PRINT.CONDUCTING HISTORICAL RESEARCH AND PREPARING PUBLICATIONS BASED ON PRIMARY AND SECONDARY SOURCE RESEARCH.PRODUCING AT LEAST ONE NEW VIRTUAL PROGRAM.BENEFICIARIES:PUBLIC, SITE VISITORS, STUDENT CONSERVATION ASSOCIATION

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): THE RECIPIENT WILL SELECT AND OVERSEE QUALIFIED AND MOTIVATED UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE STUDENTS TO WORK ALONGSIDE NPS STAFF IN THE CULTURAL RESOURCES, INTERPRETATION, AND RELATED FIELDS IN DIFFERENT PARK UNITS/PROGRAMS AND FEDERAL OFFICES THROUGHOUT THE NATION. SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: THE INTERN WILL WORK ON THE FOLLOWING: CATALOGING AND DIGITIZING HISTORICAL PHOTOGRAPHS. UNDER THE SUPERVISION OF NOCA'S MUSEUM CURATOR, THE INTERN WILL PRODUCE PRESERVATION-QUALITY DIGITAL FILES, METADATA AND SECTION 508-COMPLIANT IMAGE DESCRIPTIONS FOR THE PHOTOGRAPHS ALONG WITH A FINDING AID FOR THE COLLECTION. UPON PROJECT COMPLETION, THE DIGITIZED PHOTOGRAPHS WILL BE UPLOADED TO NPGALLERY AND AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC USE. THE INTERN WILL WORK UNDER THE SUPERVISION OF THE MUSEUM CURATOR AT THE CURATION FACILITY LOCATED IN THE MARBLEMOUNT RANGER STATION CLOSE TO THE PARK COMPLEX'S ENTRANCE. THE INTERN MAY BE TASKS WITH OTHER CULTURAL RESOURCES OR EDUCATION PROJECTS WITH PARK STAFF. PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: INTERN(S) WILL BE RECRUITED, SELECTED, AND COMPLETE THEIR TERMS AS FEASIBLE. INTERNS WILL COMPLETE TASKS OUTLINED IN THE SCOPE OF WORK.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): THE RECIPIENT WILL SELECT AND OVERSEE QUALIFIED AND MOTIVATED UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE STUDENTS TO WORK ALONGSIDE NPS STAFF IN THE CULTURAL RESOURCES, INTERPRETATION, AND RELATED FIELDS IN DIFFERENT PARK UNITS/PROGRAMS AND FEDERAL OFFICES THROUGHOUT THE NATION. SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: THE INTERN WILL CONDUCT HISTORICAL RESEARCH AT THE MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF ARCHIVES AND HISTORY, THE LOUISIANA DIGITAL LIBRARY, AND THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES DIGITAL RECORDS TO UNCOVER THE RECONSTRUCTION ERA AND CIVIL RIGHTS STORIES CONNECTED TO THE MEDGAR AND MYRLIE EVERS HOME NATIONAL MONUMENT (MISSISSIPPI), VICKSBURG NATIONAL MILITARY PARK (MISSISSIPPI), AND CANE RIVER CREOLE NATIONAL HISTORICAL PARK (LOUISIANA). THE INFORMATION WILL BE USED TO DEVELOP INTERPRETATION AND EDUCATION PRODUCTS, SUCH AS BROCHURES, WEBSITES, AND SOCIAL MEDIA POSTS, THAT WILL LINK THE HISTORIES OF ALL THREE PARKS. APPLICANTS WILL WORK WITH THE PARK STAFF AT ALL THREE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE (NPS) SITES AND MUST DEMONSTRATE STRONG COMPUTER, RESEARCH, WRITING AND ORGANIZATIONAL SKILLS. PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: INTERN(S) WILL BE RECRUITED, SELECTED, AND COMPLETE THEIR TERMS AS FEASIBLE. INTERNS WILL COMPLETE TASKS OUTLINED IN THE SCOPE OF WORK.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):ACE AIMS TO PROVIDE NPS ACADEMY AND NON-NPS ACADEMY INTERNS TO PARKS TO FULFILL THIS PURPOSE. THE SELECTED INTERNS WILL COMPLETE 12-WEEK INTERNSHIPS IN OPERATIONS, STEWARDSHIP AND PROTECTION OF NATIONAL PARKS. ACE INTERNSHIP PROGRAMS FACILITATES WORKFORCE SUCCESSION PLANNING FOR THE NPS THROUGH RECRUITMENT AND TRAINING AND ACCOMPLISHES PROJECTS IN THE PARKS THAT OTHERWISE WOULD GO UNDONE.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THE NPS INTERNS WILL PARTICIPATE IN NATURAL RESOURCE CONSERVATION AND INTERPRETATION PROJECTS AT ROCKY MOUNTAIN NATIONAL PARK. THROUGH THESE PROJECTS THE INTERNS WILL GAIN VALUABLE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS THAT BENEFIT THEM THROUGHOUT THEIR CAREER. THE INTERNS WILL WORK PRIMARILY ON VARIOUS NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES WITH AN EMPHASIS ON VEGETATION MANAGEMENT. THE INTERNS WILL ALSO LEARN ABOUT INTERPRETATION AND VISITOR SERVICES BY WORKING IN VISITOR CENTERS, PRESENTING PROGRAMS, AND COMMUNICATING SCIENCE TO VISITORS. THE INTERNS WILL INTERACT WITH PARK STAFF FROM NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES, FACILITY MANAGEMENT, INTERPRETATION, VISITOR AND RESOURCE PROTECTION. THROUGH THESE INTERNSHIPS, THE INTERNS WILL DEVELOP SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE TO ENTER THE WORKFORCE WELL EQUIPPED FOR A CAREER IN CONSERVATION, WHILE COMPLETING IMPORTANT RESOURCE CONSERVATION WORK THAT HAS A DIRECT IMPACT ON VISITOR SERVICES.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THIS AGREEMENT INCLUDES SEVERAL ACE INTERNSHIPS, EACH A TWELVE-WEEK COMMITMENT INVARIOUS CAREER PATHS WITHIN THE NPS. THE INTERNS WILL SERVE IN THE FOLLOWING POSITIONS:THE EAST DISTRICT INTERNS WILL WORK ALONGSIDE VARIOUS PARK STAFF IN THE RESOURCESTEWARDSHIP DIVISION OF ROCKY MOUNTAIN NATIONAL PARK. THE INTERNS WILL PRIMARILY ASSISTWITH PROJECTS IN THE PARK VEGETATION MANAGEMENT PROGRAM, INCLUDING SOIL STABILIZATION, VEGETATION RESTORATION, EROSION CONTROL, INVASIVE PLANT MANAGEMENT, MITIGATIONS OF BURNED AREAS, EDUCATION OF HABITAT RECOVERY, AND RESTORATION OF ALPINE VEGETATION.THE COLORADO DISTRICT INTERNS WILL WORK ALONGSIDE PARK STAFF IN THE INTERPRETATION & EDUCATION DIVISION. THE INTERNS WORK WITH VARIOUS STAFF IN VISITOR CENTERS AND ON PARK TRAILS, VISITOR AND RESOURCE PROTECTION PATROLS, AND WITH FACILITIES MANAGEMENT DOING MAINTENANCE.BENEFICIARIES:THE PRIMARY BENEFICIARIES ARE THE INTERNS AS THEY GAIN INVALUABLE SKILLS THAT WILL HELP THEM AS THEY DEVELOP THEIR FUTURE CAREER PATHS.SECONDARILY PARK VISITORS WILL BENEFIT FROM THE ASSISTANCE AND EDUCATION THAT INTERNS PROVIDE AT VISITOR CENTERS AND ON TRAILS, AS WELL AS FROM THE ENHANCEMENTS TO PARK NATURAL AND INFRASTRUCTURE RESOURCES THAT WILL ALSO HELP PROVIDE A BETTER EXPERIENCE AS VISITORS EXPLORE THE

COMPETITIVE AWARD AGREEMENT REQUIREMENTSFUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: N/AFUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT: N/AREQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSPURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THE PROJECT WILL BE TO DEVELOP IN-PARK BASED YOUTH PROGRAMS. AS THE INTERNS LEARN ABOUT THE PARK AND DEVELOP THE ACTIVITIES AND PROGRAMS, THEY WILL BECOME FAMILIAR WITH FORMING CONNECTIONS BETWEEN YOUNGER GENERATION AND THEIR CONNECTIONS TO NATIONAL PARKS. AS A MEMBER OF THE INTERPRETIVE TEAM THE INTERNS WILL LEARN CRITICAL SKILLS IN TEAMWORK AND TIME MANAGEMENT WHILE COMPLETING PROJECTS AND SUPPORTING THE INTERPRETATION TEAM.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:WORK REQUIRES PROVIDING INFORMATION, ORIENTATION AND INTERPRETATION IN-PERSON, BY PHONE, EMAIL, AND STANDARD MAIL. THE INTERN WILL NEED TO WORK WITHIN TIME CONSTRAINTS AND DEADLINES.WORK INVOLVES RESEARCHING, DEVELOPING, AND PRESENTING INTERPRETIVE TALKS ON TOPICS INCLUDING: THE 280-MILLION-YEAR GEOLOGIC HISTORY OF THE TULAROSA BASIN, HIGH DESERT ECOSYSTEMS, CLIMATE CHANGE IN THE SOUTHWEST, AND DARK SKY RESOURCES. OTHER DEVELOPMENTAL INTERPRETIVE OPPORTUNITIES MAY INCLUDE CREATING AND PRESENTING INTERPRETIVE HIKES, STAR GAZING, AND FULL MOON PROGRAMS. PROGRAM OUTLINES ARE AVAILABLE FOR REFERENCE AND USE.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:INTERNS WILL BE PROVIDED IN-DEPTH TRAINING THROUGHOUT THEIR APPOINTMENT. THIS WILL INCLUDE INTENSIVE COACHING FROM SENIOR INTERPRETIVE STAFF IN THE AREAS OF PUBLIC PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT, CUSTOMER SERVICE, AND SAFETY AND FIRST AID.THE FINAL OUTCOME WILL BE THAT THE INTERN IS PREPARED FOR A UNIFORMED POSITION AS AN INTERPRETIVE PARK RANGER OR PARK GUIDE IN THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE, OTHER LAND MANAGEMENT AGENCIES, OR IN OTHER PRIVATE OR PUBLIC CAREERS.BENEFICIARIES:THE MAIN BENEFACTOR WILL BE THE YOUTH INTERN AS THEY ARE LEARNING SKILLS DURING THEIR INTERNSHIP WILL APPLY AID THE PARTICIPANT IN BOTH PUBLIC AND PRIVATE CAREERS.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THIS PROJECT FULFILLS A PUBLIC PURPOSE BY ENGAGING RECIPIENTS AND PARTNERS IN SHARED ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP. THE PROJECT MOTIVATES PARTICIPANTS TO BECOME INVOLVED IN THE NATURAL RESOURCE PROTECTION OF THEIR COMMUNITIES AND BEYOND. PARTICIPANTS GAIN "REAL WORLD" AND HANDS-ON EXPERIENCE OUTSIDE OF THE CLASSROOM ON NATURAL RESOURCE PROJECTS.BY PARTICIPATING IN THE PROJECT, YOUTH WILL LEARN AND DEVELOP VALUABLE SKILLS IN INVASIVE NON-NATIVE PLANT INVENTORY, MAPPING, AND MANAGEMENT; NATIVE PLANT RESTORATION; AND RESTORATION EFFECTIVENESS MONITORING. INVASIVE SPECIES WILL BE TREATED AND HABITATS RESTORED.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:PROVIDE 5, 5-7-PERSON UTAH CONSERVATION CORPS SAW CREWS TO PROVIDE INVASIVE NON-NATIVE PLANT INVENTORY, MAPPING, AND MANAGEMENT; NATIVE PLANT RESTORATION IN 2022.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:CONNECT YOUTH TO THEIR NATIONAL PARKS THROUGH RESTORATION AND INVASIVE PLANT TREATMENT PROJECTS. PROVIDE ON THE GROUND ASSISTANCE TO GLEN CANYON TO REMOVE INVASIVE SPECIES AND RESTORE NATIVE ECOSYSTEMS.EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE 20 TREES PLANTED, 1/2 ACRE OF NON-NATIVE PLANTS MAPPED AND TREATED.BENEFICIARIES: YOUTH

FUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: P-P-YOUTH-22-001FUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT: YOUTH AND VETERAN ORGANIZATION CONSERVATION ACTIVITIESPURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): DEVELOP PROGRAM MATERIALS FOR PROMOTING NATURAL RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP IN YOUTH THROUGH HANDS-ON TRAINING AND THE TREATMENT OF INVASIVE SPECIES WITHIN ST CROIX NATIONAL SCENIC RIVERWAY.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: ENGAGE A YOUTH CREW IN HANDS-ON TRAINING AND IN THE LONG-TERM MANAGEMENT POLICIES WHILE DEVELOPING STEWARDS OF THE PARK'S NATIVE PLANT SPECIES AND ASSOCIATED RESOURCES. IDENTIFY TARGET SITES WITHIN THE PARK FOR MONITORING AND TREATMENT OF INVASIVE SPECIES; DEVELOP AND CO-LEAD TRAININGS FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE YOUTH WHO WILL PERFORM TREATMENTS OF INVASIVE SPECIES; DOCUMENT, MAP, AND DEVELOP RECORDS OF THE TREATMENT SITES FOR ASSURING LONG-TERM MONITORING GOALS ARE ACHIEVED.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: PROVIDE YOUTH THE TRAINING AND EXPERIENCE WITH INVASIVE SPECIES MANAGEMENT AND HOW IT FITS WITHIN THE OVERREACHING PARK MANAGEMENT OBJECTIVES.BENEFICIARIES: CONSERVATION CORPS OF MINNESOTA & IOWA

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): THIS PROJECT WILL MOTIVATE YOUTH TO BE INVOLVED WITH THE NATURAL, CULTURAL, AND HISTORIC RESOURCE PROTECTION OF THEIR COMMUNITIES AND BEYOND. PURPOSE OF AWARDSUMMARY OF PROJECT-SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: SUPPORT FOR RESOURCE PROTECTION AND RESTORATION AT ZION NATIONAL PARK; SPECIFICALLY, VEGETATION MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES (THINNING, EXOTIC PLANT CONTROL, NATIVE PLANT MATERIAL COLLECTION AND PRODUCTION, REVEGETATION) AND HISTORIC STRUCTURE PRESERVATION.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THROUGH THIS AGREEMENT CORPS MEMBERS WILL RECEIVE HANDS-ON TRAINING IN RESOURCE PROTECTION AND RESTORATION IN NATIONAL PARKS, INCLUDING SEED COLLECTION, SEED CLEANING, OUT-PLANTING, EXOTIC PLANT TREATMENTS, FIRE BREAK PREPARATION AND MAINTENANCE OF HISTORIC IRRIGATION DITCHES. COMPETITIVE AWARD AGREEMENT REQUIREMENTSFUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: N/AFUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT: N/AREQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSPURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):THIS COLLABORATIVE AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE STUDENT CONSERVATION ASSOCIATION INC, AND THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE (NPS) WILL ASSIST FORT LARAMIE NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE TO PRESERVE, CATALOG, AND DIGITIZE FOR SECURITY AND ACCESS APPROXIMATELY 6,000 LIBRARY AND ARCHIVAL ITEMS. THIS PROJECT HELPS THE PARK MEET CURRENT PRIORITIES SET BY THE DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR, INCLUDING CREATING A CONSERVATION STEWARDSHIP LEGACY THROUGH PRESERVING AND CATALOGING PRECIOUS PARK RESOURCES INTO INTERIOR COLLECTIONS MANAGEMENT SYSTEM (ICMS) AND THE LIBRARY RESOURCE INFORMATION SERVICE (LIBRIS). ADDITIONALLY, THIS PROJECT ENSURES AGENCY AND PARK GOALS ARE CONTINUED AND MET. THIS NATIONALLY SIGNIFICANT COLLECTION DOCUMENTS A WIDE ARRAY OF RESOURCES AND ACTIVITIES ON THE PREMIER FRONTIER POST OF WESTERN EXPANSION IN THE UNITED STATES.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:THIS PROJECT WILL CREATE BASELINE DOCUMENTATION THROUGH DETAILED CATALOG RECORDS IN LIBRIS AND ICMS THAT WILL ACCURATELY DESCRIBE THE CURRENT INTELLECTUAL AND PHYSICAL CONDITION OF LIBRARY AND ARCHIVAL MATERIALS AND PROVIDE BASELINE DATA FOR FUTURE MONITORING AND REPORTING. COMPLETED PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE ACTIVITIES ON NEARLY 6,000 OBJECTS WILL BE PERFORMED THROUGHOUT THE DURATION OF THE INTERNSHIP.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THERE ARE OVER 355,000 ARTIFACTS AND PUBLICATIONS HELD WITHIN THE FORT LARAMIE NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE COLLECTIONS. NEARLY 6,000 OF LIBRARY AND ARCHIVAL MATERIAL ARE ON IN CIRCULATION AND AVAILABLE FOR PUBLIC USE. ACCESSIBILITY TO VIEW THIS MATERIAL AND ENSURE ITS INTEGRITY FOR THE FUTURE RELIES HEAVILY ON THE ACTIONS AND PREVENTATIVE MAINTENANCE ACTIVITY THAT NEEDS TO BE CONDUCTED ANNUALLY. INTERN WILL ASSIST IN THIS PROCESS THROUGH RECEIVING HANDS-ON TRAINING BY EXPERIENCED PROFESSIONALS. ADDITIONALLY, THEY WILL REORGANIZE, HOUSE, AND CATALOG VARIOUS LIBRARY MATERIAL. WORK WILL ALSO BE CONDUCTED IN THE PARK ARCHIVES AND INCLUDES LARGE FORMAT SCANNING, ARRANGEMENT OF BACKLOG MATERIAL, AND ENTERING CATALOG DATA INTO THE INTERIOR COLLECTIONS MANAGEMENT SYSTEM (ICMS) AND THE LIBRARY RESOURCE INFORMATION SERVICE (LIBRIS).BENEFICIARIES:THE PUBLIC BENEFITS FROM THIS PROJECT ARE MANY. PUBLIC INTEREST IN NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES IS CONTINUALLY GROWING. OVER 46,000 VISITORS CAME TO FORT LARAMIE NATIONAL HISTORIC SITE IN FY 21. NEARLY ALL THESE PATRONS VIEW AND INQUIRE ABOUT LIBRARY AND ARCHIVAL MATERIALS WHICH INCLUDE THEIR PROVENANCE TO THE SITE, HISTORICAL CONTEXT, TIES TO FAMILIAL HISTORY, AND MORE. ADDITIONALLY, MATERIAL WITHIN IN THE COLLECTIONS ARE USED IN COLLABORATIVE RESEARCH PROJECTS WITH UNDERGRADUATE, GRADUATE, AND FACULTY FROM UNIVERSITIES NATIONWIDE, INDEPENDENT AND NEWS MEDIA, AND MANY MEMBERS OF THE PUBLIC.

COMPETITIVE AWARD AGREEMENT REQUIREMENTSFUNDING OPPORTUNITY NUMBER: N/AFUNDING OPPORTUNITY GOALS TEXT: N/AREQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSPURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): THE INVOLVEMENT OF YOUNG ADULTS IN THE CARE AND ENHANCEMENT OF PUBLIC RESOURCES STIMULATES THE PUBLIC PURPOSE OF ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION, DEVELOPMENT OF RESPONSIBLE CITIZENSHIP AND PRODUCTIVE COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT. AT THE SAME TIME THIS PROJECT FOCUSES ON THE REDUCTION OF DEFERRED TRAIL MAINTENANCE THROUGH LONG TERM, SUSTAINABLE MAINTENANCE PRACTICES AND TECHNIQUES, PROVIDES INCREASED OPPORTUNITIES FOR VISITOR ENJOYMENT AND CREATES OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE YOUTH EMPLOYED TO COMPLETE MEANINGFUL STEWARDSHIP WORK ON AN IRREPLACEABLE NATURE RESOURCE.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: -CONSERVATION YOUTH CREWS WILL TRANSFORM MORE THAN 1400 FEET OF EXISTING TRAIL TREAD INTO ACCESSIBLE TRAIL TREAD AND REHABILITATE SEVERAL MILES OF FIRE IMPACTED TRAIL. THEY WILL ALSO CORRECT TRAIL STRUCTURAL TREAD DEFICIENCIES ON HIGH USE STOCK AND FOOT TRAILS TO INCLUDE BOARDWALK REPLACEMENT, TURNPIKE CONSTRUCTION AND CHECK AND FILL, AND CLEAR MORE THAN TWO MILES OF WOODY BRUSH ALONG TRAIL CORRIDORSPERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: TRANSFORMING EXISTING TRAILS TO ACCOMMODATE ACCESSIBILITY ALLOWS FOR INCREASED OPPORTUNITIES FOR VISITORS TO ENJOY THEIR NATURAL RESOURCES, A CONTINUED RESPONSE TO BURNED OVER TRAILS BOTH BY CLEARING AND RE-ESTABLISHING PROPER DRAINAGE WILL CURTAIL FUTURE MAJOR TREAD FAILURES AND DECREASE REQUIRED MAINTENANCE. WOODY BRUSH REMOVAL ALONG TRAIL CORRIDORS INCREASES LINE OF SIGHT DISTANCES AND IS PART OF THE BEAR MANAGEMENT PLAN IN EFFORTS TO REDUCE SURPRISE WILDLIFE ENCOUNTERS.BENEFICIARIES: MORE THAN 200,000 VISITORS EACH YEAR WILL BENEFIT DIRECTLY FROM THE WORK PERFORMED BY THIS PROJECT WITH AN IMPROVED TRAIL CORRIDOR, THE YOUTH INVOLVED WILL BENEFIT FROM THE EXPOSURE TO NATURAL RESOURCE STEWARDSHIP AND PROTECTION AND THE RESOURCE ITSELF MAY BENEFIT AS WELL WITH SUSTAINABLE, WELL EXECUTED TREAD REPAIRS FENDING OFF THE RELENTLESS EROSIVE FORCES THAT CAN ACCOMPANY INCREASED VISITATION.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): PERSONNEL FROM THE YMCA AND NPS WILL COLLABORATE TO CREATE EXPERIENCES AND EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUTH SUMMER PROGRAMS THROUGH BRINGING YOUTH OUTDOORS TOGETHER. YMCA INTERNS WILL GET VALUABLE WORK EXPERIENCE AND CRITICAL ON THE JOB TRAINING THAT WILL HELP THEM IN THEIR FUTURE CAREERS. SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: PROJECT GOALS - CENTERED ON THE PROGRAM ELEMENTS OF RECREATION, CONSERVATION AND SERVICE, THE PROGRAM PROVIDES UNIQUE RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES, SPECIAL LEARNING EXPERIENCES IN NATURE AND HISTORY, SERVICE EXPERIENCE THROUGH SIMPLE MEMORABLE WORK PROJECTS AND CONTINUED LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT THROUGH WORK EXPERIENCES FOR STAFF AND VOLUNTEERS INVOLVED WITH THE Y AND NPS ASPECTS OF THE PROGRAM. THE YMCA-NPS SUMMER CAMP PROGRAM SETS AN ANNUAL MINIMUM GOAL FOR 2022 TO REACH OVER 4,000 YOUTH AGES 5-15 TO PARTICIPATE IN A SUMMER DAY CAMP PROGRAM EXPERIENCE LEARNING ABOUT THE OUTDOORS, NATURAL OR CULTURAL HISTORY AT THE Y AND AT THEIR NEARBY NATIONAL PARK SITES. NPS FUNDING SUPPORTS YS IN REACHING THIS GOAL, AS WELL AS THE PARTICIPATING YS TYPICALLY DOUBLE THEIR TARGET YOUTH SERVED EACH YEAR AND BRING A 1-1 MATCH TO THE TABLE. IN ADDITION, A GOAL WAS ALSO SET TO ENGAGE OVER 250 TEENS AGES 16-18 IN LEADERSHIP TRAINING AND SERVICE-LEARNING EXPERIENCES AND INVOLVE AT LEAST 75 YOUNG ADULTS AGES 18-25 WITH EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES IN THE PROGRAM

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): PERSONNEL FROM THE RMYC AND NPS WILL COLLABORATE TO CREATE EXPERIENCES AND EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUTH THROUGH THE AMERICAN SIGN LANGUAGE (ASL) ROCKY MOUNTAIN YOUTH CORPS PROGRAM. RMYC INTERNS WILL GET VALUABLE WORK EXPERIENCE AND CRITICAL ON THE JOB TRAINING THAT WILL HELP THEM IN THEIR FUTURE CAREERS. SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: PERFORMANCE GOALS - COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT NUMBER P20AC00137 WAS ENTERED INTO BETWEEN THE NPS AND RECIPIENT FOR THE PURPOSE OF ASSISTING THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE (NPS) IN THE REHABILITATION, RESTORATION AND ENHANCEMENT OF OUR NATION'S PARKS AND MONUMENTS AS WELL AS CONNECTING PEOPLE TO PARKS AND HELPING LOCAL COMMUNITIES PROTECT WHAT IS SPECIAL TO THEM. THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO INCREASE OUR ABILITY TO PROVIDE LOCAL YOUTH WITH AN OUTDOOR EXPERIENCE AND JOB TRAINING SKILLS, ASSISTING AND LEARNING FROM NPS STAFF, ACTIVITIES THAT ENHANCE VISITOR EXPERIENCE, PROTECT NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCES, AND MAINTAIN INFRASTRUCTURE.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): YOUTH CORPS WILL EMPLOY YOUTH TO REPLACE AN OBSERVATION DECK, AND PERFORM TRAIL MAINTENANCE ON THE LITTLE CALUMET RIVER TRAIL AT INDIANA DUNES NATIONAL PARK (INDU). THIS PROGRAM SEEKS TO UTILIZE QUALIFIED NON-PROFIT YOUTH AND VETERAN SERVING ORGANIZATIONS TO CARRY OUT APPROPRIATE NATURAL AND CULTURAL RESOURCE CONSERVATION, EDUCATION, VOLUNTEER SERVICE AND EDUCATION PROJECTS ON DEPARTMENT OF THE INTERIOR LANDS THROUGH AUTHORIZED NPS PROGRAMS.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:ADD 3-4 INCHES OF TRAIL MIS AND TURNPIKES (A COMBINED MIXTURE OF SAND, CLAY, AND GRAVEL) DELIVERED AND STOCKPILED BY THE ROADS AND TRAILS CREW. TRAIL MIX WILL BE ADDED TO THE EXISTING TRAIL SURFACE OF THE LITTLE CALUMET TRAIL STARTING WEST OF HOWE ROAD AND APPROXIMATELY 5000 SQUARE/FEET 2.4 MILES. MATERIAL WILL BE SPREAD USING WHEELBARROWS, SHOVELS, RAKES, PULASKI, AND OTHER TRAIL TOOLS. TURNPIKES WILL BE MADE UP OF CORRUGATED DRAIN TILE, AND TIMBERS ADDED TO PROVIDE APPROPRIATE RUNOFF/DRAINAGE. IN ADDITION, THE YOUTH CREW WITH DEMO AND RECONSTRUCT A 273 SQUARE FOOT WOODEN OBSERVATION PLATFORM USING TREADED LUMBER, GENERATORS, ELECTRIC CIRCULAR SAWS, SCREW GUNS, HAMMERS, PREY BARS, LEVELS, AND TAPE MEASURES PROVIDED AND TRANSPORTED BY THE ROADS AND TRAILS CREW.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES: THIS IS A TWO WEEK PROJECT, YOUTH CREW WILL LEAVE WITH VALUABLE EXPERIENCE WORKING IN A NATIONAL PARK.BENEFICIARIES: PRIVATE NON-PROFIT INSTITUTIONS AND ORGANIZATIONS; PUBLIC AND PRIVATE NON-PROFIT ACADEMIC INSTITUTIONS; STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENT AGENCIES; QUASI-PUBLIC NON-PROFIT INSTITUTIONS AND ORGANIZATIONS THAT SUPPORT YOUTH AND YOUNG ADULT CAREER TRAINING AND DEVELOPMENT, AND EDUCATION IN THE AREAS OF NATURAL AND/OR CULTURAL RESOURCE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT. INDIVIDUALS/FAMILIES; STUDENTS; AND THE GENERAL PUBLIC WILL RECEIVE A BENEFIT FROM THE DEVELOPMENT AND EXECUTION OF THESE PROGRAMS AND PROJECTS.

REQUIREMENTS FOR ALL AGREEMENTSPURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT):VALLES CALDERA NATIONAL PRESERVE HAS APPROXIMATELY 9 MILES OF LEGACY LIVESTOCK FENCES LEFT IN THE VALLE GRANDE AND THE VALLE SAN ANTONIO. THE GOAL IS TO RESTORE THE LANDSCAPE TO A PRE-FENCED CONDITION. THE OBJECTIVES ARE TO (1) IMPROVE THE VISUAL LANDSCAPE, (2) REDUCE WILDLIFE INJURIES AND MORTALITIES FROM ATTEMPTED FENCE CROSSINGS, AND (3) IMPROVE PUBLIC HEALTH AND SAFETY FOR VISITORS BY REMOVING OBSTACLES TO HIKING AND WINTER SKIING/SNOWSHOEING.SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES:FIELD CREWS WILL CUT OFF AND BUNDLE OLD FENCE WIRE, AND PULL POSTS FROM THE GROUND. OLD FENCE MATERIALS WILL BE STACKED IN CACHES ALONG THE FENCELINES FOR REMOVAL AND RE-CYCLING.PERFORMANCE GOALS INCLUDING MILESTONES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES:THE MAIN PERFORMANCE GOAL IS TO REMOVE THE 9 MILES OF FENCE TO RESTORE THE LANDSCAPE VIEWS AND WILDLIFE AND VISITOR SAFETY. THE PROJECT SHOULD START EITHER SPRING OR FALL 2022, AND TAKE 9 WEEKS; PROJECT SHOULD BE COMPLETE BY DECEMBER 2022.BENEFICIARIES:THE PUBLIC VISITORS WILL BENEFIT FROM THE ENHANCED VIEWSHEDS WITHOUT FENCE DEBRIS, AND VISITOR HEALTH AND PUBLIC SAFETY WILL BE IMPROVED BY REMOVAL OF OBSTRUCTIONS TO HIKERS, SKIERS, AND SNOWSHOERS. WILDLIFE INJURIES AND DEATHS WILL BE ELIMINATED BY THE REMOVAL OF THE OLD FENCES.

PURPOSE OF AWARD (SUMMARY OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE PROJECT): NPS GOAL: DRIVE ADOPTION OF ULTIMATE JOURNEY SO THAT MORE YOUTH ARE PARTICIPATING IN ENVIRONMENTAL SCIENCE FOCUSED LEARNING WHILE APPRECIATING AND EXPLORING NATIONAL PARKS. BGCA GOAL: INCREASE THE NUMBER OF CLUBS ADOPTING THE ULTIMATE JOURNEY CURRICULUM WHILE SUPPORTING STAFF THROUGH PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT OPPORTUNITIES THAT CREATE COMFORT AND CONFIDENCE WITH PROGRAM MATERIAL. ADDITIONALLY, BGCA WOULD EXPOSE TEENS TO CAREER OPPORTUNITIES WITHIN THE NATIONAL PARKS SERVICE. SUMMARY OF PROJECT SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES: BGCA WILL PARTNER WITH NINE LOCAL ORGANIZATIONS. BUILDING ON THE PREVIOUS YEAR'S WORK, WE WILL EXPAND THE REACH OF THE ULTIMATE JOURNEY PROGRAM; WITH THE ADDITIONAL GOAL OF NURTURING AND BUILDING ON THE ESTABLISHED OF RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN NATIONAL PARK SITES AND LOCAL CLUBS AND YOUTH CENTERS. PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO BGCS IMPLEMENTING ULTIMATE JOURNEY FACILITATE WEBINARS AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE CALLS WITH LOCAL BOYS & GIRLS CLUB ORGANIZATIONS AS NEEDED TO SUPPORT THEIR IMPLEMENTATION OF THE ULTIMATE JOURNEY PROGRAM.
