A.	PROJECT GOALS ' THE BROAD GOALS OF THIS TASK AGREEMENT ARE TO GIVE A YOUNG MUSEUM PROFESSIONAL THEIR INITIAL---OR EARLY CAREER---EXPERIENCE IN THE PROFESSIONAL MUSEUM ENVIRONMENT, AS WELL AS TO PROVIDE THE PARK WITH INPUT FROM A NEWLY TRAINED MUSEUM PROFESSIONAL WITH UP-TO-DATE ACADEMIC EDUCATION AND TRAINING.

B.	PROJECT OBJECTIVE ' THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS TASK AGREEMENT IS TO SUPPORT AND STIMULATE WORK AND/OR EDUCATION AND TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOUNG ADULTS THROUGH COLLABORATIVE PARTICIPATION IN SITKA NATIONAL HISTORICAL PARK'S RESOURCE MANAGEMENT DIVISION.

A.	PROJECT GOALS ' THE 1.5 MILE LONG TRAIL IS IN NEED OF CYCLIC MAINTENANCE AND IS HARD TO USE AS THERE ARE MANY DIVERSIONS AROUND FALLEN TREES AND NEW SOCIAL TRAILS ARE BEING ESTABLISHED. THIS PROJECT WILL REMOVE THE FALLEN TREES AND MAKE THE TRAIL PASSABLE. THE CREW WILL FALL LARGER SPRUCE BARK BEETLE KILLED TREES WITHIN 50 FEET OF THE TRAIL THAT MAY FALL ACROSS THE TRAIL, MOSTLY TREES THAT ARE UPHILL SIDE OF THE TRAIL ON SLOPED AREAS. APPROXIMATELY 35 TREES HAVE FALLEN ACROSS THE TRAIL AND WITH THE TREES REMOVED, THE TRAIL WOULD BE MORE ACCESSIBLE FOR PARK USE AND ALLOW PARK VISITORS TO GO ON THE TRAIL WITH CANOES WITHOUT LEAVING THE CURRENT TRAIL SYSTEM. 

B.	PROJECT OBJECTIVES ' THE PORTAGE TRAIL IS THE ONLY TRAIL ON THE SAVANOSKI LOOP A POPULAR CANOE (KAYAK) TRIP TO PADDLE INTERCONNECTED LAKES AND RIVERS. TOURIST OFTEN START AT BROOKS CAMP PADDLE TO THE BAY OF ISLANDS IN NAKNEK LAKE AND THEN PORTAGE TO GROSVENOR LAKE IN ORDER TO COMPLETE THE LOOP BACK TO BROOKS CAMP.  THIS WORK WILL KEEP THE TRAIL IN GOOD SHAPE AND MAKE IT EASIER FOR TOURIST TO USE THE TRAIL.

THE NPS AND SCA WILL COLLABORATE TO RECRUIT YOUTH FOR A RESOURCE MANAGEMENT FIELD TECHNICIAN INTERNSHIP AND AN EDUCATIONAL OUTREACH INTERNSHIP WITH THE GOAL OF BUILDING CAREER EXPERIENCE BY WORKING PARALLEL FROM THE TWO DIVISIONS AS PART OF A SCIENCE COMMUNICATION TEAM.  THE SCIENCE COMMUNICATION TEAM PROVIDES THESE INTERNS THE OPPORTUNITY TO IMPROVE SCIENCE LITERACY AMONG VISITORS AND ENGAGE THEM IN THE PARK'S RESEARCH AND MONITORING THROUGH CITIZEN SCIENCE PROGRAMS. TO DO SO, THE SELECTED INTERNS WILL DEVELOP AND CONDUCT INTERPRETIVE PROGRAMMING BASED ON MONITORING ACTIVITIES, SUCH AS: INVASIVE PLANTS, PHENOLOGY, AND HYDROLOGY.

PROJECT GOALS ' 
THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE AN IMMERSIVE DEVELOPMENTAL OPPORTUNITY FOR ONE (1) INTERPRETER IN BEST PRACTICES NATURAL AND CULTURAL INTERPRETIVE CONTENT DEVELOPMENT FOR WEB, SOCIAL MEDIA, AND PRINTED PUBLICATION.  ALL PRODUCED CONTENT WILL BE SHARED WITH THE PUBLIC.  THE CONSERVATION ASSOCIATE INTERN WILL WORK FOR 24 WEEKS AT 40 HOURS PER HOUR.  

PROJECT OBJECTIVES ' 
THE INTERN WILL EXECUTE THE 2019 WEBSITE CONTENT MANAGEMENT STRATEGY FOR THE PARK WEBSITE, SOCIAL MEDIA, AND PARK PUBLICATIONS INCLUDING CONTENT SPECIFIC TO CULTURAL RESOURCES, STORIES, AND SIGNIFICANCES RELATED TO FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED TRIBES WHOSE VILLAGES ARE RESIDENT ZONE COMMUNITIES OF LAKE CLARK NATIONAL PARK AND PRESERVE ESTABLISHED BY THE ALASKA NATIONAL INTEREST LANDS CONSERVATION ACT (ANILCA), THE PARK'S ENABLING LEGISLATION.

PROJECT GOALS ' 
THIS TASK AGREEMENT SPECIFIES A PARTNERSHIP PROJECT BETWEEN THE NPS AND THE STUDENT CONSERVATION ASSOCIATION WHICH INVOLVES PLACEMENT OF A YOUTH ASSOCIATE AT GATES OF THE ARCTIC NATIONAL PARK AND PRESERVE IN FAIRBANKS, ALASKA TO SUPPORT PARK SCIENCE, OUTREACH, AND STEWARDSHIP THROUGH EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMMING AND FIELD WORK. THE PRIMARY FUNCTIONS OF THIS POSITION ARE TO ASSIST WITH FIELD BIOLOGY OUTREACH PROGRAMS RELATED TO ALASKA PARK SCIENCE, TO DEVELOP THE INTERN'S SKILLS IN WILDLIFE BIOLOGY, AND TO PRESERVE AND PROTECT THE NATURAL, CULTURAL AND HISTORICAL RESOURCES OF THESE PARKS.

PROJECT OBJECTIVES ' 
THE INTERN WILL PARTICIPATE IN A VARIETY OF FIELD BIOLOGY PROJECTS IN DIFFERENT PARKS TO DEVELOP AND PRESENT A SCIENTIFIC POSTER SHOWCASING A PARK SCIENCE PROGRAM OF THEIR CHOICE, SUCH AS SNOWSHOE HARE RESEARCH IN GATES OF THE ARCTIC NATIONAL PARK AND PRESERVE OR SMALL MAMMAL MONITORING IN DENALI NATIONAL PARK AND PRESERVE. IN ADDITION, THE INTERN WILL PARTICIPATE IN OUTREACH PROGRAMS IN GATEWAY COMMUNITIES (WHICH MAY INCLUDE CIRCLE, NENANA OR ANAKTUVUK PASS, ALASKA) AND LOCAL SCHOOLS THAT HIGHLIGHT THESE ALASKA PARK SCIENCE PROGRAMS.

MEDIA OUTREACH INTERN
TWO (2) SLED DOG KENNEL INTERNS WILL SERVE IN THE AREAS OF INTERPRETATION, VISITOR SERVICES, AND COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION.

THE PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE ONE (1) YOUTH INTERN THE OPPORTUNITY TO DEVELOP INTERPRETIVE MEDIA, PUBLICATIONS, AND SOCIAL MEDIA CONTENT. THE INTERN WILL BE ABLE TO TRAVEL TO DIFFERENT AREAS OF THE PARK TO DOCUMENT, TAKE PHOTOS, FILM, AND COLLECT INFORMATION TO DEVELOP INTERPRETIVE MEDIA. THE PROJECT WILL DOCUMENT A YOUTH AND ELDER CULTURAL EVENT ON THE YAKUTAT COAST, DEVELOP A FILM TO BE USED BY THE TRIBE AND/OR NPS IN SOCIAL MEDIA AND TRAINING. OTHER TOPICS THAT MAY BE DOCUMENTED INCLUDE GLACIAL CHANGE STUDIES BY THE NPS, AND SALMON (TRADITIONAL KNOWLEDGE MEETS SCIENCE). SOCIAL MEDIA CONTENT WILL BE DEVELOPED TO SHARE THESE STORIES. 

THIS POSITION WILL FACILITATE VISITOR AND STAFF UNDERSTANDING OF THE CONNECTIONS BETWEEN HUMANS, THE PARK LANDSCAPE, AND THE AQUATIC ECOSYSTEMS IN AND AROUND THE PARK. BY DEVELOPING INTERPRETIVE CONTENT, THE INTERN WILL HELP FACILITATE THESE CONNECTIONS TO THE AQUATIC ECOSYSTEMS IN THE PARK. THIS WILL HELP VISITORS ENJOY PARK RESOURCES, AND EDUCATE VISITORS ON BEHAVIOR CONSISTENT WITH RESOURCE PROTECTION. THIS WILL ALLOW FRIENDLY COMPLIANCE WITH THE LAWS AND REGULATIONS FOR SAFE PARK USE, AND TO ENCOURAGE VISITORS TO DEVELOP A SENSE OF STEWARDSHIP FOR PARK RESOURCES.

STUDENTS WILL RECEIVE A THOROUGH ORIENTATION TO THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE, WITH A FOCUS ON PARKS AND PROGRAMS IN THE ALASKA REGION.  THE CURRICULUM INCLUDES AN INTRODUCTION TO THE HISTORY OF THE NATIONAL PARK SERVICE, ORIENTATION TO SAFETY, EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES VIA A FIELD TRIP TO KENAI FJORDS NATIONAL PARK, AND OPPORTUNITIES TO EXPLORE AND OBSERVE VARIOUS CAREER OPPORTUNITIES IN THE NPS.  ALSO INCLUDED ARE SESSIONS IN LEADERSHIP SKILLS DEVELOPMENT, AN INTRODUCTION TO MENTORING AND A VARIETY OF RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES.  THE ORIENTATION WORKSHOP WILL FOCUS ON ALASKA SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES OF THE NPS, INCLUDING SESSIONS ON ALASKA NATIVE CLAIMS SETTLEMENT ACT (ANCSA), ALASKA NATIONAL INTEREST LANDS CONSERVATION ACT (ANILCA) AND SUBSISTENCE ACTIVITIES AND PREPARE STUDENTS FOR SUMMER LONG INTERNSHIPS WITHIN THE ALASKA REGION PARKS AND PROGRAMS.

THIS TASK AGREEMENT COVERS THE PLACEMENT OF THREE (3) INTERNSHIPS WITH A FOCUS ON RESOURCE MANAGEMENT AT PARK UNIT SITES ACROSS ALASKA THROUGH THE NPS ALASKA ACADEMY PROGRAM IN PARTNERSHIP WITH SCA. THESE SITES INCLUDE DENALI NATIONAL PARK AND PRESERVE, WESTERN ARCTIC PARKLANDS, AND KENAI FJORDS NATIONAL PARK. THESE POSITIONS WILL PROVIDE PARKS WITH YOUNG ADULTS FOR 12 WEEKS DURING THE PEAK FIELD SEASON OF MAY ' AUGUST, WHO WILL ASSIST PARK SERVICE STAFF IN A VARIETY OF RESOURCE MANAGEMENT TASKS INCLUDING COMPLETING RESOURCE MONITORING, ARCHAEOLOGY, ECOLOGY, AND WILDLIFE STUDIES, AND MANAGEMENT OF SUBSISTENCE RESOURCES.

FOSTER VILLAGE INVOVLEMENT IN PARK STEWARDSHIP, NATIONAL PARK OF AMERICAN SAMOA

Award Type: DIRECT PAYMENT FOR SPECIFIED USE, AS A SUBSIDY OR OTHER NON-REIMBURSABLE DIRECT FINANCIAL AID (C)
Description: NATIONAL PARK SERVICE 21ST CENTURY CONSERVATION SERVICE CORPS PROGRAM

Award Type: DIRECT PAYMENT FOR SPECIFIED USE, AS A SUBSIDY OR OTHER NON-REIMBURSABLE DIRECT FINANCIAL AID (C)
Description:
A.	PROJECT GOALS '

THE GOAL OF HOSTING WINTER SCA INTERNS AT THE DENALI NPS KENNELS IS TO TRAIN AND INSPIRE THE NEXT GENERATION OF DOG MUSHERS, ANIMAL HANDLERS AND PARK RANGERS. IT IS IMPORTANT TO HAVE AN INTAKE PROGRAM TO TRAIN YOUTH IN SPECIALIZED TRADITIONAL SKILLS IN THE PARK SERVICE IN ORDER TO CONTINUE THE LONG TRADITION OF RANGERS USING DOG TEAMS TO PROTECT AND PRESERVE THE UNIQUE NATURAL AND CULTURAL HISTORY OF DENALI NATIONAL PARK & PRESERVE. IN ADDITION, INTERNS WILL HELP THE PARK BETTER SERVE WINTER VISITORS BY ASSISTING WITH INFORMATION AND ACCESS TO THE PARK'S BACKCOUNTRY AS WELL AS PROVIDING INTERPRETIVE AND EDUCATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES FOR VISITOR'S TO UNDERSTAND THE PURPOSE AND SIGNIFICANCE OF DOG TEAMS IN DENALI.

B.	PROJECT OBJECTIVES '

THE PROJECTS MAY INCLUDE EXTENDED MULTI-DAY OR MULTI- WEEK TRAVEL ON THE PARK ROAD OR OFF TRAIL IN THE BACKCOUNTRY. THE INTERN MAY BE TRAINED TO TRAVEL ON SKIS, SNOWSHOES, OR DOGSLED IN A VARIETY OF WINTER CONDITIONS AND TERRAIN THROUGHOUT THE PARK. THE INTERN MAY BE BASED IN THE PARK'S BACKCOUNTRY AND/ OR HISTORIC RANGER PATROL CABINS OVERNIGHT OR BE TEMPORARILY ASSIGNED TO WORK AT ANOTHER DUTY STATION WITHIN THE PARK IN ORDER TO COMPLETE THEIR PROJECTS.  ALL TRAVEL WILL COMPLY WITH NPS INVITATIONAL TRAVEL (NO-COST) PROTOCOLS AND WILL BE OF BENEFIT TO THE UNITED STATES GOVERNMENT.
